autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-season-5-subverts-evil-twin-trope/\">Lucifer Season 5 Avoids a Troubling Mistaken-Identity Trope</a></span></p><p>Principal photography on the Season 5 finale has been temporarily suspended due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, with star Tom Ellis estimating that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-covid-19-shut-down-shooting-before-season-5-finale-finished/\">approximately 60%</a> of the finale was filmed before the global health crisis directly impacted production.</p><p>No release date for production to resume has been announced, along with an intended premiere date for Season 5's final eight episodes, but the series has since been <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-lucifer-final-season-6-renewal-teaser/\">renewed for a sixth</a> and final season by Netflix.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lucifer-season-5-show-ditch-procedural-format/\">Lucifer Season 5 Proves the Show Should Ditch the Procedural Format</a></span></p><blockquote><p>Lucifer, bored and unhappy as the Lord of Hell, resigns his throne and abandons his kingdom for the gorgeous, shimmering insanity of Los Angeles, where he gets his kicks helping the LAPD...and the savvy detective Chloe Decker in particular. In Part A of season 5, Lucifer's twin brother Michael secretly takes the devil's place on earth while he's back in Hell. Eventually, Lucifer must return and face the mess his brother made with his life. He'll also finally confront his feelings for Chloe, and answer a question fans have been asking since the very beginning: 'will they or won't they'?</p></blockquote><p>Helmed by Joe Henderson and Ildy Modrovich, <em>Lucifer</em> stars Tom Ellis as Lucifer Morningstar, Lauren German as Det. Chloe Decker, D.B. Woodside as Amenadiel, Rachael Harris as Dr. Linda Martin, Kevin Alejandro as Det. Dan Espinoza, Lesley-Ann Brandt as Mazikeen Smith and Aimee Garcia as Ella Lopez. The first half of Season 5 is available to stream now on Netflix.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 17:39:36 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-header.jpg","linkMd5":"968696ee04a6787f3499dc5304acfaad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn65@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-988_4057452cbea43658.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":131846,"destBytes":131846,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lucifer-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn65@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-988_4057452cbea43658.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Wynonna Earp's Tim Rozon Opens Up About THAT Moment from the Midseason Finale","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-tim-rozon-breakup-midseason-finale/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/wynonna-vampiredoc.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for  \"Holy War, Part 2,\" the latest episode of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wynonna-earp/\">Wynonna Earp</a>.</strong></em></p><p>Between the supernatural gunfights and monster-hunting, <em>Wynonna Earp</em> found time to romance the legendary cowboy Doc Holliday, even going as far to have a child with him over the course of the series. However, the fan-favorite couple hit a rough patch in the midseason finale.</p><p>After being confronted by Sheriff Holt Clanton, a member of the historical family who still holds a deep grudge against the Earps, Wynonna shot him in the back even after Doc talked him down. As this was the biggest offense of his personal moral code since the 19th century, a visibly disgusted Doc chose to break up with Wynonna before celebrating Waverly Earp and Nicole Haught's engagement. According to star Tim Rozon, the breakup also stems from the two characters having different priorities, as Wynonna deals with the responsibility of defending their town of Purgatory from a new wave of monsters.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-midseason-finale-trailer-against-demonic-nuns/\">Wynonna Earp Midseason Finale Trailer Pits Her Against Demonic Nuns</a></span></p><p>\"More than just going by his old-school moral code, Doc Holliday is finished with fighting. He wants to be in love with the woman he loves and make a family and settle down, and to do that he’s gotta let go of the past. But the thing that he needs to remember is that Wynonna doesn't have the luxury to do that, because she has the burden of being the hero and he doesn’t,\" Rozon told <a href=\"https://tvline.com/2020/08/30/wynonna-earp-recap-season-4-episode-6-midseason-finale-tim-rozon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">TVLine</a>. \"She can't just let go. So I don't agree with what she did, and I definitely don't agree with shooting him in the back, but that burden always falls on Wynonna, and it has since Episode 1. They fight together, but let's be honest: Wynonna Earp is the one who’s got to take the brunt of the responsibility.\"</p><p>A <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-sneak-peek-release-window-season-4-part-2/\">teaser trailer</a> from the second half of Season 4 showed Wynonna won't handle the break-up well. For Rozon, the possibility of the couple reconciling was open but would need Wynonna to make a clean break from her past and the responsibility that comes with it.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-nicole-haught-killed/\">Wynonna Earp: A Longtime Main Character Is Horrifically Killed</a></span></p><p>\"I think that's what this whole, whole thing is about -- both of them finally letting go of the past. If they can do that, they can have a future; if they can't, they can't. But like I said, it's easier for Doc to do that. Also, his past is 150 years ago,\" Rozon observed. \"Wynonna has the hero's burden. Purgatory and all that stuff, it relies on her, so she'd have to walk away from everything. But what a great season, though, for Melanie Scrofano and the Wynonna Earp character. The fact that she doesn't have Peacemaker and lost her identity of who she is but still, at the end of the day, has to be the hero... it's great stuff. I don't know how she's going to be able to let go of the past. I don't know if she can.\"</p><p>Produced by SEVEN24 Films and IDW Entertainment, <em>Wynonna Earp</em> stars Melanie Scrofano as the title character, Dominique Provost-Chalkley as Waverly, Katherine Barrell as Nicole Haught and Tim Rozon as Doc Holliday. Season 4 airs on Sundays at 10pm ET/PT on Syfy.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Wynonna Earp's Midseason Finale Has Two VERY Different Reunions\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-midseason-finale-two-different-reunions/\">Wynonna Earp's Midseason Finale Has Two VERY Different Reunions</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 19:24:02 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/wynonna-vampiredoc.jpg","linkMd5":"66ab31e341fbf9d4d26c99a41bf05102","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn78@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-994_7c2ec7ff48dc2db0.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":49370,"destBytes":49370,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/wynonna-vampiredoc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn78@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-994_7c2ec7ff48dc2db0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The Adventure Zone: The Bureau of Balance, Explained | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/adventure-zone-bureau-balance-explained/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Petals-to-the-Metal-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-adventure-zone/\">The Adventure Zone</a></em>, an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-actual-play-shows-boosting-lgbtq-representation/\">actual-play <em>Dungeons and Dragons</em> podcast</a> from the McElroy family, struck gold with its first season. Part of what made this initial adventure so compelling was the story's structure, setting individual quests in the context of a broader mission.</p><p>Providing this larger structure is the Bureau of Balance, a benevolent organization with strict hierarchies that is trying to rid the world of some powerfully evil artifacts. The Bureau of Balance provides not only a setting for the world but also an impetus for the quests, making it a crucial component of the <em>Balance</em> universe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/adventure-zone-best-balance-universe-one-shots/\">The Adventure Zone: 5 Best One-Shots In The Balance Universe</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Here-There-Be-Gerblins.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Bureau of Balance, created and directed by NPC Lucretia, is a secret organization devoted to restoring the balance of good and evil to the world by removing from it items of unimaginable thrall and power that have been wreaking havoc on the land. Each of these Grand Relics becomes the object of one of the quests in <em>Balance</em>, giving each arc a MacGuffin and a definitive end to the whole season.</p><p>The main characters run across their first Grand Relic accidentally. While answering a Craigslist-style call for adventurers, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-adventure-zone-player-characters/\">Merle, Magnus and Taako</a> are drawn into a quest with even higher stakes. While trying to rescue a companion lost in a cave system, they run into an employee of the Bureau, who identifies the adventurers as potential recruits. Before Merle, Magnus and Taako reach the Bureau, they feel like an unlikely group of adventurers, linked only by the shared trauma of their first quest.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-two-new-subclasses/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons Unearths Two Spooky Subclasses</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Balance.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Bureau of Balance follows a very rigid corporate structure. New recruits, like the three player characters, must undergo a rigorous interview process -- troll combat -- to determine if they're a good fit. All employees are also required to wear a bracer with the Bureau's logo on it, showing their commitment to their organization.</p><p>The main characters are brought aboard as Reclaimers, those responsible for retrieving the Grand Relics and bringing them back to the Bureau so they can be destroyed. They work alongside Seekers, who deal in information as they attempt to track down the location of the remaining Relics, and Regulators, responsible for dealing with anyone who has given into the thrall and used one of the Relics. The strict hierarchy of roles is rigorously adhered to, especially once Merle, Magnus and Taako prove themselves to be the only ones capable of regularly resisting the thrall of the powerful artifacts.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dd-beyond-vs-roll20-explained/\">D&#38;D Beyond Vs. Roll20: Which One Should You Use For Your Campaign?</a></span></p><p>In addition to the strict division of labor, the Bureau also institutes performance reviews and year-end bonuses, giving the organization a very corporate vibe. The modern, corporate ideology in a very fantasy <em>D&#38;D</em> setting is a fun space to play in and makes for amusing adventure set-ups.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Murder-on-the-Rockport-Limited.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Bureau is located on its own, hand-crafted moon, giving the staff the ability to quickly travel to anywhere in the land that may hold a Relic. The way of travel to and from the moon is a literal canon, firing glass balls holding the travelers. Employees can summon one of these transports using their Bureau of Balance bracer. It's revealed the moon itself can move as well, though traveling by moon isn't very subtle.</p><p>While the moon isn't large, it does contain its share of other businesses. In addition to dorm rooms, training chambers and offices of the Bureau itself, it also features a Fantasy Costco, selling adventurers all of the magical items they might want.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dd-incorporate-one-shots-into-campaigns/\">D&#38;D: How To Incorporate One-Shots Into Extended Campaigns</a></span></p><p>Part of what makes the Bureau of Balance so secretive is that folks are prevented from discussing it. The Bureau makes use of a creature called a voidfish which feeds on information, erasing it from memories for those who haven't been inoculated. This secrecy is crucial for the Bureau -- they used it to erase the knowledge of the Grand Relics from the land in the hopes that it would help reduce their devastation. It also means that when Merle, Magnus and Taako first met a representative of the Bureau (and someone under the thrall of a Relic), they hear static whenever these items were discussed.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Adventure-Zone.jpg\"/></figure><p>Not every secret, evil-fighting, moon-owning organization is out for good, however. While the Bureau staff seem trustworthy, some unanswered questions call the adventurers' continued work for the Bureau of Balance into question.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-scaling-enemies-monsters-guide/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons: How To Scale Enemies &#38; Monsters</a></span></p><p>After successfully reclaiming a Relic, the three adventurers return to the Bureau's moon and immediately must hand it over for destruction. The process is intense but leaves a lot of room for items to be switched out and secreted away, making the adventurers suspect that they may be reclaiming these Relics for some other purpose. The three characters also have a roommate who is mysteriously mind-controlled and caught exploring the director's quarters. Coupled with the use of voidfish technology and suggestions from other characters, it's enough to suspect the Bureau of ulterior motives.</p><p>The Bureau of Balance is a fallible, corporate-inspired organization that does the heavy lifting of setting up the stakes and the mood of the larger <em>The Adventure Zone: Balance</em> story. By providing individual arc goals in the form of quests for the individual Relics but an overarching continuity, it drives the structure of the podcast. But by including <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/adventure-zone-balance-best-npc/\">interesting characters with individual motivations</a> -- to play their music for someone who will appreciate it, to quench their thirst for invention, to hit people really hard -- it also becomes a lived-in space, full of interesting stories.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dungeons-dragons-tashas-cauldron-changes-race-approach/\">Dungeons &#38; Dragons: How Tasha's Cauldron Changes The Game's Approach To Race</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:15:54 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Petals-to-the-Metal-1.jpg","linkMd5":"b7b51e45c939f298fc6c19259e7e24fc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn82@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-334_89d0d87b6ff04640.webp","destWidth":1293,"destHeight":647,"sourceBytes":175950,"destBytes":175950,"author":"E.L. Meszaros","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Petals-to-the-Metal-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn82@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-334_89d0d87b6ff04640.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Here-There-Be-Gerblins.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn1@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-12-165_16d0c7190c03b55b.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Balance.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn73@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-14-635_b141e6d6887c252b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Adventure-Zone-Murder-on-the-Rockport-Limited.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn65@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-17-177_35516901840c6993.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Adventure-Zone.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn96@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-16-192_324427fddf4b19cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Game of Thrones' Emilia Clarke Slams Sexist Double Standard in How Female Castmembers Were Treated","link":"https://www.cbr.com/game-of-thrones-emilia-clarke-sexist-double-standard-female-castmembers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Game-of-Thrones-Season-8-Danaerys-Targaryen-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/game-of-thrones-tv/\"><em>Games of Thrones</em></a> star Emilia Clarke called out the double standards she experienced as a female cast member on the set of the popular HBO series.</p><p>The actor discussed the show's costumes at the Edinburgh TV Festival over the weekend, revealing that female cast members were not given the same luxuries as their male counterparts while wearing uncomfortable costumes during filming.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/house-of-the-dragon-casting-daemon-targaryen/\">RUMOR: House of the Dragon: Game of Thrones Prequel Series Casting for a Rogue Prince</a></span></p><p>\"The guys in the Night's Watch, Jon Snow, are wearing a woolly mammoth all the time,\" Clarke explained. \"When we were shooting things in a hot country when they had all of those things on, they had this pump that had its own little generator attached into the costumes.\"</p><p>She went on to note that the crew used the generator \"to pump cold water into these pipes and cool them all down so underneath they had this weird kind of cooling system,\" adding that the \"girls weren't allowed that.\"</p><p>\"All I could get was the back of my wig to be lifted up,\" Clarke continued. \"It's too hard, I've got a wig on, they don't make cold packs you know, you put ice packs on yourself.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/emilia-clarke-annoyed-game-of-thrones-finale/\">During her tenure as Daenerys Targaryen</a>, Clarke donned everything from skimpy draped fabrics in the hotter desert settings to thick fur throws for scenes set in the North.</p><p><em>Game of Thrones</em> stars Peter Dinklage, Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Lena Headey, Emilia Clarke, Sophie Turner, Maisie Williams and Kit Harington. The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/game-of-thrones-4k-collection-preorder/\">4K UHD collection</a> will be released on Nov. 3.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a Prosser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Game-of-Thrones-Season-8-Danaerys-Targaryen-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn17@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-02-329_b48929b6fe78745b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Wynonna Earp: Melanie Scrofano on the Midseason Finale and What's Next","link":"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-midseason-finale-whats-next/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wynonna-earp-header.jpg\"/></figure><p class=\"article-title\"><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wynonna-earp/\">Wynonna Earp</a> Season 4, Episode 6, \"Holy War, Part 2,\" which aired Sunday on Syfy.</strong></em></p><p><em>Wynonna Earp</em> Season 4 has put its eponymous gunslinger through the emotional wringer, forcibly separated from her <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-scrofano-importance-peacemaker/\">mythical revolver Peacemaker</a> while learning the more troubling history behind her legendary ancestor Wyatt Earp.</p><p>Wynonna scoured her hometown of Purgatory far and wide for the missing pistol, which had been taken from her during Season 3 by the demonic Bulshar, going through desperate, morally compromising lengths to re-obtain it. As Wynonna came closer and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-midseason-finale-two-different-reunions/\">closer to her goal</a>, she was forced the confront Wyatt's bloody legacy, just in time for her family's historical rivals, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-brings-back-clantons-historical-grudge/\">the Clantons</a>, to resurface. For series star Melanie Scrofano, the revelations about Wyatt's past cause Wynonna to question everything about her family history and responsibilities as the Earp to defend Purgatory.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-midseason-finale-trailer-against-demonic-nuns/\">Wynonna Earp Midseason Finale Trailer Pits Her Against Demonic Nuns</a></span></p><p>\"It has been really interesting to look further into the complicated history of the Earp family. There are always dark secrets in every family tree, especially when your family is known for being involved in a particularly famous gun fight,\" Scrofano told CBR. \"Wynonna has always had to live in the shadow of the Earp curse and this season we’re seeing her realize Wyatt might not be the hero she’s been led to believe.\"</p><p>While Wynonna was able to secure Peacemaker and seemingly put down the Clantons for good, the lengths she undertook cost her her romantic relationship with Doc Holliday, who broke up with her in disgust during the midseason finale. With a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-sneak-peek-release-window-season-4-part-2/\">sneak peek</a> at the second half of Season 4 revealing a drunk Wynonna struggling with the emotional fallout, Scrofano hinted that her character would grow even more reckless than before.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wynonna-earp-nicole-haught-killed/\">Wynonna Earp: A Longtime Main Character Is Horrifically Killed</a></span></p><p>\"Ultimately, we’ll see our girl whiskey soaked and reckless as she struggles to find her place in the new reality of Purgatory,\" Scrofano teased.</p><blockquote><p>In Season 4, the infamous Earp Curse is broken, and witty and wild demon hunter Wynonna Earp would love to be celebrating with cold whisky and hot donuts. Too bad she has to rescue everyone she loves, save the town of Purgatory, and take on her most diabolical, Earp-hating enemy yet — all without her trustworthy gun, Peacemaker. And that’s just Monday…</p></blockquote><p>Produced by SEVEN24 Films and IDW Entertainment, <em>Wynonna Earp</em> stars Melanie Scrofano as the title character, Dominique Provost-Chalkley as Waverly, Katherine Barrell as Nicole Haught and Tim Rozon as Doc Holliday. Season 4 airs on Sundays at 10 p.m. ET/PT on Syfy.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:55:37 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wynonna-earp-header.jpg","linkMd5":"74166cb2008e52bad2f35adfc5db5cf5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn73@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-03-389_42fcbc10baf5662f.webp","destWidth":2997,"destHeight":1499,"sourceBytes":616959,"destBytes":523608,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/wynonna-earp-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn73@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-03-389_42fcbc10baf5662f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The Walking Dead Debuts Whisperer War Final Showdown Trailer","link":"https://www.cbr.com/walking-dead-whisperer-war-final-showdown-trailer/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Walking-Dead-Season-10-Finale-Header.png\"/></figure><p>After going on an extended hiatus caused by the ongoing coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-walking-dead-tv/\">The Walking Dead</a> is back in October to conclude its escalating \"Whisperer War\" storyline that has been steadily building since Season 9.</p><p>AMC has released a teaser trailer for the Season 10 finale, showing the community of Alexandria going to battle against the Whisperers, now led by Beta after the shocking murder of their original leader Alpha earlier in the season. The spinoff is planned to run for two ten-episode seasons on AMC before concluding its run.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a AMC, <em>The Walking Dead</em> Season 10 finale stars Norman Reedus, Melissa McBride, Josh McDermitt, Christian Serratos, Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Seth Gilliam, Ross Marquand, Khary Payton, and Cooper Andrews.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 01:01:44 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Walking-Dead-Season-10-Finale-Header.png","linkMd5":"fed78f14433819dab8126df089c61111","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-712_526d5097586dd83e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":739216,"destBytes":739216,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Walking-Dead-Season-10-Finale-Header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-712_526d5097586dd83e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Why Star-Lord Should Have Kept His Celestial Powers in Guardians of the Galaxy","link":"https://www.cbr.com/video-why-star-lord-kept-celestial-powers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Lord1.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/guardians-of-the-galaxy-film/\">Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2</a> saw Peter Quill/Star-Lord finally learning his true parentage, which conferred on him some pretty incredible powers. However, the climax of the film -- which saw Star-Lord going up against his father, Ego, the Living Planet -- resulted in him losing those abilities. In this video, we're going to go through why that's a huge mistake.</p><p>As Ego's son, Peter has some pretty incredible abilities, many of which he used in the battle against his father. Peter, for example, turned into Pac-Man at one point to take down his father and there was a ton more that happened in their epic fight. There was potentially no limit to just what Peter might have been able to accomplish, but it's very unlikely we'll ever get to see just what he might have done since, when Ego was destroyed, Star-Lord's powers seemingly went with him.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-complicated-irrelevant-legacy-of-both-sequels/\">Iron Man: The Complicated (&#38; Possibly Irrelevant) Legacy of Both Sequels</a></span></p><p>Check out the video below for why Star-Lord should have kept his Celestial powers.</p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0QgxCONoK9E?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-rotten-tomatoes-score-x-men-spinoff-wasnt-worth-wait/\">New Mutants’ Rotten Tomatoes Score Suggests the X-Men Spinoff Wasn’t Worth the Wait</a></span></p><p>Following the events of <em>Avengers: Endgame</em>, it's not totally clear just what shape the next phase of the Marvel Cinematic Universe will take. While there's a good indication the characters Disney acquired from 21st Century Fox will soon arrive, there's not much solid information on just when or how that might happen. At this time, the Guardians of the Galaxy are slated to return in a third film, which is not thought to have been affected by the ongoing coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the delays its meant for the industry on the whole.</p><p><em>Let us know what you think in the comments, and check out many other deep, thought-provoking videos on <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/comicbookresources\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">our YouTube channel</a>! The film is expected to begin production in February 2021.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/eternals-marvel-studios-mcu-new-title/\">The Eternals: Marvel Studios Gives the MCU Film a New Title</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 21:30:37 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Lord1.jpg","linkMd5":"ed2f894842ff56a8a3156f6e646ada3e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn18@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-01-976_2a588a392866e3b8.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":166773,"destBytes":123804,"author":"Liam Nolan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Lord1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn18@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-01-976_2a588a392866e3b8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Why Digital Games Should Be Cheaper Than Physical Ones | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/digital-games-should-be-cheaper/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/physical-and-digital-games.jpg\"/></figure><p>Digital video games have been growing in popularity over the last few years as more people choose to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/what-digital-only-consoles-mean-for-gaming/\">download games</a> from the comfort of their own homes instead buying physical copies from retailers. Last year, Sony revealed that its digital game sales <a href=\"https://www.gameinformer.com/2019/07/30/playstation-4-hits-100-million-sold-as-digital-game-sales-eclipse-physical-for-the-first\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">surpassed physical</a> for the first time. But while digital games are a convenient alternative to buying games from stores, it doesn't make sense for them to cost the same as a physical copy.</p><p>While development costs are the same regardless of whether a game is physical or digital, there is a cost difference where distribution is concerned. Publishers don't have to <a href=\"https://www.eneba.com/blog/digital-vs-physical-games/#:~:text=Another%20key%20reason%20is%20the,expenses%2C%20logistics%20and%20so%20on.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">pay for packaging</a> and shipping costs when uploading a game on a digital platform, so if anything, physical games should cost more than digital titles to cover these extra expenses.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-1984-xbox-fan-response/\">Wonder Woman 1984: Fan Response to the Furry Xbox Console Is WILD</a></span></p><p>Digital games tend to hold their value for a longer period of time, but that doesn't explain why a digital download sometimes costs more than a physical copy. <a href=\"https://gamerant.com/ubisoft-addresses-digital-physical-game-pricing-348/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ubisoft's CEO has stated</a> that digital prices remain the same because, as time goes on, physical copies become more difficult to find. However, many uncommon physical games are still <a href=\"http://gamesniped.com/2017/04/04/cheap-nes-games-rare-uncommon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">relatively cheap</a> despite being somewhat scarce. Buying a loose copy of a rare game like <em>Mermaids of Atlantis</em> still <a href=\"https://www.pricecharting.com/game/nes/mermaids-of-atlantis?q=mermaids+of+atlantis\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">costs less</a> than buying certain modern games on digital platforms.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/physical-games.jpg\"/></figure><p>Poking addition holes in Ubisoft's logic is the fact that many older games are available for low prices on digital storefronts while being hard to find or access physically. For example, a loose copy of <em>Earthbound</em> for the SNES <a href=\"https://www.pricecharting.com/game/super-nintendo/earthbound?q=earthbound\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">costs around $275</a> and a complete copy is over $1000, but a digital copy typically cost about $10.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ps-plus-september-2020-free-games-information-guide/\">PS Plus: Everything You Need To Know About September 2020's Free Games</a></span></p><p>There are a few good reasons why digital games are sometimes priced higher than physical editions. Retailer will sometimes sell games at a discount to make room for newer games and accessories. This makes it harder to find older games, especially ones from previous generations or that weren't mega-hits, as they are quickly replaced with whatever is new and popular. Digital platforms don't have this issue, as there is endless shelf space in these online stores.</p><p>But while digital platforms cut out the middleman that gets the product onto store shelves, the platforms themselves play this role. To sell their games on a digital store, publishers have to give the platform a cut of the game's sales. Xbox receives around <a href=\"https://www.thexboxhub.com/why-do-digital-versions-of-games-cost-more-than-physical/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">33 percent of profits</a> from games sold on the Xbox Marketplace, which impacts how much the publisher and developer actually make for every digital copy sold.</p><p>Just as physical and digital games themselves are a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/why-physical-games-shouldnt-die-off/\">hot topic among gamers</a>, concerns over how they are priced are also contentious. While there are good arguments on both sides of the debate, perhaps the most compelling reason for digital games to be cheaper is the nature of these copies themselves. Buying a digital game means paying for something you don't physically own and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/video-games-you-can-no-longer-play/\">losing access to it</a> should it be removed from the platform in question. While digital downloads are convenient for gamers and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/digital-downloads-sparked-indie-games-rise/\">good for indie developers</a>, their prices should reflect the lower distribution costs and the risk involved in purchasing them.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nintendo-needs-updated-switch/\">Nintendo NEEDS to Release an Updated Switch</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:15:00 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/physical-and-digital-games.jpg","linkMd5":"02f58224fd64d130f796c4c48e629f57","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-231_df04d542f2c3a171.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":211398,"destBytes":172306,"author":"Zack Millsap","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/physical-and-digital-games.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-231_df04d542f2c3a171.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/physical-games.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn38@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-06-968_7726199a8affef7e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 Panther</a></em> star <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-obituary/\">Chadwick Boseman passed away</a> Aug. 28 at the age of 43 after a four-year battle with colon cancer. In honor of his memory, veteran Marvel Comics artist Bill Sienkiewicz produced a special portrait of Boseman both as himself and the King of Wakanda.</p><p>The portrait sees an image Boseman's face on top of the actor as Black Panther, with the later image based on one of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-character-posters/\">character posters</a> of the hero's self-titled film.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/sinKEVitch/status/1300229741211918336\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-chadwick-boseman-tribute-video/\">Marvel Shares Chadwick Boseman Tribute Video: “You Will Always Be Our King”</a></span></p><p>\"R.I.P. [Chadwick Boseman],\" Sienkiewicz wrote. \"Such an incredible loss of an inspiring human being and gifted artist. This was one of the most difficult portraits I've ever done.\" He also posted another portrait of Boseman on Facebook, this one with a smile.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.facebook.com/bill.sienkiewicz.18/posts/3180744415295626\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Boseman's T'Challa/Black Panther first appeared in the Marvel Cinematic Universe in 2016's <em>Captain America: Civil War</em>. The character featured in his own solo movie 2018, which would go on to be a critical and commercial hit. Boseman would also reprise the role for <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers-infinity-war/\">Avengers: Infinity War</a></em> and <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers-4/\">Endgame</a></em>.</p><p>Prior to his death, Boseman was also set to star in <em>Yasuke</em>, a movie set in feudal Japan about the only African samurai in the country, and was planning on returning the role of Black Panther for both<em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther-2/\">Black Panther 2</a></em> and Marvel's upcoming <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/what-if/\"><em>What If...?</em> </a>animated anthology series for Disney+. After Captain America's apparent death, the grieving team disbands. Eventually, Kamala Khan takes it upon herself to reunite the Avengers. After being exposed to the Terrigen mists, Kamala transforms into the superhero Ms. Marvel. 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Fresh Prince of Bel-Air Unscripted Reunion Special Headed to HBO Max","link":"https://www.cbr.com/fresh-prince-of-bel-air-hbo-max-reunion/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/fresh-prince-of-bel-air-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>The beloved 1990s sitcom <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-fresh-prince-of-bel-air/\">The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air</a></em> will be the latest comedy series to receive a reunion special.</p><p>The special -- celebrating the show's 30th anniversary -- is being developed by HBO Max and will see Will Smith return to the role that launched him into superstardom. He'll be joined by fellow castmates Tatyana Ali, Karyn Parsons, Joseph Marcell, Daphne Maxwell Reid and Alfonso Ribeiro, as well as recurring cast member DJ Jazzy Jeff. The special will be directed by Marcus Raboy and produced under Smith's Westbrook Media banner.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/will-smith-fresh-prince-of-bel-air-drama/\">Will Smith's The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air is Being Remade as a Drama</a></span></p><p><em>The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air</em> starred Smith as a fictionalized version of himself, who moved from Philadelphia to live with his wealthy aunt and uncle in California. The entire series is currently available to stream on HBO Max, and it's also being <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/will-smith-fresh-prince-of-bel-air-drama/\">reworked into a drama titled <em>Bel-Air</em></a>, which Smith will produce under Westbrook Media.</p><p>HBO Max has been developing other reunion specials for shows in its library; a reunion special for <em>Friends</em> has been in the works, though filming has yet to begin due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, and Aaron Sorkin's political drama <em>The West Wing</em> is also getting a reunion special to help bolster voter awareness.</p><p><em>The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air</em> reunion special will tape on Sept. 10 before arriving on HBO Max around the Thanksgiving holiday.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Jim Lee Confirms DC Universe Original Content to Migrate to HBO Max\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-universe-content-migrates-to-hbo-max-jim-lee/\">Jim Lee Confirms DC Universe Original Content To Migrate To HBO Max</a></span></p><p>HBO Max's official press release is below:</p><p><em><b>Los Angeles, CA</b> – <b>Westbrook Media </b>is celebrating the 30-year anniversary of <b>The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air</b> by reuniting the cast for an unscripted special looking back at the series and the cultural impact the series has had since its debut. Set to tape September 10th, the actual 30th anniversary of the series in 1990, the reunion will launch exclusively on<b> HBO Max</b> around Thanksgiving. HBO Max is the exclusive SVOD home of the full series library in the US, debuting on the platform when it launched in May.</em></p><p><em>Bringing the Banks family back together, series star <b>Will Smith </b>will be joined by series regulars <b>Tatyana Ali</b>,<b> Karyn Parsons</b>,<b> Joseph Marcell</b>,<b> Daphne Maxwell Reid </b>and <b>Alfonso Ribeiro</b> as well as the recurring <b>DJ Jazzy Jeff</b>, for a funny and heartfelt night full of music, dancing, and special surprise guests, in honor of the series that ran for six seasons and 148 episodes.</em></p><p><em>Marcus Raboy (Laugh Aid, Whitney Cummings: Can I Touch It?) will direct the special, which will be executive produced by Rikki Hughes, who will serve as showrunner, as well as Miguel Melendez, Lukas Kaiser, and Brad Haugen for Westbrook Media.</em></p><p>(via <em><a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/08/hbo-max-the-fresh-prince-of-bel-unscripted-reunion-special-1203027634/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a></em>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:35:14 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/fresh-prince-of-bel-air-header.jpg","linkMd5":"68d5220bf8fd59429c1f1e12b79aa02b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-710_3f9223f1df34886e.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":152250,"destBytes":152250,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/fresh-prince-of-bel-air-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-710_3f9223f1df34886e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Megan Fox Is Thrilled Jennifer's Body Is Finally Recognized as a Horror Classic","link":"https://www.cbr.com/megan-fox-thrilled-jennifers-body-horror-classic/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/jennifers-body-1-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Megan Fox is pleased that her 2009 feature <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/jennifers-body/\">Jennifer's Body</a></em> has become recognized as a horror classic.</p><p>\"That, obviously, is overdue,\" Fox told <a href=\"https://collider.com/megan-fox-interview-rogue-jennifers-body/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Collider</a> about the film's recent reappraisal by fans and critics. \"We were all aware of what we were making at the time that we were making it. We were all taken aback – and we meaning me, Karyn [Kusama], Diablo [Cody], and the main players – by how the studio marketed that movie, which was outrageous, and by how it was received. I can’t sit there and watch that movie and not be like, 'This is a fucking hilarious, subtle satire. This is a great movie.'\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dracula-reboot-development-universal-blumhouse/\">Dracula Reboot In Development By Universal, Blumhouse</a></span></p><p>\"It’s so interesting,\" Fox continued. \"Diablo is so brilliant. Some of those shots in that movie, like that shot going across the football field, are insane. It was so good. The DP and the directing was so good. I don’t know. It just wasn’t time. It was a decade ahead of its time, and it took this long for culture to catch up.\"</p><p>When it was released in September 2009, <em>Jennifer's Body</em> received mixed reviews and only grossed $31.6 million at the worldwide box office. Since then, though, it has developed a far more <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jennifers-bodys-evolution-into-a-campy-cult-classic/\">positive reputation</a>, particularly for its handling of experiences specific to women and queer viewers.</p><p>Directed by Karyn Kusama and written by Diablo Cody, <em>Jennifer's Body</em> stars Megan Fox, Amanda Seyfried, Johnny Simmons, J.K. Simmons, Amy Sedaris and Adam Brody. It is now available for rental and purchase from physical and digital retailers.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/seeleys-hackslash-same-universe-as-jennifers-body/\">Tim Seeley's Hack/Slash Takes Place In The Same Universe As Jennifer's Body</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 21:38:09 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/jennifers-body-1-1.jpg","linkMd5":"3a510b2d9fe8fc1fe57af8034ebe77e2","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":185944,"destBytes":142134,"author":"Douglas Laman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/jennifers-body-1-1.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Dragon Ball Z: Every Death In The Saiyan Arc (In Chronological Order)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-saiyan-arc-every-death-in-order/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsdd-fi.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Red Ribbon Army arc was the first time death had real consequence in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Bora was murdered on-screen almost as soon as he was introduced, fundamentally changing Goku’s motivations for the rest of the arc. More importantly, Bora’s death set a precedent. Not only could characters die, they could come back to life. </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-z\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> had stumbled onto a way to play with drama on a brand new scale.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-gohan-rage-boosts-chronological-order/\">Dragon Ball Z: All Of Gohan’s Rage Boosts (In Chronological Order)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While the Dragon Balls ultimately become a fail safe that the audience can always count on to fix any mess, part of the series’ tensest arcs knock the Dragon Balls out of the equation. It’s also important to remember that </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-super\">Dragon Ball</a> </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">handles death remarkably well early on. The Saiyan arc is filled with death from start to finish, serving as an important period of transition for the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> franchise. </span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Farmer</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/farmer-with-shotgun.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Affectionately nicknamed “Farmer with Shotgun” by most of the community, Raditz’s first victim has had a big impact on fans and it’s not hard to see why. Beyond his memorably simple character design, the farmer’s death is off-putting with it without context. For fans who had already read or watched </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, this was a level of mundane violence the series had yet to see. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For those jumping in with </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Z</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, it’s just an unforgettable opening. Raditz’s murder of the farmer not only introduces death right away, it puts into perspective just how ferocious Raditz is. On a thematic level, Raditz catching the farmer’s bullet &#38; killing him with it parallels Goku’s first encounter with Bulma.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Son Goku &#38; Raditz</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Cartoon-Death-Dragon-Ball-Goku-Raditz.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Raditz might very well be the most intimidating opponent Goku fights in the entirety of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Raditz may be at the bottom of the Saiyan hierarchy, but Goku and Piccolo can’t even put up a fair fight while battling as a team. The fact of the matter is that Raditz far outclasses anything that came before him. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Goku is forced to give his life just to stop Raditz. Grabbing his brother and holding him in place, Goku is pierced through the chest by Piccolo’s Makankosappo– a technique that was developed with killin Goku in mind to begin with. Goku &#38; Raditz die side by side, Goku slowly fading away and Raditz personally finished off by Piccolo. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Earthlings</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Earthlings.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The very first thing Nappa does upon touching down on Earth is eviscerating his and Vegeta’s landing area. Every single Earthling levelled by Nappa’s blast was killed and they were </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">not </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">revived by the Dragon Balls at any point in the series. There’s really no reason to care about these dead Earthlings, but this scene highlights Nappa &#38; Vegeta’s relationship. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ultimate-butoden-dragon-ball-games-never-heard-of/\">Ultimate Butoden &#38; 9 Other Dragon Ball Games You’ve Never Heard Of</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Where Nappa is an impulsive brute, Vegeta is suave &#38; in control. He doesn’t care that the Earthlings have died, but he does care that Nappa could have destroyed a Dragon Ball. More importantly, it’s made clear that Nappa very much respects &#38; abides by Vegeta’s word. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Yamcha</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/yamcha.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yamcha’s death is anything but a joke. His fight against the Saibaiman is simple, but it features incredibly tight choreography and an unforgettable ending. After Yamcha has honorably defeated his opponent, he’s suddenly gripped by the Saibaiman. The two explode together and Yamcha’s lifeless corpse litters the battlefield. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While Yamcha death pose has become a meme, consider the actual context of the scene. Yamcha– a character who has been with </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">since the first arc– has unceremoniously been killed because he underestimated his opponent. It’s a genuine shock and signals to the rest of the Dragon Team that this isn’t a game. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Chaozu</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Chiaotzu-vs-Nappa.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Yamcha’s death is also an unfortunate sign that the Earthlings didn’t train hard enough for the fight against the Saiyans. They treated it like training for a tournament and now they’re suffering for it. Yamcha walked away from his opponent because the fight was over, but the Saibaiman was not dead. It’s this desperation that drives the fight against Nappa– the fact that he </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">must </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">be killed. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Chaozu hones in on this immediately and tries to take out Nappa in a kamikaze attack. Unfortunately, the blast is barely strong enough to chip Nappa’s armor. Chaozu gives up his life for the second time for nothing, no longer able to revived with the Earth’s Dragon Balls. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Tenshinhan</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DBZ-Tien-Final-Energy-Attack.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With Chaozu dead, Tenshinhan loses all hope. The anime plays this up quite a bit, featuring a rather emotional moment where Tenshinhan reflects on everything he and Chaozu have been through together. Determined to follow Chaozu in death, Tenshinhan puts everything he has into a Kikoho and unleashes it on Nappa. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-piccolo-bests-fights-original-series/\">Dragon Ball: Piccolo’s Best Fight In Every Arc (In The Original Series)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For the only time in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, the Kikoho is successful in killing Tenshinhan. His lifeless body falling onto the ground, Tenshinhan dies much like Chaozu– in vain. In spite of how powerful the Kikoho is, it does very little to Nappa in the grand scheme of things. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Piccolo &#38; God</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dragon-Ball-Piccolo-Purple-Blood.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With half of the supporting cast dead, Piccolo, Krillin, and Gohan are left to fight Nappa alone. By this point, however, they’ve eased into the battle and can coordinate accordingly. All three martial artists even manage to get some solid hits on Nappa at different points, but it all falls apart when it matters most. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">During a combo attack where Piccolo and Krillin successfully set Gohan up for the finishing blow, the young boy chickens out and can’t finish Nappa off. This results in a chain reaction where Piccolo gives his life to protect Gohan from Nappa’s retaliation. As Piccolo dies, so does God– taking the Dragon Balls with them. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Nappa</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Nappa-dead-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Goku arrives just in time to save Gohan from Nappa. Although Nappa overwhelmed every single member of the main cast, Goku is able to deliver a cathartic beatdown thanks to the Kaioken. Leaving Nappa broken, Goku explicitly does not kill him. Vegeta, however, isn’t too fond of this mercy. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Citing his disgust at a Saiyan who can’t fight, Vegeta launches Nappa into the air and kills his former companion. Establishing himself as someone beyond even the ties of his heritage &#38; race, Vegeta shows Goku why he’s the arc’s main villain. No one dies for the remainder of the arc, but both Goku and Vegeta come dangerously close.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/questions-dragon-ball-timeline-answered/\">10 Questions About The Dragon Ball Timeline, Answered</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 22:00:24 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsdd-fi.jpg","linkMd5":"9ee8482bcd8aa0931bd48d08c93a1edf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn10@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-335_25e0197defb1046c.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":230562,"destBytes":230562,"author":"Renan Fontes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dbsdd-fi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn10@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-335_25e0197defb1046c.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/farmer-with-shotgun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn5@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-932_7d21bf8b06cf372f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/Cartoon-Death-Dragon-Ball-Goku-Raditz.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn54@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-836_3b6093850480280b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Earthlings.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn18@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-14-884_16a43f947fe21e0d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/yamcha.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-16-792_7531eabfe442a522.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Chiaotzu-vs-Nappa.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn67@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-10-320_b354db486febe0ce.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/DBZ-Tien-Final-Energy-Attack.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn29@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-043_73767acd506e4f20.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dragon-Ball-Piccolo-Purple-Blood.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn65@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-847_eb536a5c7a128ca5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Nappa-dead-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn25@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-08-245_08d82c389876d779.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Avatar Theory: Kyoshi's REAL Animal Companion Was the Unagi | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-theory-kyoshi-real-animal-companion-unagi/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/shadow-of-kyoshi.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender-the-shadow-of-kyoshi/\"><strong>Avatar: The Last Airbender - </strong><strong>The Shadow of Kyoshi</strong></a><em><strong> by author F.C. Yee, available now.</strong></em></p><p>When <em>The Shadow of Kyoshi </em>came out fans clamored at one particular mystery. There's the mystery of who Kyoshi goes on to have children with or how she manages to live for over two centuries before passing the mantle to Roku, but the real juicy secret is who her animal companion was. The novel ended without supplying a definite answer, but a recent theory on <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/TheLastAirbender/comments/iag4xt/fan_theory_the_unagi_was_kyoshis_animal_companion/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Reddit</a> puts forward a compelling idea. What if the Unagi is Kyoshi's animal companion?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Avatar: What's the Strongest Waterbending Feat in the Series?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-strongest-waterbending-feat/\">Avatar: What's The Strongest Waterbending Feat In The Series?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kyoshi-Island-Unagi-1.png\"/></figure><p>Every Avatar gets an animal companion. For Aang, that companion was Appa, bound to him since childhood in the tradition of the Air Nomads and surviving with him frozen in an iceberg for a century as the only living relic Aang retains from his past. The two were best friends, heartbroken when they were apart, and remained together throughout their entire lives. It turned out as the series progressed that such a bond was typical of Avatars, and most other Avatars had their animal companions detailed.</p><p>Roku's was his dragon Fang, and Korra's was the polar bear dog Naga. Even other past Avatars seldom seen had their animal companions revealed, with the tradition going back to the first Avatar Wan and his deercat, and even through to the previous Air Nomad Avatar before Aang, Yangchen, who had the sky bison Boma and two winged lemurs named Pik and Pak. At a certain point, the absence of any mention of Kyoshi's animal companion starts to seem conspicuous, which is exactly the reason why its fertile ground for crafting a fan theory.</p><p>Throughout the two novels, <em>The Rise of Kyoshi</em> and its sequel <em>The Shadow of Kyoshi</em>, the Earth Kingdom Avatar makes plenty of friends among humans but proves lacking in the animal companionship department. While she rides around on the sky bison Pengpeng she briefly inherited from her lost mentor after the airbender's death, it's explained later that Pengpeng retired to the Southern Air Temple to raise her calves. A sky bison may have been a tempting companion for the Avatar given her mother's heritage, but it just wasn't meant to be.</p><p>But what if it turns out that fans of the show have already seen Kyoshi's animal companion all the way back to before Kyoshi herself was introduced? The first episode to touch on her lore was \"The Warriors of Kyoshi,\" in which it was explained that a band of warriors founded by Kyoshi held her in esteem as they protected an island bearing the Avatar's name. Later on, viewers learn that Kyoshi formed the island herself when she split it off the main continent using her Avatar State, granting the island a measure of protection and isolation.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Avatar: What's the Strongest Earthbending Feat in the Series?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-whats-the-strongest-earthbending-feat-in-the-series/\">Avatar: What's The Strongest Earthbending Feat In The Series?</a></span></p><p>What grants the island even further protection and isolation is the natural threat of the Unagi, a giant eel that inhabits the waters around Kyoshi Island. Aang first ran into the Unagi as a threat when he went for a leisurely swim in the coastal waters, only to discover the gargantuan beast nearly ready to devour him whole. Later on, the Unagi proved to be a valuable fixture in repairing the damage done to Kyoshi Island by the Fire Nation, spouting water across the flames burning down the small village. And that all may have been Kyoshi's plan.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Kyoshi-Warriors-training.jpg\"/></figure><p>If the Unagi were Kyoshi's <em>real</em> animal companion, then that would mean she left the beast to guard her legacy even centuries after her death. While typically it seems that Avatars' animal companions pass on to the Spirit World alongside their owner (Fang sacrificed himself upon Roku's death to the volcano) there's certainly no hard and fast rules about it. While no relationship between Kyoshi and the Unagi is hinted at in the prequel novels, the possibility remains entirely open.</p><p>However, the novels do provide a rival for the title of animal companion in the form of a small fox Kyoshi meets at the end of her latest novel. The fox helps guide Kyoshi to a meditation site that allows her to commune with Yangchen, and the story seems to leave off with the fox sticking around. At the same time, the companionship still isn't confirmed and if anything, Yangchen and Aang stand as proof that an Avatar isn't restricted to solely one animal.</p><p>The fox would certainly be a weird choice, as they already serve as Knowledge Seekers to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-why-wan-shi-tong-chose-stay-human-world/\">Library of Wan Shi Tong</a>. The Unagi would be a great companion for Kyoshi, representing her mythic status and breathtaking power. She certainly has her fox-like qualities as well, but it's hard to imagine a beast more exemplative of the life and legacy of Avatar Kyoshi.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-consistently-inconsistent-good-thing/\">The Avatar Is Consistently Inconsistent - And That's A Good Thing</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:00:23 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/shadow-of-kyoshi.jpg","linkMd5":"ff1d72a3570f125d2d26c09d4cfffdbf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn10@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-01-900_04362f66c1e3eb26.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":166342,"destBytes":166342,"author":"Brenton Stewart","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/shadow-of-kyoshi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn10@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-01-900_04362f66c1e3eb26.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kyoshi-Island-Unagi-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn89@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-06-225_f3d16c935fad6028.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Kyoshi-Warriors-training.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn18@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-05-900_f5da9d4bdccc3604.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Marvel's Chadwick Boseman Tribute Topped Sunday Night's Ratings","link":"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-tribute-black-panther-sunday-night-ratings/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Panther-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>To honor the late <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther-film/\">Black Panther</a></em> star <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\">Chadwick Boseman</a>, ABC aired a tribute that celebrated his role in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. That special and the network's airing of <em>Black Panther </em>went on to top Sunday night's TV ratings across the board.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/tv/news/black-panther-abc-chadwick-boseman-tribute-ratings-1234754568/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a>, ABC's Sunday night airing of <em>Black Panther </em>scored a 1.4 rating, while the \"A Tribute for a King\" special that aired immediately following landed a 1.1 rating. In other words, <em>Black Panther</em> drew 6.1 million viewers, while \"A Tribute for a King\" netted 4.7 million viewers. Combined, the tribute landed more viewers than the MTV Video Music Awards and NBC's sports coverage.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Chadwick Boseman Remembered in Stunning Bill Sienkiewicz Portrait\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-bill-sienkiewicz-portrait/\">Chadwick Boseman Remembered In Stunning Bill Sienkiewicz Portrait</a></span></p><p>\"A Tribute of the King\" saw various MCU stars -- including Scarlett Johansson, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Renner, Winston Duke, Mark Ruffalo and Paul Rudd -- remember Boseman. Oprah Winfrey, Whoopi Goldberg, Marvel Studios President Kevin Feige, former Disney CEO Bob Iger and Robert Downey Jr. also appeared.</p><p>Boseman tragically passed away <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-obituary/\">last week</a> at age 43. Boseman had been battling colon cancer since 2016, and it had progressed from stage III at the time of diagnosis to stage IV. He continued to appear in many films while undergoing surgeries and chemotherapy procedures at the same time.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Marvel Shares Chadwick Boseman Tribute Video: \" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-chadwick-boseman-tribute-video/\">Marvel Shares Chadwick Boseman Tribute Video: \"You Will Always Be Our King''</a></span></p><p>Boseman's T'Challa, aka Black Panther, first appeared in the MCU in 2016's <em>Captain America: Civil War</em>. The character featured in his own solo movie 2018, which would go on to be a critical and commercial hit. Boseman would also reprise the role for <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers-infinity-war/\">Avengers: Infinity War</a></em> and <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers-4/\">Endgame</a></em>.</p><p>Prior to his death, Boseman was also set to star in <em>Yasuke</em>, a movie set in feudal Japan about the only African samurai in the country, and was planning on returning the role of Black Panther for both<em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther-2/\">Black Panther 2</a></em> and Marvel's upcoming <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/what-if/\"><em>What If...?</em> </a>animated anthology series for Disney+. Boseman's last confirmed film role will be in the Netflix adaptation of the play <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Father of Terminally Ill Child Shares Chadwick Boseman's Message of Strength to His Son\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/father-terminally-ill-child-shares-chadwick-bosemans-message-strength/\">Father Of Terminally Ill Child Shares Chadwick Boseman's Message Of Strength To His Son</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:37:29
