</b></i><b><i><a href=\"https://cbr.com/tag/millionaire-detective/\">The Millionaire Detective Balance: </a></i></b><i><b><a href=\"https://cbr.com/tag/millionaire-detective/\">Unlimited</a>, \"Money Is the Root of All Evil\" now streaming on Funimation.</b></i></p><p>The latest episode begins with a flashback to when <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-3-strong-partnership/\">Chosuke was still at the investigation headquarters</a>. Solving the death of Sayuri Kambe wasn't simple back then, with the politics of the detective department creating obstacles for them, not to mention the Kambe family seemingly trying to hide a key suspect in the case. But t's not simple now,either, even with the addition of Daisuke's technology, because it seems that the same forces back then are still doing their very best to keep the truth behind Sayuri's death under wraps.</p><p>This episode, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-daisukes-unlimited-balance-gets-limited/\">Daisuke spends over 7.3 billion yen</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/how-you-can-support-anime-industry/\">How YOU Can Support the Anime Industry</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-kambe-family.jpg\"/></figure><p>19 years ago, Chosuke and Takei worked together in the investigation headquarters and were quite friendly, with Chosuke jokingly complimenting his partner's \"strategic move\" in marrying the director's daughter. Suddenly, the two of them get a call and rush over to their latest crime scene. At the location, the picture is grim. Underneath the covering is a young woman's corpse, the floor awash with her blood: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-6-kambe-family-murder-mystery/\">Sayuri Kambe</a>, 34, who died with a single stab to the heart. Her house appears to be ransacked but the two detectives and Director Kiyomizu are convinced that this isn't a simple robbery gone wrong.</p><p>Their investigation reveals that Shigemaru Kambe, the head of the family and husband of Sayuri, is a researcher currently looking into a dangerous material called \"allodium,\" which is represented with an omega-like symbol. Chosuke and Takei head to the Kambe mansion to ask Kikuko if they can speak to Shigemaru, though she says he's still overseas for work. Takei asks whether Sayuri and her husband are separated, since it turns out that, two months prior, she rented the house she was found in. Kikuko remains tight-lipped. When they fail to get Shigemaru's photo from Kikuko, Chosuke fakes a stomach ache and steals a photo album.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-kyoshi-novels-missed-massive-opportunity/\">Avatar: The Kyoshi Novels Missed a MASSIVE Opportunity</a> </span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-director-saiki.jpg\"/></figure><p>Inviting him to his office, Director Saiki instructs Kiyomizu to watch Chosuke and keep him informed. He warns him to look at the bigger picture instead of  chasing justice. Right at that moment, Takei comes in to deliver a report on Shigemaru and the director <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-3-humor-tension-combo-satisfying/\">swiftly changes tack</a>, telling his son-in-law to be kind to his daughter.</p><p>During a late night, Chosuke realizes that there's a key taped to the back of a family picture with Shigemaru, Sayuri and a young Daisuke. It appears to be the key to a coin-operated locker marked \"D15,\" with the symbol for allodium. Chosuke is about to call Kiyomizu, but he's stopped by Takei, saying they should wait until they get more information. Kiyomizu warns them not to get in too deep.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/muhyo-rojis-bureau-ebisu-backstory-explained/\">Muhyo and Roji's Bureau: Ebisu's Backstory, Explained</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detective-shigemaru-death.jpg\"/></figure><p>Some time passes and Chosuke receives a call that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-5-daisuke-makes-troubling-discoveries/\">Shigemaru had committed suicide</a>, just as they got a new lead on what the key might open. What's worse is that someone has stolen the key. Suddenly, everything comes to a grinding halt; with Shigemaru dead, the investigation will have to close and the headquarters dissolved.</p><p>As what has become a regular tradition, Chosuke and Takei sit at a bench in the park  and eat watermelon ice cream with Chosuke spitting out the chocolate seeds. Takei gets promoted to the First Division and Chosuke gets demoted. Before he leaves, the older detective hands Takei an envelope for his newborn, telling him to become a father that he can be proud of.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jujutsu-kaisen-trailer-plot-release-date-news/\">Jujutsu Kaisen: Trailer, Plot, Release Date &#38; News to Know</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/millionaire-detectie-takeis-memories.jpg\"/></figure><p>Daisuke's appearance 19 years later gave Chosuke hope that Sayuri's case could finally be solved, turning him into an advocate for the cause. So much so that He and Haru bust through the Kambe residence gates when Daisuke doesn't come to work. It turns out that he's trying to figure out what actually happened leading up to Imura's death, as the surveillance footage was tampered with. Haru confronts him once more and asks him what he's after, knowing that there must be a reason why he's doing illegal things like tampering with Imura's car. Instead of ignoring him, Daisuke admits he came to Modern Crimes to figure out what really happened to his mother.</p><p>As soon as Takei's car starts, gas pours in through the vents and he loses consciousness. In a weird dream state, he's thrown into various flashbacks, where it's clear that Takei knows more than he's letting on. At the same park he was at with Chosuke, Imura materializes in front of him, accusing him of killing her. She admits that she knew it would come to this, but tells him he needs to report to \"him.\" Takei's about to call, but he sees Haru and Chosuke approaching and he wakes up.</p><p>It turns out Takei was in a virtual world that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/millionaire-detective-episode-3-suzue-identity-revealed/\">Suzue</a> and Daisuke had created to coax the truth out of his memories. From the phone call, Daisuke figures out was trying to contact the late Director Saiki. Completely ashamed, Takei tries to deny Chosuke's remarks that he did all of this because of his ambition. Haru turns to look at Daisuke, who watches Takei break down with an unreadable expression on his face.</p><p>From the photos, it seems that Sayuri and Shigemaru were involved in allodium research, which cost them their lives. It's unclear whether Saiki is the one orchestrating all of this or if he's answering to someone else. With Haru and Chosuke now working together with Daisuke, they may finally get to the bottom of what happened 19 years ago.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a revealed how a discussion between himself and Vince McMahon helped to fend off his suicidal thoughts.</p><p>\"I'm very thankful to have a relationship with him like that because I might not even be here,\" Strowman said on the latest episode of <em>WWE Chronicle</em>. \"There was -- I don't even like talking about this out loud -- I was thinking about killing myself a couple of times and it's just... it's shitty that I got to that point and I should have talked to somebody sooner, and I never knew how much he cared about me. I thought I was just, you know, a number in the system, and that day he made me realize that I'm more important than just a number. I can't thank him enough for doing that.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wwe-rent-for-thunderdome-space-hockingly-low/\">WWE's Rent For The ThunderDome's Space Is Shockingly Low</a></span></p><p>Strowman appeared on <em>WWE Chronicle</em>, where he talked about interrupting a production meeting to request a sitdown with McMahon. The meeting resulted in Strowman regaining his confidence, while also admitting he once contemplated killing himself. \"I got to the point where I was feeling like I was doing all this hard work and I was just spinning my tires in the mud and Vince reassured me that that's not what was happening and told me like, 'hey, not only do I want you here for the long haul, I need you here for the long haul,'\" he said.</p><p>\"The Monster Among Men\" lost the Universal title to \"The Fiend\" Bray Wyatt at <em>SummerSlam</em>. He got a rematch against Wyatt at <em>Payback</em>, though Roman Reigns inserted himself into the match at the last minute to pin Strowman and win the Universal championship.</p><p>(via <a 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The God of High School Just Gave Mori & Mira SERIOUS Upgrades","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-episode-9-mori-mira-upgrades/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mori-Episode-9-header.png\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for Season 1, Episode 9 of </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/god-of-high-school/\">The God of High School</a><em>, \"cursed/cornered,\" now streaming on Crunchyroll.</em></strong></p><p>It's the quarterfinals of the God of High School national tournament and Jin Mori is nowhere to be found. After receiving a ransom note at <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-episode-8-lured-mori-deadly-trap/\">the end of the last episode</a> for his grandpa, Jin Taejin, who has been kidnapped by Nox, Mori doesn't so much as waste time even <em>texting </em>his teammates, Mira and Daewi, to let them know that he's been called away on an impromptu rescue mission. With Good Guy Daewi suspended for supreme Good Guy-ing in Episode 7, that places the pressure of their team's progression to the next round <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-mira-fighting-solo-episode-9-clip/\">squarely on Mira</a> in Episode 9, \"cursed/cornered.\"</p><p>Thankfully, Mori and Mira's extreme situations have painful but positive outcomes. They both experience breakthroughs in their fighting careers: For Mira, it's the acquisition of godly power, and for Mori, it's the invention of some brand new moves.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/god-of-high-school-episode-6-mujin-nox-mistake-traitor/\">The God Of High School: Mujin’s Enemies Just Made A Costly Mistake</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mira-Episode-9-header.png\"/></figure><p><em>The God of High School</em>'s most formidable swordswoman has been <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-episode-4-mori-mira-daewi-strengthens-friendship-break-it/\"><em>without </em>her legendary sword since Episode 4</a>. The Moon Light Sword, a blade passed down the generations of Mira's family, was stolen from her by her husband-to-be -- one of Nox's agents. This hasn't prevented Mira from kicking ass and taking names, however; instead, she felt that being free of the weapon meant also being free of the restrictive burden of legacy that had long weighed on her. Her swordless style has proven more than effective enough to get her this far, too.</p><p>But in Episode 9, as Mira is forced to drag out her match against greased-up marine Lee Marin until Mori shows up, the battle becomes inexplicably more complicated when Marin reveals that he's armed with the Moon Light Sword. Mira struggles to get purchase on his oily, near-naked body (much to the audience's discomfort) and Marin piles on the emotional pressure, too: taunting her for her stupidity in not realizing the sword' \"true power,\" and her inadequacy for failing to wield it. To add insult to injury, the sword refuses to return to her even when she has it in her grip again.</p><p>Overwhelmed, Mira falls -- but sinks into a dreamlike, oceanic world as she does. Beneath the waves, a voice calls to her, and she vows to it that she will become \"peerless and unparalleled\" in strength. When she emerges, this vow turns out to have been a contract with the charyeok, Fengxian, who looks like a historical Chinese warrior. Not only does she throttle Marin and his Kraken charyeok, but she also earns back the Moon Light Sword.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-epside-7-jugok-unstoppable-monster-nationals/\">The God Of High School: An Unstoppable Monster Tears Through Nationals</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/God-of-High-School-Mori-Episode-9.png\"/></figure><p>While Mira fights to win back her family's National Treasure, Mori fights to win back his family, period. Unfortunately, his rescue mission quickly turns into a desperate fight for his own life when one of Nox's agents uses his Doppelganger charyeok to disguise a bomb as Mori's grandpa's body. Surviving this only takes Mori out of the frying pan and into the fire -- that fire being an army of clones, who attack him in a scene that's very reminiscent of Neo being beset by Agent Smiths in <em>The Matrix </em>trilogy.</p><p>His attacker, Fei Long, has enough time to kill while watching Mori battle through his copies to do some villain monologuing, which reveals some more of Taejin's backstory: \"Our final weapon in the war against the North who became a hero when he alone survived their Death Squad’s Northern-style Taekwondo. The man who defeated every member of the Six.\" This history lesson <em>should </em>have made the agent warier of Taegin's grandson, who soon uses his acupuncture lessons from the Six's Doctor to numb himself to the pain of his injuries and unlock <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-god-of-high-school-mori-mira-daewi-fighting-styles/\">brand new techniques</a>.</p><p>Mori arrives just in time at the arena to take over for an exhausted Mira and demonstrate to Marin's teammate -- a team of doppelgangers, it turns out -- how his fight against Fei Long concluded. Mori's new moves, which he dubs \"Jin Mori Originals,\" send spiritual blue dragons hurtling toward his enemy. Watching on, three of the Six, including Mujin, feel twinges from old, cross-emblazoned wounds inflicted by Taejin, and realize that \"the tiger raised another tiger.\"</p><p><span Underworld</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 15:45:39 and Ariana Maher.</strong></em></p><p>Marvel's <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/empyre/\">Empyre</a></em> has been a roller coaster that's quickly approaching its finale. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers/\">The Avengers</a> have split up to tackle different parts of the Kree/Skrull and Cotati <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-empyre-vibranium/\">conflict that has touched Earth</a>, the Moon and other far-reaching portions of the universe.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america/\">Captain America</a> winds up in a familiar setting as he defends the planet, with his boots on the ground leading troops on the front line of combat. The Star-Spangled Avenger is working closely with a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-america-new-howling-commandos/\">small Military unit</a>, and a Kree/Skrull fleet to destroy a large Cotati army attacking Mexico City.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/empyre-major-mcu-absence-shaped-crossover/\">Empyre: How a Major MCU Alien's Absence Shaped the Marvel Crossover</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-America-Empye.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Cotati force is led by a priest named Shi Qaanth and he's summoned a gargantuan flora monster to attack the human city. The Kree/Skrull force implore the Captain to attack with large amounts of air support, but the hero is unwilling to risk the civilian casualties an airstrike would cause.</p><p>Captain America instead takes a small unit of human soldiers to break the line and figure out a plan on the fly. Once the Avenger figures out that the giant monster is being controlled by the Cotati priest Shi Qaanth, the plan becomes simple -- get to the alien priest and eliminate him to dispel the magic that is controlling the monster. While the Captain leads the assault on the ground, the Kree and Skrull plan to vaporize the city and its inhabitants if Captain America and his companions can't get the job done quickly.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-sister-innocent-empyre/\">Captain Marvel Thinks [SPOILER] Is Innocent &#38; She'll Wage War to Prove It</a></span></p><p>While Captain America is bashing his way through Cotati monsters, the Kree/Skrull attack Shi Qaanth from the air, but they're all swatted down with ease. Captain America uses this opportunity to enact his plan. He grabs one of the winged thrusters from the crashed ships and turns it into a makeshift hoverboard to challenge Shi Qaanth on top of his giant terraformed terror. An epic battle between Captain America and Shi Qaanth ensues. The plant priest almost subdues Cap with its alien vines, but a perfect shield throw destroys the magical artifact keeping the giant monster alive.</p><p>The issue and miniseries ends with Captain America saving Mexico City. However, there is no time to celebrate as the Avenger receives word that something big is happening in Wakanda, and the world is once more in need of its <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-america-best-soldier/\">greatest soldier</a>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a Olsen-Koziol","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-america-empyre-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn48@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-709_be4d15fe6061fb67.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Captain-America-Empye.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn69@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-915_407d8f1a831edd24.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Spider-Man: Sin-Eater Is Building A Potentially VERY Formidable Army","link":"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-sin-eater-super-powered-army/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Spider-Man-Sin-Eater-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man/\">Amazing Spider-Man</a> #47 by Nick Spencer, Marcelo Ferreira, Roberto Poggi, David Curiel, &#38; VC's Joe Caramagna, on sale now</em></strong></p><p>There are some pretty powerful <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man/\">Spider-Man</a> enemies out there, with many of them finding the ability to rally entire armies of supporters. Norman Osborn's Goblin Army, Doctor Octopus' legion of henchmen, and others have risen up over the years. Now, another major Spider-Man enemy is rallying their own force of potentially deadly New Yorkers.</p><p>The Sin-Eater is rallying an army of like-minded citizens - and could end up with a pretty powerful force if his hint about giving them his power turns out to be true.</p><p>RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/amazing-spider-man-mystery-hero-last-remains-crossover/\">Amazing Spider-Man Teases the Return of a Mystery Hero in 'Last Remains' Crossover</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sin-Eater-Army-Spider-Man-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>After sneaking into Norah Winter's car, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-sin-eater-personal/\">Sin-Eater seemed to turn his gun on the reporter</a>. But it's revealed that instead of opening fire on Norah and adding her to his list of confirmed kills, in reality, it was Norah trying to shoot him with her gun. Unaffected by the bullet to the chest, Sin-Eater revealed that despite her numerous sins, he didn't want to kill her. In fact, he wanted her to actually do her job and report on his crusade. This allows Sin-Eater to make his case directly to the people of New York City, arguing that his tactics are brutal but necessary if they want to save the world form what he calls an unrelenting wave of crime and death and sin. He even calls on the various peoples of the city to unite behind him and his crusade.</p><p>Despite Jonah Jameson's reluctance to spread this manifesto, Norah argues it's important for New Yorkers to see the video and decide for themselves what they want to do. But Jonah's fears of this motivating the angriest people in the city to action is well-founded. Following a believer in Sin-Eater's principals, Spider-Man sneaks into a building where multiple people have begun donning Sin-Eater inspired costumes and masks. There are dozens of them already, all clamoring for Sin-Eater's brand of justice. Seeing an army grow around him, Sin-Eater hints that like him, they'll soon carry out a holy crusade against crime, killing everyone they deem a genuine threat.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/peter-parker-sin-eater-amazing-spider-man-47-preview/\">Peter Parker Smashes Sin-Eater In Amazing Spider-Man #47</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sin-Eater-Army-Spider-Man-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>What makes this army so particularly concerning is the suggestion that Sin-Eater hints at: that his current ability to take the superhuman abilities of the people he guns down could be spread through his disciples. While using his powers to trounce Spider-Man in a 1-on-1 fight, he calls out to his cheering crowd and tells them that soon, they'll all be capable of this and more. Although he'd earlier been talking about the symbolic power the Sin-Eaters can develop by working as a unified force to take control of the city-streets, Sin-Eater's attack on Spider-Man - and his mastery of multiple powers - hints that this could be a gift that could be spread. If the Kindred was able to empower Sin-Eater, then why couldn't they do the same to a host of his followers?</p><p>This could create an entire army of killers who are capable of stealing the powers of the people they kill - which could lead to a very potential fearsome force. While they may be directed towards bringing down criminals, they're still be commanded by a repeat killer and someone who'd been, until recently, doomed to suffer for the sins of the world he'd taken on. It's his dark morality that defines this army, meaning he (or the Kindred through him) could use this burgeoning strikeforce to attack anyone in the city. These reinforcements might even give Sin-Eater more than enough bodies and fire-power to attack - and try to kill - Norman Osborn, his newest target.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Spider-Man-Sin-Eater-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn69@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-695_3af3b80c324c0095.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sin-Eater-Army-Spider-Man-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn41@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-15-188_82e45ad41dccf583.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sin-Eater-Army-Spider-Man-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn9@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-06-885_375f109b53046d9c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Dragon Ball Z: Every Butterfly Effect Trunks & Cell Caused Through Time Travel","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-every-butterfly-effect-through-time-travel/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/tt-fi.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Time travel always comes with consequences in fiction, especially in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-z\">Dragon Ball Z</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. While Trunks erroneously believes that his arrival has created a butterfly effect where Goku shows up on Earth too late to stop Frieza, unaware that he’s about to create his own massive butterfly effect that’ll fundamentally alter the course of history. Trunks shouldn’t feel too guilty, though, because Cell beat him to the punch a few years prior. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-piccolo-bests-fights-original-series/\">Dragon Ball: Piccolo’s Best Fight In Every Arc (In The Original Series)</a></span></p><p><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s main timeline was already undergoing a butterfly effect before Trunks travelled back in time thanks to Cell’s own time traveling. Trunks came from a future with no hope, unsure if his plan would even work and how exactly the butterfly affected his own timeline (it didn’t in the grand scheme of things.) It’s almost hard to believe, but without both Cell and Trunks meddling with the course of time, </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-super\">Dragon Ball</a> </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">would tell a much darker story. </span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>The Frieza Interference</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Future-Trunks.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even though Cell’s time travelling prior to Trunks’ would have naturally had subtle effects on the main timeline, it’s not until Trunks makes his voyage back in time where </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s chronology begins to diverge. Even though Trunks travels back to the right place and right time, he doesn’t know Goku can teleport. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When Frieza touches down with his army and Goku isn’t anywhere in sight, Trunks immediately steps in &#38; wipes out Frieza’s men. It turns out Goku was about to teleport when he sensed Trunks’ Ki handling the situation, choosing to just let things play out. Trunks’ interference here would have the largest effect on the timeline, ultimately leading into him warning Goku about the Androids’ eventual invasion and his Heart Virus. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Goku’s Delayed Heart Virus</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Goku-Suffering-From-the-Heart-Virus.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Whether it’s because Cell travelled back in time first or due to Trunks telling him about the Heart Virus, Goku doesn’t feel the effects of his ailment until much later in the main timeline. Goku’s already dead by the time the Artificial Humans attack in Trunks’ future, but Goku doesn’t get sick until his fight with Android 19 in the main timeline. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In fact, it’s the stress of turning Super Saiyan that ends up putting pressure on Goku’s heart, bringing out the full effects of the Heart Virus at the worst time possible. While Goku ultimately survives the virus thanks to the medicine Trunks gave him, Chichi and Yamcha do need to scramble to find it in Goku’s home since he never had a reason to take it in the first place. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Android 16’s Activation</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Dragon-Ball-Android-16.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trunks returns to his future shortly after warning the Dragon Team about the Android attack, but he decides to travel back in time to him with the eventual assault. Unfortunately, Trunks’ presence seems to have had a greater effect on the timeline than he imagined as he doesn’t even recognize Dr. Gero and Android 19. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-gohan-power-ups-in-order/\">Dragon Ball Z: All Of Gohan’s Power Ups (In Chronological Order)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While it’s possible that Dr. Gero and Android 19 were present in the fusion’s initial attack as well, there’s a clear anomaly in Android 16’s activation. 16 isn’t so much as referenced in the future, but the main timeline stresses that he not only wants to kill Goku, he’s the strongest of the three Androids. 16 may be introduced as a dangerous villain, but he goes on to play one of the most heroic roles in the Cell arc– instrumental in saving the world.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Stronger Artificial Humans</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Android-18-takes-off-jacket-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The main timeline isn’t in the best situation with the activation of Android 16, but it’s made even worse when Trunks realizes that these versions of Android 17 and 18 are much stronger than the ones he fought in the future. Whether it’s because his androids were holding back doesn’t really matter. The point is that Trunks’ presence has severely altered how the androids are behaving. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In a single battle, both Androids 17 and 18 overwhelm every single member of the Dragon Team. Vegeta is left broken &#38; battered, Future Trunks has his sword shattered, and both Tenshinhan &#38; Piccolo can hardly do a thing to fight back. Krillin is left the last man standing as the Androids approach him. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>The Survival Of The Dragon Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/krillin-and-18.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In spite of their freak strength, the Androids of the main timeline curiously spare the Dragon Team. In Trunks’ future, it’s suggested they killed off every member of the main cast one by one as they came to fight them. Here, however, the Androids very explicitly leave everyone alive. Android 18 had every reason in the world to kill Vegeta, but she doesn’t. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Krillin is spared alongside the rest of the Dragon Team and it’s made clear that quite a number of things have changed between the main timeline and Trunks’ future. Androids 17 and 18 might be much stronger, but they at least don’t have a taste for bloodlust like they did in the future. Though this likely has to do with Goku still being alive. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Gohan’s Potential</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Gohan.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Gohan ends up training Trunks in the future, but he hits a wall when it comes to Super Saiyan. Future Gohan genuinely believes that this is his peak. Only about as strong as Goku was on Namek– if a bit stronger– Future Gohan fights an uphill battle that costs him everyone he holds dear, his arm, and ultimately his life. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-manga-best-chapters/\">Dragon Ball Super: 10 Best Chapters Of The Manga (So Far)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With Goku still alive in the main timeline, Gohan never frames himself through Goku’s strength. Instead, Goku is able to help Gohan see the full scope of his potential. By training with his father inside of the Room of Spirit and Time, main timeline Gohan becomes stronger than Future Gohan ever was.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Goku’s Sacrifice</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Goku-Willing-to-Sacrifice-Self.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The whole reason Trunks travels back in time is to prevent Goku’s death, but fate seems to have its grip around the Saiyan’s life. While Goku does not succumb to the Heart Virus in the main timeline, he’s forced to sacrifice himself during the Cell Games to save the Earth. The main takeaway being that while Goku is still dead, it wasn’t in vain. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even though the Dragon Balls could have revived Goku, he opts to stay dead, citing a conversation he had off-screen with Bulma where she tells him that villains always flock to him. While Goku’s death buys the world seven years of peace, the Majin Buu arc makes it very clear just how much </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">needs Son Goku. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>The Majin Buu Crisis</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Majin-Buu-Eating-Sweets.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Arguably the most significant butterfly effect caused by Trunks and Cell time travelling is the Majin Buu crisis. In both timelines, they happen at radically different points in time and play out differently. Presumably because the Androids wiped out most of human life, Bobbidi only arrives after Trunks has rebuilt the future. From there, Trunks is able to handle the crisis with minimal casualties. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the main timeline, Bobbidi and Dabra arrive much earlier on a healthy planet Earth. Without Trunks’ pragmatism, however, the main Dragon Team mess everything up, resulting in a chain reaction that revives Majin Buu, mass human extinction, and the destruction of the planet. Everything works out in the end, but Buu proves to be a greater threat in the main timeline.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-android-18-characters-can-cant-beat/\">Dragon Ball Z: 5 Villains Android 18 Could Defeat (&#38; 5 She’d Lose To)</a></span></p>\n                        \n Fontes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/tt-fi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn30@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-709_375c7943edb8d286.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Future-Trunks.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn97@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-12-165_19369683ff2f50e7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Goku-Suffering-From-the-Heart-Virus.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn1@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-09-697_f7f150e0df510607.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Dragon-Ball-Android-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn17@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-10-629_46216930f7deb1ce.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Android-18-takes-off-jacket-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn35@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-15-099_5813eeb404a331b0.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/krillin-and-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn27@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-17-596_aad79802b566b42e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Gohan.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-10-912_15533ea52a528289.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Goku-Willing-to-Sacrifice-Self.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn1@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-547_46acd067a5b43833.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Majin-Buu-Eating-Sweets.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn5@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-14-760_0858865f5e8c13cf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"X-Men: 10 Best Line-Ups, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-best-teams-ranked-marvel-comics-excalibur-first-outbackclass/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/X-Men-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a> have one of the most expansive rosters in all of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel/\">Marvel Comics</a>, even routinely placing in the line-ups of other high profile teams. The line-up shifts so often that it's hard to keep straight, but a good barometer of what generation a fan belongs to is to find out what their favorite line-up is. Whether it's the 80s, 90s, or right now, everybody has a favorite roster they'd love to see in that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/james-gunn-x-men-roster-mcu-movi/\">upcoming MCU X-Men movie</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-facts-genosha/\">X-Men: 10 Facts Fans Should Know About Genosha</a></span></p><p>But what are the best line-ups the X-Men have ever had? What eras and iterations of the team stand out amongst all the rest? Here are the ten best X-Men line-ups, ranked.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Age of Apocalypse</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Age-of-Apocalypse.jpg' /></figure><p>A good number of X-Men line-ups hail from alternate realities. Just think about it: <em>House of M, Age of X</em>, and perhaps most significantly, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-age-apocalypse-aged-well-poorly/\"><em>Age of Apocalypse</em></a>.</p><p>The core X-Men line-up changed dramatically in the horrific alternate future of the classic 90s event. Now led by Magneto after the murder of Professor X, the team is dominated by characters who had once been villains, including an incredible take on Sabretooth, and Magneto's own wife, Rogue. Throw in fan-favorite Blink, and this team easily ranks as one of the best.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>New X-Men</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/www.cbr-.comnew-x-men-a72e5d70b233ed258b649a0e6a51108c7e956751.jpg' /></figure><p>The New X-Men era of the team emerged in the wake of the hugely successful first Fox X-Men movie. This version focused on some classic characters like Cyclops and Jean Grey, but leveraged new members of the team, like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-emma-frost-costumes-love-hate/\">Emma Frost</a>.</p><p>The White Queen's evolution as a key member of the team to where she is now - one of the most important and influential players in all of mutantdom on Krakoa - really begins here. The very movie-inspired line-up succeeds by introducing a lot of new elements, like Beast's continued evolution.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Excalibur</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/excalibur-meggan-captain-britain-phoenix-shadowcat.jpg' /></figure><p>While technically not the X-Men, this Britain-based line-up of mutant heroes functionally was in the wake of the team's apparent demise in the 80s. Former X-members <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-kitty-pryde-best-worst-mutant/\">Kitty Pryde</a>, Nightcrawler, and Rachel Summers joined forces with Captain Britain and Meghan to form Excalibur.</p><p>This team proved one of the most interesting and certainly one of the funniest of all the teams. A little bit of humor was sorely needed given the main X-Men titles involved a lot of doom and gloom (and often still do).</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Mid-80s</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-80s-Lineup.jpeg' /></figure><p>Excalibur evolved out of the most iconic periods in the X-Men's history. Kitty, Rachel, and Kurt all anchored a team that included some of the X-Men's most prominent and powerful members like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-top-colossus-costumes-ranked-marvel-comics/\">Colossus</a> and Rogue. This period saw Storm without her powers, and the introduction of her iconic mohawk look. She and Cyclops duked it out for leadership of the X-Men, which he ultimately yielded before leaving the team.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rogue-better-as-avenger-or-x-men/\">5 Reasons Why Rogue Is Better As A Member Of The Uncanny Avengers (&#38; 5 Why She Should Stay An X-Man)</a></span></p><p>Though this period was transitional between the early Claremont era and the crossover craziness of the late 80s and early 90s, it was one of the best in the team's history.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>First Class</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Original-X-Men-Team.jpg' /></figure><p>The classic X-Men remains one of the best line-ups in the team's history. Cyclops, Jean Grey, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-iceman-best-worst-mutant/\">Iceman</a>, Beast, and Angel represent some of the most important and consequential characters in all of Marvel history. Together, they ushered one of the most consequential elements of the Marvel universe: mutants.</p><p>Though their early adventures didn't prove as popular as later iterations of the book, they laid a solid and important foundation that keeps them anchored in the team's destiny to this day (it helps that they die and come back to life. A lot).</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Astonishing X-Men</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Colossus-Astonishing-X-Men.jpeg' /></figure><p>The <em>Astonishing X-Men</em> run in the mid-2000s by Joss Whedon and Frank Quietly succeed the <em>New X-Men</em>, by involving many of the same characters like Cyclops, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/beast-belong-avengers-x-men/\">Beast</a>, and Emma Frost. But where it really popped was in returning some old fan favorites like Kitty and Colossus.</p><p>Their relationship finally grew up here, and arguably was never better (it's not exactly in great shape at the moment). This roster returned fans to the colorful costumes and the crazy fun of earlier eras while adding in that trademark Whedon pathos as well.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Giant-Size X-Men</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Nightcrawler-New-X-Men.jpg' /></figure><p>As integral to the history of the team as the original five from the 60s, the line-up introduced in <em>Giant-Size X-Men</em> #1 greatly expanded and diversified the team.</p><p>It's hard to imagine today, but this was the first appearance of numerous iconic characters, like Storm, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-nightcrawler-kurt-wagner-trivia/\">Nightcrawler</a>, and Colossus. Like pretty much every line-up, this particular one would go through quick and significant changes. Thunderbird died quickly after, and Banshee bowed out, but much of this line-up remains in place today.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Outback Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/X-MEN-ROSTERS-Outback.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most interesting line-ups occurred in the late 80s. It was also one of the funniest, despite the circumstances. The X-Men faked their deaths and then went into hiding in the Australian Outback. From there, they launched secret missions around the world with a line-up that including newcomers <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/betsy-braddock-psylocke-captain-britain-better/\">Psylocke</a> (before her traumatic transformation into a ninja assassin) as well as Dazzler and Longshot.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-worst-x-men-crossover-events/\">The 5 Best X-Men Crossover Events (&#38; The 5 Worst)</a></span></p><p>This roster scraped by on next to nothing, which honestly made a lot more sense for outcasts than living in a fancy mansion and flying a supersonic jet.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Blue Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-Blue-Team.jpeg' /></figure><p>Once the X-Men revealed themselves to be alive and went back to more or less the status quo, the team expanded and then divided into what are arguably for most fans its two most well-known line-ups. The first was the X-Men Blue Team, which consisted of Cyclops, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-alpha-flight-every-team-roster-ranked/\">Wolverine</a>, Beast, Rogue, Gambit, Psylocke, and Jubilee.</p><p>This line-up is likely one of the most tactically effective in their history, with numerous heavy hitters highly experienced and effective in close-quarters combat. And Jubilee helped sometimes, too.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Gold Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Storm-X-Men-Gold.jpg' /></figure><p>The Gold Team existed alongside the Blue, and it's debatable if one is better than the other, but the Gold Team features something the Blue Team doesn't. Three <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-omega-level-mutants-universe-builders/\">Omega-Level mutants</a> rank among this team's line-up, including Storm, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-jean-grey-best-mutant-worst/\">Jean Grey</a>, and Iceman.</p><p>Any of these mutants rank on any list of the most powerful characters in comics. The three of them together - though not necessarily all at their apex at this point - puts this over the top not only in sheer power but in awesomeness. It also helps that Colossus, Archangel, and Bishop round out the squad, nicely balancing firepower with a little bit of muscle and air superiority.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-blackbird-little-known-trivia/\">X-Men: 10 Things Fans Should Know About The Blackbird</a></span></p>\n                        \n Harn","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/X-Men-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn10@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-467_ebe50d7eeb1a27d5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/Age-of-Apocalypse.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn93@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-10-452_4704c620316d0e3a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/www.cbr-.comnew-x-men-a72e5d70b233ed258b649a0e6a51108c7e956751.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn91@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-15-671_44f953b8a4a135b5.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/excalibur-meggan-captain-britain-phoenix-shadowcat.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn66@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-12-641_0cbe7165dfc59f51.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-80s-Lineup.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-14-588_df388e00e9f64ea9.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Original-X-Men-Team.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-495_a150cc5146fd93df.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Colossus-Astonishing-X-Men.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn50@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-05-912_f61a38e880987a65.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Nightcrawler-New-X-Men.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/X-MEN-ROSTERS-Outback.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn42@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-06-972_4ecee37381c93bb2.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-Men-Blue-Team.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn82@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-07-138_04620a79117e18e6.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Storm-X-Men-Gold.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn49@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-10-986_ba48c2d9beb6bef1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":" Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaiba: 10 Amazing Shinobu Cosplays That Look Just Like The Anime","link":"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-kimetsu-no-yaiba-shinobu-cosplay/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Shinobu-Header-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p>In <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/demon-slayer/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Demon Slayer</a></em>, Shinobu is one of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-strongest-hashira/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Hashiras</a>, some of the strongest slayers in the world. From the jump, she was an interesting character, as shown with her being sixth in the first character poll the series did. She had a look that was unlike any other in the series, truly embodying the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-powerful-breathing-techniques-ranked/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">insect breath</a> she represented.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-best-ways-manga-foreshadowed-grand-finale-ending/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Demon Slayer: The 10 Best Ways The Manga Foreshadowed The Grand Finale</a></span></p><p>Her pleasant disposition is also very unique as she loves joking around with and teasing her teammates, being almost your standard pixie <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rascal-does-not-dream-bunny-girl-senpai-memes-hilarious-anime/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">dream girl</a>. This pleasantness even seemingly expands to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-what-to-know-before-watching-mugen-train/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">demons</a> as she says she wants to be able to get along with them (not truly the case). The cosplay below helps bring out a lot of that playfulness her character has.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Dreams To Reality</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Shinobu-Cosplay-by-cospoxia.png' /></figure><p><em>Cosplay by cospoxia:</em> https://www.instagram.com/p/CCO5rpsDHsp/?utm_source=ig_embed</p><p>Be it photo manipulation or some sort of latex mask, Cospoxia manages to make herself look doll-like as if she were an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/most-expensive-anime-figures-ranked/\">anime figurine</a> come to life rather than a mere cosplay. It's both astounding and almost jarring to look at as you can't take your eyes off how her face looks. It's a true credit to her ability as a cosplayer to pull off something so eye-catching. Once you manage to pull your eyes away from it, you'll see the rest of the outfit is equally as good.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Free As A Butterfly</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>The butterfly motif her clothing has is perfect on several levels, first being that she's the insect Hashira and second, that free-roaming nature of the bug fits in with the personality she often exudes to others. That almost <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/howls-moving-castle-fan-art/\">whimsical</a> and fun persona is shown beautifully here by Summer. You can see she's someone who roams the world on a whim, never letting the atrocities within it get her down. She's that beacon of light in the dark.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Growth</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>The way she's caressing that budding flower works well for the character, outward appearance being rather nurturing, even as she struggles to contain her inner rage.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-questions-after-end-of-the-maga/\">Demon Slayer: 10 Burning Questions We Still Have Now That The Manga Is Over</a></span></p><p>Blooming of the flower is also very symbolic since her character develops as the series goes on, fully sprouting her petals towards the end of the series when her true nature comes out in full. The highlights of purple in her hair work so well with the natural black.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Shroud Of Purple</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Cospoxia may be the gold standard when it comes to Shinobu cosplay. Every one of her images is not only amazing to look at but so different from each other. They all show different sides of her character, this one focusing more on her abilities, a stream of purple smoke surrounding her. It's the first one that gives the fullest view of the outfit as well, showing how well done it is. The butterfly styling of the robe going perfect with the end of her leggings.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Insect Queen</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Her eyes are a little jarring at first, looking almost cross-eyed, but when you move passed that fact, it's one that nails Shinobu's hair better than anyone else. Rather than going with streaks, she colored the tips of her hair with purple, just as the character does. The color matches well with her butterfly hairpin as well. Her use of props is spot on as well, the butterflies used adding to the cosplay, showing off why she's the insect Hashira.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Ready To Slay</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>It's hard to not have your eyes immediately divert to her eyes, from how thick her eyelashes are to the pale pink contacts used for her eyes. They have a way of sucking you into them.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-best-worst-characters/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Demon Slayer: 5 Characters Fans Have Come To Love (&#38; 5 They Still Find Annoying)</a></span></p><p>As with others, the purple in her hair matches very nicely with the coloring of the hairpiece nestled on the back of her head. The way it looks like she's ready to unsheath her sword shows how quickly Shinobu can switch from smiling to a straight-up killer at the drop of a hat.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Living Doll</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>It's always going to be incredible seeing people who can turn themselves into what can only be called a living doll. It isn't just her face either, even her hand looks like it could be made of porcelain, lacking any sort of blemish on it at all. Photo editing comes into play, naturally, but it's not the only thing. Beyond that, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-inosuke-anime-cosplay/\">cosplay</a> is everything you'd want it to be, robes, hair, and hairpiece all looking as you'd want them to.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Girl Power</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>If there's one thing you can always give Demon Slayer as a series, it's that it treats its female characters with as much respect as it's men, something that isn't always the case in shounen. Shinobu, Mitsuri, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-reasons-protect-nezuko/\">Nezuko</a> all have moments where they get to shine. All three cosplayers here, look great as their respective characters, deep purple streaks in Shinobu's hair being perfect when contrasted with the sheer brightness of Mitsuri's pink and neon green hair.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Blade</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>That sword is phenomenal looking, engravings within the metal making it look as authentic as possible. The way she's holding it is also on point of the character, using it more as a defensive weapon than one of pure offense as she's well aware she's lacking in physical strength. Her eyes are such a nice royal purple, matching not only her hair and the hairpiece but also the background as well. The purple lighting and sheets hanging near it help provide a very pleasing backdrop for the photo.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Transformation</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>That quote used by Nagini sums up why the butterfly is such a perfect symbol for Shinobu as a character. The metamorphosis the creature had to undergo to achieve the beauty we see is often glossed over, not unlike what Shinobu herself had to undergo. The large bamboo stalks in the background help transport you more to that feudal Japan setting that much of <em>Demon Slayer</em> is set in. The choice to have the butterfly be a different color from the rest of her purple garb was smart, giving a nice point of contrast and avoiding things looking too similar.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-amazing-nezuko-cosplays/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Demon Slayer: 10 Amazing Nezuko Cosplays That Look Just Like the Anime</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:00:22 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Shinobu-Header-Cropped.jpg","linkMd5":"093355332267da6f5e1e56999cab4c29","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn55@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-907_e0c75b9fd528abbc.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":120932,"destBytes":120932,"author":"Anthony Mazzuca","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Shinobu-Header-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn55@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-907_e0c75b9fd528abbc.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Shinobu-Cosplay-by-cospoxia.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn76@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-15-557_e4cf373c664644af.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Taika Waititi and Jeff Goldblum are Working on a Secret Project","link":"https://www.cbr.com/taika-waititi-jeff-goldblum-secret-project/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/taikajeffheader.jpg\"/></figure><p>After working together on <em>Thor: Ragnarok,</em> Jeff Goldblum has hinted at an impending reunion with director <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/taika-waititi/\">Taika Waititi</a>.</p><p>When asked about the Disney+ show <em>The Mandalorian</em>, which features Waititi as both a director and the voice of the character IG-11, by <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/jeff-goldblum-jurassic-world-dominion-laura-dern-disney-plus-emmys-2020-8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Insider</a>, Goldblum responded, \"I'm a fan of it! I'm a fan, of course, of Taika Waititi. I adore him, always did before I even worked with him, and maybe we'll do something again together.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-wars-taika-waititi-feature-film/\">Star Wars Recruits Thor: Ragnarok's Taika Waititi For New Film</a></span></p><p>\"We've talked about doing something else that has to be secret right now but I would do anything with him, sure,\" Goldblum continued. \"And Disney+ are just a great bunch of people to be associated with. They are a wonderful family, how smart and sweet and kind they are.\"</p><p>Fresh off winning an Academy Award for the screenplay for <em>Jojo Rabbit</em>, Taika Waititi has a number of upcoming projects in the works. One of those films is the <em>Thor: Ragnarok</em> sequel <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/thor-4/\">Thor: Love and Thunder</a></em>. \"I can't give away any secrets,\" Goldblum previously said about reprising his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jeff-goldblum-wants-to-return-grandmaster-thor-love-and-thunder/\">role of The Grandmaster in <em>Love and Thunder</em></a>. \"I know there's been rumblings and whisperings and I know nothing. I can't say anymore than that.\"</p><p>Before <em>Love and Thunder</em>, though, is Waititi's next film, the sports comedy <em>Next Goal Wins</em>. Starring Michael Fassbender, Elisabeth Moss, Kaimana, Oscar Knightley, Rhys Darby and Armie Hammer, <em>Next Goal Wins</em> is currently in post-production and has no release date.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/taika-waititi-thor-love-and-thunder-romantic/\">Taika Waititi Says Thor: Love And Thunder Is A Very Romantic Film</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:58:32 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/taikajeffheader.jpg","linkMd5":"bd5c946adb389f9cdbe0a800c5891cd0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn77@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-699_1ae3ce2e6b0e3b86.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":201099,"destBytes":168996,"author":"Douglas Laman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/taikajeffheader.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn77@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-699_1ae3ce2e6b0e3b86.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Attack On Titan: 10 Hanji Pieces Of Fan Art We Love | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-best-hanji-fan-art/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Header-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p>Within the <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/attack-on-titan/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan</a></em> universe, Hanji is incredibly unique. She's more mind over matter character as she relies on her <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-smartest-minds-ranked/\">genius-level intellect</a> over brute strength as some of the other characters do. She also seems more light-hearted and fun (at first) in comparison to the others.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-best-sasha-fan-artwork/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan: 10 Pieces Of Sasha Fan Art We Love</a></span></p><p>Some of that fades as the series goes on, Hanji forced to be more serious once she becomes the commander, but it's still there, just in a darker form. That's shown by brief glimpses of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/carnage-vs-joker-villain-psychotic/\">psychotic</a> side of her character. It gives her a well-rounded personality, one that's on full display in these fan art.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Psycho</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan.jpg' /></figure><p>It doesn't come out often, but Zoe has a very unhinged side to her. She held a similarly <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/psycho-pass-most-sadistic-villains-ranked/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">sadistic</a> smile when she was torturing Djel Sannes. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/sukiblog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sukiblog</a> does a fantastic job of showing that unhinged energy she has, from the smile to the wideness of her eyes. It all shows that Zoe isn't right in the head. The smudging and overall coloring of the background help give it an interesting look as if blood is splattering around her without making it an overly gory piece.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Notes</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-2.jpg' /></figure><p>If there's one thing Zoe is always going to be, it's studious. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/goatrocket\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Goatrocket</a> puts her in a more relaxed setting, sitting amongst her notes and books with a nice steamy cup of coffee or tea. The weathered-look they manage to give both the documents and the journal she's flipping through is a nice touch. The entire piece puts Zoe at a sense of peace as if this is where she can be her true self, among the pages of these books rather than around people.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Headlines</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-3.jpg' /></figure><p>Slapping Zoe's face onto the cover of a magazine is such a unique way to do fan art. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/emametlo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Emametlo</a> doesn't stop there either, giving it more depth by adding the small headlines around it, the line about 8 amazing titan facts being apt for how articles are written now.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-best-erwin-fan-artwork/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan: 10 Pieces Of Erwin Fan Art We Love</a></span></p><p>The art itself is very well done too. The depth in her hair is particularly noteworthy, each strand can be visible, looking thin enough to pluck right off her head. The fullness of her lips is instantly eye-catching as well.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Smirking</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-4.jpg' /></figure><p>While she loses some of her light-heartedness as the series goes on, that smirk seemed plastered all over her face when she first showed up on the scene. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/blackteakimi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Blackteakimi</a> does a good job of making it both playful and foreboding, never knowing what exactly is going through Zoe's mind. With someone like Zoe, you never know if she's going to play some sort of practical joke on you or try to drag you into one of her <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-weapon-x-experiments-wrong-right/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">experiments</a>. The way her eye color nearly matches the color of her hair gives the art a nice bit of symmetry.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Titans</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-5.jpg' /></figure><p>If there's one thing Zoe has an obsession over, it's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-titan-ymir-quotes-best/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Titans</a>. It's to the level of the guy from <em>Ancient Aliens</em>, everything in some way tying back into the Titans in some way. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/jazzie560\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jazzie560</a> gives some of that confidently smart energy to her here, look of utter confidence in her face as she adjusts her glasses, no doubt ready to launch into some long spiel about why she's right. The small spread of her lips showing she'd be completely in her element doing so.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Glowing</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-6.jpg' /></figure><p>The amount of glow Zoe has here makes it seem like she's standing right in front of the sun, basking in the full amount of its rays. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/jazzie560\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jazzie560</a> does a phenomenal job with the light refracting off the right side of her body as well as her glasses.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-best-annie-leonhart-fan-art/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan: 10 Annie Leonhart Fan Art Pictures Just Like the Anime</a></span></p><p>The colors they chose for both her and the leaves in the background scream warmth. You can feel yourself transported to a nice autumn day where a light breeze is sending the foliage cascading down around you.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Levi</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-7.jpg' /></figure><p>The relationship that Zoe and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-titan-awesome-best-levi-cosplay-anime/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Levi</a> have with one another is an interesting one. On one hand, Levi would trust Zoe with his life, going by whatever plan she ever came up with. On the other hand, her eccentric nature wears on him, clashing far too much with his more calm and detached demeanor. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/ikimaru-art\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ikimaru-art</a> shows so much of that here, Levi sipping from his cup as he internally wants to scream. Zoe meanwhile looks like she's having the time of her life.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Morning Planning</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-8.jpg' /></figure><p>Everyone looks like they met up to discuss their next course of action, Zoe talking their ears off on what her newest discovery was or just being her usual eccentric self. She isn't the star of this art by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/fansyl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fansyl</a> though, that spot belonging to Levi who's face exudes a fed up energy, that he feels like he's surrounded by idiots, and is at his wits end over it. From the throbbing vein in his forehead to the darkened eyes, you can tell that Zoe is the source of his dismay yet again.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Circle Of Life</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-9-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Who knew a combination of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-season-four-fan-theories-perfect-bad/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan</a></em> and <em>Lion King</em> would work so well. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/mistiqarts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Mistiqarts</a> recreation of one of the best scenes in the movie with Zoe as Rafiki and Levi as Simba is fantastic. Zoe has so much of that zany and odd energy that Rafiki had, two characters easily being friends if they were to meet each other. That look of utter dismay and resignment in Levi's face fits perfectly too. He wants to be anywhere, but right here, yet, he knows there's no use trying to argue once Zoe gets an idea in her head.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>What Now?</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Hanji-Attack-On-Titan-10.jpg' /></figure><p>Most of the art has focused on the eccentricity of Zoe, while <a class=\"_e75a791d-denali-editor-page-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/ayywa\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ayywa</a> went more for a serious look. She looks like she's drifted into quiet contemplation over what her next move should be. The weight of the world could very well be on her shoulders, so many lives hinging on whatever plan she comes up with. The flickering embers around her hint at either the city around her burning or that her gaze is focused on the roaring flames of a fire pit.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/attack-on-titan-characters-duos-perfect-together-no-sense/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Attack On Titan: 5 Duos That Are Perfect Together (&#38; 5 That Make No Sense)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:00:10
