Brueheim","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Easter-Eggs-Feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn21@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-681_f5efe1c425e02fff.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Howard-the-Duck-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn42@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-908_33631c3861f35f82.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Aaron-Davis-Spider-Man-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn65@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-13-559_eb0cf155910e3338.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Jasper-Sitwell-Doctor-Strange-1.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Lokis-Kids.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn13@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-06-825_71e576610aeb3b71.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Ten-Rings-Logo-Iron-Man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-14-194_05f8226556351e23.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Cameron-Klein-1-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn2@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-13-877_1f433e05626f7e15.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Dancing-Monkey-Easter-Egg-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn81@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-658_1129e53fc5aecbc1.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Photon-Easter-Egg-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn75@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-18-318_b3e1558be4df40ae.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-Helen-Cho-2-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn29@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-09-168_46f25db91c71f0e9.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marvel-MCU-In-Flight-Movies-1-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn60@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-15-192_bd238a988ec32450.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700502},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Serious Sam: The First Encounter Is Still Worth Playing | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/serious-sam-first-encounter-still-worth-playing/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/serios-sam-firstencounter.jpg\"/></figure><p>Sometimes classic <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/video-games/\">video games</a> fail to withstand the test of time. Fortunately, that is not the case with <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/serious-sam/\">Serious Sam</a>: The First Encounter</em>. The first <em>Serious Sam</em> game is still a fantastic first-person shooter that hasn't lost its charm. Its fast-paced action and simple, yet enjoyable gameplay are more than enough to satisfy any gamer's thirst for nostalgia.</p><p><em>Serious Sam: The First Encounter</em> is like throwing Duke Nukem in the middle of ancient Egypt, while abhorrent monsters and sci-fi creatures run rampant throughout the land. Players take control of Sam \"Serious\" Stone as he travels back in time to save the planet from an evil alien invasion. While it isn't the most original plot in the world, it works for <em>Serious Sam</em>'<em>s</em> arcade-style gameplay.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/turok-rage-wars-rarest-n64-game/\">How a Turok Game Accidentally Became One of Nintendo 64's Rarest Titles</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/serious-sam-the-first-encounter-2.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Serious Sam: The First Encounter</em> offers an extremely fun FPS experience that will captivate players for hours on end. It is one of those games that is easy to pick up, but hard to put down. Players will take on hordes of blood-thirsty creatures as Sam travels through the Egyptian landscape.</p><p>It's like <em>Doom II</em> had a zombie mode with a sci-fi story. It's a bit strange, but it just adds to the game's charm. Mowing down enemies with a variety of powerful weapons is extremely rewarding and never really loses its appeal. The game's simplicity helped it age better than most other retro first-person shooters.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-cold-war-reveal-trailer/\">Call of Duty: Black Ops Brings the Heat to the Cold War With First Trailer</a></span></p><p><em>Serious Sam: The First Encounter</em> has a cheesy, B-rated movie vibe that helps it stand out from other games in the genre. Sam is constantly spouting off catchphrases as he plows through goofy-looking creatures. Most of the enemies have a low budget horror  look, which definitely plays into the overall tone of the game. One enemy belts out a hilarious scream as they run towards Sam with their arms spread like an eagle taking to the sky. <em>Series Sam: The First Encounter</em> has a great sense of humor.</p><p>Very few classic games hold up as well as <em>Serious Sam: The First Encounter</em>. Players will get lost in its bizarre world full of creative creatures and unique weapons. <em>Serious Sam: The First Encounter</em> is a terrific retro title that is worth revisiting nearly 20 years after its release, especially ahead of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/serious-sam-4-launch-month-cinematic-trailer/\">upcoming </a><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/serious-sam-4-launch-month-cinematic-trailer/\">Serious Sam 4</a>.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cod-black-ops-cold-war-trailer-tiananmen-footage/\">Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War Trailer Banned in China Due to Tiananmen Square Footage</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 22:15:34 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/serios-sam-firstencounter.jpg","linkMd5":"c356ab1f97b5d2586982c2acb63fd3d7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn41@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-673_c0f025536f4214e4.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":121060,"destBytes":121060,"author":"Zack Millsap","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/serios-sam-firstencounter.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn41@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-673_c0f025536f4214e4.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/serious-sam-the-first-encounter-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-05-853_13ba5d1cd6ed872f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Black Adam: 5 Avengers He Can Beat (& 5 He's Lose To) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-black-adam-marvel-avengers-fight-win/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Adam-5-Avengers-He-Can-Beat-5-Hes-Lose-To-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-adam/\">Black Adam</a> is about to enter the public spotlight in a big way with his own movie, being played by Dwayne \"The Rock\" Johnson. The movie is going to let general audiences in on something that comics fans have known a long time – Black Adam is one of the coolest DC characters around. Starting life as a villain fighting <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/shazam/\">Shazam (then known as Captain Marvel)</a>, he would eventually become an anti-hero, trying to do the right thing...or what he considered the right thing.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-adam-jsa-info/\">Black Adam: 10 Things Fans Need To Know About The JSA</a></span></p><p>Gifted with the same powers as Shazam, Black Adam is a formidable foe for anyone he fights. If he were to go up against the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers/\">Avengers</a>, which ones would he be able to defeat? Which ones would defeat him?</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Can Beat: Captain America</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-america.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america/\">Captain America</a> is one of the greatest heroes in the Marvel Universe and a great leader but he just wouldn't be able to stand a chance against Black Adam. Captain America has been able to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-steve-rogers-vicious-injuries-survived/\">defeat all kinds of foes he shouldn't have stood a chance against</a>, but Black Adam would just be too overwhelming for him.</p><p>Black Adam is a brutal man, so he would go at Cap immediately, hitting him with blows that would kill just about anyone. Cap would be able to block a few shots with his shield, but Black Adam's overwhelming strength and speed would allow him to break through Cap's defenses and take him down.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Would Lose To: Vision</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Vision-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/vision/\">The Vision</a> is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-vision-overrated-underrated-avenger/\">one of the most stalwart Avengers of them all</a>. While Black Adam is definitely stronger than the Vision, the Vision's density controlling abilities would give him a unique edge over Black Adam. Not only would Vision be able to phase through his assaults, but he could also increase his density and make his shots that much harder.</p><p>Black Adam is a very emotional man and not being able to hit Vision is going to make him lose his cool very quickly. An enraged Black Adam would be one that is easy for the Vision to take advantage of, using his solar blasts, keeping Adam from hitting him by phasing, and then hitting him with powerful retaliatory strikes at full density. It won't be a quick fight but Vision will get the win.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Can Beat: Black Panther</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-panther-5.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther/\">Black Panther</a> is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-black-panther-overrated-avenger-underrated/\">one of the most skilled and intelligent members of the Avengers</a>. The king of Wakanda, he's a formidable foe but even with all of his skills, he couldn't even phase Black Adam. It wouldn't be an easy battle for Black Adam – Black Panther's vibranium claws and vibranium weave costume would allow him to survive some shots and get some offense in, but that wouldn't help much.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/shazam-black-adam-heroic-evil-things/\">Shazam: The 5 Most Heroic Things Black Adam Has Ever Done (And The 5 Most Evil)</a></span></p><p>Black Panther would be able to take Black Adam's initial attacks but it wouldn't take long before the latter had things well in hand. Panther's superior fighting skills and claws would keep him in the fight for a bit but Black Adam's victory is inevitable.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Would Lose To: Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Worldbreaker-hulk-Replacement-image.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hulk/\">The Hulk</a> is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-hulk-worldbreaker-hulk-blue-hulk-strongest/\">the strongest one there is</a> and Black Adam would find that out the hard way. As powerful as Black Adam is, he couldn't knock the Hulk out right away and that's going to cost him as the Hulk just gets stronger and more dangerous.</p><p>While Black Adam's ability to fly would allow him to make some hit and run attacks against the Hulk, he would abandon that strategy out of frustration to try and punch it out with the Green Goliath. That's the mistake that will cost him the fight as Hulk's strength just keeps increasing. Black Adam would find himself outmatched quickly.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Can Beat: Scarlet Witch</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Scarlet-Witch-Secret-Wars-BossLogic.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/scarlet-witch/\">Scarlet Witch</a>'s <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-cinematic-universe-mcu-scarlet-witch-powerful-techniques/\">magic and reality-altering powers make her a formidable foe</a>, but the biggest problem with her is that she's still basically a normal human. That is going to be a big factor in Black Adam's victory. He prefers quick, brutal strikes and she wouldn't be able to survive very long.</p><p>Black Adam loves to fly in and through his opponents and that's pretty much what he'd do to Scarlet Witch. One of Black Adam's powers is speed and he'd be able to get to her before she could do anything and that would be that. Scarlet Witch would pop like a balloon.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Would Lose To: Hyperion</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Hyperion.jpg' /></figure><p>One of Marvel's several Superman pastiches, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hyperion/\">Hyperion</a> hails from an alternate Earth and is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/5-reasons-why-sentry-is-the-marvel-universes-most-powerful-hero-5-why-its-hyperion/\">one of the most powerful heroes to ever join the Avengers</a>. Much like Superman, Hyperion is vulnerable to magic but he's also powerful enough to keep fighting and take Black Adam down.</p><p>Black Adam knows about Superman's magic weakness and uses it against him but he doesn't know about Hyperion, so he's not going to start the fight by summoning the lightning. The two men will clash, beating on each other relentlessly. Hyperion will start getting the best of Black Adam, who might fall back on some lightning blasts, but by then it will be too little, too late.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Can Beat: Wonder Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Wonder-Man.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-man/\">Wonder Man</a>'s ionic energy-based powers make him a hard foe to fight but he's just not strong enough to hang with Black Adam. While his invulnerability will keep him in the fight for a while, his attacks just don't have the oomph needed to deal with Black Adam.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-characters-black-adam-destroyed/\">10 DC Characters Black Adam Destroyed</a></span></p><p>Black Adam has all the advantages in this fight – he's stronger, faster, and can take way more damage, and that's on top of the magical lightning he can summon. Combine all of this with his millennia of experience and Wonder Man just doesn't stand a chance.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Would Lose To: Thor</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/thor.jpg' /></figure><p>There are few things <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/thor/\">Thor</a> likes more than smiting his enemies with the hammer Mjolnir, and he'd get a lot of chances to do that against Black Adam. The two men are remarkably similar – millennia-old butt-kickers who can throw magical lightning – but the difference is that Thor is a god and Black Adam isn't.</p><p>Thor versus Black Adam would be the kind of battle that would be talked about for ages. The two men would go at each other furiously, neither backing down, but as time went on, Thor's heavy blows with Mjolnir would take their toll. Black Adam would try and blast Thor with lightning but Thor could control it and turn it back on him, robbing Black Adam of his powers for a few crucial seconds and allowing Thor to take him out.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Can Beat: Iron Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Man-War-of-the-Realms.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/iron-man/\">Iron Man</a>'s <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-best-worst-upgrades-tony-stark-armors/\">powerful armor has allowed him to beat many opponents</a> over the years but it wouldn't be of much use against someone as powerful as Black Adam. Iron Man's not strong enough and his weapons just don't have the kind of oomph they need to have much of an effect on Black Adam. Unfortunately for Iron Man, the same can't be said for Black Adam.</p><p>Honestly, it's doubtful that Iron Man's armor would even be able to last very long against Black Adam. Black Adam would immediately start tearing away at it and while Iron Man would get some separation using his weapon systems, as the damage mounted they would become less powerful. It wouldn't be long before Black Adam tore the armor to shreds and ended Tony Stark.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Would Lose To: Captain Marvel</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Reputation-Captain-Marvel.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most powerful members of the Avengers, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-marvel/\">Captain Marvel</a> has the powers and skills to take Black Adam out. While she's probably not as strong as him, Captain Marvel is much faster and her energy absorption abilities would allow her to take any of his lightning strikes and just get stronger. All of this would make things very difficult for Black Adam.</p><p>Captain Marvel's durability would allow her to stay in the fight against Black Adam's superior strength, while her speed would allow her to get some separation and blast away at him with energy bolts. Captain Marvel would keep the pressure on Black Adam, staying mobile and wearing him down. Eventually, her strategy will pay off and Black Adam will fall.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-adam-vs-marvel-villains-win-lose/\">Black Adam: 5 Marvel Villains He Would Defeat (&#38; 5 He Would Lose To)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:30:25 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Adam-5-Avengers-He-Can-Beat-5-Hes-Lose-To-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"4fabd02bc5fe5167832b6d809d460c3e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-02-562_25bc542fe61c97de.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":186504,"destBytes":186504,"author":"David Harth","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Adam-5-Avengers-He-Can-Beat-5-Hes-Lose-To-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn45@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-02-562_25bc542fe61c97de.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/captain-america.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn71@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-10-225_3571b4ffe98ae907.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Vision-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn14@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-10-702_bf3c21c98d791408.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-panther-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn74@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-11-855_3e732c1b38166121.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/04/Worldbreaker-hulk-Replacement-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn43@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-09-293_c4cb4e4956ded008.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Scarlet-Witch-Secret-Wars-BossLogic.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn81@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-815_e8137a3bf5b75f30.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Hyperion.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn78@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-14-662_39d7071d20f1ff31.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Wonder-Man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn64@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-15-468_ea31f7f81bfe69b6.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/thor.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn21@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-12-284_05042afde0426375.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Iron-Man-War-of-the-Realms.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Reputation-Captain-Marvel.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn76@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-10-303_99c11cb9118a22b3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The New Mutants Features Marvel's Best LGBTQ Film Couple Yet","link":"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-marvels-perfect-lgbtq-film-couple/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/new-mutants-dani-rahne.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-new-mutants-film/\">The New Mutants</a>, now in theaters.</strong></em></p><p><em>The</em> <em>New Mutants </em>director Josh Boone recently <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-director-slams-rise-of-skywalker-lgtbq/\">slammed <em>Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker</em></a> for its lack of representation in regards to the LGBTQ community, calling the film's kiss \"embarrassing.\" However, Boone's outspoken distaste for Star Wars' handling of LGBTQ characters isn't just all talk, because in <em>The New Mutants</em> he creates the best LGBTQ relationship in a Marvel movie yet.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-movie-million-dollar-debut/\">The New Mutants Set to Enjoy a Solid $8 Million Debut</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dani-Moonstar-New-Mutants-Movi.jpeg\"/></figure><p>The relationship in <em>The New Mutants </em>is between Rahne Sinclair and Dani Moonstar. Their chemistry is first hinted at when <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-pay-tribute-buffy-vampire-slayer/\">Rahne watches the classic '90s fantasy series, <em>Buffy the Vampire Slayer</em></a>. That series received a lot of attention when it showcased the romantic relationship between two of the show's main characters, Willow and Tara. In the episode that Rahne watches, Willow and Tara share a kiss.</p><p>This foreshadowing eventually leads to Rahne and Dani developing feelings for each other. They end up sneaking out of the hospital to lie in a cemetery to watch the storming sky. However, the force field dome surrounding the facility blocks the rain so when the rain strikes, it lights up in beautiful red and purple energy strikes. The couple notes how beautiful the scene is before turning and sharing a kiss.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The New Mutants' REAL Enemy Connects Directly to Logan\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-connects-logan-essex-corporation/\">The New Mutants' REAL Enemy Connects Directly To Logan</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/New-Mutants-Rahne-Dani-Header-1.png\"/></figure><p>This moment is especially big for Rahne, as she says it's her first time kissing <em>anyone</em>. The moment is beautiful. It isn't sensationalized and instead serves as a sweet moment between two characters. It's no different than if any another couple shared a romantic kiss, and therefore, the scene is a great example of representation that normalizes LGBTQ folks instead of tokenizing or sensationalizing them.</p><p>In an interview, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-lgbtq-romance-makes-sense/\">Maisie Williams</a>, who plays Rahne, said that she felt the romantic relationship between her character and Dani made a lot of sense. She said the characters shared the telepathic connection in the comics, that equated to love in her mind. She also liked the fact that the characters' relationship was normalized in the movie and was not there for sensationalistic purposes or to get people talking.</p><p>This relationship is a big step forward for Marvel superhero movies. Both <em>Deadpool 2 </em>and <em>Avengers: Endgame </em>technically had LGBTQ couples, and Marvel Studios also intends to have a gay relationship in <em>Eternals</em>. However, <em>The New Mutants </em>is a huge step forward in that it makes these characters solid, well-developed leads. <em>The New Mutants </em>sets a new benchmark for LGBTQ relationships in a Marvel film by pushing that representation forward in a new, exciting way.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The New Mutants: Why [SPOILER] and [SPOILER]'s Same-Sex Romance Just Makes Sense\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-lgbtq-romance-makes-sense/\">The New Mutants: Why [SPOILER] And [SPOILER]'S Same-Sex Romance Just Makes Sense</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 21:45:43 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/new-mutants-dani-rahne.jpg","linkMd5":"f24cf3fb5347b3cbd4d30ecdd1489707","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn42@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-711_8c0a274cd8448bdc.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":75346,"destBytes":75346,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/new-mutants-dani-rahne.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn42@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-711_8c0a274cd8448bdc.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dani-Moonstar-New-Mutants-Movi.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-19-429_d3223a79c0ec2781.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/New-Mutants-Rahne-Dani-Header-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn76@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-16-241_0208bf01e48bb136.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Dragon Ball: Every Match In The 25th Tenkaichi Budokai (In Chronological Order)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-25th-tenkaichi-budokai-every-match-in-order/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/db25-fi.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tournaments are an important part of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s early lifeblood, occurring every other arc and giving audiences something to perpetually look forward to. After Goku’s win at the 23rd Tenkaichi Budokai, however, </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-z\">Dragon Ball</a> </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">changes direction and starts to leave tournament arcs behind. It wouldn’t be until midway through the Majin Buu arc where the Tenkaichi Budokai would finally return as a setting. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-saiyan-saga-battles-best/\">Dragon Ball: The 10 Best Battles In The Saiyan Saga, Ranked</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Unlike the first three tournament arcs in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-super\">Dragon Ball</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai never actually finished– interrupted by the conflict with Majin Buu. All the same, the tournament is an exciting time for the series, one where </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">consciously reflects on where it came from in order to come to terms with what it became. Where the Tenkaichi Budokai respected martial arts as a true event, it’s now a commercialized affair meant to amuse the masses and little else. </span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Trunks Vs Idasa</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kid-Trunks.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The most glaring difference between the 23rd Tenkaichi Budokai and the 25th is the Junior Division present in the latter. Introduced in the 24th Tenkaichi Budokai, the Junior Division keeps children away from the adult martial artists– a rule which would have outright prevented Goku &#38; Krillin from entering the Tenkaichi Budokai back in the day. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Junior Division proves to be far too easy for both Trunks and Goten. In Trunks first fight of the match, he knocks his opponent Idasa out without much trouble. Trunks doesn’t so much need to transform, use Ki, or exert any effort. Even the youngest members of the Dragon Team have far eclipsed the children of yore.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Son Goten Vs Ikose</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Goten.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Super Saiyans younger than Goku was when he entered the 21st Tenkaichi Budokai, Goten and Trunks make short work of the Junior Division. Understandably, not a single young martial artist offers the two boys a decent fight. Idasa’s brother, Ikose, believes he’ll have an easy time against Goten because of his age &#38; demeanor, but Goku’s son puts Ikose in his place with ease. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Catching every single punch Ikose throws at him, Goten knocks his opponent down with a single punch to the fight. Both boys having earned their spots in the finals, the Junior Division ends with a match-up between Goten and Trunks. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Son Goten Vs Trunks</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goten-vs-Trunks.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As strange as it might sound, this might actually be the best fight in the entire tournament. Goten’s match against Trunks is the only battle in the entire 25th Tenkaichi Budokai that actually evokes the spirit of the original three tournaments. Between a mix of flashy choreography and Vegeta trying to trash talk Goku, the Junior Division ends on a high note. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-every-time-vegeta-almost-died/\">Dragon Ball Z: Every Time Vegeta Almost Died (But Didn’t)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It’s also worth pointing out that Goten doesn’t win and there's a surprising amount of tension surrounding the otherwise lighthearted battle. Goten and Trunks are near evenly matched, so it really could have been anyone’s game. Trunks &#38; Goten </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">trying </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">not to turn Super Saiyan also lends an exciting flair to the arc. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Krillin Vs Punter</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Krillin.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With the Junior Division out of the way and Trunks now champion, the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai can begin in earnest. The first match also serves as Krillin’s last in the original </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Heading up to fight Punter, Krillin brushes off his opponent’s trash talk as little more than gag character fodder. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Krillin’s right to do so as he knocks Punter out with a single punch. While it’s an anticlimactic start to the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai, Krillin’s victory is heartwarming. He’s a character who’s been with </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">since nearly the very beginning. Why doesn’t he deserve a win at the twilight of his life? </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Majunior Vs Shin</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/supreme-kai.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Considering the 25h Tenkaichi Budokai opens with a gag fight, it’s more than a little surprising that the next immediate match involves Piccolo forfeiting the moment he realizes who his opponent is. In awe of the Kaioshin’s tremendous power, Piccolo refuses to fight back and exits the arena.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Kaioshin reveals himself and his attendant Kibito to Goku, informing the Saiyan that a warlock named Bobbidi is attempting to revive Majin Buu. Almost as soon as the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai begins, the tournament is derailed by a larger than life part. While there are still more matches to come, the 25th TB is now unrecognizable from its predecessors. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Videl Vs Spopovich</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Videl-Dragon-Ball-Z-header.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Easily the most violent fight in the story arc, Videl’s match against Spopovich is hard to stomach. Toriyama doesn’t write romance particularly well, but Gohan and Videl’s relationship has been built up naturally. The 25th Tenkaichi Budokai should have been an opportunity for the two to further bond. Instead, Videl’s nearly beaten to death. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-krillin-piccolo-deaths/\">Dragon Ball: All Of Krillin’s Deaths (&#38; All Of Piccolo’s)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Possessed by Bobbidi, Spopovich is far stronger and sturdier than he should be. Even with flight at her side, Videl is unable to fight back adequately against her opponent. Spopovich beats Videl bloody, leaving Gohan enraged and Mr. Satan’s daughter near-death. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Great Saiyaman Vs Kibito</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Super-Saiyan-2-Gohan.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Like Piccolo’s match against Kaioshin, there’s no real “fight” here. Instead, Gohan’s match with Kibito serves to move the story forward. Still enraged by what happened over Videl and his inability to do anything, Gohan humors Kibito’s request to tap into Super Saiyan 2. Notably, this is the last time Gohan uses the form in the manga. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Gohan immediately has his energy drained by Spopovich and Yamu, but this is all part of the plan. With the two possessed warriors flying off towards Bobbidi, the Dragon Team can follow them to try to prevent Majin Buu’s revival. With most of the main cast leaving the tournament right away, the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai scrambles to course correct. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Battle Royale</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Android-18-Chokes-Mr.-Satan.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Following Gohan’s match with Kibito, the only martial artists left in the tournament are Android 18, Mr. Satan, Jewell, Killa, and Goten &#38; Trunks (under the guise of Mighty Mask.) To accommodate the odd fighter count, the 25th Tenkaichi Budokai caps off with a battle royale between all five registered fighters. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Jewell and Killa are knocked out of the arena immediately while Android 18 focuses her attention on Mighty Mask. Realizing that Goten &#38; Trunks are in costume, she simply forces them to divide before heading towards Mr. Satan. Instead of defeating him, however, she lets Satan take the win in exchange for an obscene bribe.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-every-character-goku-killed-in-order/\">Dragon Ball: Every Character Goku Killed In The Original Series (In Chronological Order)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:30:26 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/db25-fi.jpg","linkMd5":"94f16ccf5034818b023846c060c32499","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":144426,"destBytes":144426,"author":"Renan Fontes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/db25-fi.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kid-Trunks.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn69@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-11-112_2ed47e62b6de5bad.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Goten.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn42@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-413_8c24f1622f5d443e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Goten-vs-Trunks.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn6@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-16-597_5391bbb35691bd9d.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Krillin.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn98@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-07-146_d86533efcdaca69c.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/supreme-kai.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn89@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-12-184_4897446d299beda7.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/03/Videl-Dragon-Ball-Z-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn26@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-12-426_214e26aed128c596.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Super-Saiyan-2-Gohan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn51@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-16-067_2e9da326b2aa6cee.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Android-18-Chokes-Mr.-Satan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn2@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-11-002_47eeb6a3f7f25272.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Legend of Korra's Most Forgettable Villain Should Be Its Next Mastermind","link":"https://www.cbr.com/legend-of-korra-most-forgettable-villain-lieutenant/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/amon-legend-of-korra.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the%20legend%20of%20korra/\">The Legend of Korra</a> </em>packed in plenty of of twists and turns, but some parts of the plot got lost in the mix. The Equalist movement that provided much of the first season's conflict fell to the wayside as the series continued, and along with it fell the second-in-command who could one day become their perfect leader: The Lieutenant. As <em>The Legend of Korra</em> continues in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legend-of-korra-redeems-kuvira/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">comics</a>, fans deserve to see the Equalist plotline picked back up, and the Lieutenant deserves to lead the charge.</p><p><em>The Legend of Korra</em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/video-everything-need-know-legend-korra-season-1/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Season 1</a> made it clear that there were rising anti-bender sentiments throughout the culturally diverse metropolis of Republic City. While many benders saw it as a haven for unity and a celebration of what the Four Nations could accomplish together, much of the nonbending populace that made up the city's majority held a festering resentment that they were disempowered and disenfranchised. Governed by the United Republic Council that included in its membership a bender representative of every nation, at the time there was no voice to represent the citizens who could not wield the elements to their whim.</p><p>That's where Amon stepped forward, rousing the rabble that became known as the Equalist Movement. Promising a new day forged from an anti-bending revolution, Amon told an all-too familiar story of how his own family were struck down by firebenders. Sharing much the same tragedy, the industrialist Hiroshi Sato pioneered technological innovations that empowered nonbenders with weapons to contend at last with their bending oppressors. And overlooking all of it from Amon's side was his trusted henchman-in-charge, the Lieutenant.</p><p>RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The Avatar: The Last Airbender's Unaired Pilot Is Now Streaming on Twitch\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-unaired-pilot-streaming-twitch/\">The Avatar: The Last Airbender's Unaired Pilot Is Now Streaming On Twitch</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lieutenant-Equalist-Korra.png\"/></figure><p>Of course, the revolution Amon promised did not really end up panning out. The movement died at its head with the discovery that Amon was in truth a bender himself, a sinister bloodbender lying about his past and manipulating the sentiments of the city for his own gain. With Amon defeated, Hiroshi Sato imprisoned and political advancements made in the form of the democratically elected President Raiko, it seemed that the world of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-kyoshi-rangi-vs-korrasami-best-otp/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Avatar</em></a> heard the last of the Equalists and the Lieutenant along with them.</p><p>But... why? While a nonbending political leader free from tethers to any of the Four Nations was certainly an advancement, it goes without saying that the most radical political factions could hardly be appeased with the status quo so barely changed. If anything, the revelation that Amon was actually a bender taking advantage of them should have stoked the flames of revolution all the more. In the years that followed Amon's attempted coup the sudden proliferation of airbenders, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/video-best-moments-legend-korra-season-3/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">near-anarchic collapse of government at the hands of the Red Lotus</a> and the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/video-the-legend-of-korra-season-4s-best-moments/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">dictatorial regime headed by Kuvira</a> should only further fuel the fires of nonbenders' outrage.</p><p>Nobody had more reason to feel outraged or betrayed than the Lieutenant, who saw Amon bloodbend first hand shortly before the revolutionary's public reveal. Although little story space went to fleshing out the Lieutenant as a character (afterall we still do not even know his real name) his look of betrayal and sense of defeat upon seeing Amon bloodbend was one of the most moving parts of the show's first season. He turned his taser tonfas on his former leader and Amon whipped him away like he was nothing, something that happened all too often to the poor man.</p><p>In almost every single fight, the Lieutenant was involved in he proved to be a punching bag. Though he could capably dispose of the metalbending officers, he frequently saw anticlimactic defeat at the hands of Team Avatar. In the span of the one day Jinora whipped him away from a fight only for him to return and have Naga immediately bat him aside. All of that loss and all of that pity could be worth it if the Lieutenant returned. That wasn't his story, that was just the beginning to his arc -- and fans deserve to see him become the General.</p><p>RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Avatar: What's the Strongest Waterbending Feat in the Series?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-strongest-waterbending-feat/\">Avatar: What's The Strongest Waterbending Feat In The Series?</a></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lieutenant-Equalist-Korra-2.png\"/></figure><p>Though the story of the Equalists saw a brief return in the barely-remembered <em>The Legend of Korra</em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/high-score-missile-command-mit-students/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">video game</a> (led by a bender named Hundun), their fate still remains unresolved alongside that of the Lieutenant. The comics already proved their commitment to continuing many plotlines from the show such as the acclimation of the human world to its new relationship with the Spirit World and the fallout of Kuvira's attempted domination of the entire Earth Kingdom. The best route the comics could take would be to return to the story of the Equalists and give the subplot a proper sendoff.</p><p>Finally getting backstory on the Lieutenant and the Equalists at large would be rewarding all its own. Many questions surrounding Amon remain unsatisfactorily resolved, and brief flashbacks to the origins of the political movement could also take the time to flesh out the story of Amon and the gap in his life between leaving the North Pole and arriving in Republic City as a new man. Who exactly was the Lieutenant, and what was his relationship to the masked figure he would one day come to feel so betrayed by?</p><p>Throughout all of <em>Avatar,</em> there has yet to be a truly formidable nonbending antagonist. Watching the Lieutenant rise to the occasional to claim that title would not only be rewarding after his repeated failures and longstanding absence, it would serve as the most satisfactory way to tie up a loose thread from the series left dangling for years. The next upcoming <em>Avatar</em> comic titles take place in the original series' timeline, but when the <em>The Legend of Korra</em> comics return and follow up on <em>Ruins of the Empire, </em>a return to Equality is without a doubt the best place to go.</p><p>KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Avatar: Toph Vs Korra: Who Wins This Bender Fight?\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-toph-vs-korra/\">Avatar: Toph Vs Korra: Who Wins This Bender Fight?</a></p>\n                        \n                        \n
