Stewart","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/amon-legend-of-korra.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn33@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-742_4eb3878874c2e1e5.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lieutenant-Equalist-Korra.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn29@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-966_ad8359510e1eeebc.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lieutenant-Equalist-Korra-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn25@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-427_ef14920da3fe8ae2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Falcon and Winter Soldier Shirt Offers a Glimpse of the Heroes' New Costumes","link":"https://www.cbr.com/falcon-and-winter-soldier-shirt-new-costumes/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/falcon-and-the-winter-soldier-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Though <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/falcon-and-winter-soldier/\">The Falcon and the Winter Soldier</a></em> has yet to receive an official release date, new merchandise for the series provides a first look at the new costumes Sam Wilson (Anthony Mackie) and Bucky Barnes (Sebastian Stan) will wear during the series. Twitter user @SpinelessOyster posted a picture of the shirts, which come in two colors: black and gray.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SpinelessOyster/status/1300103318300233732\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">black shirt</a> features the clearest look at the costumes yet. Bucky has a blue jacket and cargo pants similar to the outfit he wore in <i>Avengers: Infinity War</i> and <em>Avengers: Endgame, </em>but his hair is trimmed and he is clean shaven. Sam sports a new red and white Falcon suit that takes its cues from his original comics costume. In the background, Captain America's shield looms large. The gray shirt features a similar image with the heroes' silhouettes.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/falcon-and-winter-soldier-information-guide/\">Falcon and Winter Soldier: Trailer, Plot, Release Date &#38; News to Know</a></span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/SpinelessOyster/status/1300103318300233732\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><em>The Falcon and the Winter Soldier</em> will feature Sam Wilson and Bucky Barnes protecting the mantle of their friend Steve Rogers (Chris Evans) while dealing with new threats, including the return of Zemo (Daniel Brühl). The series resumed filming this summer after production shut down in March due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.</p><p>Directed by Kari Skogland, <em>The Falcon and the Winter Soldier</em> stars Anthony Mackie, Sebastian Stan, Emily VanCamp, Wyatt Russell, Noah Mills, Carl Lumbly and Daniel Brühl. The series debuts on Disney+ in fall 2020.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-plus-falcon-winter-soldier-fall/\">Disney+ Officially Changes Falcon and Winter Soldier Release Window</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 22:33:27 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/falcon-and-the-winter-soldier-header.jpg","linkMd5":"28ce8f5cbcb4e5f7b6a4f36491b5d4fe","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":87842,"destBytes":87842,"author":"Collier Jennings","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/falcon-and-the-winter-soldier-header.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The New Mutants: The Biggest Differences From the Comics' Demon Bear Saga","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-differences-from-comics/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/new-mutants-poster-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for </strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-new-mutants-film/\">The New Mutants</a></strong><strong>, now playing in theaters.</strong></em></p><p><em>The New Mutants</em> hit theaters as the final movie in the Fox X-Men series.The film itself takes on the task of telling the \"Demon Bear Saga\" by Chris Claremont, Bill Sienkiewicz, Glynis Wein and Tom Orzechowski. Despite a lot of moments paying homage to that classic storyline, there are significant differences between the two tales, including the following.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-New-Mutants-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>The entire setting and overall plot of the movie is different from the comic books. In <em>The New Mutants</em>, the five teenagers are held captive in an abandoned hospital and cared for by one solitary doctor who says she is trying to help them control their powers, but this backfires. While Dani sleeps, her powers manifest and summon the Demon Bear. In the comics, this event takes place while the New Mutants are at Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters, where they are not prisoners. Where the comics feature the Demon Bear as the main threat, the film and its setting present other antagonistic forces, from the doctor to the asylum itself.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-sunspot-actor-usavengers/\">The New Mutants' Sunspot Actor Wants to Bring the USAvengers to the Big Screen</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/new-mutants-trailer-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>The powers of the New Mutants in the movie are nearly the same as those in the comic books; however, there is one significant difference. In the comics, when the \"Demon Bear Saga\" begins, the New Mutants are already heroes who've trained with their powers extensively. In the movie, the New Mutants don't know how to use their powers. For instance, Cannonball struggles with his confidence, and Roberto has no idea what he is capable of, so they are far from the established heroes seen in the comics. In the movie, they are simply kids who want to be left alone; however, they are forced to fight.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/magma.jpg\"/></figure><p>There is one member of the New Mutants that is missing in the movie. Magma is one of the original members of the team, and while she doesn't last as long as the others, she is still a massive part of the \"Demon Bear Saga\" in the comics. However, the director, Josh Boone, has a reason behind this decision. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/why-new-mutants-doesnt-include-magma/\">Magma is from an ancient Roman world</a> that exists in the Amazon; however, this has yet to be established in the film universe, and Boone wasn't going to go there in the movie.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The New Mutants' REAL Enemy Connects Directly to Logan\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-connects-logan-essex-corporation/\">The New Mutants' REAL Enemy Connects Directly To Logan</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lockheed-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Lockheed is mostly known as a purple alien dragon that serves as Kitty Pryde's sidekick in the comic books. However, in the \"Demon Bear Saga,\" he is at Illyana's side. Meanwhile, in the movie, he is a hand-puppet that Illyana carries as a mental defense mechanism. He does come to life when she goes to Limbo, but he is only real when she brings him out for the final battle of the movie.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/new-mutants-limbo-header.jpeg\"/></figure><p>The most significant change in <em>The New Mutants</em> movie compared to the comics comes with the origin of Illyana Rasputin. In the comics, she is Colossus' sister. When she was six, she was kidnapped and whisked away to the realm of Limbo, where she remained for seven years. In the X-Men's world, she returns only seconds later; however, she is 13, the Queen of Limbo and skilled in black magic. In the movie, Illyana is a young girl abused by older men who take advantage of her powers, so she creates Limbo, where she teleports herself to hide from the pain. She is there for so long that Limbo eventually becomes real, but it is not the pre-existing dimension from the comic books.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The New Mutants Changes Lockheed - and Makes Him Even Better\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-mutants-changes-lockheed-origin/\">The New Mutants Changes Lockheed - And Makes Him Even Better</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dani-Demon-Bear.jpg\"/></figure><p>In <em>The New Mutants</em> movie, Dani Moonstar is a new prisoner/patient for Dr. Cecilia Reyes. She has no idea what her mutant powers are, and she is alone after her family and neighbors die in a mysterious attack. In the comics, she is already a fully-fledged member of the New Mutants team. There are also differences in the role she plays. In the movie, Dr. Reyes tries to kill her to stop the Demon Bear attacks, and Dani is out of action due to this. In the comics, Dani takes the fight to the Demon Bear and ends up beaten and almost dead, which is how she is taken out of action in the books.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-New-Mutants-Demon-Bear-Featured.jpg\"/></figure><p>The \"Demon Bear Saga\" from the comic books and <em>The New Mutants</em> movie have the same overall message when it comes to the final battle. In the comics, Rahne reaches into Dani's mind and learns that the team has to learn to work together to cut out the heart of the Demon Bear. The movie also plays on the idea of trusting each other and working as a team to survive; however, the end of the battle is drastically different. In the film, it is Dani who stands up to the bear and proves its scare tactics don't affect her. Meanwhile, Dani doesn't return for the final battle in the comics, and the ending is more finite. Illyana uses her Soulsword to split the Demon Bear in half, destroying it once and for all.</p><p><em>Directed and co-written by Josh Boone, The New Mutants stars Maisie Williams as Rahne Sinclair/Wolfsbane, Anya Taylor-Joy as Illyana Rasputin/Magik, Charlie Heaton as Sam Guthrie/Cannonball, Henry Zaga as Roberto da Costa/Sunspot, Blu Hunt as Danielle Moonstar/Mirage and Alice Braga as Dr. Cecilia Reyes. The film is now in theaters. </em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"The New Mutants Pays Tribute to Buffy the Vampire Slayer\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-new-mutants-pay-tribute-buffy-vampire-slayer/\">The New Mutants Pays Tribute To Buffy The Vampire Slayer</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:45:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/new-mutants-poster-header.jpg","linkMd5":"005bf6dc78e0d642de0a5a877a0aac4e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-839_13f346a88224ee9e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":217263,"destBytes":162692,"author":"Shawn S. Lealos","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/new-mutants-poster-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-839_13f346a88224ee9e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-New-Mutants-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn69@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-06-583_68596e0774c7bfc9.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/new-mutants-trailer-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn22@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-06-970_1d04aaae029a760f.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/magma.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn5@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-06-674_b7c7583f3861360d.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Lockheed-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-09-491_c31a0ec1f47aba52.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/new-mutants-limbo-header.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn84@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-10-355_e319a6fec567e220.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dani-Demon-Bear.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn85@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-543_fdf489d5bb7f7dbf.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-New-Mutants-Demon-Bear-Featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn39@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-09-164_16066edfaaf7ee31.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Supernatural Final Season Return Trailer Heralds the End of an Era","link":"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-season-15-return-extended-trailer/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/supernatural.jpg\"/></figure><p>The end is nigh for <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/supernatural/\">Supernatural</a></em>.</p><p>As the long-running series gears up for its big return, The CW has released an extended trailer for the final seven episodes of the series. The promo picks up with an ominous narration from Death herself: \"I just watched a whole planet burn alive,\" she tells the Winchester brothers. \"God will be back soon. It could be today; it could be tomorrow. But when he comes, there won't be a moment to waste.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Jared Padalecki Shares a Supernatural Season 15 'Spoiler'\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jared-padalecki-shares-supernatural-season-15-spoiler/\">Jared Padalecki Shares A Supernatural Season 15 'Spoiler'</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mBTwCWkOFKw?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>As the Winchesters' final fight grows even more dire, Jack grapples with his destiny. \"I'm supposed to kill God, but I need to complete a final ritual,\" he warns. Meanwhile, God laughs off their attempt to stop him, scoffing, \"I control space and time. They think they can kill <em>me</em>?\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Supernatural Hypes Final Seven Episodes With New Promo\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-final-seven-episodes-promo/\">Supernatural Hypes Final Seven Episodes With New Promo</a></span></p><p>While the Winchesters exchange emotional dialogue about standing by each other, the trailer flashes to some of the many people that helped them on their journey, from Castiel to Jack to B0bby Singer. \"The whole mission is saving the world,\" Dean announces, as a montage shows their bunker under siege.</p><p>In its final moments, the trailer finds Dean sitting in his iconic 1967 Chevy Impala, lovingly nicknamed Baby, on a rainy day. He turns to the person in the passenger seat, whose face is not shown, and says, \"It's time.\" With that, the promo comes to a close.</p><p>Starring Jared Padalecki, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins, and Alexander Calvert, the final seven episodes of <i>Supernatural</i> begin airing on Oct. 8 on The CW. The first fourteen seasons of <i>Supernatural </i>are now available on Netflix.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Supernatural: First Photo From Restarted Final Season References COVID-19 Shutdown\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-first-photo-restarted-final-season-covid-19-shutdown/\">Supernatural: First Photo From Restarted Final Season References COVID-19 Shutdown</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:03:35 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/supernatural.jpg","linkMd5":"3a8784c87c1bd112104946041be756ba","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn49@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-02-149_1c98c162d1e0927a.webp","destWidth":1800,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":357444,"destBytes":294438,"author":"Meagan Damore","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/supernatural.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn49@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-02-149_1c98c162d1e0927a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Justice League: HBO Max Debunks Rumored September 2021 Release Date","link":"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-hbo-max-debunks-september-2021-release-date/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/snyder-cut-justice-league-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hbo-max\">HBO Max</a> has disputed reports that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/justice-league-film/\">Zack Snyder's Justice League</a> is set to premiere on the streaming platform in September 2021.</p><p>\"Rumor going around that #TheSnyderCut is premiering in September of 2021,\" tweeted Collider Editor-in-chief Steven Weintraub. \"I reached out to @hbomax and they say it's not true.\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-introduce-supergirl/\">Justice League: The Snyder Cut May Introduce Superman's [SPOILER]</a></span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/colliderfrosty/status/1299038542388027393\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>Rumors the Snyder Cut would premiere on HBO Max in September of next year started after the director debuted the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-justice-league-trailer-darkseid-shocking-death/\">film's first trailer during the virtual DC FanDome</a> event on Aug. 22. While Snyder didn't give an exact date for the film's release, a leaked title page that was briefly posted on a DC Press Portal website displayed the date Sept. 5, 2021. Both Warner Bros. and HBO Max have since denied that a specific date has been decided on.</p><p>The update comes just days after Snyder admitted that he thought executives at Warner Bros. were joking when they told him to cut his version of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-zack-snyder-warner-bros-2-hour-joke/\">Justice League down to just two hours</a>. \"In what world is that a two-hour movie?\" Snyder said on a recent episode of the Reel in Motion podcast. \"I mean, <em>Batman v Superman</em> is a full three hours, and that’s two characters.\"</p><p>Like the theatrical release, the Snyder Cut of <em>Justice League</em> follows the superhero squad as they attempt to save the world from the threat of Steppenwolf and his army of Parademons. It will initially be released as a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/zack-snyder-cut-hbo-max-justice-league-four-episodes/\">four-part miniseries</a> -- with each episode clocking in at an hour -- and re-released as a four-hour film at a later date.<em></em></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/justice-league-snyder-cut-confirmed-martian-manhunter/\">Justice League: The Snyder Cut May Have Confirmed a New (Yet Familiar) Hero</a></span></p><p>The official synopsis for <em>Zack Snyder's Justice League</em> can be found below.</p><blockquote><p>In Justice League, fueled by his restored faith in humanity and inspired by Superman’s selfless act, Bruce Wayne enlists the help of his newfound ally, Diana Prince, to face an even greater enemy. Together, Batman and Wonder Woman work quickly to find and recruit a team of metahumans to stand against this newly awakened threat. But despite the formation of this unprecedented league of heroes—Batman, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Cyborg and The Flash—it may already be too late to save the planet from an assault of catastrophic proportions.</p></blockquote><p><em>Justice League</em> stars Ben Affleck as Batman, Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman, Henry Cavill as Superman, Amy Adams as Lois Lane, Jason Momoa as Aquaman, Ezra Miller as The Flash, Ray Fisher as Cyborg, Jeremy Irons as Alfred Pennyworth, Diane Lane as Martha Kent, Ciarán Hinds as Steppenwolf, Jesse Eisenberg as Lex Luthor and J.K. Simmons as Commissioner Gordon.</p><p>(via <a href=\"https://www.digitalspy.com/movies/a33828377/justice-league-snyder-cut-release-date-rumours-2021/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Digital Spy</a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 22:35:24 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/snyder-cut-justice-league-header.jpg","linkMd5":"87c359089cc3cf3360fb618b2f81d7bc","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":169940,"destBytes":169940,"author":"Keegan Prosser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/snyder-cut-justice-league-header.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Superman: 5 Titles to Inspire a Man of Steel Video Game | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/superman-5-titles-to-inspire-a-man-of-steel-video-game/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/rumor-superman-game-incoming-from-batman-arkham-creators.jpg\"/></figure><p>Without a doubt, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/superman/\">Superman</a> is the most famous superhero of all time. His image has broken out of comic books and into blockbuster movies, television shows, and many other mediums, yet video games<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-never-starred-good-video-game/2/\"> consistently seem to be the Man of Steel's kryptonite</a>. Almost every Superman game released has been seen as either mediocre or a broken, unplayable mess.</p><p>This isn't the case for every superhero, though. There are plenty of video games that adapt comic book superheroes faithfully, with mechanics and gameplay features that are a perfect fit for Superman and his many abilities. If developers can learn from these games, perhaps the next piece of Superman software won't be another budget mobile game, but a triple-A masterpiece akin to these games.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-kill-the-justice-league-trailer-evil-superman/\">Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League Unleashes An Evil Superman in First Trailer</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Arkham-Knight-Bat-Family.jpg\"/></figure><p>The Caped Crusader's adventures in developer Rocksteady's ground-breaking <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman-arkham\">Arkham</a> series are collectively the first and most obvious source of inspiration in most people's minds. The <em>Arkham</em> titles are renowned for their tight controls, something that wouldn't be too difficult to apply to a Superman game. Superman's super-senses already make a fair equivalent to Batman's Detective Mode, and Superman's abilities can easily replace most of Batman's essential gadgets.</p><p>Similar to Batman's Predator challenges, Superman may be challenged by opponents with weapons that can legitimately hurt him. This could force players to use Superman's powers in more creative ways, such as using heat vision to activate sprinklers, smashing walls or floors to catch enemies by surprise, or applying freeze-breath to make floors slippery. There's also <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-villains-underrated-stay-away-comparison/\">Superman's rogues' gallery</a>, which is one of the largest and most diverse in comic books. Having a series of Most Wanted side missions like <em>Arkham Knight</em>'s would be a great way to not only implement Superman's deadliest nemeses but even introduce relatively obscure villains like Volcana or the Atomic Skull.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/injustice-3-release-date-plot-news/\">Injustice 3: Release Date, Plot and News to Know</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/PS4-Spider-Man-Classic-Suit.jpg\"/></figure><p>No matter how faithful a comic book-based video game is to its characters, most developers favor fun over realism, and Insomniac's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man-ps4/\"><em>Marvel's Spider-Man</em></a><em> </em>is no exception. Spider-Man tends to use a hefty amount of force against his foes that should reasonably kill a normal person, from dropping huge metal scaffolds to brutally an opponent's heads to the ground. Having Superman punch mobsters or throw them against walls might look brutal, but it's part of the over-the-top fun of a comic book game.</p><p>However, <em>Marvel's Spider-Man</em> also emphasizes the \"hero\" part of \"superhero.\" The friendly neighborhood wallcrawler is a man of the people, with side ventures ranging from saving citizens involved in crashes to helping a friend find his pet pigeons. Helping people should be a fundamental aspect of a Superman game, perhaps even more so than with Spider-Man. The air combat in <em>Marvel's Spider-Man </em>is surprisingly fluid and graceful as well, resulting in encounters with the likes of Sable Air Troopers or Vulture being fun rather than tedious. This application of aerial battles can be easily adjusted into a Superman game by having more flying enemies for Clark to fight, such as Brainiac drones or robots made by the Toyman.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-miles-morales-ps5-gamers-will-feel-spidey-sense/\">Gamers Will Actually Feel and Use Miles Morales' Spider-Sense Via the PlayStation 5 Controller</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/hulk-ultimate-destruction-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>The hardest part of any Superman game has been justifying his health bar. That hasn't been a problem for the Incredible Hulk, who's probably one of the few A-list Marvel heroes <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/video-the-hulks-incredible-power-explained/\">who can almost match Superman in both strength and toughness</a>. 2005's <em>The Incredible Hulk: Ultimate Destruction </em>by Radical Entertainment had the primary goal of allowing players to do what the Hulk does best: smash everything. The Hulk is not only utterly unstoppable, but the game's combat loop revolves around utilizing the Hulk's strength in varied and creative ways, from crafting giant brass knuckles out of cars to forging shields by flattening buses.</p><p>Most of these destruction tactics turn out to not only be fun, but necessary. For all his power in <em>Ultimate Destruction, </em>the Hulk is not actually invincible. The game features a traditional health bar gauging the Jade Giant's remaining strength but implemented in a way that does not take away from Hulk's character. Regular soldiers with guns do little to nothing to the player, but getting bombarded with a dozen homing missiles or thrown around by military Hulkbuster builds up a lot of damage over time. Giving Superman a health bar doesn't have to be something that diminishes the experience outright, but can instead be an excuse for developers to throw as much as they can at the player, challenging them to overcome obstacles by any means possible.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hulk-maestro-marvel-universe/\">Hulk: How Maestro EXPLODED Into The Marvel Universe</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/infamous-cole-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>One of the more recognizable superhero games without a Marvel or DC character, Sony Entertainment and Sucker Punch's <em>InFAMOUS </em>series is a surprisingly well-balanced package. Cole MacGrath's versatile electricity powers allow him a variety of impressive abilities, like gliding long distances, firing electric bolts at enemies and using his hands as defibrillators to rescue injured civilians. The story is, appropriately, like something out of a comic book: Cole is one of many \"Conduits\" that received superhuman powers from a mysterious explosion and takes it upon himself to fight crime and other Conduits in Empire City.</p><p>Playing in the sandbox of Empire City showcases the applications of Superman's abilities in a potential game, but <em>InFAMOUS </em>has an interesting quirk that affects both story and gameplay: a \"Karma\" morality system. Whether you play Cole as heroic or villainous grants him different powers, i.e., Good Karma allows for an explosive burst, Bad Karma allows for continuous electric steam. Cole's Karma even affects the ending of the story. Thanks to concepts like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-kryptonite-types-effects/\">red kryptonite</a>, a morality system such as this can exist in a Superman video game, justifying a destructive and evil playthrough.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/call-of-duty-pulled-fortnite-reveal/\">Call of Duty Black Ops: Cold War Pulled a Fortnite</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-returns.jpg\"/></figure><p>It might seem strange to include Electronic Arts' <em>Superman Returns, </em>but this movie tie-in<i> </i>can be seen as both a blueprint for an amazing Superman game and as a cautionary tale. Despite everything going against it, <em>Superman Returns: The Video Game </em>has a lot of exciting ideas with untapped potential, from its then-beautiful flight mechanics to racing Mr. Mxyzptlk in trippy challenges or suddenly turning into Bizarro to \"save\" Metropolis with your fire breath. Perhaps most intriguing was the decision to not give Superman a health bar, but to instead give one to Metropolis. Not only is Superman unable to die, but protecting the city is player's number one priority, making them feel the burden that the Last Son of Krypton must carry.</p><p>As great as most of these ideas were, the problem was the execution. Sluggish controls, ugly graphics, an incohesive story were the tip of the iceberg. Giving Metropolis a health bar instead of Superman meant that defeating enemies could be counter-intuitive, as you could easily miss and damage the city yourself. With a frankly absurd amount of repetitive enemies, a terrible camera and a tornado serving as the final boss, the game was clearly rushed to completion. <em>Superman Returns</em> is yet another lesson on terrible Superman games that future developers can learn from.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/brainiac-tired-trope-dc-video-games/\">Brainiac Is Becoming A Tired Trope of DC Video Games </a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:15:40 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/rumor-superman-game-incoming-from-batman-arkham-creators.jpg","linkMd5":"429cc9a4751137e645e20a7a0d04c797","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":217549,"destBytes":192916,"author":"Vladimir Olivares","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/rumor-superman-game-incoming-from-batman-arkham-creators.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Arkham-Knight-Bat-Family.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn5@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-11-529_b7fad3545194eda8.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/PS4-Spider-Man-Classic-Suit.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn10@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-12-033_25b893e14de52389.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/hulk-ultimate-destruction-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn28@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-14-967_fd30dbf166343d39.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/infamous-cole-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn44@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-18-317_9720dcb7979834e1.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/superman-returns.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn86@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-13-283_bf9327c5ad914818.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Fullmetal Alchemist: 5 Ways Izumi Is A Great Teacher (& 5 Ways She Isn't)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-izumi-ways-great-bad-teacher/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-5-Ways-Izumi-Is-A-Great-Teacher-5-Ways-She-Isnt-featured-image-2.jpg\"/></figure><p>Izumi Curtis is one of the most strong-willed and intimidating female characters in all of <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fullmetal-alchemist/\">Fullmetal Alchemist</a>, </em>rivaled only <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-olivier-armstrong-cosplay/\">by Olivier Armstrong</a>. Born in Western Amestris, Izumi set out when she was eighteen to try to find a formal teacher to advance her studies in alchemy to no avail, and then decided to set off on her own self-taught travels. One fateful stormy day in Resembool, she'd stop to use her alchemy to help keep the town from flooding, where she comes across Edward and Alphonse Elric.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemists-best-fights/\">Fullmetal Alchemist: 10 Best Fights In The Series, Ranked</a></span></p><p>There are many strengths that make Izumi a great teacher for the boys. She is strong-willed, soft underneath her intimidating exterior, and understands how heavy the toll of committing taboo really is. However, that doesn't mean that she is the perfect candidate to be teaching kids, and has points that make it arguably difficult to claim her as a great role model through-and-through.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Great: Healthy Beliefs</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Smiling.jpg' /></figure><p>Although <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-izumi-curtis-olivier-armstrong-best-girl/\">Izumi is an incredibly capable alchemist</a>, she also still believes in the value of doing things with one's own hands, if that's still a possible option. It's unsure if this is something that she's always staunchly believed, or if this is a belief system that she developed after her rebound with human transmutation.</p><p>A small child from the village comes to Izumi, asking if she can fix his broken toy \"with alchemy.\" Instead, she takes it in her hands and fixes it the traditional way instead, instilling how important it is to not rely solely on alchemy.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Not So Great: Overly Violent</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/izumi-curtis-fma.jpg' /></figure><p>It's one thing to harshly reprimand one's students when they do something wrong, but Izumi takes this to an unhealthy extreme a lot of the time. Sure, in the early 2000s, female characters being overly violently aggressive - especially towards the protagonist when they do something foolish - was a trope, but that doesn't mean it's one that makes for a good character trait.</p><p>Whenever Izumi rushes in to save Ed during his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-greed-cosplays/\">fight with Greed</a>, she completely pummels him in the process. She is seen doing similar acts throughout the series that make her come off as physically abusive at worst.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Great: Adventurous Spirit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-In-The-Briggs-Mountains.jpg' /></figure><p>Izumi is incredibly fearless and self-reliant, able to survive in the harsh Briggs Mountains by herself for an entire month, and she has an affinity for traveling. Until she met her husband and decided on wanting a child of her own, Izumi was an unbound free spirit who traveled wherever her adventurous spirit would take her.</p><p>This is a great trait that she actually seemed to have passed on to Edward, given how fearless and excited he becomes about exploring new places during his own travels.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Not So Great: Death Threats</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Curtis-Death-Glare.jpg' /></figure><p>Going along with her more violent physical tendencies, Izumi has an incredibly bad habit of threatening - and actually at times endangering - the lives of her students, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-edward-right-wrong/\">particularly Edward.</a> After learning that they had committed a taboo after studying under her, she rejects them as students and chucks a knife <em>directly </em>at Ed's head when he tries to re-enter. They're even warned by her husband not to let her kill them, which isn't stated in a joking manner.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-anime-live-action-comparison-better-worse/\">Fullmetal Alchemist: 5 Things The Live-Action Movie Got Right (&#38; 5 The Anime Did Better)</a></span></p><p>Ed and Al are also seen essentially having a panic attack upon thinking about visiting Izumi for the first time since the accident, fearing her reaction. Winry's remark that they should \"find a new teacher\" is played off as a joke, but it's a genuine sentiment given some of Izumi's reactions.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Great: Emotional Support</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Hugging-The-Elrics.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-facts-alphonse-elric/\">The Elric brothers</a> have a tendency to shove many of their emotions aside, especially when it concerns the taboo that the two committed. It makes sense, then, that Izumi would naturally be the one who could empathize with them the strongest, as she also was driven to commit the same act to try to revive a dear loved one.</p><p>They tried to insist that they were fine in front of her, but she relents, stating that it's okay for them to hurt. They break down in her strong familial embrace, and it's an incredibly heartwarming moment that really shows their bond.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Not So Great: No Contact</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Hands-On-Hips.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-edward-best-worst-things/\">Whenever Ed</a> and Al lament over the thought of having to give a visit to their old teacher, it's mostly due to the fact that she still doesn't know they committed the taboo. Considering Ed had been a state alchemist for several years at this point, it does beg the question of why Izumi didn't try to contact them.</p><p>While Amestris still lacks modern-day instant methods of communication, it isn't like she couldn't have tried sending out letters. In fact, when they do show up, at first she seems much more concerned with pummeling them than asking how they'd been holding up.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Great: Away From Taboo</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Curtis-Glaring.jpg' /></figure><p>Because Izumi had already made the mistake of committing the ultimate taboo and suffering the harsh consequences, she understood full well what Edward was thinking when he first mentions it around her. She immediately snaps, stating that it's forbidden, and something that no self-respecting alchemist should dare to try.</p><p>It's clear that there is a personal reason why she felt so strongly against it, though it's not explicitly explained until much later. Sadly, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-best-boy-edward-is-best-boy-roy-mustang/\">Edward is smart enough</a> to hide it after this so she can't stop him.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Not So Great: Overly Harsh Training</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-And-Young-Elrics.jpg' /></figure><p>Izumi is no stranger to strict teaching, as she was told to survive a month in the harsh Briggs Mountains by herself. This seems to be something that stuck with her, as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-things-edward/\">she later dumps Ed</a> and Al on an uninhabited island and tells them they must survive for an entire month, or she'd refuse to train them.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-characters-zodiac-signs/\">Which Fullmetal Alchemist Character Are You, Based On Your Zodiac?</a></span></p><p>It's one thing to put students through the same experiences that molded their teacher, but Izumi was eighteen when she did this, and the Elrics were only just hitting their double-digits. They did almost die, both from enemy attacks and starvation, so no matter what Izumi's intentions were, it makes her look like a less-than-exceptional teacher.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Great: Helps Those Who Can't</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Smiling-Under-An-Umbrella.jpg' /></figure><p>Izumi has a tendency to help others who have the drive, but perhaps not the means, to help themselves. This is clearly seen with how she agrees to take on the Elric brothers, as she outright refused several times before it was stated that they didn't have any parents. Izumi's empathy is reflected clearly in her eyes, and she then states that she doesn't have any other choice, since she'd feel too guilty abandoning two orphaned kids.</p><p>Izumi's kind nature is also shown in how she repairs the toys of neighborhood kids, while also instilling into them that it's better if they simply aren't carelessly rough enough to break them in the first place.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Not So Great: Wrathful Temper</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/izumi-fullmetal-angry.jpg' /></figure><p>Although Izumi is the most understanding when it comes to the Elrics' situation and the burden of having committed a taboo, she's also the most outwardly violent and furious towards them about it.</p><p>This instilled a debilitating fear into Ed and Al so deep that they genuinely considered running away instead of facing her once more, and they didn't even flinch when a <em>gun </em>was pointed directly at them. It doesn't take much to send Izumi into a blind, violent rage, which just doesn't help someone who's supposed to be a teacher.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fullmetal-alchemist-brotherhood-best-quotes/\">Fullmetal Alchemist Brotherhood: 10 Awesome Quotes That Will Always Stick With Us</a></span></p>\n                        \n
