Grimes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-5-Ways-Izumi-Is-A-Great-Teacher-5-Ways-She-Isnt-featured-image-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn66@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-694_369395cec88cfcfd.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Smiling.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn73@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-05-917_2fb49d3b2a0f64a7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/izumi-curtis-fma.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-In-The-Briggs-Mountains.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn96@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-482_130f9074645cd675.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Curtis-Death-Glare.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn5@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-09-724_d25a25d673ed8c72.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Hugging-The-Elrics.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn51@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-15-278_f1cd5c4938ca35a7.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Hands-On-Hips.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn83@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-15-620_aee8e7fd7ec25483.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Curtis-Glaring.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn49@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-13-474_22244a2891e381ff.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-And-Young-Elrics.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn29@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-09-790_4f9ef15d3ea92dfd.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Fullmetal-Alchemist-Izumi-Smiling-Under-An-Umbrella.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-16-432_de217c9452e10590.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/izumi-fullmetal-angry.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn15@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-412_b3af027f8424f5f5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Andrew Lloyd Webber Creates 'Phantom of the WAPera' Remix of Megan Thee Stallion, Cardi B Song","link":"https://www.cbr.com/andrew-lloyd-webber-phantom-of-the-wapera-remix-megan-thee-stallion-cardi-b-song/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Webber-WAP-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Acclaimed musical theater composer Andrew Lloyd Webber created a remix of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/cardi-b/\">Cardi B</a> and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/megan-thee-stallion/\">Megan Thee Stallion</a>'s summer hit, \"WAP,\" titling it \"Phantom of the WAPera.\"</p><p>Webber is an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/two-egot-winners-also-razzie-winners/\">EGOT</a> (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar and Tony) award-winning and nominated composer, responsible for the some of the most commercially successful musicals on Broadway such as <em>Evita</em>, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/cats/\"><em>Cats</em></a>, <em>Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat</em> and <em>The Phantom of the Opera</em>. After hearing Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion's hip-hop single, the 72-year-old composer shared his own rendition on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/tiktok/\">TikTok</a>.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cats-andrew-lloyd-webber-slams-movie-director/\">Cats: Andrew Lloyd Webber Slams Movie, Director: 'The Whole Thing Was Ridiculous'</a></span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/oneofthosefaces/status/1299340149109727232?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1299340149109727232%7Ctwgr%5E393535353b636f6e74726f6c&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pinknews.co.uk%2F2020%2F08%2F29%2Fandrew-lloyd-webber-phantom-of-the-wapera-wap-cardi-b-megan-thee-stallion-remix-tiktok%2F\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>The TikTok video features Webber dancing in his home to \"WAP,\" intercut with a shot of him sitting at his piano playing the hauntingly familiar score from <em>The Phantom of the</em> <em>Opera</em>'s<em> </em>title track. Webber posted the video with the caption, \"Phantom of the WAPera ft. the man himself - TeamALW.\"</p><p>Webber created his <a href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/@officialalw?lang=en\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">TikTok account</a> back in June and already has multiple videos featuring himself playing piano, hanging out with his pets, barbecuing and recording at Abbey Road Studios.</p><p>\"WAP\" was released on Aug. 7 and is the lead single for Cardi B's upcoming second album. It debuted at number-one on the <i>Billboard</i> Hot 100 and broke the U.S. record for the best opening streaming week for a song. It also reached number one in Australia, Canada, Ireland and New Zealand.</p><p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2020/08/29/andrew-lloyd-webber-phantom-of-the-wapera-wap-cardi-b-megan-thee-stallion-remix-tiktok/?fbclid=IwAR2-TDOlN8Uh6ZLx5ODphlzitmxPFyIm2S13LGrqSY_5OzM4jV1PLgBtBz4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PinkNews</a></em>)</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/cardi-b-cosplays-barb-wire-pamela-anderson/\">Cardi B Cosplays as Barb Wire in Instagram Photoshoot</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:05:39 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Webber-WAP-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"37a3f8511bada8e0abb5c15ee91ca3fd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-02-969_d5832fb042053b35.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":71840,"destBytes":71840,"author":"Hillary Sussman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Webber-WAP-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn56@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-02-969_d5832fb042053b35.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700502},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"10 Behind-The-Scenes Facts About Batman: Arkham Asylum | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dc-batman-arkham-asylum-behind-the-scenes-facts/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Behind-The-Scenes-Facts-About-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman-arkham-asylum/\">Batman: Arkham Asylum</a></em> is one of the most influential and critically successful games of all time. In addition to the incredible reviews the game received upon its initial release, <em>Arkham Asylum</em> helped to change the gaming world with its fluid and unique ‘Arkham combat’ system, allowing the player to truly feel like Batman.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-arkham-villain-changes-good-bad/\">Batman: Arkham - 5 Changes To Batman's Villains That Were Great (&#38; 5 That Weren't)</a></span></p><p>With the trailers for Rocksteady’s <em>Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League </em>and Warner Bros Montreal’s <em>Gotham Knights </em>recently dropping, now is the perfect time to head back into the past and explore the behind the scenes facts of one of the most iconic video games of all time, <em>Batman: Arkham Asylum. </em>All entries come from the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hncjC6PtixU\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Batman: Arkham Asylum</em> behind-the-scenes documentary</a>, unless otherwise stated.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Undercurrent Theme</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-arkham-asylum-game-cover.jpg' /></figure><p>The developers were aware that, during movies and games, it is common for the main character to have their own theme, the main villain to have their own theme, and then during the final clash between them, the separate musical scores also clash.</p><p>While Batman had his own theme in <em>Arkham Asylum</em>, the developers had an undercurrent Arkham theme that would be present throughout the game. It’s subtle, but the beat changes throughout the game even depending upon which area of the asylum the player is exploring.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Warner Bros Foley</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-1.jpg' /></figure><p>The creators of <em>Batman: Arkham Asylum</em> were focussed on creating a world that the player could get lost in. They wanted it to feel believable and engrossing, despite featuring characters such as Batman and Poison Ivy.</p><p>One area that the developers took an interest in was their sound design. They wanted the in-game sounds to be incredible. As a result, they used professional sound designers and Foley from Warner Bros for a week to create the in-game sounds.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Batman’s Cape</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-2.jpg' /></figure><p>Fans of the video game series may be unaware that over two years of effort went into animating <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-cape-cowl-unusual-secret-powers/\">Batman’s cape</a>. The developers said that they wanted the cape to feel like it was a character itself.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-batman-quotes-arkham-games/\">10 Best Batman Quotes From The Arkham Games</a></span></p><p>One way in which they did this, apart from the brilliant movement involved when Batman moves, is how the cape becomes damaged after various encounters with villains.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Mix Of Motion Capture &#38; Hand-Drawn Animation</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Batman-arkham-asylum-148.png' /></figure><p>The creative team behind <em>Arkham Asylum</em> took an extensive amount of care in making sure that the player would feel like Batman when playing their game. In order to get this right, the developers used a mix of motion capture and traditional hand-drawn animation to make their game feel natural.</p><p>A martial artist was used to capture Batman’s attacks, while a gymnast was brought in to make sure that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-harley-quinn-best-costumes-ranked/\">Harley Quinn’s unique movements</a> were captured correctly. This allowed for a balance between realism in the motion capture and stylized imagery with the hand-drawn animation.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>The Nuance Of The Predator System</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg' /></figure><p>The predator system is one of the most iconic features of the <em>Arkham</em> games. The system allows Batman to take down a group of enemies using stealth. Batman moves unseen through the environments akin to a predator.</p><p>The game's creators, however, were worried that if this predator system wasn’t done correctly it would make Batman seem cowardly. As a consequence, great care was taken to make sure Batman was seen as ‘in control’ during these predator missions.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Batman's Design</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batcave-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg' /></figure><p>Batman has gone through many designs over the decades. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-best-worst-outfits/\">The hero has changed his costume several times</a> and, even when these changes are fairly major, the character is always instantly recognizable as Batman.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-arkham-game-plot-holes-fixed-comics/\">Batman: Arkham - 10 Plot Holes In the Games' World That Were Resolved In The Comics</a></span></p><p>The creators of <em>Arkham Asylum</em> wanted to incorporate some of these iconic Batman designs into their own portrayal. Consequently, they drew from Neal Adams, Jim Lee, and Dave McKean's versions when creating their own Batman.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Batman: The Animated Series Connections</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Batman-The-Animated-Series-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>The makers of <em>Batman: Arkham Asylum</em> wanted their game to be not only the best Batman game of all time but also one of the Dark Knight's greatest stories. To do this, they knew that they had to get the best voice actors and writers for the job.</p><p>Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamill voiced Batman and Joker respectively in <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-animated-series-behind-scene-facts-know/\">Batman: The Animated Series</a> </em>and reprised their roles in the<em> Arkham </em>games. Further, one of the lead writers on <em>Arkham Asylum</em>'s story was Paul Dini, who helped create and write <em>Batman: The Animated Series</em>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Born From The Failure Of The Dark Knight Game</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-James-Gordon-and-Joker-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg' /></figure><p>Surprisingly, EA had the rights to Batman games in the mid-2000s. The publisher released the movie tie-in game to <em>Batman Begins</em> and was working hard to produce a movie tie-in video game for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dark-knight-saved-superhero-movies-hurt/\"><em>T</em><em>he</em> <em>Dark Knight</em></a> too.</p><p><p style=\"text-align: left;\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-arkham-series-comics-trivia/\">10 Things About The Batman Arkham Series You Only Learn In The Comics</a></span></p></p><p>However, the developers struggled to release the game on time. As EA didn’t release a game, the video game rights to Batman reverted back to Warner Bros, who then <a href=\"https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2016-02-02-peek-at-the-cancelled-batman-the-dark-knight-movie-tie-in-game\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">gave the rights to Rocksteady</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Arkham Asylum: A Serious House On Serious Earth</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Arkham-Asylum-A-Serious-House-On-Serious-Earth-joker.jpg' /></figure><p>In a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/paul-dini-talks-batman-arkham-asylum/\">2009 interview</a>, Paul Dini specifically signaled out Grant Morrison's <em>Arkham Asylum: A Serious House on Serious Earth </em>as an influence on <em>Arkham Asylum</em>'s creation.</p><p>The 1989 graphic novel deals with Batman entering Arkham to try and put an end to a riot, which naturally leads to the Caped Crusader running into several famous faces of his Rogues Gallery. The novel is one of Batman's greatest stories and is considerably more psychologically driven than <em>Arkham Asylum</em>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Gothic Art Deco</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Arkham-Asylum-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg' /></figure><p>When crafting a Batman story, it’s vital that the creators think carefully about the world they are creating. The character's mythos and Gotham City in general are so stylized that getting the world wrong could alienate fans.</p><p>With this in mind, the creators of <em>Arkham Asylum</em> aimed to create a gothic, Art Deco style in a similar manner to <em>Batman: The Animated Series, </em>though with far more grit imbedded in its designs. The asylum itself is a gothic nightmare with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/arkham-asylums-darkest-secrets-finally-revealed/\">secrets buried in its long history</a>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-worst-moments-arkham-franchise/\">The 5 Best Moments In The Arkham Franchise (And The 5 Worst)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 22:00:03 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Behind-The-Scenes-Facts-About-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"60b020c44aac994f55b97bf0130a945e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn96@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-694_d29f9bb822a8cb01.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":174918,"destBytes":174918,"author":"Sam Hutchinson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/10-Behind-The-Scenes-Facts-About-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn96@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-694_d29f9bb822a8cb01.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-arkham-asylum-game-cover.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn58@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-11-075_d1023584910157b0.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-1.jpg":null,"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn31@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-05-840_3b15367a79606693.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Batman-arkham-asylum-148.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn19@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-17-549_3004d039dfe718e3.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn38@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-542_dd5b49a610d82705.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batcave-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn17@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-13-199_0c2e45267a895a99.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Batman-The-Animated-Series-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn33@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-264_ebca7cc63aadc226.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Batman-James-Gordon-and-Joker-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn78@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-804_a14bddd64556d2f8.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Arkham-Asylum-A-Serious-House-On-Serious-Earth-joker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn34@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-09-154_ed92daa3d35db4c5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Arkham-Asylum-in-Batman-Arkham-Asylum.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn79@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-11-342_ac8c717365dd791e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Supernatural: Padalecki, Ackles Share Emotional Messages Ahead of Filming the Series Finale","link":"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-padalecki-ackles-messages-series-finale/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/supernatural-final-season-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/supernatural/\"><em>Supernatural</em></a> stars Jensen Ackles and Jared Padalecki shared emotional messages ahead of filming the show's series finale episode.</p><p><span class=\"\">\"As I head out to the first day on my LAST season finale, I can’t help but be incredibly grateful for all that #Supernatural and the #SPNFamily mean to me,\" Padalecki, who portrays Sam Winchester, captioned a selfie showing him giving a thumbs up to the camera. \"It’s been an incredible journey, to say the least. I, for one, am hoping that #SupernaturalNeverDies.\"</span></p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEc2-1QHmt-/?utm_source=ig_embed\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jared-padalecki-shares-supernatural-season-15-spoiler/\">Jared Padalecki Shares a Supernatural Season 15 'Spoiler'</a></span></p><p>Ackles -- who has been portraying Dean Winchester for 15 seasons -- also shared a heartfelt video on his own account, in which he marked the end of the series by explaining a bittersweet change he noticed on the final script.</p><p>\"So last night, we completed 326 episodes of <em>Supernatural</em>,\" a visibly emotional Ackles said. \"And at the very end of every one of those scripts are <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-wiki-to-be-continued-pins/\">three words: 'To Be Continued.'</a> Today, we start episode 327. And at the very bottom of the very last page of this script, there are only two words.\" Ackles then held up the final page of the script to the camera, which showed the words \"The End.\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEc3RIuAe1U/?utm_source=ig_embed\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/supernatural-final-seven-episodes-promo/\">Supernatural Hypes Final Seven Episodes With New Promo</a></span></p><p>Emphasizing how tough it will be to say goodbye to the show, Ackles also captioned the video, \"It's gonna be a rough two weeks.\"</p><p>Starring Jared Padalecki, Jensen Ackles, Misha Collins, and Alexander Calvert, the final seven episodes of <i>Supernatural</i> begin airing on Oct. 8 on The CW. The first fourteen seasons of <i>Supernatural </i>are now available on Netflix.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:43:11 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/supernatural-final-season-header.jpg","linkMd5":"89fc8d1225e849701cb19bf6d93583a8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-742_903e2751f8fe0e83.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":74346,"destBytes":74346,"author":"Keegan Prosser","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/supernatural-final-season-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn62@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-742_903e2751f8fe0e83.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"15 Best Characters In Fire Force, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-best-characters-ranked/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Fire-Force-Ranked-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fire-force/\">Fire Force</a></em> or <em>Enen No Shouboutai</em> is a Japanese Shonen Manga that has been running since 2015. It's created by the same genius that made the widely beloved<em> Soul Eater</em>, Atsushi Ōkubo. Thankfully, it is also the same sort of insanely-stylized, action-packed, and incredibly unique sort of tale than Okubo is known for. And now, with the recent anime adaption, it seems like we all agree! <em>Fire Force</em> is a story about Firefighters that fight fire...with fire?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: 5<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-vs-soul-eater-comparison/\"> Reasons Why Fire Force is an Improvement on Soul Eater (&#38; 5 Why Soul Eater is Classic)</a></span></p><p>Basically, Spontaneous Human Combustion is real in this setting and firefighters are its enemy. But, the mystery is secondary to the diverse, unique, and frankly refreshing characters <em>Fire Force</em> has to offer, so let's go through and introduce the best of them.</p><p><em><strong>Update August 31st, 2020 by Louis Kemner: </strong>By now, Fire Force's second season is well underway, and all kinds of shocking revelations are being revealed one at a time, both in the Tokyo Empire and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-season-2-episode-8-truth-oasis/\">in mainland China</a>. Shinra is rapidly working his way to the truth of the white-clad cult and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-season-2-episode-7-great-cataclysms-mysteries/\">the Great Cataclysm</a>, and he's meeting all kinds of cool new allies and villains along the way. Now, let us review five more cool characters who make Fire Force what it is.</em></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">15 </span>Charon, The Indestructible Fire Warrior</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/charon-fire-force.jpg' /></figure><p>This large fellow has appeared a few times alongside Haumea, and he has proven himself one tough pyrokinetic in combat. He took on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-shinra-facts-only-true-fans-know/\">Shinra</a> in close-quarters combat, and it seemed like nothing Shinra could throw at him would faze him.</p><p>The secret: Charon is a second-generation pyrokinetic, and he can absorb his enemy's firepower and throw it right back at them. It'll take more than fire kicks to take this behemoth of a warrior down.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">14 </span>Haumea, The Cackling Troublemaker</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-haumea.jpg' /></figure><p>Here is another white-clad cult member who has definitely made her presence known by now. This woman hides her eyes not with a cloth, but with a crown, suggesting a great deal of authority in the cult. At least, she acts like it, being a competent field commander for her fellows.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-best-ignition-powers/\">Fire Force: The 10 Best Ignition Powers</a></span></p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-episode-4-haumea-most-threatening-villain/\">Haumea</a> is a wicked schemer who loves to stir things up, and every time the heroes think they've got her cornered, she blasts off and taunts them over her shoulder. Just what is she plotting next?</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">13 </span>Arthur Boyle: One Trick Knight...King</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Arthur-Boyle-Characters-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>At first, this fire soldier was more of a gag character than a serious fighter, but that's starting to change. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-arthur-boyle-facts-history-trivia/\">Arthur Boyle</a>, the so-called \"Knight King\" is a third-gen pyrokinetic who uses fiery plasma rather like a lightsaber blade, making him really stand out in all the right ways. This chivalric buffoon trained with Shinra at the academy and is assigned to Brigade 8 as well.</p><p>He's incredible in a fight as long as he's fully immersed in his knightly persona. For now, Arthur plays second fiddle to most of his Company 8 allies, but he's catching up quickly, and he may be a real kingly knight on the battlefield someday.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">12 </span>Shinra Kasakabe: A Refreshing Shonen Protagonist</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Shinra-Character-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>Shinra on the other hand, is a bit less trope-y then the standard run-of-the-mill shonen protagonist, both mentally and appearance-wise. Most protags tend to act how they look, but Shinra is the exact opposite. The more demonic he looks in the moment, the more the readers can be sure he's actually incredibly conflicted.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-shinmon-benimaru-comparison-characters/\">Fire Force: 5 Anime Characters More Powerful Than Shinmon Benimaru (&#38; 5 Weaker)</a></span></p><p>Shinra Kusakabe can be hard-headed, but most of the time he's respectful, realistic, and a quick-thinker. Which are three traits that are not easily found in shonen main characters. But, at the end of the day, he's still the poster boy.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">11 </span>Iris</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Iris-fire-force.jpg' /></figure><p>This young lady is a fully trained sister, or nun, who never fails to pray for the souls of fallen Infernals when the fire soldiers destroy them. She's not a fighter; she's a healer for the soul, and she can help escort the victims of spontaneous combustion to the great fire of heaven <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-different-interpret-of-latom/\">with a prayer</a>.</p><p>That's an important job, and Iris does it with crisp professionalism. On a personal level, she is a charming and upbeat friend for everyone at Company 8, and she gets a little flustered when she's with the girls, but she's in good company all the same.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Sho Kusakabe</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Sho-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>This is Shinra's little brother, who was once thought lost in a house fire. But the white-clad cult made sure that he survived, and they spirited him off and began training him. Now the Kusakabe brothers are on opposite sides of the fight for humanity's future.</p><p>Sho is stoic and stern, but he does have a fascinating ability: to cool down the entire universe and thus freeze time, except for himself. This makes him a deadly swordsman, and time will tell if he begins to feel guilt about his role in all this and whether he'll long to return to Shinra's side.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Vulcan Joseph: The Mechanic Obsessed With Animals</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Vulcan-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>Vulcan is the future engineer of Fire Brigade 8 and a total animal lover. The setting of <em>Fire Force</em> takes place long after a fire-based global calamity. And Vulcan's family has passed down the knowledge of all the species of animals that were lost in said calamity. As such, all of Vulcans inventions are animal-based, and an absolute delight to see.</p><p>Vulcan himself is a rather standard eccentric fellow, with a gift for invention. But, what propels him above the rest is the strength of his personal design, the designs of his animal contraptions, and the charm of his creations.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Princess Hibana</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Firefighters-Ranked-princess-hibana-3.jpg' /></figure><p>She's not literally a princess, but Princess Hibana sure acts like it, often putting her foot on bowing subordinates to keep them in their place. She was once a nun in training and knows Iris on a personal level, and she has a mind of scientific curiosity.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-my-hero-academia-characters-could-couldnt-defeat-shinra/\">Fire Force: 5 My Hero Academia Characters Shinra Could Defeat (&#38; 5 Who'd Pulverize Him)</a></span></p><p>All this drives her to ruthlessly study Infernals, and she will use her fearsome firepower on anyone who opposes her, even Shinra. But she's cooled down a bit, so to speak, and is now a loyal and rather charming ally.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Benimaru Shinmon: The Not-So-Standard Lone Wolf Powerhouse</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Benimaru.jpg' /></figure><p>On the surface, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-amazing-cosplays-anime/\">Benimaru Shinmon</a> seems to be another example of the \"sulking bad boy\" trope. A character that seems apathetic and rude, but is too powerful to teach a lesson to. But, the more time he spends on the screen, the more readers see that Shinmon is actually quite a relatable character.</p><p>Sure, he's a powerhouse Ignition-user with a weird right pupil, but he's also a capable leader who has quite the dedicated following. Plus, he's self-sacrificing, unapologetically kind, and weirdly confrontational. All this adds up to making Benimaru one of the characters on Shinra's side so far. Plus, it's fun to see him vaulting around on those poles.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Ogun Montgomery: Just An Overall Great Guy</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ogun.jpg' /></figure><p>Ogun knew Shinra and Arthur from their academy days, and he acted as a sort of peacemaker between them all. He scoffed at the idea of knights, since Arthur is actually a firefighter, but he does enjoy his rivalry-based friendship with Arthur.</p><p>Now that season 2 has begun, Ogun is a part of the squad, and he has proven an outgoing and reliable friend during the trip to China. It's likely that he'll have a few glorious moments to his name before the season is over.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Viktor Licht: The Wackjob Scientist</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-viktor.jpg' /></figure><p>Around the same time that Vulcan joins the crew, Viktor Licht shows up. He's the scientist or researcher of Brigade 8 who obviously has an ulterior objective. But, despite lying to everyone, Viktor is weirdly charming? He's not an Ignition user and isn't really even a firefighter, but he shows up to all the battles regardless.</p><p>He's constantly around to explain complicated fire-based science to the readers, and even works as a tertiary comedic relief. Licht is just an all-around positive addition to the dynamic the Brigade 8 eventually falls into and is completely dedicated to solving the human combustion mystery.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Maki Oze: The Kick-Butt Female Mage</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Maki-Fire-Force-Character.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-maki-oze-facts-trivia-history/\">Maki Oze</a> is one of the best characters in <em>Fire Force</em>, hands down. First of all, she's a female character that actively contributes to the fights in a Shonen series, something that doesn't happen as often as it should. Secondly, she's muscular and has served in the military, another two things that again, isn't seen in female characters often.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-season-two-speculation-best-worst/\">Fire Force: 5 Things the Second Season Should Have (&#38; 5 That it Shouldn't)</a></span></p><p>And lastly, she's unique! Maki isn't the serious veteran stereotype one would think she is. She's funny, vulnerable, and uses her powers to create cute little characters! Basically, the \"Mage\" of Brigade 8 is highly adept at bringing readers under the spell of her charms.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Karim Fulham: Apathetic Trope Done Well</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Firefighters-Ranked-karim-flam-6.jpg' /></figure><p>In <em>Fire Force</em>, the firefighters are split off into different fire \"Brigades\" 1 through 8. And the one that's closest to the Church of the Holy Sun is Brigade 1. These are apparently the most pious and devout of the Fire Brigade members, but Karim seems to defy expectations. On the surface, he's just an apathetic \"soldier,\" but the more time he spends around Shinra and crew, the easier it is to see how likable he is.</p><p>Karim is conversationally repetitive, apathetic, and sarcastic. Which isn't the best defense of his charms. But, he's also a hero, reliable, and is always there to help. Plus his Ignition ability is so interesting that fans are always clamoring to see more of him.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Akitaru Obi: The Buffest Firefighter In History</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Obi-Character-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>Akitaru Obi is absolutely, without a doubt, 100%, the model firefighter. A man who started as a normal firefighter, and worked his way up to captain of Brigade 8. Obi is tenacious, kind-hearted, and a total musclehead. If Obi isn't working out, then something must be wrong. But honestly, his obsession with fitness ties back to a devout need to help others.</p><p>Akitaru is a great leader, a kind captain, and is honestly quite funny. People tend to find these sort of \"good guy\" leaders boring, but Obi is an exception to the rule. Plus he contributes to fights despite literally having no fire-based abilities.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Takehisa Hinawa: The Complete Package</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Lieutenant-Character-Fire-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>And finally, it's time to talk about Takehisa. It was a rough time trying to figure out who should rank first, Takehisa or Obi. But, at the end of the day, Takehisa Hinawa is a more diverse character. Hinawa is lieutenant of the 8th directly under Akitaru, but he acts more like the leader himself sometimes.</p><p>Takehisa is dryly amusing to watch. His thousand-yard stare is somehow both intimidating and charming, his lack of social awareness makes for some great punchlines, and his obsession with ruining Maki's fire-creations is the sort of humor that keeps him finely balanced as a <em>Fire Force </em>character. And for combat, he uses second-gen pyrokinetic to actually use magic bullets. Now that's cool.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-anime-hilarious-memes/\">10 Fire Force Memes That Are Too Hilarious For Words</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 14 Jul 2019 22:00:12 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Fire-Force-Ranked-header.jpg","linkMd5":"07e161d32f328cafab771083a3fa600b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn6@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-03-306_999d412fcf4441c5.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":89552,"destBytes":89552,"author":"Jacob erx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-06-903_44a3a76956baf338.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-viktor.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn63@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-10-253_5928a9da08bd2b68.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Maki-Fire-Force-Character.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn69@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-13-672_545933fdbf12cbd8.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Firefighters-Ranked-karim-flam-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn11@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-489_74524cda6ffda67b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Obi-Character-Fire-Force.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn55@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-17-542_580d340544febe89.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Lieutenant-Character-Fire-Force.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700510},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Netflix Launches 'Watch Free' Site With Bird Box, Episodes of Stranger Things and More","link":"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-watch-free-site-bird-box-stranger-things/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Netflix.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/netflix/\">Netflix</a> is offering access to some of its original movies and series for free -- and viewers will not need an account to watch.</p><p>To attract new subscribers, Netflix launched a “<a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/watch-free\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Watch Free</a>” portal that is available to anyone with internet access. The section includes 10 movies and shows that the streaming service is offering for free without a subscription.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-conducting-tests-for-shuffle-option/\">Netflix Is Conducting Tests for a 'Shuffle Play' Option</a></span></p><p>The free films include <em>Bird Box</em>, <em>Murder Mystery</em>, <em>The Boss Baby: Back in Business</em> and <em>The Two Popes</em>, while the free television shows are <em>Stranger Things</em>, <em>Love Is Blind</em>, <em>When They See Us</em>, <em>Grace and Frankie</em>, <em>Elite</em> and <em>Our Planet</em>.</p><p>With the new free access, viewers can watch these titles with all language options but will only be able to stream the first episode of each Netflix original series. According to the Watch Free site, Netflix will be changing the selection from time to time, allowing viewers to preview more of their original movies and shows.</p><p>\"We’re looking at different marketing promotions to attract new members and give them a great Netflix experience,\" a Netflix representative told <em><a href=\"https://gadgets.ndtv.com/entertainment/news/netflix-free-movies-tv-shows-series-watch-android-computer-browsers-2287882\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Gadgets360</a></em>.</p><p>Each of the free titles can be watched online on a computer or through an Android device. The website states that Apple iOS browsers are not supported, and viewers cannot stream the free content on a smart TV or Netflix-enabled streaming box.</p><p>This is not the first time Netflix has promoted its streaming service with free content. In February, the streaming service made their original film <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/to-all-the-boys-ive-loved-before/\">To All the Boys I’ve Loved Before</a> </em>free to all US viewers, and in April, Netflix released 10 documentaries on YouTube for free.</p><p>(<em>via <a href=\"https://variety.com/2020/digital/news/netflix-free-streaming-bird-box-stranger-things-two-popes-1234754478/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Variety</a></em>)</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/netflix-replaces-ta-dum-sound-theatrical-releases-hans-zimmer-intro/\">Netflix Replaces Iconic 'Ta-Dum' Sound on Theatrical Releases With Hans Zimmer-Composed Intro</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:06:12 Andrews","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Netflix.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn85@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-02-179_7b471ad4c3311a69.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Food Wars!: The BLUE Tournament Becomes a Family Reunion | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-the-blue-tournament-becomes-a-family-reunion/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mana-vs-erina.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: the following contains spoilers for Season 5, Episode 9 of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/food-wars/\">Food Wars!: Shokugeki no Soma</a>, now streaming on Crunchyroll.</strong></em></p><p>Erina Nakiri is the girl with the God Tongue, the top student at Totsuki, and its dean as well. But perhaps not even she can handle the monumental challenge placed before her. Up until now, Erina has been treated differently from the other chefs who had entered <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-season-5-episode-8-takumi-erina-greatest-challenges-yet/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">the BLUE</a>. Now she comes face to face with the mysterious Bookmaster. The conversation that follows changes everything for Erina and her Totsuki allies.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-blue-tournament-seriously-heating-up/\">Food Wars: The BLUE Tournament is SERIOUSLY Heating Up</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mana-nakiri-sitting.jpg\"/></figure><p>Erina Nakiri didn't take part in the three-gate challenge that Soma, Takumi and Megumi did. Instead, she fought the countless chefs who failed those challenges, all by herself, and exhausted herself in the process. She won't stand for this much longer, so she marched right into the central castle on the BLUE tournament's grounds and demanded to see the Bookmaster. Before long, she stood before the head judge herself, and defiantly notes that she has survived all of the Bookmaster's attempts to eliminate her from the BLUE. The Bookmaster can't see why Erina should complain, since she has indeed won all her matches, and then the bamboo blinds are raised to reveal the kimono-clad woman sitting there, a fan in hand. This is Mana Nakiri, Erina's very own <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-key-events-vol-94/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">mother</a>.</p><p>Mana is on a quest, but so far, she feels nothing but despair about her progress. She, too, possesses the God Tongue, but she has maxed out her culinary journey. She has sampled and tasted every flavor and cooking style the world has to offer, and she is desperate to taste something gourmet that the world has not yet seen. It's the classic \"I'm too strong for my own good\" paradigm that sometimes appears in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/japan-top-shonen-jump-protagonists-international-fandom-divide/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">shonen anime</a>, and coldly, Mana doubts that her daughter can give her what she wants. She has already given up on Erina, and instead believes that Asahi Saiba can fulfill her dream to taste that new gourmet dish. Erina feels differently. She stands proud and declares that she shall win this tournament, and prove her mother wrong, whatever it takes.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-season-5-episode-7-saiba-faces-tsukasa-eishi/\">Food Wars!: Saiba Faces Tsukasa Eishi With His Incredible Arsenal of Cookware</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/erina-fired-up.jpg\"/></figure><p>Erina is now fired up more than ever, with the personal stakes of her mother's quest versus her own self-worth. Erina defied her controlling father, Azami, and freed Totsuki from his self-serving vision of what \"perfect\" gourmet looks like. Now Erina will prove her worth to her mother, too, and never has Soma seen Erina this alive in the kitchen. Up until now, Erina was a lofty goddess of gourmet, casually rejecting any dish that didn't meet her stratospheric standards. But now someone stands above Erina, and it's time to get to work.</p><p>The single-elimination tournament is well underway, and after <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-season-5-episode-8-soma-takumi-rivalry-paid-off/\">defeating Don Kama with Soma</a>, Takumi must face Erina alone. These are steep odds, and Takumi knows it. He will challenge Erina with all he has, and when Erina presents an astounding dish to the judges, Takumi retorts with his own modified version of a dish Erina had once defeated him with. It's a fine comeback, but alas, it's not enough to douse the flames of Erina's determination to topple her mother. Erina has no grudge against Takumi, but neither does she show any mercy. She defeats him 3-0 in their match, taking Takumi out of the running and moving Erina one step closer to challenging Mana's own God Tongue. Sooner or later, Erina is bound to run into Soma and/or Asahi Saiba as well, and they may be next on Erina's chopping block.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/food-wars-season-5-episode-7-soma-diner-experience-pays-off/\">Food Wars!: Soma's Diner Experience Pays Off Yet Again</a></span></p>\n                        \n Kemner","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mana-vs-erina.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn17@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-325_9d62ac0598b9884e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/mana-nakiri-sitting.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn82@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-943_139def1da727362b.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/erina-fired-up.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn71@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-15-551_132e1f7a606299da.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Bill & Ted Face the Music: Why Dave Grohl Makes a Cameo | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-dave-grohl/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/bill-ted-face-the-music-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bill-and-ted-3/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</a>, now in theaters and on premium video on demand.</strong></em></p><p>If someone wants to know what the world will look like five years from now, they should probably just ask Dave Grohl. At least, that's what <em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</em> suggests: The Foo Fighters founder makes a cameo as himself in the year 2025.</p><p>After nearly 30 years, Bill Preston (Alex Winter) and Ted Logan (Keanu Reeves) are back to save the world in <em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</em>. Bill and Ted travel into the future and the past to steal the song that will unite the universe. The tricky part is that they have to steal it from <em>themselves</em>. It's convoluted and complicated, with jumps back and forth in time, as is to be expected from a <em>Bill &#38; Ted</em> movie.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-other-selves/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music: All the Other Selves the Duo Meets</a></span></p><p>In any case, the 2020 Bill and Ted travel through time and, in the process, come across their allegedly successful selves in 2025. However, the future Bill and Ted are prepared for this visit, faking their \"glamorous\" lives. They ensconce themselves in a mansion and imitate English accents for one reason or another. In the course of the encounter, the present-day Bill and Ted are able to get the song that will save the world; at least, that's what they <em>believe</em> -- until the mansion's owner returns.</p><p>As they leave, Bill and Ted bump into Grohl. Present-day Bill and Ted are stoked about the encounter, thinking Grohl is visiting their future selves. However, Grohl is far from excited about the meeting.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Grohl-Bill-Ted.jpg\"/></figure><p>\"Who are you guys?\" Grohl asks. \"What are you doing in my house?\"</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-post-credits-scene/\">Does Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Have a Post-Credits Scene?</a></span></p><p>It finally dawns on Bill and Ted that their future selves have lied about their success, so present-day Bill and Ted close the door in Grohl's face, marking the end the too-brief cameo by the one-time Nirvana drummer. This isn't Grohl's first screen role, by any means. Aside from appearances in numerous Foo Fighters and Nirvana videos, his appearances include episodes The X-Files and The Muppets; he's also voiced characters on <em>The High Fructose Adventures of Annoying Orange</em> and <em>Metalocalypse</em>.</p><p>Grohl’s cameo in <em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</em> suggests the musician will not have aged a day over the next five years. Everything else the film predicts seems absurd, so this is probably its most accurate instance of prognostication.</p><p><em>Directed by Dean Parisot and written by Chris Matheson and Ed Solomon, Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music stars Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, Anthony Carrigan, Kid Cudi, Brigette Lundy-Paine and Samara Weaving. The film arrived in theaters and on premium video on demand Aug. 28.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-sets-world-record-air-guitar-online/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Sets World Record for Most People Playing Air Guitar Online Simultaneously</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 23:45:24 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/bill-ted-face-the-music-header.jpg","linkMd5":"67ba9ba1fdc7ec48fbb21a6c256ba042","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-03-181_1dc7bc329bd183ae.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":182055,"destBytes":143224,"author":"Simon Boehm","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/bill-ted-face-the-music-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn66@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-03-181_1dc7bc329bd183ae.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Grohl-Bill-Ted.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"JoJo: 5 Times We Hated Josuke (& 5 Times We Loved Him) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-bizarre-adventure-diamond-unbreakable-josuke-best-worst-moments/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/JoJo-5-Times-We-Hated-Josuke-5-Times-We-Loved-Him-featured-image.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/jojos-bizarre-adventure/\">Diamond is Unbreakable</a> </em>is the fourth installment in the <em>JoJo</em> series. It follows the adventure of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-josuke-higashikata-villains-fight-win/\">Josuke Higashikata</a>, the son of Joseph Joestar. A lot has been said about Josuke and how he seems like a step down from Jotaro Kujo.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED:  <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojos-bizarre-adventure-last-survivor-trivia/\">10 Things You Didn't Know About JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Last Survivor</a></span></p><p>But, it is merely a matter of taste. Josuke is a great character in his own right. He is quite different from the other JoJos. It is worth noting that Josuke is <a href=\"https://comicbook.com/anime/news/jojos-bizarre-adventure-creator-reveals-his-favorite-character/#:~:text=The%20creator%20was%20then%20asked,Diamond%20Is%20Unbreakable%2C%20Josuke%20Higashikata.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Hirohiko Araki's favorite character</a>. Josuke is someone a lot of people would feel comfortable to be around. Part 4 has some of his best and worst moments.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>HATED: Wasted Time With Rohan</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Josuke-Dice.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it finally confirmed that a serial killer was on the loose in Morioh, it sent shivers down the spine of everyone...everyone except Josuke. Despite knowing that something bad was happening to his town, he decided to go to Rohan's house to con him out of some money.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Josuke requested Mikitaka to turn into dice and used him to cheat Rohan. Rohan was furious with the losses, but he couldn't find out what was wrong. This was bad on Josuke's part who could have done more productive things such as looking for Kira?</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>LOVED: Doesn't Kill Enemies</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Smartest-and-Dumbest-josuke-1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A lot of people have pointed out how Josuke <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-bizarre-adventure-anime-character-jonathan-joestar-stronger-weaker/\">resembles Jonathan Joestar</a>. Both the characters could not bear to kill anyone, no matter who it was. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Jonathan was hesitant to kill even Dio Brando, who had caused him so much suffering. Josuke is similar in this way, he doesn't like killing people. He even spared Kira after defeating him.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>HATED: Stole Joseph's Wallet</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joseph-and-Josuke.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-outstanding-joseph-joestar-cosplayers/\">Joseph Joestar</a> came all the way to Morioh to help Jotaro find out about the person who was using Red Hot Chili Pepper. This proved to be the perfect opportunity for Josuke to meet his father.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-characters-araki-wasted-shouldnt-exist/\">JoJo: 5 Characters Who Were Wasted By Araki (&#38; 5 Who Shouldn't Have Existed)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Towards the end, when Joseph and Jotaro were leaving Morioh, Josuke enquired about the picture that he lent to Joseph. Joseph confirmed that he had put it in his wallet and that was all Josuke needed to hear. He used Crazy Diamond's power to steal his wallet. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>LOVED: Cared About His Family</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/3.-Josukes-grandpa.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Josuke lived with his family in Morioh ever since he was a kid. He loved both his grandfather and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-bizarre-adventure-forgotten-characters/\">his mother</a> and was willing to go to any lengths to protect them. When Angelo killed his grandfather, Josuke was furious and he didn't rest until he got rid of Angelo. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Josuke has protected his mother several times, including from Enigma and also from Joseph. Josuke knew that she would be distraught if she saw Joseph again.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>HATED: Too Cautious About His Hair</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/5-josuke-school-thug.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Josuke is very proud of his hair. He copied the hairstyle of his savior, who helped Josuke and his mom to reach the hospital. This is undoubtedly a very nice gesture; however, Josuke gets riled up too easily when someone takes a jibe at his hairstyle. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With his hairstyle, it is very obvious that people passing will pass a remark or two, however, it doesn't give Josuke the right to attack them in a blind fury. Jotaro would have been in real trouble if he didn't have his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-bizarre-adventure-star-platinum-stands-better-worse/\">Star Platinum to defend himself</a>. He goes overboard when his hair is insulted.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>LOVED: Unique Stand</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Crazy-Diamond-stand-JJBA.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Early in Part 4, Jotaro said that Josuke has a unique power. Unlike most Stands, Josuke's Stand did more good than harm. Its ability to heal people and other objects is very precious, and it is difficult to pinpoint one particular moment that highlights the Stand's brilliance since Josuke used it in very ingenious ways.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-bizarre-adventure-stardust-crusaders-band-references-missed/\">JoJo: 10 Band References You Missed In Stardust Crusaders</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Josuke used the rubber glove trick to beat Angelo, while he used his Stand against Otoishi to trap <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-jojo-localization-stand-names/\">Red Hot Chili Pepper in a tire</a>. The aforementioned moments endeared Josuke to the fans.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>HATED: Troubled Shigechi</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/JoJo-Heroes-Dispicable-Acts-josuke-bullies-shigechi-9.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojos-bizarre-adventure-funniest-characters-most-hilarious-quote/\">Josuke and Okuyasu</a> became the best of friends despite their chaotic first encounter, where the two of them were pretty close to killing each other. The two of them were looking for a way to earn some money when they met Shigechi and his Stand, Harvest.</p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After some careful deliberations, Josuke came up with a plan that would exploit Shigechi's Stand and make them rich. Josuke and Okuyasu befriended Shigechi only because they wanted to use his Stand.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>LOVED: Dedication For His Hero</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Josuke-Saves-Himself.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While Josuke has been criticized for overreacting to comments pertaining to his hair, there is a pretty solid reason behind his reactions. The reason is that his hero had exactly the same hair as Josuke, so insulting his hair would mean insulting him. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Josuke is usually very calm, as was shown early on in Part 4 when he was being bullied by his seniors and he did nothing. He only got violent when they insulted his hair.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>HATED: Too Laid Back Sometimes</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jotaro-Josuke.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><em>Diamond is Unbreakable</em> is Josuke's part, but at times it didn't really feel that was the case. Many a time, Josuke would wander off and do something too unnecessary. Most of the hard work in the Kira case was done by Jotaro. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It is not possible to blame anyone who thinks that Jotaro was more important in solving the mystery of Kira. Josuke isn't a bad protagonist, but some other characters did more work in the Kira case.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>LOVED: Funny Throughout Part 4</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/josuke-and-okuyasu.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">After seeing <em>Stardust Crusaders</em>, fans had high expectations from the next JoJo. It is fair to say that Josuke is a brilliant JoJo in his own right. He is not serious all the time like Jotaro, as he loves to have fun. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It could be said that many viewers can relate to Josuke's day to day high school struggle. His demeanor throughout Part 4 was outStanding. He pitched in with the jokes every now and then, which made the whole thing more interesting.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojos-bizarre-adventure-hamon-alternatives/\">Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: 5 Ways Hamon Is Anime's Best Fighting Style (&#38; 5 Better Alternatives)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:30:33 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/JoJo-5-Times-We-Hated-Josuke-5-Times-We-Loved-Him-featured-image.jpg","linkMd5":"a0b719d218d6a417834a7e15f437a088","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":67024,"destBytes":67024,"author":"Suzail Ahmad","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/JoJo-5-Times-We-Hated-Josuke-5-Times-We-Loved-Him-featured-image.jpg":null,"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Josuke-Dice.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn1@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-16-572_00381ecd8ba8e047.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Smartest-and-Dumbest-josuke-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn94@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-06-321_bdb861cc63049d75.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joseph-and-Josuke.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn57@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-05-839_d4b107f462e9467e.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/3.-Josukes-grandpa.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn45@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-052_8f91538e4a2bb309.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/5-josuke-school-thug.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn70@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-900_d9d102f8ae71ffed.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Crazy-Diamond-stand-JJBA.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn31@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-161_50812cf2d913b7f1.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/JoJo-Heroes-Dispicable-Acts-josuke-bullies-shigechi-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn98@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-10-430_092dafcb0ab1f739.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Josuke-Saves-Himself.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-15-494_a5905d064d06daf1.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jotaro-Josuke.jpg":null,"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/josuke-and-okuyasu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn97@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-16-445_98fdf71030261740.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"What Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther Meant to Superhero Movie Culture Outside America","link":"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-black-panther-meant-superhero-movie-culture-outside-america/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/black-panther-chadwick-boseman.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-obituary/\">The death of Chadwick Boseman</a> has shocked people around the world. In many ways, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Boseman</a> performance in 2018's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther-film/\">Black Panther</a> went beyond Hollywood's usual depictions of superheroes, and a lot of that has to do with what he represented and the people he connected with outside of America.</p><p>To them, he was their Black Superman, especially in places like Africa, Asia and the Caribbean. In that sense, given what he's accomplished as the Wakandan king on the big screen, <em>Black Panther</em> wasn't just a movie, it was a movement, and Boseman wasn't just an actor, because he was a cinematic civil rights leader.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-angela-bassett-full-circle-black-panther/\">Chadwick Boseman: Angela Bassett Recalls 'Full Circle' Black Panther Experience</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/black-panther-boseman.jpg\"/></figure><p>From the moment he pushed back against King T'Challa using <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-accent-importance/\">a European or American accent</a> because he wanted Africa to be depicted as authentic, Boseman became a key figure in Ryan Coogler's movement. After all, to get an all-Black cast and team behind the camera to bring this landmark project to life made a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-movie-mcu-diversity-statement/\">big statement</a> about what the Marvel Cinematic Universe could do for representation in movies. Now, after <em>Black Panther's</em> success, more Black films are entering the mainstream, especially in the superhero genre.</p><p>Boseman's role on the throne showed that you didn't need white heroes to save the world and that the feminist movement could rock the box office as well, like with 2019's <em>Captain Marvel</em>. Not to mention, it gave people hope that maybe someday even LGBTQ heroes could find their place on the big screen. This is all testament to the inspiration Boseman has been to everyone, <em>everywhere</em>, seen from the YouTube clips where audiences gave incredible reactions when he went through the portal in <em>Avengers: Endgame</em>, and from personal experience in the Caribbean where every scene he's in is greeted with rapturous applause. While white Hollywood has its Captain and Caped Crusader, Black fans had their King in Boseman.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/joe-biden-kamala-harris-pay-their-respects-to-chadwick-boseman/\">Joe Biden, Kamala Harris Pay Their Respects to Chadwick Boseman</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Panther-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p>On top of all of that, given Boseman's social work, rallying for the Black Lives Matter movement and better representation in governance, he also appeals to minorities, immigrants and POC all over the world who've taken a strong stance against, racism and systematic oppression. The impact can be felt when you look back at him, with stoicism yet humility, as fans talk about seeing a hero who looks like them or talks like their ancestors. It's an emotional impact that kids of color didn't feel before. Sure, the '90s had <em>Blade</em>, but that franchise wasn't the call for change that <em>Black Panther</em> was.</p><p>Boseman's T'Challa embodied all these things to the outside world, making POC feel they could be more. It's why his speech when Killmonger passed in <em>Black Panther</em> resonates for people whose family were slaves, indentured or who suffered when their lands were colonized. This was a big stroke as it cemented him as the first modern superhero of a new era, one that changed the game to make us fans non-cis-white leads could marshal a tentpole blockbuster. To us outside of America, the sentiment is exponential as he represented the possibility of a cosmopolitan, kaleidoscope and accepting society -- a belief the world can change and embrace everyone, no matter what, which is what Wakanda stands for in the MCU.</p><p>This is best summed up in one reaction online where a giddy fan uses Martin Luther King Jr.'s  \"I have a dream\" line when T'Challa makes his return in <em>Endgame.</em> It shows that he was a paragon of virtue to those who never saw themselves truly on the big screen. It wasn't that he was just a freedom fighter, as he was actually an institution these people connected to. His portrayal spoke to them, letting them know that their art, fashion, food and terrain were worthy of Hollywood. Boseman was the tipping point for a new wave, and since his arrival, it's gained so much momentum. Now, in the wake of his passing, we can only expect it to drive forward in honor of his legacy. Because, from now on, every time we hear \"Yibambe\" or see the \"Wakanda Forever\" salute, we'll remember them as universal tributes to a beacon of light gone too soon, and a superhero regent that changed the world for the better.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-chairman-marvel-president-express-grief-chadwick-boseman/\">Disney Chairman and Marvel President Express Grief For Chadwick Boseman</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 17:45:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/black-panther-chadwick-boseman.jpg","linkMd5":"3466abf35dd4e42564092b3c3179e0e2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn53@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-789_36f6bee82c1ed4f5.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":128260,"destBytes":101934,"author":"Renaldo Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/03/black-panther-chadwick-boseman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn53@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-789_36f6bee82c1ed4f5.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/black-panther-boseman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn93@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-13-870_b77c771646d5fb7d.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Black-Panther-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn55@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-16-078_fe255266acbe3d76.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 come to an end but grateful it was able to adapt the complete story from Joe Hill's 2013 novel. In addition to thanking Hill, along with the series' cast and crew, O'Brien thanked the fans for their continued support behind the series.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/jami_obrien/status/1300488640515067909\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/jami_obrien/status/1300488642763259904\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-joe-hill-season-2-postmortem-interview/\">NOS4A2 EP Joe Hill On Strong Creatives &#38; New Storylines + a Deleted Scene From the Finale</a></span></p><p>In an exclusive interview with CBR following the series finale's initial airing, O'Brien expressed hopes that the series would be renewed by AMC, hinting that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2-showrunner-jami-obrien-season-2-postmortem-interview/\">a potential third season could follow Vic and her son</a> after their traumatic encounters against the monstrous Charlie Manx. The vampire had preyed on children to stay eternally young, menacing Vic across the first two seasons before their longstanding feud reached a dramatic finish in the Season 2 finale.</p><p>Adapting the Hill novel of the same name, <em>NOS4A2</em> was developed by O'Brien and premiered on AMC in June 2019 before being renewed for a second season the following month.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/nos4a2s-paul-schneider-interview/\">NOS4A2: Paul Schneider on Bringing the Hourglass Man to Murderous Life</a></span></p><blockquote><p>Charlie Manx, a seductive immortal who feeds off the souls of children, has his whole world threatened when a young woman in New England discovers she has a dangerous gift. A young Victoria \"Vic\" McQueen discovers she has the power to unlock portals that help her find lost objects.</p></blockquote><p><em>NOS4A2</em> Season 2 stars Zachary Quinto, Ashleigh Cummings,
