10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Disney+ Source Code Indicates a Group Watchalong Feature Is in Development","link":"https://www.cbr.com/disney-plus-watchalong-in-development/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Ttg2CEH543tfSAaZEEH2DG-1.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/disney-plus/\">Disney+</a> might be bringing more family and friends together with the addition of a new group watch feature just in time for the debut of <em>Mulan</em>.</p><p>According to <a href=\"https://www.disneyplusinformer.com/group-watch-feature-disney-plus/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Disney Plus Informer</a>, new code was added to the Disney+ service on Aug. 28 that adds a Group Watch feature to all accounts and will allow subscribers to stream their favorite movies and shows with family and friends across the world.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Everything Coming To Disney+ September 2020\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/everything-coming-to-disney-plus-september-2020/\">Everything Coming To Disney+ September 2020</a></span></p><p>The Group Watch feature works by generating an invitation that subscribers can send to someone else. Once the recipient clicks on the link, they will be added to a watch session where they can use interactive emojis and a chat feature to connect with others during the film or show. Currently, the program is coded to have seven emojis and reactions, including laugh, love, cry, anger, winking and smiling.</p><p>Each subscriber can send up to six invites and therefore have a maximum of seven people in each watch party. All participants must have a Disney+ account and Premier Access if watching a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-plus-more-movies-mulan-premier-access-releases/\">Premier Access movie</a>. The invitation will send a sign-up link to all invited participants who do not have a Disney+ account.</p><p>All subscribers must also have the content available in their own international market. Therefore, someone in the United States would not be able to start a watch party with an individual in the United Kingdom if the content is not available in their region.</p><p>As of now, the Group Watch feature can only be used from a laptop or mobile device and not through an app on a television or streaming box. Subscribers will also only be able to join one watch party at a time, and the feature cannot be initiated by a Kids profile.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Disney, Verizon Extend Free Disney+/Hulu/ESPN Deal for 12 Months\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/disney-verizon-extend-free-disney-plus-hulu-espn-deal-12-months/\">Disney, Verizon Extend Free Disney+/Hulu/ESPN Deal For 12 Months</a></span></p><p>The feature will also have a PIN code option that will likely be used as a parental control to prevent children from taking part in watch parties that feature more mature content. This is in line with other rumors that suggest Disney+ is adding a PIN-enabled, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rumor-disney-to-add-adults-only-section-for-r-rated-fox-mgm-films/\">adults-only section</a> of the streaming service.</p><p>Should the feature come to fruition, this would make Disney+ the first international streaming service to have watchalongs built directly into its program, as other platforms such as Netflix must use extensions to add the functionality.</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 15:50:08 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Ttg2CEH543tfSAaZEEH2DG-1.jpg","linkMd5":"08c86b36be039788c7b71cddfda43186","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn22@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-606_e8cba47ed048c168.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":58150,"destBytes":58150,"author":"Jessica Andrews","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Ttg2CEH543tfSAaZEEH2DG-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn22@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-606_e8cba47ed048c168.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"DCEU: 5 Villains We'd Love To See In Wonder Woman 3 (& 5 Who Wouldn't Work)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dceu-5-villains-wed-love-to-see-in-wonder-woman-3-5-who-wouldnt-work/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-Villains-Featured-Image.jpg\"/></figure><p>With <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/wonder-woman-1984/\"><em>Wonder Woman 1984</em></a> just around the corner and the likelihood being quite high that it will setup another sequel for Gal Gadot to return to the role, fans are already speculating which villain(s) will be next on her journey. Who will follow-up Maxwell Lord and Cheetah?</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-wonder-woman-comics/\">The 10 Best Wonder Woman Comics Ever</a></span></p><p>Not only does Wonder Woman have a diverse gallery of villains to pick from but there is potential for other antagonists of the DC universe to cross her path as shown with Maxwell Lord. However, there are also villains that probably are best left forgotten due to their strange or downright goofy powers and abilities.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Yes: Fury</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Aresia.jpg' /></figure><p>Also known as Aresia, Fury is essentially Diana's opposite. While Diana sees hope for mankind and seeks to help to guide them towards a better future, Fury just sees the violence and hatred of men. Fury wants nothing but to rid the world of all males in order to create peace on Earth.</p><p>This character was reinvented as a villain with a tragic backstory for the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-animated-series-dcau-shows/\">DCAU's <em>Justice League</em> animated series</a>. Since Aresia became one of the show's most famous villains, perhaps the DCEU could translate her into a live-action form.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>No: Doctor Psycho</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Doctor-Psycho-Harley-Quinn.jpg' /></figure><p>While this character has some potential in a movie, the concept of a small-bodied man with a giant head and psychic powers has been overplayed in so many comic book stories. Hector Hammond from Green Lantern, The Leader and MODOK from Marvel Comics, and the Thinker who will be appearing in James Gunn's <em>The Suicide Squad</em>.</p><p>Still, even if they manage to include Doctor Psycho, his design would need to be drastically altered to fit the tone that the movies have set. Perhaps it's best to leave him in the comics or <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/harley-quinn-animated-series-season-two-best-episodes/\">comedic animated shows like <em>Harley Quinn</em></a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Yes: Circe</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Circe.jpg' /></figure><p>When it comes to villains, Wonder Woman has a trinity of main recurring rivals: Ares, Cheetah, and the evil sorceress known as Circe. The latter has had several drastically different depictions in the comics over the years, but she is generally always an evil centuries-old witch who has a hatred for Amazons.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-wonder-woman-weaknesses-diana-prince/\">DC: 10 Weaknesses You Didn't Know Wonder Woman Had</a></span></p><p>With Wonder Woman being one of the biggest sources of magical elements in the DCEU, Circe is ripe for the big screen. She would be a perfect villain for Diana to fight in the modern era, maybe Circe can even join the likes of Lex Luthor, Black Manta, and Deathstroke in a live-action <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/legion-of-doom-most-powerful-members-ranked/\">Legion Of Doom</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>No: Veronica Cale</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/veronica-cale-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Veronica Cale is a rich philanthropist who hates the main hero out of prejudice while using her limitless resources to not only destroy them but also control the entire world. Seems familiar, doesn't it? That's because this is a very common comic book trope that was popularized by Lex Luthor and has been used with the likes of Maxwell Lord and Simon Stagg.</p><p>Veronica is essentially Wonder Woman's Lex Luthor but without any of the memorable traits of the latter. She is an uninspiring character who, much like Doctor Psycho, is just victim to an overused villain concept. Veronica would need something new in a live-action form to make her distinct.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Yes: Genocide</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Wonder-Woman-Genocide.jpg' /></figure><p>With Ares established in the first <em>Wonder Woman</em> movie and the high chance that the God of War will eventually return, perhaps his ultimate soldier created to destroy Wonder Woman would be a great logical step for a sequel.</p><p>Genocide was created by Ares and a handful of Wonder Woman's foes as the perfect killer of the Amazon princess. She is powered by the Lasso of Hestia itself, allowing her to siphon the truth out of her victims or attack their soul. Genocide is, essentially, the Wonder Woman equivalent of Doomsday, and an effective one at that. She proves to be a danger to both Wonder Woman and the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-greatest-enemies-justice-league/\">Justice League</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>No: Blue Snowman</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Blue-Snowman.jpg' /></figure><p>A woman who wears a high-tech armored snowman suit, it's pretty easy to see why this one might come across as a little silly on film. Even the Silver Age would feel ashamed to have Blue Snowman alongside the likes of Egghead and Crazy Quilt.</p><p>Furthermore, cold-related villains are more overused concepts for villains that should be saved for the iconic ones like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/awesome-mr-freeze-cosplay-every-batman-dc-fan-needs-see/\">Mr. Freeze</a> or Captain Cold. Even the name, Blue Snowman, is not exactly one that puts fear into the hearts of people. It sounds more like a character from an animated preschool show.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Yes: Giganta</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Giganta.jpg' /></figure><p>Fans have seen a hero grow to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-ant-man-powers-creative-uses/\">size of a skyscraper with Ant-Man </a>and the Atom but what if a villain got that power? Giganta is one of the longest-lasting villains of Wonder Woman's roster of villains. While she has received multiple origins over the years, the more recent interpretations would fit perfectly on the big screen.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-wonder-woman-closest-allies/\">DC: Wonder Woman's 10 Closest Allies</a></span></p><p>The story of a scientist trying to cure themselves of a disease, thus leading to them gaining superpowers is nothing new. However, the ability to change size is one that could provide a new kind of superpowered fight in which Diana must face a titan. It can also lead audiences to sympathize with the villain, making Giganta less of a one-note villain.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>No: Angle Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Angle-Man.jpg' /></figure><p>With the right visuals, this character could potentially provide some of the more interesting fight scenes due to his ability to change the angles of plains. Think Christopher Nolan's<em> Inception</em> mixed with 2017's <em>Doctor Strange</em>, and it could make for a fun watch. So why would Angle Man not work?</p><p>Well, the truth is that audiences might consider those aspects about the character too unoriginal as even <em>Doctor Strange</em>'s reality-bending sequences were considered too reminiscent of <em>Inception</em>. It also doesn't help that the character is so obscure that some fans might consider Angle Man to be a waste of a villain slot.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Yes: Silver Swan</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/silver-swan.jpg' /></figure><p>Most of Wonder Woman's more iconic villains originate from magic but Silver Swan's origins stem from science and a dark descent into madness. She began as an ally hero and friend of Wonder Woman but slowly, Silver Swan lost her mind. The nanites that allowed her to walk and fly as Silver Swan combined with a misunderstanding to turn her into a deadly threat</p><p>Silver Swan is one of the more unique Wonder Woman villains due to her disturbing and dark psyche that only gets worse and worse. With nanites at her disposal, nearly indestructible wings and claws, and superhuman speed, Silver Swan is just begging for a live-action incarnation.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>No: Sharkeeta</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sharkeeta.jpg' /></figure><p>As if the name was bad enough, Sharkeeta is a half-woman, half-shark who was contained like a pet by the Amazons until she had enough and broke out to get back at her captors. Even though she technically came first, the idea of a human-shark hybrid was done much better with King Shark, who is set to appear in<em> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/suicide-squad-cast-characters-revealed/\">The Suicide Squad</a></em>.</p><p>Much like with Doctor Psycho, there is a chance Sharkeeta could work in a movie if rebooted with a new design to make her more intimidating and have a better story. If not, she is just a silly villain that should be better left forgotten.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-avengers-win-lose/\">Wonder Woman: 5 Avengers She Could Beat (&#38; 5 She'd Lose To)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:30:55 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-Villains-Featured-Image.jpg","linkMd5":"d959162bdab2a0364a2e405c4f9940e9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn70@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-02-009_088d62d36d249e2f.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":145280,"destBytes":145280,"author":"Melody Macready","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Wonder-Woman-Villains-Featured-Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn70@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-02-009_088d62d36d249e2f.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Aresia.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn17@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-323_7e41376fde973f22.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Doctor-Psycho-Harley-Quinn.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn78@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-07-075_4f5e46e15ad92ddb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Circe.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn54@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-11-773_bef1fa67490fa5a5.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/veronica-cale-Cropped.jpg":null,"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Wonder-Woman-Genocide.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn90@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-08-008_214bd78a774c7be6.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/Blue-Snowman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn41@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-08-363_b7dacfb462e2aa38.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Giganta.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn22@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-05-965_a4d545847191934f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Angle-Man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn14@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-842_1fa7643f2603fd17.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/silver-swan.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-008_22ded0f3cf351dba.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sharkeeta.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn6@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-12-289_d88e3ce29e8474fb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Fans Petition to Replace Confederate Statue With One of Chadwick Boseman in the Actor's Hometown","link":"https://www.cbr.com/petition-replace-confederate-statue-chadwick-boseman-hometown/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/boseman.jpg\"/></figure><p>As accolades pour in to honor the life of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-panther-film/\"><em>Black Panther</em></a> star <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\">Chadwick Boseman</a>, a Change.org petition seeks to both establish a permanent monument to the late actor and strike a blow against systemic racism in the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/black-lives-matter/\">Black Lives Matter</a> era.</p><p>The <a href=\"https://www.change.org/p/city-of-anderson-petition-to-replace-the-confederate-monument-in-anderson-with-a-chadwick-boseman-memorial?use_react=false\">Change.org</a> \"Petition to replace the Confederate monument in Anderson with a Chadwick Boseman memorial\" calls for the Boseman statue to go in the town square of his South Carolina hometown.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-director-ryan-coogler-shares-tribute-chadwick-boseman/\">Black Panther Director Ryan Coogler Shares Moving Tribute to Chadwick Boseman</a></span></p><p>Petitioner DeAndre Weaver notes that Boseman, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-obituary/\">who died Friday of colon cancer at age 43</a>, \"made it a mission to give back to his community. Not only with his appearances at his alma mater Howard University but financially as well.\" Boseman rented a theater in Anderson when <em>Black Panther</em> was released, Weaver said, providing free screenings \"so that young boys and girls could be inspired by the film without the financial barrier.\"</p><p>\"It is only fitting that his work is honored in the same place that birthed him,\" Weaver said.</p><p>However, a South Carolina law stipulates no monuments of any kind to the \"<a href=\"https://law.justia.com/codes/south-carolina/2012/title-10/chapter-1/section-10-1-165\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">War Between the States</a>\" or any other U.S. conflicts can be moved, renamed, rededicated or changed. This law blocked an attempt earlier this year to remove the existing statue.</p><p>Weaver writes, \"To move forward into a brighter day Section 10-1-165 must be repealed. And upon the removal of a monument to the past I can think of no better person than Mr. Chadwick Boseman as a monument to the future.\"</p><p>As of this writing, the petition has gathered 17,041 signatures out of its 25,000 goal.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-black-panther-meant-superhero-movie-culture-outside-america/\">What Chadwick Boseman's Black Panther Meant to Superhero Movie Culture Outside America</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:45:05 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/boseman.jpg","linkMd5":"5c39ba615366bf463f0c665ed00b41dd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn92@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-02-207_4c233ae216115e85.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":43732,"destBytes":43732,"author":"Kelvin Childs","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/boseman.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn92@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-02-207_4c233ae216115e85.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Fire Force: The 10 Best Ignition Powers | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-best-ignition-powers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-featured.jpg\"/></figure><p>With the second season of Atsushi Okubo's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-vs-soul-eater-comparison/\">(the genius behind Soul Eater)</a> <em>Fire Force</em> underway, now seemed like a good time to give it credit for having one of the most unique settings and power systems we've seen in anime for quite a while. The idea of firefighters fighting fire with fire sounds like something a kid would think up, and that unique creativity is one of the reasons the series is so great.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Fire Force: 5 My Hero Academia Characters Shinra Could Defeat (&#38; 5 Who'd Pulverize Him)\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-my-hero-academia-characters-could-couldnt-defeat-shinra/\">Fire Force: 5 My Hero Academia Characters Shinra Could Defeat (&#38; 5 Who'd Pulverize Him)</a></span></p><p>There are different generations of fire-power users in the show known as Ignition Ability holders, among them, here are the ten that stand at the peak of all peaks.</p><p>Disclaimer: There will be spoilers and some answers <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-season-one-questions-answered-unsolved/\">to the mysteries of Season 1</a> so read carefully.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>The Devil's Footprints Of Shinra Kusakabe</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Devils-Footprints.jpg' /></figure><p>We would be remiss if this list didn't start with the main character themselves, Shinra Kusakabe. This plucky young hero/devil is the protag of <em>Fire Force</em> and always one of the most fun to watch fight. Shinra's Ignition Ability (titled the Devil's Footprints) allows him to generate flames from his feet in many different ways. He can fly, cause explosions, create jet propulsion, and even move at the speed of light in certain circumstances (<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-shinra-facts-only-true-fans-know/\">a mystery that's only happened once</a>). It's a bit unfair since Shinra is an Adolla Burst user, but for all intents and purposes, Shinra's a fantastic third-generation user.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Sho Kusakabe's Severed Universe</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sho-Feathers.jpg' /></figure><p>Moving right from one Kusakabe to the next, Shinra's Brother Sho is also a Third-Generation fire user who sadly works opposite to Shinra as part of the cult of the Evangelist (a cult <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-different-interpret-of-latom/\">built off the setting's mysterious religion</a>). Unlike Shinra who relies solely on his Third Generation, Sho is so dependant on his \"Fourth Generation\" ability given to him by the Evangelist that fans don't really even know what his Third Gen power is. Sho can slow down time to where it almost seems to be frozen, and that's absurd enough in of itself. But, the feathers he generates are something that is even more curious, and if he figures out how to use both of these Ignition Abilities in conjunction, he might quickly become the strongest pillar.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Arrow's...Arrow?</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Arrow.jpg' /></figure><p>Staying within the Cult of the Evangelist, Arrow is the personal bodyguard and servant of Sho Kusakabe and one of the most underrated ability users out there. Given ample time and the element of surprise, she can take down anyone with a single shot since Arrow is able to create flaming arrows that pierce even the strongest of flame retardant materials.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Soul Eater: The 10 Most Powerful Meisters, Ranked\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/soul-eater-most-powerful-meisters-ranked/\">Soul Eater: The 10 Most Powerful Meisters, Ranked</a></span></p><p>Arrow can change the trajectory of her arrows, fire them from any distance, and even set them up to explode at any distance. Frankly, she was almost enough to kill Benimaru, and if she didn't expose herself to the enemy so frequently she would be at the top of the food chain.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Benimaru Shinmon's Dual Generation Abilities</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Benimaru.jpg' /></figure><p>While most Ignition Ability users in<em> Fire Force</em> have a pretty easily understood power, Benimaru doesn't. This man is known as <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-shinmon-benimaru-comparison-characters/\">the strongest member of the <em>Fire Force</em></a> and was also lucky enough to be born as both a Second and Third-Generation ability user. His ignition ability allows him to create massive amounts of flame, but other than that it's pretty non-descript. But, because of his Second-Generation abilities, he can do such a diverse amount of things with the flame he creates, allowing him to seem like he has total control over fire in general. Benimaru's abilities can only be explained in one simple way, powerful.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Leonard Burn's Voltage Nova</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Leonard.jpg' /></figure><p>Leonard Burns, the Captain of the 1st Brigade has one of the most simple Ignition Abilities out there. But, just because it's simple doesn't mean it's weak, because it really isn't. In fact, it's likely the strongest ability out there if he's allowed to progress from Stage 1 all the way to Stage 5. To keep things simple, Burns basically generates fire inside himself rather than outside, and this fire creates an aura of heat around him as well as enhancing his own bodies' durability and natural strength. The stronger these flames become, the hotter the aura is, and the more durable Burns becomes. He's basically a towering, buff, furnace that can eventually melt anything around him given enough time to generate heat.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Kayoko Huang's Asclepius Staff</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kayoko.jpg' /></figure><p>Kayoko Huang is a very unique case, as her Ignition Ability is very likely useless in combat. But, outside of it, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-most-powerful-firefighters-ranked/\">this power is one of the most useful in all of the<em> </em>Fire Force.</a> Basically, Kayoko can generate a blue flame in the form of a snake that slithers into her patients and uses their own Ignition Abilities to heal them. This Snake also takes the form of the Asclepius Staff, a staff from Greek Mythos that is commonly associated with medicine and healing. Her power can save people from the brink of death, cure diseases, and even heal non-ability users with ease.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Ogun Montgomery's Flamy Ink And Forge</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ogun.jpg' /></figure><p>Ogun might not be a character that most fans think of when the idea of \"most powerful ignition abilities\" comes to mind, but that's only because Ogun hasn't been given the chance to show off enough yet. This 4th Brigade cool-guy is a longtime friend of Shinra and Arthur, and easily keeps up with them in battle thanks to his Ignition Ability.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Soul Eater: 10 Tsubaki Nakatsukasa Facts Most Fans Don't Know\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/soul-eater-tsubaki-nakatsukasa-facts-fans-dont-know-black-star-dwma/\">Soul Eater: 10 Tsubaki Nakatsukasa Facts Most Fans Don't Know</a></span></p><p>Ogun is able to conjure up a variety of blacksmith-esque weapons out of fire and launch them at enemies, and he's also able to brand himself with fiery tattoo's that buff up his stats to astronomical levels. Ogun has a very versatile ability that could frankly be absurdly powerful if he was just part of the narrative a bit more.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Nataku Son As The Sixth Pillar</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Nataku.jpg' /></figure><p>It's so sad that an innocent young child was forced to bear such deadly powers thanks to Rekka. But, after Nataku Tatsu awakened to his Third and Fourth Generation abilities as the Sixth Pillar, it became clear that his Ignition powers could one day level all of Tokyo if left on their own. Tatsu's Third Generation powers let him create a giant flaming claw from his right arm that he can use to cause massive destruction. But, even worse, when tapping into his Fourth Gen abilities, Tatsu can actually create floating Radiation Symbols that expel beams of massively destructive fire and radiation. Also, when using this, Tatsu himself expels high levels of deadly radiation. Hopefully, he grows up to use this power responsibly, because the series might be over quickly if he ever learns how to control it with precise mastery.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Kurono Yūichirō's Black Smoke</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kurono.jpg' /></figure><p>Kurono Yuichiro is another unique character in<em> Fire Force</em>. First of all, he's an awful person, spending most of his life delighting in bullying the weak. Secondly, his power is so insanely versatile it actually puts him on par with someone like Benimaru. Kurono has the Ignition Ability to create and modify Black Smoke from his body. That might not sound that great but this Black Smoke can be ridden on, can be solidified into any shape or form, let's Kurono detect any movement within it, and can be forced inside someone to burn them from the inside out. This character hasn't shown up yet in the anime (<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-anime-manga-differences/\">but has in the manga</a>), but we're hoping the animation studio does him justice.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Dragon's Firebreathing</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dragon.jpg' /></figure><p>Lastly, there's Dragon, a villain that showed up in the previous Arc and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fire-force-arthur-boyle-facts-history-trivia/\">was a massive turning point for Arthur</a>. Dragon's power is an enigma because at first, it seems like he can breathe fire and explode it from a distance. But, that doesn't explain his scales or how he can Infernalize his body at will. Plus, it doesn't explain his \"Draconic Pressure\" that damages his opponent the more Dragon is attacked. All of these lead fans to believe that Dragons actually Third-Gen power has something to do with Dragons themselves, and all of these are a natural result of it. It's still unclear, but one thing that isn't is just how powerful this ability is. Benimaru himself was even apprehensive about fighting the guy.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a class=\"bc-title-link\" title=\"Soul Eater: 10 Pieces Of Crona Fan Art You Have To See\" href=\"https://www.cbr.com/soul-eater-crona-fan-art/\">Soul Eater: 10 Pieces Of Crona Fan Art You Have To See</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:30:54 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-featured.jpg","linkMd5":"61a1af8fed824bcbbc0ab6a0789a19ec","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn1@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-872_1dd185ef9513acee.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":103910,"destBytes":103910,"author":"Jacob Buchalter","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/fire-force-featured.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn1@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-872_1dd185ef9513acee.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Devils-Footprints.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn49@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-12-674_01212204bd154be6.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Sho-Feathers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn89@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-07-142_3b53bb953f460edd.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Arrow.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn39@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-15-926_da3c654ed1ee298b.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Benimaru.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn37@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-12-592_c0b80fe7080201e8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Leonard.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-695_f91fce1eceb00296.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kayoko.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn22@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-09-006_7d0067f94f62506d.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Ogun.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn18@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-06-903_44a3a76956baf338.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Nataku.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn65@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-488_13fabedd980f5d5e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Kurono.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Dragon.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn70@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-08-622_5001b7f03bf1eb4d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Avengers: Yellowjacket's Origin Involves Murdering One of the Avengers","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-yellowjacket-origin-murder-goliath-hank-pym/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yellowjacket-versus-goliath-display.jpg\"/></figure><p>This is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/from-a-different-point-of-view/\">\"From a Different Point of View,\"</a> a feature where I discuss a comic book series with another writer. In this case, it is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/author/egon/\"><b>Eileen Gonzalez</b></a> who will be going over the history of the Avengers with me, story by story!</p><p> When <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-yellowjacket-debut-j-jonah-jameson-endorsement-spider-man/\">last we checked in with our heroes</a>, we had just met Yellowjacket for the first time in Avengers #59, \"The Name is...Yellowjacket!\" by Roy Thomas, John Buscema and George Klein. Yellowjacket stopped some fur thieves and was a total jerk about it, which got him the attention of J. Jonah Jameson, who was quickly pro-Yellowjacket.</p><p>This takes us to Yellowjacket's bizarre introduction to the Avengers!</p><p>I opened by noting, \"The first clue we should have had that Yellowjacket was someone we know is that he knew the go-to move to become an Avenger. Tie up Jarvis.\" \"Eileen commiserated with the sad sack Avengers butler, \"Poor Jarvis. He was having such a good time polishing things, too. And then Yellowjacket introduces himself as pompously as possible. It's kind of hilarious.\" I agreed, \"He's practically grabbing his crotch!\" Eileen noted, \"I get that they're probably trying to contrast him with his secret identity as much as possible, but still. Also, I guess he's chewing gum, too? I hope that's what that is.\" I replied, \"Yellowjacket is into chaw now.\" Eileen quipped, \"To cement his bad boy image, as opposed to genteel Jarvis, who is out here smoking a pipe as is proper. So why did Jan faint because of the 'strain of Hank's recent work' exactly? Hank was working really hard and this exhausted Jan somehow? I guess picking on someone and continuing to try to force him to marry you is hard work.\"</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-b.jpg\"/></figure><p> I wondered, \"I almost wonder if Thomas felt that was too much. You know, one of those instances where the writer has to try to explain away the art. So Thomas might have though, 'Ooph, that's a bit much to have her pass out just due to Yellowjacket's comments,' and so he threw in, 'Oh, and the stress of Hank's recent work!' It doesn't make sense, of course, but it's better than a superhero just fainting over some guy claiming he killed her boyfriend.\" Eileen replied, \"Hm, true. Maybe this is a first, though rather weak, attempt to improve Jan's character a bit.\"</p><p>Yellowjacket then tells the story of how he killed Goliath. Eileen noted, \"This flashback with the Yellowjacket vs. Goliath fight seems weird once we find out who Yellowjacket is. Like, wow, he really put a lot of effort into detailing every single aspect of this fight that never happened.\" I agreed, \"Right? He is DISTURBED. It's honestly kind of fascinating, when you think about it. How later writers were just, like, 'Yeah, he sort of snapped there for a bit, but it's all good now.' This is downright DISTURBING.\" Eileen opined, \"He should either take up creative writing or see a psychologist.\" I continued, \"Joe Casey did a miniseries where he tried to explain away how disturbing this all was and it was a good effort, but it really didn't work. I'll get into that a bit next issue, as that's where Casey really put a lot of effort into trying to explain it away. Because, obviously, we both know next issue is BONKERS. But yeah, the flashback to the fight even includes THOUGHT BALLOONS for Goliath!! And, of course, a classic John Buscema ordinary citizen.\" Eileen noticed, \"Yellowjacket is even inventing one-liners for the civilians!!\" </p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-e.jpg\"/></figure><p>I concurred, \"But that, in and of itself, makes no sense, as Yellowjacket is inventing WITNESSES to this thing! That, though, makes me wonder. Perhaps Buscema didn't know what the twist was? I did a Comic Book Legends Revealed recently about how Ed Hannigan left out a bit from an early issue of Legends of the Dark Knight. And then that bit turned out to be a clue as to the murderer's identity later in the storyline. Because Denny O'Neil didn't tell him that the guy in the beginning was going to be the murderer later on.\" Eileen replied, \"Ohhhh that would make sense. Either Thomas didn't tell Buscema about part two, or they just weren't thinking through how disturbing this would look in hindsight.\"</p><p>Eileen then wondered, \"My big question with all this is why the Avengers didn't immediately go running to Hank's house to try to rescue him and/or confirm his death. Wouldn't that be the obvious course of action?\" I agreed, \"Right? He specifically notes that he doesn't know if Hank is dead!\" Eileen added, \"This issue is a mess.\" I continued, \"And the Goliath/Yellowjacket fight is FOUR PAGES! That's an eternity. Filled up with this over-the-top, ridiculous fight.\"</p><p>Yellowjacket then kicks the Avengers' collective ass and kidnaps Wasp to his hidden headquarters in a tiny treehouse. Eileen had a question about his headquarters, \"I'm sorry, I hate to keep asking questions, but WHERE did Yellowjacket get that treehouse? Also, WHY did he get that treehouse? It's ugly.\" I agreed, \"So ugly. However, it DOES match some of Hank's past labs, design-wise.\"</p><p>I continued, \"Then we get the creepiest scene of the book. I will let you rant on this scene now.\" Eileen began her rant, \"I hardly even know what to say, to be honest. Again, I know they're trying to contrast Yellowjacket with the more mild-mannered Goliath, but we've already done that. There is no need for this scene at all!  Yellowjacket comes off as an even bigger creep than before, and Wasp's reaction makes everything worse. But hey, he feels bad afterwards, so I guess that makes it okay. Rant over. Thanks for that.\"</p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-i.jpg\"/></figure><p>I then wondered, \"And what does he mean by 'I've got other ways of knowing what you're really thinking'? Is that just a basic 'no means yes' bit? Or is it even more disturbing? Like, we don't see where his hand is, right?\" Eileen responded, \"Or she's kissing back because she's figured out who it is on a subconscious level.  Oh, ew, I didn't even notice the lack of hands. Ack.\" I continued, \"That certainly supports a disturbing reading of that sequence, right? I would assume that was not the intent, of course. But it's still weird language.'I have ways of knowing what you REALLY feel.\" Eileen theorized, \"I have a feeling this whole issue wasn't intended to be as horrible as it ended up. I don't think Thomas (and Buscema, depending on how much he was involved) realized how upsetting this all looked.\"</p><p>The Avengers then get their rematch and kick Yellowjacket's ass. I pointed out, \"I like that the others looked more competent in their rematch. Panther looked like he was about to cripple Yellowjacket. And I like the bit about how Hawkeye would have just killed him.\" Eileen added, \"Yeah, they're not playing around here. Too bad Jan stops them. For the WORST reason ever. Sheesh.\" </p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-j.jpg\"/></figure><p> I continued, \"Sigh. Yeah. That ending. It reminds me as sort of sad reflection of #54's ending. Where Thomas had the climax be one shocking thing. But it was really hiding the REAL twist. And he's doing that here, too. But it's a bad cliffhanger hiding an even worse twist. Hmmm...well, I mean, I guess the twist IS technically better than the cliffhanger. But they're both bad. Really great Jan drawing by Buscema, though.\" Eileen agreed, \"Yeah, I was actually just staring at it. It's such a great picture. I'll just ignore the speech bubble and the blurb text there.\" I opined, \"It's a nice romance comic throwback pose, right?\" Eileen agreed, \"It does look like that! I still can't believe this series fell so hard in quality after the Vision issues. I should sue them for whiplash.\"</p><p>I followed up on that, \"Visually, it's on par with the Vision issues. But yeah, story-wise and, perhaps, more importantly, tonally? All over the place. I think Thomas just wanted to mix things up. It was less longterm planning. And more just thinking of cool ideas in the moment. Yellowjacket, in a vacuum, is not a bad idea. The execution, though...yikes.\" Eileen noted, \"I seem to remember they did a better job with this in Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes, but the show got cancelled before they could really explore the concept.\" I continued, Well, we'll see how much more this goes off the rails when we look at the next issue. I always love a good wedding....and this is not a good wedding.\"</p><p>Okay, folks, if you have any questions for me or Eileen, you can drop us a line at brianc@cbr.com (yes, it's technically just my e-mail address, but I'll obviously pass it along to Eileen, as well).</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:43:55 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yellowjacket-versus-goliath-display.jpg","linkMd5":"90e050308024cfa7e9fed67c8a4d24be","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn82@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-833_21f72d8542588cb0.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":252589,"destBytes":230718,"author":"Brian Cronin","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/yellowjacket-versus-goliath-display.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn82@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-00-833_21f72d8542588cb0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-b.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn4@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-17-485_0cc122d325eaeee0.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-e.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn99@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-15-704_0c1802078f1702f7.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-i.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn81@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-06-184_a8ebb52bc4626651.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/avengers-59-j.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-09-772_4d67e75e4284e794.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Buffy the Vampire Slayer Reveals a New, Doomed Scooby Gang | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-the-vampire-slayer-doomed-scooby-gang/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Buffy-the-Vampire-Slayer-Cordelia-Giles.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following article contains spoilers for \"Where All Paths Lead,\" by Nilah Magruder, Lauren Knight, Alex Guimarães and Jim Campbell, from </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/buffy-the-vampire-slayer/\">Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Every Generation #1</a></strong><em><strong>, available now.</strong></em></p><p>With the story “Where All Paths Lead,” the <em>Buffy the Vampire Slayer: Every Generation</em> anthology offers fans a glimpse of an alternate universe from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/new-buffyverse-after-hellmouth/\">\"Hellmouth,\"</a> a crossover between the <em>Buffy The Vampire Slayer</em> and <em>Angel</em> comics, in which Buffy doesn't win the fateful final battle against Hellmother and Sunnydale destroyed. Interestingly, the comic reimagines Buffy’s original Scooby gang. and this change leads to this Buffy's unfortunate fate.</p><p>In \"Hellmouth,\" Buffy enters Hellmouth with Angel and several of her friends in order to defeat Hellmother and liberate Sunnydale from her power. In a turn of events, Hellmother possesses Angel, but Buffy doesn't fight her alone. With the help of Willow, Cordelia, Kendra, Anyanka and Rose, Buffy is able to cast Hellmother out of Angel and into the Hellmouth lake where a Buffy from an alternate universe pulls the demon deeper into the lake and to her certain doom. It's that Buffy that is the focus of \"Where All Paths Lead,\" which gives a little more backstory as to why this Buffy failed.</p><p>One of the first things revealed to be different in this alternate universe is that Cordelia, who often butts heads with Buffy, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-dating-cordelia-every-generation-comic/#:~:text=Although%20Buffy%20the%20Vampire%20Slayer%20did%20feature%20Willow%2C,an%20alternate%20universe%20take%20on%20the%20source%20material.\">is actually Buffy’s girlfriend</a>. “Where All Paths Lead” tweaks Cordelia’s role in Buffy’s past, revealing that the two had been dating since their time in high school. While not canon, it is great to see Buffy, who is often considered queer by fans, presented as undeniably queer in this universe and in a meaningful relationship with Cordelia.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-joss-whedon-willow-change-in-reboot/\">Joss Whedon Would Make a Major Willow Change in the Reboot</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Buffy-and-Cordelia-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>While Buffy's relationship with Cordelia may seem to be a positive, the second difference in this universe is shocking and sobering -- Willow is dead. Snippets of flashbacks reveal that Willow was killed before the Hellmouth opened and that Buffy blames herself for not <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/willow-boom-studios-first-look-buffy-vampire-slayer-comic/\">being able to protect Willow</a>. Struggling to cope with Willow's death, Buffy distances herself from Xander and many of her other friends, leaving her Scooby gang in \"Where All Paths Lead\" to consist of only Giles and Cordelia. To make matters worse, Buffy believes facing Hellmother alone will be the only way to keep everyone she loves safe, and after arguing with Giles and Cordelia, Buffy pushes Cordelia into Giles and jumps into Hellmouth by herself.</p><p>Of course, as echoed by Giles, Cordelia, and even the demon Agog, Buffy is defeated by Hellmother, who, in turn, destroys Sunnydale. Ironically, Hellmother only destroys Sunnydale out of spite because Buffy did not bring her friends into Hellmouth and therefore Hellmother did not have a suitable vessel for her wicked scheme. Shocked and refusing to believe that her world is gone along with all her friends, \"Where All Paths Lead\" closes with this Buffy running through the tunnels of Hellmouth, hoping she can save Cordelia.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-cordelia-whedon-wanted-black-actor/\">Buffy: Cordelia Was Black, But The WB Told Whedon to Make Her White</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/FF14-Buffy-Every-Gen-On-Her-Own-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Ultimately, it's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-cordelia-whedon-wanted-black-actor/\">Buffy's love for Cordelia</a> and fear for her friends' safety that brings doom upon Buffy and her loved ones. \"Where All Paths Lead\" reveals that only with the help of her Scooby gang can Buffy hope to defeat Hellmother, emphasizing <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/every-buffy-the-vampire-slayer-season-ranked-according-to-critics/\">the importance Buffy's friends play in her battles</a>, although it seems this is not the first time Buffy has had to learn this lesson the hard way. When facing off with Hellmother, the demon hints that Buffy has tried to fight her alone, perhaps in other alternate universes, but they all end in failure.</p><p>Buffy's love for her friends and determination to keep them safe is her bane, but her friends themselves are her boon and, ultimately, are the reason she's able to defeat Hellmother in the \"Hellmouth\" crossover. Buffy's watered down Scooby gang in \"Where All Paths Lead\" wasn't enough for her to succeed and reveals that this was the cause of her downfall. While there's no happy ending in \"Where All Paths Lead,\" it does show insight into Buffy's character and loyalty to her friends as well as how much her friends likewise care for her. After all, Buffy wouldn't be as good of a vampire slayer without her slayer Scooby gang.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Next: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/buffy-whedon-spike-ruining-approach-to-vampires/\">Buffy: Whedon Threatened to Kill Spike for Ruining His Approach to Vampires</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:20:02 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Buffy-the-Vampire-Slayer-Cordelia-Giles.jpg","linkMd5":"79674c8c69ba1cfa85ceb8c4b93be1bc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn73@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-699_3e78c159a39bc10d.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":77018,"destBytes":77018,"author":"Lee","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Buffy-the-Vampire-Slayer-Cordelia-Giles.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn73@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-699_3e78c159a39bc10d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Buffy-and-Cordelia-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn9@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-15-536_8a396bfc9a678f5a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/FF14-Buffy-Every-Gen-On-Her-Own-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn89@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-08-845_0cab4f139a19f699.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700502},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Plastic Man Vs Mister Fantastic: Who Would Win? | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/plastic-man-vs-mister-fantastic-who-would-win-marvel-dc-comics/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Plastc-Man-vs-Mr-Fantastic-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>The hero <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/plastic-man/\">Plastic Man</a> has been around for longer than most people imagine. Eel O'Brian's body was doused in an unknown chemical, gaining the ability to stretch and shift shape into just about anything. He's a great detective, one that even Batman trusts, and way more formidable than his demeanor would lead one to believe.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mcu-mr-fantastic-dream-castings/\">Fantastic Four: 10 Actors Who Could Play Reed Richards In The MCU</a></span></p><p>In some ways, he was probably a bit of an inspiration for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mister-fantastic/\">Mister Fantastic</a>. One of Marvel's first superheroes of the Silver Age, Mister Fantastic has the power to stretch as well and is <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-universe-most-intelligent-heroes-ranked/\">one of the most intelligent people on the face of the planet</a>. If these two malleable heroes were to clash, which one would win - Plastic Man or Mister Fantastic?</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">11 </span>Plastic Man: A Master Of Disguise</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/plastic-man-1.jpg' /></figure><p>Plastic Man's stretching ability gives him an advantage over most other stretchy heroes in that he can change his shape at will. He can not only transform into inanimate objects of all kinds but most importantly, with a little concentration, he can transform into other people as well.</p><p>This skill has served him well over the years, as it's allowed to get into all kinds of places that he wouldn't be able to. This helped both in his life as a detective and a superhero, allowing him to use his powers and skills against vulnerable aspects of his opponent's operations.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Mister Fantastic: A Better Fighter Than Most Imagine</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Mister-Fantastic-Fantastic-FOur.jpg' /></figure><p>While Mister Fantastic is primarily known as the brains of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fantastic-four/\">Fantastic Four</a>, able to think his way out of just about any situation and is the second most intelligent superhero of them all. When most people think of the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fantastic-four-villains-ranked/\">battles the Fantastic Four fights</a>, they don't think of Mister Fantastic as a big help.</p><p>However, Mister Fantastic has proven over the years that while he's better with his brains, he knows how to throw hands with the best of them. So, while it's not Mister Fantastic's first inclination if need be, he can fight it out with the best or them.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Plastic Man: Batman's Endorsement</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/batman-plastic-man-header.jpg' /></figure><p>For a long time, Plastic Man worked mostly on his own, sometimes helping Batman out in his investigations. However, when the time came for the Justice League to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-justice-league-rosters/\">expand its roster</a>, Batman recommended Plastic Man for the team.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-fantastic-four-rarest/\">Marvel: The 10 Rarest Fantastic Four Comics (&#38; What They're Worth)</a></span></p><p>Batman's recommendation is a very big deal. It's hard to earn Batman's respect and most people would look at Plastic Man and his demeanor and think that Batman would hate him but that's not the case at all. Batman has a ton of respect for Plastic Man and will bring him in whenever he needs some extra help.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Mister Fantastic: All Those Gadgets</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/mr-fantastic-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Mister Fantastic spends nearly all of his free time inventing things, sometimes to the detriment of his family and friends. It's kind of his thing- he spends most of his time in his lab, coming up with all kinds of new inventions and gadgets. Iron Man calls himself a futurist, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/iron-man-best-worst-upgrades-tony-stark-armors/\">but pretty much just invents weapons</a>; Mister Fantastic is actually inventing the future.</p><p>This gives Mister Fantastic access to all kinds of gadgets and technology that can help him in battle if need be and have served to help him get an advantage over all manners of foes.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Plastic Man: Fights Dirty</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Plastic-Man.jpeg' /></figure><p>Plastic Man wasn't always the best person in the world. In fact, he was a criminal when he gained his powers and then reformed, becoming the superhero everyone knows and loves. However, just because he's a superhero doesn't mean he fights completely fair.</p><p>Plastic Man learned a lot during his time as a criminal and he knows that sometimes, one has to do whatever it takes to win. Plastic Man doesn't always fight fair and his powers give him a unique advantage in that regard. If it comes down to winning, Plastic Man will do what it takes.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Mister Fantastic: Can Think His Way Through Any Problem</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Reed-Richards-Mr-Fantastic.jpg' /></figure><p>Mister Fantastic's knowledge isn't just good for solving scientific problems. As the leader of the Fantastic Four and a member of the Illuminati, Mister Fantastic has had to figure ways out of all kinds of problems, whether they be alien invasions, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/galactus-marvel-cosmic-characters-stronger-weaker-comparison/\">attacks by cosmic beings</a>, or <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-illuminati-members-hated-didnt-care-evil-things/\">trying to keep things under wraps that could destroy the superhero community</a>.</p><p>Mister Fantastic is used to thinking his way out of just about any problem, even when he is vastly outclassed. It's one of his greatest skills.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Plastic Man: Immortal</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Plastic-Man-Acid-in-a-Bullet-Wound.jpg' /></figure><p>Plastic Man's plasticity has had some remarkable side effects on his body. He's virtually indestructible- he'll lose his form when exposed to sudden heat or solvents, but he can reform his shape once these outside stimuli are gone. His internal organs are just as pliable as the rest of his body and he moves them around his body at will, preventing damage to them.</p><p>He's barely aged since WWII and once survived three thousand years at the bottom of the ocean floor. Batman has long said that Plastic Man is one of the most powerful members of the Justice League.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Mister Fantastic: Fantastic Back-Up</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Mr-fantastic-gear-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Mister Fantastic, although certainly able to defeat opponents on his own, has some of the best back-up a hero can ask for- the Fantastic Four. The FF is more than just a superteam- they're a family and always have one each other's backs. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/invisible-woman/\">Invisible Woman</a> <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-invisible-woman-dc-heroes-fight/\">is one of the most powerful people on Earth</a>, the Thing can go toe to toe with some of the strongest beings around, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/human-torch/\">Human Torch</a> can burn as hot as the sun.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/fantastic-four-mcu-fan-castings-ranked/\">Fantastic Four: Top 10 MCU Fan Castings, Ranked</a></span></p><p>If Plas were to somehow get the best of Mister Fantastic, he could call on some of the best back-ups around.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Plastic Man: His Powers Are Better</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/plastic-man.jpg' /></figure><p>Mister Fantastic can stretch and it makes him a pretty tough opponent, however his powers have nothing on Plastic Man's. Not only can Plastic Man stretch but he can transform his body into whatever he needs it to be. Let's say he can't lift something- he can make his muscles more powerful and lift it. He's functionally immortal.</p><p>Plastic Man can do things with his powers that Mister Fantastic just can't and that gives him a huge advantage in this battle.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Mister Fantastic: A Balanced Foe</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/8.-Mr.-Fantastic.jpg' /></figure><p>Fighting Mister Fantastic isn't like fighting other heroes- it's not just a physical fight, it's a race against time. Mister Fantastic is thinking the whole time he's fighting, trying to figure out the best way to win any given battle, using his prodigious intelligence, powers, and years of fighting experience to figure out the most efficient way to take out his foe.</p><p>Plastic Man's powers are undoubtedly better than Mister Fantastic, but Mister Fantastic is a foe unlike any he's ever faced before.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Winner: Mister Fantastic</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/mr-fantastic-bridge.jpg' /></figure><p>If there's anyone who can figure out a way to stop Plastic Man, it's Mister Fantastic. The fight would be touch and go for a while, but both men's powers afford them amazing durability and this will give Mister Fantastic time to figure out a way to counteract Plastic Man's greatest powers.</p><p>Even if he somehow can't do that, Mister Fantastic can call on his friends in the Fantastic Four to help him out. Regardless of the circumstances, Mister Fantastic would hand Plastic Man the loss.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-fantastic-four-reed-richards-costumes-love-hate/\">Fantastic Four: 5 Reed Richards Costumes That We Love (&#38; 5 That We Hate)</a></span></p><p>&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:00:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Plastc-Man-vs-Mr-Fantastic-header.jpg","linkMd5":"5afa9ff3e13d4e01cf29da16eb999439","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-565_a58850e04948f7b0.webp","destWidth":2000,"destHeight":1000,"sourceBytes":158796,"destBytes":158796,"author":"David Harth","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Plastc-Man-vs-Mr-Fantastic-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn13@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-565_a58850e04948f7b0.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/plastic-man-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn22@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-09-960_a7cd824ba544ec3b.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Mister-Fantastic-Fantastic-FOur.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn33@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-689_c1eb37f9faad2e25.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/batman-plastic-man-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn30@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-13-393_acbb77b9d5d11558.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/mr-fantastic-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn17@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-918_11a9755de7e8bb22.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Plastic-Man.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-17-328_e5756cb258e139cc.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Reed-Richards-Mr-Fantastic.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn86@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-08-808_d9aef1d1bad6b8ff.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/Plastic-Man-Acid-in-a-Bullet-Wound.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn37@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-406_2d293f739eccb4c8.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Mr-fantastic-gear-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn69@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-14-613_7fcbc117ff736863.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/plastic-man.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn77@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-17-847_9256d90b6ea07561.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/8.-Mr.-Fantastic.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-10-800_769ffc80d0dd585a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/mr-fantastic-bridge.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn23@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-031_6bc15fcf26112f3c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Star Trek: Lower Decks Name Drops a Forgotten TNG Villain | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-lower-decks-episode-4-moriarty-tng/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/lower-decks.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-trek-lower-decks/\">Star Trek: Lower Decks</a></strong><em><strong> Season 1, Episode 4, \"Moist Vessel,\" now streaming on CBS All Access.</strong></em></p><p>Since its series premiere, <em>Star Trek: Lower Decks</em> has made it clear it is a celebration of the entire <em>Star Trek</em> franchise. In just three episodes, the animated series has offered nods to multiple <em>Star Trek</em> series, from <em>The Original Series</em> to <em>Voyager</em>. However, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/star-trek-the-next-generation/\">Star Trek: The Next Generation</a> is the series <em>Lower Decks</em> has homaged the most since its first episode, referencing multiple characters from the live-action series, as well as specific storylines and aliens that first appeared on the fan-favorite show.</p><p>And these nods keep coming in <em>Lower Decks</em>' latest episode. In \"Moist Vessel,\" the animated series not only tips its hat to <em>TNG</em>'s classic poker games, but it also mentions a forgotten villain in Professor James Moriarty. Yes, that Moriarty.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-lower-decks-most-important-starfleet-officer-miles-obrien/\">Why Star Trek: Lower Decks Named The RIGHT Most Important Starfleet Officer In History</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-Lower-Decks-Boimler-Mariner-Ferengi.jpg\"/></figure><p>In \"Moist Vessel,\" Captain Freeman assigns her daughter the grossest and most menial jobs on the U.S.S. Cerritos in an effort to have her request a transfer off the ship. However, Mariner manages to find fun in these tasks, and instead, Captain Freeman attempts to discourage her in another manner: by promoting her to the rank of Lieutenant.</p><p>Ensign Boimler is the first to be left completely in shock at Mariner's promotion. After all, he does everything right while she does everything wrong, and yet somehow, she got the promotion he so desperately wants. Therefore, in an attempt to move up in ranks himself, Boimler attempts to copy Mariner's attitude.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-lower-decks-brings-back-kirk-punch/\">Star Trek: Lower Decks Brings Back A Classic Fight Move</a></span></p><p>He tries this when he receives an order via his Combadge. Since he finally has a chance to enact his plan, Boimler deviously answers back, even letting out an evil laugh. However, he quickly snaps out of it when the person on the other end asks him what's happening. He then brushes it off, saying it wasn't him but Moriarty.</p><p>The mention of Moriarty is a throwback to <em>Star Trek: The Next Generation</em>. While most <em>Star Trek</em> villains are aliens like the Ferengi, the Romulans and the Borg, Moriarty was a different breed. The character debuted in the Season 2 episode \"Elementary, Dear Data\" as part of a Holodeck program created by Geordi LaForge that brought Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's <em>Sherlock Holmes</em> stories to life.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-lower-decks-makes-tng-theme-song-canon/\">Star Trek: Lower Decks Makes A Popular Theme Song Canon</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Star-Trek-TNG-Moriarty.jpg\"/></figure><p>Professor Moriarty was, of course, included as Holmes' nemesis. But even though he was a computer program, he eventually gained sentience to maliciously attack the crew of the Enterprise. His only wish was to exist outside of the Holodeck's programming and while he didn't accomplish his goal the first time around, he made a second attempt when he returned in the Season 6 episode \"Ship in a Bottle.\"</p><p>Boimler dropping a mention of Moriarty is yet another deep cut in the iconic lore of <em>Star Trek: The Next Generation</em>, and continues to show <em>Lower Decks</em> can homage any episode of the series without missing a beat.</p><p><em>Star Trek: Lower Decks stars Tawny Newsome as Ensign Beckett Mariner, Eugene Cordero as Ensign Rutherford, Jack Quaid as Ensign Brad Boimler, Noël Wells as Ensign Tendi, Dawnn Lewis as Captain Carol Freeman, Jerry O'Connell as Commander Jack Ransom, Gillian Vigman as Doctor T'Ana and Fred Tatasciore as Lieutenant Shaxs. The show premiered on CBS All Access on Aug. 6.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/star-trek-lower-decks-teases-romance-mariner-ransom/\">Star Trek: Lower Decks Teases a Major Love Story Between Mariner and [SPOILER]</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Riverdale Star's Side Job as an Undercover Sex Trafficking Agent Getting TV Adaptation","link":"https://www.cbr.com/riverdale-marisol-nichols-undercover-sex-trafficking-agent-tv-adaptation/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marisol-Nichols-Header.jpg\"/></figure><p>Marisol Nichols', who portrays Hermione Lodge on The CW's <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/riverdale-casting-new-girlfriend-husband/\">Riverdale</a></em>, side gig as an undercover sex trafficking agent is getting the small-screen adaptation.</p><p>Nichols' role with the FBI, Operation Underground Railroad (a nonprofit which assists governments around the world in the rescue of human trafficking and sex trafficking victims, especially children) and local law enforcement was revealed in the May issue of <em>Marie Claire. </em>For the past six years, she has been assisting the agency hunt down child sex predators, serving as \"bait\" for domestic and international sting operations. In some instances, she plays the part of a parent pimping out a child. In others, she plays the child herself.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/riverdale-season-5-casting-pop-tate-granddaughter/\">REPORT: Riverdale Season 5 Casting Introduces [SPOILER]'s Granddaughter</a></span></p><p>Sony Pictures Television is developing the series with Nichols attached as an executive producer. While no one is currently attached to star, Nichols is likely to take on the lead role in the series.</p><p><em>Riverdale</em> stars KJ Apa, Lili Reinhart, Camila Mendes, Cole Sprouse, Madelaine Petsch, Casey Cott, Vanessa Morgan, Mark Consuelos, Skeet Ulrich, Marisol Nichols and Madchen Amick. The series returns for Season 5 in January 2021 on The CW.</p><p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/08/marisol-nichols-undercover-sex-trafficking-agent-sony-1203027844/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a></em>)</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/riverdale-casting-new-girlfriend-husband/\">Riverdale Casting Reveals a New Girlfriend for One Character, Husband for Another</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 23:34:57 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marisol-Nichols-Header.jpg","linkMd5":"8fd954a15cbdb41bee1f07e76ab952c3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn46@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-707_b1750a1fae8b6cc1.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":41850,"destBytes":41850,"author":"Samuel Gelman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Marisol-Nichols-Header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn46@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-707_b1750a1fae8b6cc1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: 10 Worst Episodes According To IMDb","link":"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-worst-episodes-ranked-by-imdb/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-Team.jpg\"/></figure><p>When it comes to the original run of the <em>Power Rangers</em> franchise, there's a certain amount of nostalgia that makes fans look back on even the worst of the show with a smile. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/mighty-morphin-power-rangers/\"><em>Mighty Morphin Power Rangers</em></a> is an incredibly beloved part of the franchise, kicking off the series in 1993 and running for three seasons - longer than any other <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/power-rangers/\">Power Rangers</a></em> series that comes after it.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-character-based-zodiac-sign/\">Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Which Character Are You Based On Your Zodiac Sign?</a></span></p><p>Despite how much fans adore it, we can't deny that some of the episodes aren't nearly as great as we might remember. With <a href=\"https://www.imdb.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Internet Movie Database</a> allowing fans to rate the episodes on a scale of one (the worst) to ten (the best), these are the episodes that rank the worst.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>S2E49 Storybook Rangers Part II (5.7)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E49-Storybook-Rangers-Part-II.jpg' /></figure><p>This episode concludes the story of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-pink-ranger-kimberly-questions/\">Kimberly</a>, Tommy, and Rocky being trapped in a book while the rest of the team fights monsters in the outside world.</p><p>To be fair, this is a pretty standard episode as far as plot goes. The trouble is that some of the editing to blend <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-differences-american-original-japanese-show/\">the Japanese footage</a> with the American footage is so poorly completed that it's obvious the show has been spliced together. There are characters from the Japanese footage that appear in shots who never actually have a part to play in the American series, making for a really disjointed episode.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>S2E39 Rangers Back In Time Part I (5.7)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E39-Rangers-Back-In-Time-Part-I.jpg' /></figure><p>Lord Zedd finds a little inspiration from a class assignment of the teens in the Power Rangers.
