Using the Rock Of Time, he de-ages the planet by about 10 years when the teens reminisce about their childhoods.</p><p>The Power Rangers as children becomes a much bigger storyline a year later, but the events of this episode don't entirely line up with those. This time around, the kids have no memory of their teen years at all, which makes the episode a little less interesting for fans.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>S2E33 Lights, Camera, Action (5.6)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E33-Lights-Camera-Action.jpg' /></figure><p>Does any television fan actually like a clip show? It's a rare show that can do a successful episode that does little more than recap the events of the series. (<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-the-10-best-ember-island-players-gags/\"><em>Avatar: The Last Airbender</em></a> might be the only one, but it wasn't strictly a clip show.)</p><p>The Power Rangers have their first live television interview on a talk show. Both jealous and inspired, Lord Zedd turns a camera into a monster for them to battle, but the bulk of the episode just features recycled footage that the audience has already seen.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>S1E27 Wheel Of Misfortune (5.6)</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S1E27-Wheel-Of-Misfortune.jpg' /></figure><p>The only season one episode to make the worst episodes, this one happens to have a particular focus on the Pink Ranger. While most of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-best-pink-ranger-episodes-imdb-mmpr/\">Kimberly's episodes</a> are usually about her friendship with other Rangers, this one was about her family's antique spinning wheel.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rita-repulsa-fan-art/\">Ten Rita Repulsa Fan Art Pictures That Won't Give You A Headache</a></span></p><p>When Rita Repulsa turns the wheel into a monster, Kimberly is despondent. Not only do they not have it for the school play, but she has to explain the loss to her family. Of course, the Power Rangers defeat the monster and get it back, but Bulk ruins the play, so it's all for naught anyway.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>S3E27 Another Brick In The Wall (5.5)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E27-Another-Brick-In-The-Wall.jpg' /></figure><p>This episode marks Katherine's second as an official Power Ranger, and that might be part of the reason fans don't love it. Though Kimberly has a great arc as she leaves the show, the transition is still a bit bumpy.</p><p>Rita targets Kat, wanting to turn her evil again, but she misses her mark and turns a brick into a monster. Kat ends up having to use some science fiction to save most of the team from being trapped in brick while Billy battles the monster alone. For a Kat-centric episode, it tends to put more of the spotlight on Billy.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>S2E48 Storybook Rangers Part I (5.5)</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E48-Storybook-Rangers-Part-I.jpg' /></figure><p>Since the second part of this episode lands amongst the worst, it's not surprising to see this one rank even lower. Even though the second part of the episode is disjointed, this half is liked even less by fans.</p><p>That might be because there are no Power Ranger battles in this episode. Though it doesn't use any footage from the Japanese series, it also doesn't feature any of the Power Rangers morphed at all. It makes for a dull episode as the audience constantly wonders when they're going to use their abilities to save the day. Even though <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-tommy-oliver-unknown-facts/\">Tommy</a>, Kimberly, and Rocky can't morph, they still know how to fight, and they don't even try.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>S3E22 Follow That Cab! (5.3)</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E22-Follow-That-Cab.jpg' /></figure><p>This episode begins the arc that would see Kimberly leave the series, and expands a bit on Katherine's backstory. It doesn't, however, hold interest with fans because a lot of what happens doesn't make sense.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-questions-about-zordon-answered/\">Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: 10 Questions About Zordon, Answered</a></span></p><p>Kimberly plans to talk with a coach who is looking to train a gymnast to take to the Olympics. Unfortunately, her car gets stolen, and she, Bulk, and Skull wind up trapped in the monster that used to be the cab they were using to catch the thief. The idea is that the Power Rangers won't destroy a monster with people trapped inside, but Rita and Zedd's plan makes no sense. Before this episode, monsters always reverted back to their original state as an object or animal once they were defeated - and the people trapped inside always returned safe and sound.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>S3E38 Attack Of The 60' Bulk (5.3)</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E38-Attack-Of-The-60-Foot-Bulk.jpg' /></figure><p>Technically, this episode occurs during <em>Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers</em>. The final stretch of episodes in <em>Mighty Morphin Power Rangers</em> were renamed after the main characters became children that couldn't use their powers and the Alien Rangers of Aquitar came to Earth to help.</p><p>Bulk has always been a bully - and much of the show's comic relief. Here, he becomes an actual monster when he's transformed into Bratboy. Fans like watching Bulk get into trouble, but seeing him become a monster isn't the same kind of fun.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>S3E28 A Chimp In Charge (5.0)</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E28-A-Chimp-In-Charge.jpg' /></figure><p>Another of Kat's early episodes with the team, this one explores her new friendship <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-best-yellow-ranger-episodes-imdb/\">with Aisha</a>. The team pair up to teach a chimpanzee sign language for a school project.</p><p>Their chimpanzee ends up at the center of the episode when she's transformed into a monster. It's a pretty typical episode, but perhaps fans would have enjoyed it more if the monster in question was created from an object instead of an animal.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>S2E36 The Great Bookala Escape (4.3)</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E36-The-Great-Bookala-Escape.jpg' /></figure><p>The lowest rated episode is one in which the team of Power Rangers actually have to save an alien that crashes on Earth. Making friends with Bookala, who looks like a doll in his tiny spacecraft, but grows to full size, the Rangers protect him from Lord Zedd.</p><p>It's a rather standard episode for the series, but fans certainly have a dislike for Rangers trying to save creatures from other planets as the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/power-rangers-in-space-best-worst-episodes-imdb/\">worst episode of <em>Power Rangers In Space</em></a> has a similar plot point.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mighty-morphin-power-rangers-best-episodes-imdb-mmpr/\">Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: 10 Best Episodes According To IMDb</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:00:46 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-Team.jpg","linkMd5":"bc6e5bb1103fd33bb81cd6192a6840bd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn29@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-02-007_1f64357cbe3f04e6.webp","destWidth":1580,"destHeight":790,"sourceBytes":116966,"destBytes":116966,"author":"Amanda Bruce","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-Team.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn29@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-02-007_1f64357cbe3f04e6.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E49-Storybook-Rangers-Part-II.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn52@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-10-095_5435feeb3549765b.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E39-Rangers-Back-In-Time-Part-I.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn61@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-956_ec4943ee944f7731.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E33-Lights-Camera-Action.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn79@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-989_525775964966d443.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S1E27-Wheel-Of-Misfortune.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-381_e90ed641e3847095.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E27-Another-Brick-In-The-Wall.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn77@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-072_395ba25424038950.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E48-Storybook-Rangers-Part-I.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn49@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-07-664_7fe313e51d9ff611.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E22-Follow-That-Cab.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn53@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-12-679_c4093dd00585d36a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E38-Attack-Of-The-60-Foot-Bulk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn27@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-14-181_643d60620cee88be.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S3E28-A-Chimp-In-Charge.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn2@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-05-853_4a0e7bae406b5c0c.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Mighty-Morphin-Power-Rangers-S2E36-The-Great-Bookala-Escape.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn93@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-07-156_ad3874c231f8fd0a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"One Piece: Every Major Villain, Ranked From Least To Most Evil","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-evil-villains-ranked/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/big-mom-crocodile-doflamingo-one-piece.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As the undisputed king of Shonen, </span><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\"><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> prides itself on its quality characters. From the supporting cast to the bad guys’ squad, each and every character was meticulously designed. Describing the series as a cocktail of characters wouldn’t be doing it a disservice as every character posses a certain individuality that is unique to them, and them only.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-best-villains-ranked/\">The 10 Best Villains In One Piece, Ranked</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Having said so, one of the few common grounds that are shared by the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> villains' squad is, of course, evil. A villain without evil is certainly no villain, and luckily for us, the villains of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> possess evil in spades. The cream of the crop of the series' antagonists can range anywhere in the evil spectrum. Some just have great ambitions, and choose evil as a means to fulfill said ambitions. While others genuinely wish chaos to the worldーthese are the baddest of bad guys!</span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Rob Lucci</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Rob-Lucci-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Though he technically wasn’t the commander of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-enies-lobby-villains-ranked/\">the CP9</a>, Rob Lucci certainly was their big boss. As Luffy’s final hurdle in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-luffys-best-fight-saga-ranked/\">the Water 7 saga</a>, that automatically nominates him to the series’ upper brass of villains.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lucci is a government agent who prioritizes orders more than anything. And while he won’t go out of his way to commit evil for his own selfish motives; he would surely do so if he was ordered to. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Gecko Moria</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/h0iw4oFx.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-weakest-big-name-pirates/\">Moria</a> often gets severely underrated by the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> fandom-- which is very justified. On his own, he might be a solid villain; but if compared with his counterparts, he would easily get the shorter end of the stick.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nonetheless, his incompetence doesn’t make Moria any less evil. As far as we are concerned, Moria doesn’t go out and actively hunt for shadows. Though he doesn’t mind robbing any unlucky visitor of their shadow were they to set foot in his territory. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Arlong</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-Arlong-Chew-Kuroobi-Edited.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Arlong has always been a ball of flaming hate since his youth; he was just contained by Jinbe and Fisher Tiger. However, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-most-shocking-deaths-ranked/\">the tragic demise of the latter</a> was the final straw that led Arlong to aggressively embrace the dark side.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Arlong was the biggest fish of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/anime-one-piece-east-blue-villains-best/\">East Blue</a>; has the Straw Hats not put an early end to his plans, he would’ve proceeded to terrorize the entirety of the Blue.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Sakazuki/Akainu</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Akainu.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Under the pretense of justice, Sakazuki committed multiple heinous crimes that even pirates would shy away from. Some of these crimes include but not limited to: him sinking a ship of innocent Ohara refugees and killing his own comrades due to their ‘incompetence’.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-worst-things-akainu/\">One Piece: The 10 Worst Things Akainu Did, Ranked</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In all likelihood, Sakazuki wouldn’t mind getting rid of two civilians in trade for one pirate's life. That alone speaks volumes of his camouflaged evil. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Enel</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Enel-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As evil as Sakazuki is, his hands are pretty much tied. He wouldn’t be able to practice his extreme justice, a.k.a evil, with the presence of senior Marine officers such as Garp and Sengoku.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Enel, however, had all the space to commit whatever crime he sees fit, he is a god after all-- or so he is convinced. He planned to destroy Skypiea alongside its thousands of residents, a testimony of his wickedness. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Crocodile</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Crocodile-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Crocodile was one of the first villains to remind us of the brutality of the world of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece. </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">H</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">e was willing to starve thousands of civilians while simultaneously using them in order to fulfill his selfish ambitions.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-top-villains-need-comeback/\">One Piece: Top 10 Villains That Need A Comeback</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Everything about him screamed evil; he had zero regards for life, even for that of his closest subordinates. He would readily sacrifice everyone for the sake of his grand plan.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Kaido</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/kaido-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Due to how nonchalant and uninterested he usually appears, Kaido can easily be mistaken for being tame. While in reality, Kaido is easily one of the most chaotic individuals in the series. He has no interest in One Piece and certainly couldn’t care less about ruling the seas.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">His grand plan features him and his ever-growing army fighting it out with the Marines in a great <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-better-marineford/\">never-before-seen war</a>. Why? Because, according to the Yonko, the world is too ‘mundane’.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Blackbeard</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gATcjbrW.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When even other pirates call you vile, you know you have it going on. Blackbeard has proven to stoop to the lowest levels in order to further advance his ambitions. No moral shackles can keep this man from embracing grandiose dreams!</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Backstabbing, murder, theft… you name it. Nothing is too extreme for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-strongest-pirates-under-blackbeard/\">Blackbeard and his gang of similarly evil goons</a>.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Big Mom</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/big-mom-using-fruit-in-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You wouldn’t even think that in spite of all the colors surrounding Big Mom, she would have one of the darkest hearts in the series. Like Blackbeard, Big Mom will shy away from no actions if it meant she’d eventually get that sweet, sweet One Piece.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Using her children-or rather, tools- murder, and betrayal are just the tip of the iceberg. Just her messed up Totto Land is enough to garner her a mention. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Doflamingo</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Doflamingo-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Arguably the evilest man in the entirety of </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One Piece.</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> This Heavenly Demon is involved in plenty of questionable and inhumane businesses. Slave trade, manipulating, blackmailing..etc; Doflamingo has done it all.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But what truly highlights Doflamingo’s evil are the aspirations he is vying for-- not world domination, but world destruction. He seeks to destroy the world and every known civilization-- the purest kind of malice.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single next-single\" style=\"font-weight: 400;\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/doflamingo-one-piece-flamboyant-character-fiercest-foe/\">Doflamingo: Why One Piece's Flamboyant Character Is Anime's Fiercest Foe</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:00:27 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/big-mom-crocodile-doflamingo-one-piece.jpg","linkMd5":"19efbf62925cbdb792b9849eedd8971a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn85@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-01-813_69d77ff86e3c8be4.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":102490,"destBytes":102490,"author":"Suliman Omar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/big-mom-crocodile-doflamingo-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn85@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-01-813_69d77ff86e3c8be4.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Rob-Lucci-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn33@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-12-420_fa4eae5f5312c7bd.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/h0iw4oFx.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn89@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-05-945_6dd263313577010e.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-Arlong-Chew-Kuroobi-Edited.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn38@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-05-919_9853637149e81258.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Akainu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn90@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-12-944_f5854f6a3c99fe6e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Enel-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn17@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-11-635_cad0a686a48a5651.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Crocodile-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn96@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-17-272_a8007432f4688e5e.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/kaido-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn57@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-343_c74972be60175b26.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/gATcjbrW.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/big-mom-using-fruit-in-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn58@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-845_f0747134b72bc28e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Doflamingo-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn53@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-13-376_664f0862b3b38c95.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"One Piece: Every Arc In The Four Emperors Saga, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-four-emperors-saga-arcs-ranked/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Best-Arcs-Four-Emperors-Saga.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/one-piece/\">One Piece</a></em> has been running for a long time now. It spans over 900 episodes. Many people have a problem with the huge number of episodes, but you start watching, it is difficult to stop. The Four Emperors Saga is the ninth saga of the series.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-fan-favorite-villains-myanimelist/\">One Piece: Top 10 Fan-Favorite Villains, According To MyAnimeList</a></span></p><p>The saga is still ongoing and it will continue for quite some time. There are four arcs in the saga so far; the most recent arc in the saga is Wano. All the arcs in the saga are extraordinary and very well-written. Here all the arcs in the Four Emperors Saga ranked.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>ZOU ARC</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/zou-in-one-piece.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Zou arc is the first arc in the Four Emperors Saga. It starts after <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-devil-fruit-abilities-counter-luffy-handle/\">Luffy and co. take down Doflamingo</a> and go to Zou to reunite with the rest of the crew. But, the crew was in for a surprise when they arrived on Zou. Sanji had left the crew! He left the crew for the sake of the safety of the crew. He was left with no choice but to go willingly with Capone Bege. Luffy was surprised to find out about Sanji leaving the crew without any reason. A lot of characters were introduced in the arc; some of them would go on to play a very important role in the future. The arc featured the creation of a new alliance— Ninja-Pirate-Mink-Samurai Alliance, that would take down Kaido. The Straw Hats also found out about the existence of a Road Poneglyph. The fans were expecting that the crew would be united once again, however, it wasn't the case. The Straw Hats split up once again. Luffy, Nami, Chopper, Brook left for Whole Cake Island- the territory of Big Mom. They were accompanied by Carrot.</span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>LEVELY</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Imu-One-Piece-1.jpg' /></figure><p>The Levely arc was terse in comparison to Whole Cake Island. It focused on the events after the conclusion of the Whole Cake Island arc. This arc was filled with surprises. First, Luffy's new bounty was revealed, which was 1,500,000,000 beris. Secondly, the whereabouts of the Revolutionary Army were revealed. They had managed to leave Baltigo unscathed. Thirdly, the Revolutionary Army declared war on the World Nobles. Finally, there was the appearance of Im, a mysterious figure to whom even the World Nobles bow down. The arc was fast-paced and there was a lot of stuff of happening throughout. Also, it is impossible to ignore the appearance of Shanks at Mary Geoise and talking to the Five Elders. The arc showed that the world was going to be changed soon.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>WHOLE CAKE ISLAND</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Whole-Cake-Island-Arc.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The main focus of the arc was <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-sanji-vs-devil-fruit-abilities/\">Sanji</a>. Luffy and co. went to the territory of Big Mom to bring back Sanji. It wasn't going to be an easy task by any means. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-luffys-best-fight-saga-ranked/\">The arc featured the best fight</a> in <em>One Piece</em> to date. Several mysteries were unraveled. The fans found out that Sanji is actually related to the notorious Germa 66. The arc has been subject of severe criticism mainly because there weren't as many fights as the fans would have liked. But, the main purpose of the arc was to focus on Sanji as a character and how far he had come. He was labeled as a failure by his own father. He was ostracized by his own family; only his mother cared for him.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-legendary-fights-story-who-won/\">One Piece: 5 Legendary Fights In The Story (&#38; Who Won)</a></span></p><p>Sanji was saved by Reiju who freed him from his cell. After a chain of events, Sanji ended up on Zeff's ship. Sanji considered Zeff his father, and Big Mom threatened to kill Zeff and all the cooks at Baratie. There was also a looming threat over his crew. Sanji chose to sacrifice himself in order to save everyone else. He was betrayed by Pudding as well, who was supposed to be the shining light in his dark time. The arc featured an unsuccessful attempt at assassinating Big Mom. We also got to see her backstory.</p><p>Towards the end of the arc, we saw Luffy beating Katakuri. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-big-mom-ways-won/\">Big Mom was rampaging</a> and she wouldn't stop until she had eliminated every Straw Hat. There was only one way to stop her and that was to bake her a magnificent wedding cake. This was <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-sanjis-best-fight-from-every-saga-ranked/\">Sanji's biggest challenge to date</a>, but he stepped up and made a marvelous cake, which stopped Big Mom and saved the Straw Hats from total annihilation. Also, who can forget Luffy ordering Jinbe to come to Wano and join up with the rest of the crew. The arc was unpredictable and fun. It showed that it was futile to try and predict what Oda was up to.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>WANO</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-5-Things-That-Show-Wano-Is-Already-The-Best-Arc-5-Things-It-Needs-To-Do-Better-featured-image.jpg' /></figure><p>Wano is undoubtedly the best arc after the time-skip. It is going to be a long arc for sure. The first two acts are over; the third act is currently going on. The main antagonist of this arc is none other Kaido, one of the four Yonko. Luffy and Law formed an alliance all the way back at Punk Hazard <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-luffy-proved-pirate-king-material-fell-short/\">to take down Kaido</a>; now they have a chance to take him down. The arc is far from finished. So far the arc has been breathtaking. The fans found out the bounties of the current Yonko, Whitebeard and Gol D. Roger. The incident involving Rocks was also revealed. Also, the introduction of Kozuki Oden left the fans stunned. His backstory added more spice to the arc. The culmination of the Wano arc is expected to rival that of Marineford. It <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-wano-best-arc-improve/\">has certainly got the potential to become the best arc in the series to date</a>. There will be a lot riding on Oda's shoulders, and hopefully he will deliver.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/one-piece-devil-fruits-underrated/\">One Piece: 10 Devil Fruits That Are Insanely Underrated</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:30:32 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Best-Arcs-Four-Emperors-Saga.jpg","linkMd5":"c5905ce9b559a1367b891f718f3fe8c3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn78@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-097_327975ebaf846cee.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":68968,"destBytes":68968,"author":"Suzail Ahmad","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Featured-Best-Arcs-Four-Emperors-Saga.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn78@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-097_327975ebaf846cee.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/zou-in-one-piece.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn86@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-09-547_bca905f3afc77e97.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Imu-One-Piece-1.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Whole-Cake-Island-Arc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn82@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-13-744_bdb31cc238dbffa3.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/One-Piece-5-Things-That-Show-Wano-Is-Already-The-Best-Arc-5-Things-It-Needs-To-Do-Better-featured-image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn50@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-08-396_90df0f45903496f7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Arnold Schwarzenegger to Star in Untitled Spy Series | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/arnold-schwarzenegger-star-spy-series/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/terminator-dark-fate-schwarzenegger.jpg\"/></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/Arnold-Schwarzenegger/\">Arnold Schwarzenegger</a> will star in and executive produce an untitled spy series that is expected to premiere on a streaming service.</p><p>Created by <em>Scorpion</em> creator Nick Santora, the hourlong series is being developed by Skydance Television and will follow the adventures of a global spy (Schwarzenegger) and his daughter. The series is expected to be shopped around shortly and casting is underway for the role of the daughter. Santora will executive produce alongside David Ellison, Dana Goldberg and Bill Bost.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dolph-lundgren-arnold-schwarzenegger-happy-birthday-story/\">Dolph Lundgren Wishes Arnold Schwarzenegger Happy Birthday With Hilarious Story</a></span></p><p>The action drama will be Schwarzenegger's first major venture into scripted television after a one-season role on the unscripted <em>The </em><i>Celebrity Apprentice. </i>On the big screen<i>, </i>he is best known for his role in the <em>Terminator </em>franchise as The Terminator / Guardian and as Trench in <em>The Expendables</em>. He also appeared in <em>Predator, Total Recall, Conan the Barbarian </em>and <em>Batman &#38; Robin </em>and famously served as the governor of California from 2003 to 2011.</p><p>Santora currently serves as the showrunner on Amazon Video's <em>Jack</em> <em>Reacher</em>, which received a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jack-reacher-series-ordered-amazon/\">series order</a> this past January,<em> </em>and has also worked on <em>Prison Break, The Sopranos, Law &#38; Order, The Guardian</em> and <em>Lie to Me. </em></p><p>(Via <em><a href=\"https://deadline.com/2020/08/arnold-schwarzenegger-star-ep-global-spy-adventure-series-skydance-tv-nick-santora-streaming-1203027271/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Deadline</a></em>.)</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/30-years-of-total-recall-the-smartest-stupid-movie/\">30 Years of Total Recall, the Smartest Stupid Movie</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 21:56:39 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/terminator-dark-fate-schwarzenegger.jpg","linkMd5":"c49fcca715d88cbc4d4f289e6e107731","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-619_f3fba8b0f8fc0d39.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":114608,"destBytes":114608,"author":"Samuel Gelman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/terminator-dark-fate-schwarzenegger.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-619_f3fba8b0f8fc0d39.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Dark Souls Anatomy: Why Fire Keepers Cover Their Bodies | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dark-souls-anatomy-fire-keepers/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dark-souls-fire-keeper.jpg\"/></figure><p>FromSoftware titles tend to be dark and depressing, in both obvious and subtle ways. The paradigm example of this theme is the <em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dark-souls\">Dark Souls</a></em> series, which features humanity as both a game mechanic and an item. For the Fire Keepers, who serve as bonfire guardians, humanity is intimately tied with suffering, disability and physical deformity: It visibly writhes beneath their skin.</p><p>Players start <em>Dark Souls</em> as Undead Hollow creatures, but gaining humanity allows them to reborn in human form. Humanity also provides players with useful combat buffs.</p><p>On the other hand, Fire Keepers' humanity and its appearance is described through in-game text, rather than seen in the character models themselves. Most Fire Keepers cover their bodies to hide the way their deformities. In addition to the way their humanity appears, all known Fire Keepers in <em>Dark Souls</em> are women with disabilities, which adds a rather ableist bent to the way they appear in-game.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/dark-souls-challenge-runs/\">Dark Souls: Five Challenge Runs to Keep You From Going Hollow</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dark-souls-bonfire.jpg\"/></figure><p><span class=\"related-single\">The Darkmoon Knightess, a new Fire Keeper, comes back as an Undead Hollow, much like the player character. The only difference is, she's unable to return to human form because she doesn't have enough humanity to do so. This is indicated by in-game descriptions, which note the Brass Armor worn by the Knightess \"hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.\" </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Another Fire Keeper is Anastacia of Astora, also known as the Ash Maiden. Anastacia is found locked away in a prison, with players unsure if she was put in there for some crime she committed, or if she locked herself away. Most likely, she's been locked away because of her disability and appearance. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Like the Darkmoon Knightess, Anastacia is found with her entire body covered except for her hands and face. The description of the Dingy Set she wears notes it was once a white robe, left blackened and dirty from years of use around bonfires. This could mean that over time, she has gathered enough humanity that her body is starting to heal and change into human form once more.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Related: <a href=\"http://cbr.com/dark-souls-iii-find-hollowslayer-greatsword/\">Dark Souls III: How to Find the Game's Best Greatsword</a></span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">Fair Lady, one of the Daughters of Chaos, acts as the final Fire Keeper players will meet in <em>Dark Souls.</em> As part of her lore, Fair Lady’s mother and sisters attempted to create their own first flame, only to create a flame of chaos that turned them into spider-like abominations similar to Jorogumo or Arachne. </span><span class=\"related-single\">Unlike the other Fire Keepers, Fair Lady wears no clothing. When players find her, it is clear that the Fair Lady is dying. Giving her humanity seems to ease her pain.</span></p><p>It seems that each one of these Fire Keepers must have died and come back as either Hollow or Abominations. In-game descriptions explain, “Each Fire Keeper is a corporeal manifestation of her bonfire, and a draw for the humanity which is offered to her. Her soul is gnawed by infinite humanity… below just a thin layer of skin, are swarms of humanity that writhe and squirm.”</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">It's not entirely clear if giving humanity to these NPCs is overall helpful or harmful to them. Like much of the <em>Dark Souls</em> lore, this is largely left up to player interpretation. </span>One could argue that humanity, in a way, merely hides the darkness within many characters of the game world, revealing itself as the Age of Fire slowly comes to an end.</p><p>This could help explain why many NPCs found in the <em>Dark Souls</em> series are among the most difficult enemies to face. It could also mean humanity is a rare commodity in this world of encroaching darkness, and acts as the only thing keeping these Fire Keepers alive.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">Keep Reading: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dark-souls-anatomy-aldrich-devourer-gods/\">Dark Souls Anatomy: Aldrich, Devourer of the Gods, Is More Than A Goo Puddle</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 23:15:54 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dark-souls-fire-keeper.jpg","linkMd5":"e1c5384ef08d343debe918e00ff1b124","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn49@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-709_7c0ce27c9996e88e.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":148506,"destBytes":148506,"author":"Robert Koumarelas","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dark-souls-fire-keeper.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn49@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-00-709_7c0ce27c9996e88e.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/dark-souls-bonfire.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn23@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-14-959_16423873b8382210.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700504},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Artist Bou bou Honors Chadwick Boseman With a Mind-Blowing Painting","link":"https://www.cbr.com/artist-honors-chadwick-boseman-mind-blowing-painting/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-panther-1-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>In the wake of <em>Black Panther </em>actor <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\">Chadwick Boseman</a>'s tragic passing, one fan has crafted a wonderful mural of his likeness using the most unique of paintbrushes: flowers.</p><p>Twitter artist 'Bou bou design' released a one minute video where he approaches a plate of black paint before dipping roses into them and splashing the \"brushes\" on a nearby grey canvas. He then paints what appears to be random black lines with a few splashes of white in the upper left corner until the 40-second mark, where he turns the canvas upside down to reveal a heavily detailed mural of Boseman's face. Bou bou then honors the mural with a Wakandan salute to the tune of <em>Black Panther'</em>s \"Wakanda\" score by Ludwig Göransson before walking off camera.</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/boubou_design/status/1299729913726021632\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-chadwick-boseman-tribute-video/\">Marvel Shares Chadwick Boseman Tribute Video: \"You Will Always Be Our King''</a></span></p><p>Boseman's death on August 28 shocked the entertainment world and public, both for dying so young at 43 years old and the revelation that he had been battling stage IV colon cancer for so long. The actor was diagnosed with a stage III version in 2016 yet kept the information private as he continued to star in major blockbusters, coincidentally debuting that year as T'Challa in <em>Captain America: Civil War. </em>Boseman would reprise the role for <em>Black Panther</em>, <em>Avengers: Infinity War </em>and <em>Avengers: Endgame, </em>transforming him into a larger-than-life superhero icon.</p><p>Since his passing, tributes to Boseman have come from a variety of sources, ranging from fellow <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-mourned-by-his-mcu-co-stars/\">MCU and <em>Black Panther </em>costars</a> to public figures like Oprah Winfrey and former <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/barack-michelle-obama-chadwick-bosemans-heroism/\">President Barack Obama</a>. <em>Black Panther </em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-director-ryan-coogler-shares-tribute-chadwick-boseman/\">director Ryan Coogler</a> also released a statement revealing how Boseman created many of T'Challa's features.</p><p>Boseman's last movie role released before his passing was \"Stormin\" Norman in Spike Lee's <em>Da 5 Bloods</em>. His final live-action performance will be in the upcoming Netflix adaptation of <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em>.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-danai-gurira-chadwick-boseman-tribute/\">Black Panther's Danai Gurira Pays Touching Tribute to Chadwick Boseman</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:46:21 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-panther-1-1.jpg","linkMd5":"84d2322c0e9b3026432054d838d8540e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn85@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-150_1685bf2906bc971a.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":29750,"destBytes":29750,"author":"Ben Wasserman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/black-panther-1-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn85@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-150_1685bf2906bc971a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Avengers: 10 Best Line-Ups, Ranked | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-best-teams-ranked-mcu-uncanny-secret-wars-marvel/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Avengers-Feature-Image.jpg\"/></figure><p>The <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers/\">Avengers</a> were once the greatest superhero team in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel/\">Marvel Comics</a>, then supplanted by the X-Men in the 80s and 90s. Today, the Avengers are arguably the greatest team in the entire medium, thanks to their astronomical success at the box office as the foundation of the MCU. Everybody can probably name an Avenger at this point, but it's probably a bigger ask to identify which line-up was the best in their storied run.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-avengers-quinjet-trivia/\">Avengers: 10 Things Fans Should Know About The Quinjet</a></span></p><p>Many characters across the Marvel Universe have been Avengers at one point or another, leading to some amazing line-ups through the years. Here are the ten best Avengers line-ups, ranked.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Post-Secret Wars</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Avengers-80s-Line-Up.jpeg' /></figure><p>The original <em>Secret Wars</em> event had <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-new-costume-secret-wars-venom-symbiote/\">long-lasting and dramatic effects</a> on the Marvel Universe in the 80s, and that was reflected in the Avengers line-up in the aftermath of the event.</p><p>The line-up is actually not too different than today - it features both a Hulk and a Captain Marvel, they're just different versions. But this line-up featured the great Walt Simonson era Thor, and the Monica Rambeau Captain Marvel, who eventually became the team's leader during the epic five-year run by writer Roger Stern.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>All-New, All-Different</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/All-New-All-Different-Avengers.jpg' /></figure><p>A more recent era of the team consisted again of mostly the same characters, but different versions of them. In addition to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/ms-marvel-kamala-khan-best-power-displays/\">Ms. Marvel</a>, AKA Kamala Khan, this dynamic roster featured a Spider-Man (Miles Morales), a Captain America (Sam Wilson), and a Thor (Jane Foster).</p><p>While the huge amount of change might have been too much for some, all of these characters have made lasting impacts on fans, evidenced in their recent and future migration into television series and movies within the greater MCU, like <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/thor-4-jane-foster-rebuild-valkyries-mcu/\">Jane Foster into <em>Thor: Love and Thunder</em></a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Modern Line-Up</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/empyre-avengers-header.jpg' /></figure><p>The current line-up, currently duking it out against the invading Cotati in the massive <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/empyre-young-avengers-hulking-important-facts/\"><em>Empyre</em> crossover event</a>, is one of the most dynamic and powerful Avengers rosters ever.</p><p>This roster includes one of the most cosmically powerful versions of Thor, the Carol Danvers Captain Marvel, and Black Panther. Despite their power, they've suffered some major defeats so far in the event. Both Black Panther and She-Hulk appear to have suffered grim fates, while Carol Danvers is getting <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/captain-marvel-cosmic-avengers-power/\">a little too accusatory</a> with that new hammer of hers.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Heroes Return</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Heroes-Return-Avengers-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><em>Heroes Reborn</em> was not the finest hour of the Avengers. Marvel shuffled the Avengers off to a pocket universe, rebooted by Jim Lee and Rob Liefeld in a desperate attempt to revitalize the flagging title and stop the bleeding of the collapsing speculator market in the mid-90s. The experiment was a failure, but it led to a rousing return, and one of the team's most compelling line-ups.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-united-they-stand-makes-no-sense/\">10 Things That Make No Sense About Avengers: United They Stand</a></span></p><p>Writer Kurt Busiek and artist George Perez brought the team back in style, and added some new members, like Firestar. It wasn't all perfect though. This line-up did include <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-avengers-members-never-died/\">Silverclaw</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Kree-Skull War</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/kree-skrull-war.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most epic Marvel stories ever features one of the Avengers' most amazing rosters. The team fought to save the galaxy from descending into all-out war with such heavy hitters as the Vision, Goliath, and the original Captain Marvel, Mar-Vell.</p><p>If that wasn't enough, they also had Quicksilver and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/scarlet-witch-dc-heroes-great-battles-superman-zatanna-green-lantern/\">Scarlet Witch</a> on their side. Many of these characters, like Vision and Scarlet Witch, were strongly associated with the team in the Bronze Age, but this is the only version of the team that included Mar-Vell as a member.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>West Coast Avengers</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/west-coast-avengers.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/worst-things-the-vision-has-ever-done/\">The Vision</a> and Scarlet Witch also formed the core of an 80s off-shoot of the classic team, the West Coast Avengers. The team formed out of Vision's ambition to see the team have a greater influence in the world, and consequently was one of the first proliferations of a Marvel team squad, something that is common today.</p><p>This amazing line-up included Hawkeye, Wonder Man, Tigra, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-moon-knight-worst-deeds/\">Moon Knight</a>, Mockingbird, and War Machine. All but a few of these characters have made into the MCU so far, in the films or television series.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Uncanny Avengers</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/HAVOK-Uncanny-Avengers.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the absolute best Avengers rosters of all-time stems from one of its darkest moments. In the aftermath of <em>Avengers vs. X-Men</em>, which saw the two teams clash violently over the fate of mutantkind, Captain America sought to present a mutant-friendly line-up to the world.</p><p>This roster included some of the heaviest hitters in the entire Marvel Universe, including Wolverine, Scarlet Witch, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-rogue-best-worst-costumes/\">Rogue</a>. Rogue and Scarlet Witch hash out the lingering bitterness over <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-house-m-timeline-facts/\"><em>House of M</em></a>, but the team's unity gave fans a real thrill.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Original Team</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Original-Avengers.jpg' /></figure><p>First loves are often the best, and the original Avengers set the bar very high. Though the entire team as fans tend to think of it today didn't come together completely until issue four, when Captain America emerged out of the ice after several decades, this is the classic roster of the Silver Age.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/original-uncanny-avengers-lineup-ranked/\">All Members Of The Original Uncanny Avengers Lineup, Ranked by Power</a></span></p><p>Cap, Thor, Iron Man, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-hulk-overrated-avenger-underrated/\">Hulk</a> (for a minute), Wasp and Ant-Man created one of the most exciting rosters for readers in the 1960s and provided the template for the cinematic line-up fifty years later.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>New Avengers</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/new-avengers-press-conference.jpg' /></figure><p>As great as that original line-up was, one thing fans imagined throughout the decades that followed was a line-up that included some of Marvel's other mightiest heroes.</p><p>But it took until the early 2000s and the amazing New Avengers run of the book for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-peter-parker-marvel-comics-confusing-explained/\">Spider-Man</a> and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/reasons-why-wolverine-does-doesnt-need-mcu-debut-marvel/\">Wolverine</a> to finally join the Avengers in an official capacity. Brian Michael Bendis produced one of the most powerful rosters ever - including the insanely powerful Sentry - and one of the most popular for longtime and new readers of the comic book.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>MCU Avengers</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/founding-avengers-mcu.jpg' /></figure><p>While the MCU roster of the Avengers is an evolving thing just like the comics, the initial roster features what is arguably its best line-up. The classic members of Thor, Captain America, Hulk, and Iron Man are there, and the addition of Hawkeye - a later member, and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-widow-facts-trivia-marvel/\">Black Widow</a>, not one until the late 80s and early 90s - gave it the diversity and punch it needed for the big screen.</p><p>While some fans certainly missed Ant-Man and the Wasp, their eventual inclusion - along with everyone else in the MCU - proved the best thing about the Avengers line-up is that it's always growing and changing.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-thor-quotes-from-movies-mcu/\">15 Best Thor Quotes (From The Movies)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:30:44 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Avengers-Feature-Image.jpg","linkMd5":"7708866ba1cd3778a317f9ad22aa9dcc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-771_cbc690ea8ace595d.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":478415,"destBytes":441420,"author":"Darby Harn","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Avengers-Feature-Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-771_cbc690ea8ace595d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Avengers-80s-Line-Up.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn78@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-05-916_bc7a30a6dfeb33f1.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/All-New-All-Different-Avengers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn92@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-341_3aaa9bd8f5962e79.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/empyre-avengers-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn48@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-194_d8ffb2e86564c5bf.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Heroes-Return-Avengers-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn1@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-251_66af014832b53a27.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/kree-skrull-war.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-17-167_b54d747d0903120a.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/10/west-coast-avengers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn25@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-11-906_157747d31733f050.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/HAVOK-Uncanny-Avengers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn23@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-15-761_c42f4dc41fb079cc.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Original-Avengers.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn46@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-12-525_649db895d4331be7.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/new-avengers-press-conference.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/founding-avengers-mcu.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn98@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-146_231aeb08b29d7ef0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Bill & Ted Face the Music: The Members of the Band, Explained","link":"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-band-members/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-ted-face-the-music-samaraweaving-and-brigettelundy-paine-star-in-billandted-face-the-music-rgb.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bill-and-ted-3/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</a>, now in theaters and on premium video on demand.</strong></em></p><p><em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</em> initially positions Bill (Alex Winter) and Ted (Keanu Reeves) as the rockers who once more have to save the universe. It's prophesied the Wyld Stallyns would reunite one more time and create a special song to stop reality from unraveling, connecting to the end of <em>Bogus Journey</em> in 1991 when it was hinted they'd create world peace.</p><p>However, it's not them to achieve this; it's actually their daughters, Billie (Brigette Lundy-Paine) and Thea (Samara Weaving), who get the job done. They do so by hiring a unique band comprised of musical stars strewn across different eras of time.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-where-the-two-movies-left-most-excellent-duo/\">Bill &#38; Ted: Here's Where the First Two Movies Left the Most Excellent Duo</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-and-ted.jpg\"/></figure><p>The girls see their dads teleport to get the song from their older selves since they know they can't create the tune in time. As musical experts themselves, when the girls meet Rufus' daughter, Kelly, and learn of their fathers' plans, they decide they can help by gathering a super-band throughout history. They jump into another teleporter, and their first stop is in 1967 to get Jimi Hendrix (DazMann Still). However, he brushes them off as crazy fans, which leads to them going after one of Hendrix's idols, Louis Armstrong (Jeremiah Craft) in 1922.</p><p>Armstrong is taken aback by their cell phone footage of Hendrix playing the guitar, so he returns with them, only for Hendrix to think it's a doppelgänger. However, he realizes it's no impersonator when Armstrong gets on his trumpet and works his magic.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-sets-world-record-air-guitar-online/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Sets World Record for Most People Playing Air Guitar Online Simultaneously </a></span></p><p>The team then heads to Austria in 1782 to pluck Mozart out of a rehearsal session that's driving him insane. The pianist doesn't think anyone there's on his level, but when he hears Hendrix's guitar, he begins playing keys to match. As soon as the ensemble ends, he ditches his people and goes outside to meet up with the time-travelers.</p><p>The journey's not done, as they jump to 2600 BCE China where Ling Lun (Sharon Lee) is playing the flute in her garden. The language barrier is tough to break down, so Mozart uses the flute himself. Through the communicative power of music, these notes get her to join the party.</p><p>The final piece of the puzzle comes when Lun recommends they head to 11500 BCE North Africa for the drummer Grom (Patty Anne Miller), who's a cavewoman using giant bones as drumsticks. She runs away when she sees Mozart; however, while the film doesn't show how they end up recruiting her, they all arrive in present day San Dimas to start composing the song.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-music-interview-ed-solomon-chris-matheson/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music's Ed Solomon &#38; Chris Matheson Break Down the Long-Awaited Sequel</a></span></p><p>It's a bit of a roundabout as they get killed and sent to Hell by <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-music-dennis-caleb-mccoy/\">Dennis, the killer robot</a>, only for Bill and Ted to rescue them. When it's time to get the job done, Bill and Ted realize it's not them who've assembled the song; it's their daughters.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-ted-face-the-music-review-m5f1.1200.jpg\"/></figure><p>It takes some patience, but with four minutes left until the apocalypse on the LA highway, they get Gorm to use drumsticks, Death to play the bass and Mozart to provide the melodic tune. Soon the rest of the band gets in sync, and with Kid Cudi and Ted's dad helping out, they create the song that saves reality. Bill and Ted use the phone booth and travel through various timelines to give everyone else instruments, and they all become part of the song. In the end, fans get the most excellent of bands and true unity that transcends history.</p><p><em>Directed by Dean Parisot and written by Chris Matheson and Ed Solomon, Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music stars Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, Anthony Carrigan, Kid Cudi, Brigette Lundy-Paine and Samara Weaving. The film is now in theaters and on premium video on demand.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-other-selves/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music: All the Other Selves the Duo Meets</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 15:45:59 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-ted-face-the-music-samaraweaving-and-brigettelundy-paine-star-in-billandted-face-the-music-rgb.jpg","linkMd5":"016b70b6ce715b7f4fb5c139998d5e03","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn2@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-636_d7c880cba72e2fae.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":111426,"destBytes":111426,"author":"Renaldo Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-ted-face-the-music-samaraweaving-and-brigettelundy-paine-star-in-billandted-face-the-music-rgb.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn2@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-00-636_d7c880cba72e2fae.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-and-ted.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn62@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-12-608_0a4e639906fa0eb8.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-ted-face-the-music-review-m5f1.1200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn73@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-08-632_8da7a26a31a7e8fd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700510},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"She-Hulk VS Spider-Man: Who Would Win? | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-shehulk-spiderman-who-win-fight/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Spider-Man-She-Hulk-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p>In case you haven't heard, the Amazing <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/spider-man/\">Spider-Man</a> does whatever a spider can. Not to be undone, the Sensational <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/she-hulk/\">She-Hulk</a> does <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-she-hulk-better-worse-cousin-hulk/\">whatever a Hulk can</a>. Besides both being Marvel superheroes, the two are friends and have worked together numerous times over the years. Just as the best of friends occasionally argue, superheroes can also occasionally <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/mismatched-unequal-superhero-fights-comics/\">fight each other</a>.</p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-she-hulk-who-wins/\">Wonder Woman Vs. She-Hulk: Who Would Win?</a></span></p><p class=\"article-title\">Why would Spider-Man and She-Hulk fight? Mind control is always a popular cause of superhero fights. Or it can be over little things, like an adjective (Spider-Man apparently <a href=\"https://www.marvel.com/comics/series/722/sensational_spider-man_2006_-_2007\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">needs to be sensational</a> as well). But a Spider-Man vs She-Hulk fight isn't going to go well for Spidey, right? Not so fast! Spider-Man's defeated some very <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spiderman-most-powerful-defeated-enemies/\">heavy hitters</a> over the years, and he may even be the odds on favorite, so here's a look at just who would win.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Strength: She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/She-Hulk.jpg' /></figure><p>Spider-Man has the proportionate strength of a spider, which allows him to lift approximately 10 tons. That's pretty darn impressive! Though he certainly has a lot of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-strongest-villains/\">strong villains</a>, oftentimes Spider-Man is the strongest guy in the fight, especially when he's a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/peter-parker-spider-man-friendly-neighborhood-save-world-marvel/\">friendly neighborhood Spider-Man</a>.</p><p>As clearly stated in her name, though, She-Hulk is a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/hulk/\">Hulk</a>. And Hulks are the strongest ones there are. Over the years, She-Hulk has shown off many insane <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/she-hulk-strength-moments-ranked/\">feats of strength</a> and without question, she has a considerable strength advantage over Spider-Man.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Intelligence: Spider-Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Spider-Man-Peter-Parker-Teaching.jpg' /></figure><p>Typically a Hulk is the strongest there is, but they have been far from the smartest there is over the years. While the Hulk's intelligence fluctuates depending on the incarnation, She-Hulk typically retains her intelligence in her Hulk form. Furthermore, she is even a successful attorney. Passing the bar is an impressive feat, how's Spidey gonna top that?</p><p>Oh, that's right, Peter Parker is a scientific genius who invented his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spiderman-best-worst-web-shooter-designs/\">mechanical web-shooters</a> while he was just a teenager. Spider-Man's name won't come up while discussing the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-universe-most-intelligent-heroes-ranked/\">top tier of geniuses in the Marvel Universe</a>, but he's only a level or two below them.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Team Support: She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/She-Hulk-A-Force.jpg' /></figure><p>Since she's not a mutant, the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a> are about the only major team that She-Hulk hasn't been a member of. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avengers/\">Avengers</a>? Check. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fantastic-four/\">Fantastic Four</a>? Check. She was even the leader of A-Force, the all-female Avengers team.</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-aforce-vs-champions-win-lose-fight/\">A-Force Vs. Champions: Who Would Win?</a></span></p></p><p><p class=\"article-title\">Spider-Man has been a member of both the Avengers and the Fantastic Four as well, though not as often or as long as She-Hulk. For a good while, Spider-Man considered himself a loner. While he's always down for a team-up or to join a team nowadays, his isolated past versus She-Hulk's rich team history makes it easier for her to get team assistance.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Speed &#38; Agility: Spider-Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Spider-Man-vs-Firelord.jpg' /></figure><p>In a straight-up foot race, She-Hulk's going to beat Spider-Man because of her stronger leg muscles. However, physical speed is only a portion of what makes up having the proportionate speed of a spider.</p><p>Spider-Man is legendary for his danger-detecting Spider-Sense. That combined with his incredible Spider-Agility makes him very difficult to land a blow on. Spider-Man can dodge She-Hulk for ages while swiftly landing shots of his own as well.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Public Perception: She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/She-Hulk-Mind-Over-Muscle.jpg' /></figure><p>As already mentioned, She-Hulk has been a regular member of both the Avengers and the Fantastic Four, two of the most beloved teams in the Marvel Universe. Furthermore, her popularity makes her a highly sought after attorney to boot. After all, who doesn't want a lawyer who can <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-most-powerful-lawyers/\">literally fight for them</a>?</p><p>On the other hand, Spider-Man can hardly catch a break with the public. For many years, the general public of the 616 thought that Spider-Man was a menace because of a certain <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-shadiest-things-j-jonah-jameson-has-done-marvel/\">Daily Bugle publisher</a>. JJJ has <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/j-jonah-jameson-villain-ally-spider-man/\">softened some over the years</a>, so maybe Spidey's finally turned a corner, but years of bad PR still follow him at times.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Gadgets: Spider-Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Spider-Man-Spider-Armor-feature.jpg' /></figure><p>Aside from tossing a random car or something along those lines, She-Hulk doesn't use (or need) any gadgets while she's out there doing her superhero thing. Spider-Man's web-shooters have already been mentioned, but those are only the tip of the iceberg for the Web-Slinger.</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batmobile-versus-spider-buggy-best-superhero-vehicle/\">5 Reasons Why The Batmobile Is The Best Superhero Vehicle Of All Time (&#38; 5 Why It's The Spider-Buggy)</a></span></p></p><p><p class=\"article-title\">On a few occasions, Spider-Man has busted out the Spider-Buggy, but his most impressive gadget has been the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-powerful-armors/\">armors</a> he has used over the years. Almost all of them have been designed by Peter Parker and have significantly powered him up. With the right suit, he may just be a physical match for She-Hulk.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Trainers: She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Gamora.jpg' /></figure><p>She-Hulk and Spider-Man share a common trainer, none other than <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/captain-america/\">Captain America</a>. With their respective powers, learning how to fight makes the two of them even more formidable. But Cap isn't the only hero that's worked with the two of them...</p><p>Spider-Man has worked with the Master of Kung Fu himself, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/shang-chi/\">Shang-Chi</a>. He helped Spider-Man develop \"the Way of the Spider\" martial art style. But She-Hulk received her additional training from the most dangerous woman in the universe, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/gamora/\">Gamora</a>. Kung Fu is great but it can't compete with the countless other fighting styles throughout the universe.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Costume: Spider-Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/spider-man-ben-peter-parker-costume.jpg' /></figure><p>She-Hulk stands out because she's tall, buff, and green, but when it comes to a specific outfit, she doesn't really have a defining one. That still hasn't stopped cosplayers from pulling off some <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/she-hulk-cosplay-marvel-comics-look-like/\">sensational She-Hulk cosplay</a> though.</p><p>Spider-Man's red and blue costume is iconic and also <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spiderman-best-worst-costumes/\">far from the only spectacular outfit</a> Spider-Man has donned over the years. His outfits are so astonishing that it carries over to the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-best-worst-spider-costumes/\">other Spider-People of the Marvel Universe</a> as well. If it weren't for Spider-Man's years of bad press, he could be a fashion mogul by now. Spider-Man's costumes can also give the hero an edge in battle, depending on his chosen outfit.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Famous Family: Tie</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Spider-Man-and-She-Hulk.jpg' /></figure><p><p class=\"article-title\">Spider-Man may just have the most famous aunt and uncle in history. Thanks to the countless Spider-Man adaptations, everyone knows who <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-aunt-may-facts/\">Aunt May</a> and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-uncle-ben-facts/\">Uncle Ben</a> are. Although not currently married, for many, Peter and Mary Jane had the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/spider-man-mary-jane-superman-lois-lane-best-greatest-comic-power-couple/\">ideal superhero marriage</a>.</p></p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-spider-man-family-everyday-heroes/\">10 Members Of Spider-Man’s Family Who Are Everyday Heroes</a></span></p></p><p><p class=\"article-title\">She-Hulk, in turn, might just have the most famous cousin in all of comics. When Jennifer Walters was shot by a crime boss, her cousin Bruce Banner gave her a life-saving blood transfusion that would turn her into She-Hulk because of his gamma-irradiated blood. One famous giant green cousin = three famous humans.</p></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>WINNER: She-Hulk</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/She-Hulk.jpeg' /></figure><p>A case can certainly be made for Spider-Man winning. His agility and speed make him tough to hit, and he's strong enough to do damage to her with his punches. With the addition of gadgets, his odds greatly increase.</p><p>It comes down to hand-to-hand combat, and She-Hulk's strength and training with Gamora give her the edge. While She-Hulk may have difficulty striking a shot against Spider-Man, she only needs to land one really good hit to win. Thanks to Gamora, she'll have great insight on strategies to use against a faster opponent.</p><p><p class=\"article-title\"><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/wonder-woman-vs-spider-man-who-would-win/\">Wonder Woman Vs. Spider-Man: Who Would Win?</a></span></p></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:00:47 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Spider-Man-She-Hulk-Cropped.jpg","linkMd5":"319e99449717cf38d34e5dac08301427","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn34@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-995_150856352bb92c3f.webp","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":750,"sourceBytes":264230,"destBytes":213914,"author":"Steve
