Waldinger","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Spider-Man-She-Hulk-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn34@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-01-995_150856352bb92c3f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/She-Hulk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn41@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-12-479_63e2b0df188853fb.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Spider-Man-Peter-Parker-Teaching.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn30@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-12-558_56799ae60abf1c10.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/She-Hulk-A-Force.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Spider-Man-vs-Firelord.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn15@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-16-821_c1b48ed745e09ced.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/She-Hulk-Mind-Over-Muscle.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn17@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-13-971_d18946a009c2f8d8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Spider-Man-Spider-Armor-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn10@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-978_fccf23b8d256ec8c.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Gamora.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn79@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-17-187_6cbf5eeddd9cad80.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/spider-man-ben-peter-parker-costume.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Spider-Man-and-She-Hulk.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn32@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-16-720_19433acedaddb3a8.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/She-Hulk.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn62@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-05-840_ca8f6b649e5cde06.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700502},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Superman: Red Mist Killed [SPOILER] - and They're Just Getting Started","link":"https://www.cbr.com/superman-melody-moore-red-mist-murder/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/action-comics-1005-header.jpg\"/></figure><p><strong><em>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/action-comics/\">Action Comics</a> #1024 by Brian Michael Bendis, John Romita Jr, Klaus Janson, Brad Anderson, &#38; Dave Sharpe, on sale now</em></strong></p><p><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/superman/\">Superman's</a> is well-known for being one of the most dedicated and friendly heroes within the DC Universe. He's attracted friends without even realizing it, and strives to turn everyone into allies. But sometimes, that comes with the added threat of being targeted by major villains.</p><p>Red Mist has killed Melody Moore, a relatively new Superman supporting character and friend to the Man of Steel -- and she's preparing for a far larger attack.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/most-powerful-superman-dbz-like-fusion-created-by-dr-manhattan/\">The Most Powerful Superman Is a DBZ-Like, Meta-Narrative Fusion Created by Dr. Manhattan</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Melody-Moore-Superman-death.jpg\"/></figure><p>Once Superman turned his attention to the Invisible Mafia that's been operating throughout Metropolis, the crime organization has been on the move to avoid the prying eyes of the Man of Steel. But with the group backed into a corner, super powered muscle Red Mist is prepared to take the fight to Superman. She's even indicated to her boss Ms. Leone that she's willing to target Superman's family, specifically one of the two <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/superboy/\">Superboys</a> - Jon Kent who is back from a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superboy-mon-el-legion-secret/\">future spent with the Legion of Superheroes</a>, or the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-kents-remember-post-crisis-dc-universe/\">recently returned Conner Kent</a>. Leone was cautious about this concept at first, not wanting to force Superman to take the fight to the next level if they weren't prepared to deal with the repercussions.</p><p>But that was before Superman, the two Superboys, and a visiting Braniac-5 targeted the Black Label Club, one of Leone's few places of business that are still in operation. After forcing everyone to evacuate the club, the heroes used Brainiac's future technology to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-bold-shrinking-crime/\">shrink the building</a> before literally removing it. This finally pushes Leone over the edge, and she expresses willingness for Red Mist to attack Superman's loved ones. Red Mist just found her first target too -- although it wasn't someone actually related to the Man of Steel.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/brian-michael-bendis-superman-impact/\">Superman: Brian Michael Bendis' Lasting Impact On The Man Of Steel</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melody-moore.png\"/></figure><p>First introduced in Brian Michael Bendis and Ivan Reis' <em>The Man of Steel </em>#1, Melody Moore represented a strong hope Superman had for the city, and he eventually trusted her with his secret identity. This blow hits Superman particularly hard, as all of his attempts to make life better for his loved ones have just resulted in even more chaos and confusion.</p><p>Making matters worse is the fact that Leone has given Red Mist the okay to continue her rampage...and with Superman's secret identity exposed to the world, anyone that he cares about could potentially be the next target.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/superman-outsmarts-brainiac/\">Superman Just Outwitted The DC Universe's Smartest Villain (Again)</a></span></p>\n +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/action-comics-1005-header.jpg","linkMd5":"84059856f887b7e1bcbc3619c34d4af5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-142_848f7b3336393046.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":120996,"destBytes":120996,"author":"Brandon Zachary","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/action-comics-1005-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn81@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-142_848f7b3336393046.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Melody-Moore-Superman-death.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn34@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-10-821_f2c67cefc0483724.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melody-moore.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn59@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-16-386_738d6bb59c146a0c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Netflix Delays Preview of Chadwick Boseman's Final Film, Promises to Release It in Late 2020","link":"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-netflix-delays-ma-raineys-black-bottom/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/black-panther-united-nations-1.jpg\"/></figure><p>Netflix has delayed a preview event for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\">Chadwick Boseman's</a> last movie, <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em>.</p><p>According to <em><a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2020-08-29/netflix-delays-preview-chadwick-boseman-movie-ma-rainey\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Los Angeles Times</a></em>, a virtual preview for <em>Ma Rainey</em> was scheduled to take place on Aug. 31. However, in the wake of Boseman's passing, the streamer has opted to postpone the event. Netflix did reiterate its intention to release <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em> later on in 2020.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-digital-sales-chadwick-boseman-death/\">Black Panther Digital Sales Skyrocket Following Chadwick Boseman’s Death</a></span></p><p>\"Chadwick was a superhero on screen and in life, and it’s impossible to imagine working at the level he has while valiantly battling his illness,\" Netflix Co-Chief Executive and Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos said. \"His legacy as a person and an artist will inspire millions. Our thoughts and prayers are with him and his family during this difficult time.\"</p><p>Boseman, who was most famous for portraying King T'Challa/Black Panther in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, died at the age of 43 after a four-year battle with colon cancer. Despite progressing from stage III at diagnosis to stage IV, Boseman continued to act, appearing in 2019's <em>21 Bridges</em>, 2020's <em>Da 5 Bloods</em> and the upcoming <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em>.</p><p>Directed by George C. Wolfe and based on a play of the same name by August Wilson, <em>Ma Rainey's Black Bottom</em> stars Viola Davis, Chadwick Boseman, Glynn Turman, Taylour Paige and Michael Potts. The film arrives on Netflix later this year.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/father-terminally-ill-child-shares-chadwick-bosemans-message-strength/\">Father Of Terminally Ill Child Shares Chadwick Boseman's Message Of Strength To His Son</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 19:39:01 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/black-panther-united-nations-1.jpg","linkMd5":"d03c60f72a8c25f9b34c467aa5a19bfb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn21@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-367_79fc87a2e75796d9.webp","destWidth":1200,"destHeight":600,"sourceBytes":94968,"destBytes":94968,"author":"Douglas Laman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/black-panther-united-nations-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn21@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-03-367_79fc87a2e75796d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"X-Men: The 10 Most Confusing Things About Jonathan Hickman's Run, Explained","link":"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-jonathan-hickman-confusing-things-explained/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-27.jpg\"/></figure><p>Johnathan Hickman's run on the newest line of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/x-men/\">X-Men</a> books has taken Marvel's mutants from being a group of persecuted superheroes to a thriving paradise of an independent nation.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-x-men-times-mister-sinister-biggest-threat/\">X-Men: 10 Times Mister Sinister Was Mutantkind's Bigger Threat (And We Never Even Noticed)</a></span></p><p>Hickman's <em>Age of X</em> has refreshed the previously stagnant X-Men franchise <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-dawn-x-karkoa-trivia/\">with a new status quo</a> while reintroducing and recontextualizing characters and plot threads from X-Men past into the present. However, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-marvel-comics-krakoa-no-sense/\">not every idea introduced</a> has been clearly explained, so it makes sense to take a look at some of the most confusing things from Hickman's run.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>‘A Man Called X’</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-has-a-new-dream.jpg' /></figure><p>Before <em>House of X</em>, Charles Xavier was last seen as a blonde-haired man called \"X\" following his fusion with Fantomex in Charles Soule and Gerardo Sandoval’s <em>Astonishing X-Men #</em>12. After declaring he was not Xavier and he had a new dream, X wouldn't appear again. However, Xavier is now back to normal, speaking with Moira MacTaggert in Hickman and Pepe Laraz’s <em>House of X #</em>2.</p><p>Throughout Hickman’s run, Xavier has been noticeably different, sporting an eerie new appearance and wearing a portable helmet version of Cerebro 24/7. The gap between X's last appearance and Xavier's reappearance in <em>House of X </em>has been oddly overlooked.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Moira MacTaggert’s Role</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/house-of-x-moira.jpeg' /></figure><p>The aforementioned <em>House of X</em> #2 retconned Moira MacTaggert into being a mutant. Her ability? To <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/house-x-moira-mactaggert-moments/\">relive her life from start to finish</a>, carrying knowledge from one life into the next. Her experiences positioned her as the catalyst to Krakoa's formation, as she ultimately brought the idea to Xavier when they met.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avengers-vs-xmen-ways-aged-well-poorly/\">Avengers Vs. X-Men; 5 Ways It Aged Well (&#38; 5 Ways It Hasn't)</a></span></p><p>However, since <em>Powers of X</em> #6, Moira hasn’t been seen. Readers were left to wonder why Moira hasn’t appeared in any of the <em>Dawn of X</em> titles after being built up as a significant character.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Doug Ramsey and Warlock</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/doug-ramsey-krakoa.jpeg' /></figure><p>Doug Ramsey has <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-cypher-iunderrated-useless/\">never been a big player</a> for the X-Men, but he was a consistent presence on the New Mutants, along with his Phalanx friend Warlock. Doug’s mutant genes make him a citizen of Krakoa, but Warlock is techno-organic, so he isn't. Hickman and R.B. Silva’s <em>Powers of X #2</em> sees Doug subtlety touch a flower and assimilate it with a piece of Warlock.</p><p>Doug’s appearances have been peppered with similar hints at Warlock’s existence, like when Cyclops briefly witnessed the two separate before finally revealing Warlock was stowing away on Doug’s arm, but what’s going on with them assimilating parts of Krakoa? These actions build suspicion around their intentions, and whether they are a friend or unsuspected foe.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Age of X-Man</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Age-Of-X-Man-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p>Before <em>Dawn of X</em> established the current era of Mutant prosperity, the <em>Age of X-Man </em>event put mutants at their rock bottom. The event's alternate universe, created by Earth-295’s Nate Grey, created the illusion of peace on earth by transforming humans into mutants and placing false memories in everyone's head.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-blackbird-little-known-trivia/\">X-Men 10 Things Fans Should Know About The Blackbird</a></span></p><p>After the X-Men broke through the illusion and their memories were restored, Nate returned everyone to Earth-616. Hickman’s run began immediately after the<em> Age of X-Man </em>ended, with an added time jump to boot. While <em>House of X </em>and <em>Powers of X </em>filled in key events that led to Krakoa’s formation, there is no reference to the fallout from <em>Age of X-Man. </em>It seems likely that an occurrence of that magnitude would leave some sort of residual trauma.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Kitty Pryde’s ‘Condition’</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kitty-Pryde-Krakoa-Portal.jpg' /></figure><p>Kitty Pryde has <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/xmen-kitty-pryde-best-worst-mutant/\">long been a consistent presence</a> in the X- Men lineup, progressing from young student to school headmaster. While one would expect her history with the X-Men to ensure her importance in Krakoa, Kitty is unable to participate in the luxuries of Krakoa.</p><p>Gerry Duggan and Matteo Lolli's <em>Marauders #</em>1 shows Kitty unable to pass through the Krakoan gateway, but this doesn't stop Kitty, as she gathers up a crew and becomes a pirate. However, this leads to her murder <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xmen-sebastian-shinobi-shaw-better-worse-comparison/\">at the hands of Sebastian Shaw</a> when he realizes she likely could not be resurrected. While the mutants are eventually able to bring her back with a little help from Emma Frost, it requires 16 attempts. It's still unclear what is preventing Kitty from enjoying Krakoa's luxuries.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Their Answer To Death</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-5.jpg' /></figure><p>Superhero comics are known for their fast and loose relationship with death, and Hickman's run has taken this idea to the extreme. In Hickman and Pepe Larraz's <em>House of X #4</em> Wolverine, Cyclops, and Jean Grey all die, killing off <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-xtreme-xmen-strongest-members/\">the three biggest X-Men</a>. However, in the next issue, we are introduced to the Krakoan resurrection protocols that are used to bring them back, seemingly establishing that Mutants have solved death.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-marvel-asteroid-m-facts-fans-know/\">X-Men: 10 Facts About Asteroid M That Fans Should Know</a></span></p><p>Xavier states that they can do so by backing up a copy of every mutant's consciousness to Cerebro and then placing it in new replica clone bodies that are made by a group of mutants called \"The Five.\" While the details of the process have been explained, the philosophical and technical details have yet to be explored.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>The Timelines in Powers of X</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Powers-of-X-Nimrod-Omega-Sentinel.jpg' /></figure><p>While <em>House of X</em> was mostly rooted in the present-day early formation of Krakoa, the companion series <em>Powers of X</em> jumped between various timelines. Each timeline explores the future of mutants and humans post-Krakoa, painting a picture that gets grimmer as it progresses, with enemies such as technologically augmented humans and chimera mutant fusions.</p><p>But, since these timelines were explored in <em>Powers of X,</em> we have not seen them again. This may be because the timelines were only meant to be warnings, but they surely seemed more important than that. The initial missions in Hickman's <em>X-Men </em>book saw the team following leads on Nimrod, a robotic mutant-hunting Sentinel descendant who played a role in future timelines, but mentions of possible futures have since vanished.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Apocalypse’s Intentions</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/apocalypse-header-1.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the most eye-raising parts of Hickman's run has been the sudden camaraderie of both heroic and villainous mutants. The formation of Krakoa has led to some of the biggest X-Men villains working side-by-side with the team. No villain in this group has been more suspect than Apocalypse himself. Apocalypse has quickly become one of the most important leaders on Krakoa and has consistently shown himself to be acting in the nation's best interest.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/x-men-anatomy-magneto-body/\">X-Men Anatomy: 5 Weirdest Thing About Magneto's Body</a></span></p><p>However, that hasn't stopped some of the X-Men from questioning his intentions. While other former foes like Pyro and Magneto have carved a comfortable spot in Krakoa and quickly gained the respect and trust of their former foes, there are plenty of mutants keeping their guards up against Apocalypse, and with good reason.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>\"Make More Mutants\"</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Make-More-Mutants.jpg' /></figure><p>The formation of a new nation necessitates the creation of a body to govern it, leading to the formation of the Krakoan \"Quiet Council\" in Hickman and Larraz's <em>House of X #</em>6. When the council is creating laws, Nightcrawler declares they \"Make More Mutants,\" an obvious spin on the infamous <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/how-no-more-mutants-changed-marvel/\">\"No More Mutants\"</a> line. This law serves as motivation for mutants to procreate and thrive in ways they were not able to as an oppressed group. Yet, aside from a few mentions <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-gambit-rogue-best-worst-comic-couple/\">in a conversation between Rogue and Gambit</a>, the law is just another part of Hickman's run that has not resurfaced or gained traction.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Children of the Vault</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Children-of-the-Vault.jpg' /></figure><p>One plot thread that Hickman has pulled from X-Men lore is the group of the augmented humans The Children of the Vault. The Children were raised in a vault where time moves differently, accelerating evolutionary development. In Hickman and R.B. Silva’s <em>X-Men </em>#5, they are chased back into their vault, prompting Krakoa to send a team after them on a suicide mission.</p><p>Later, In Hickman and Russell Dauterman's <em>Giant-Size X-Men: Jean Grey and Emma Frost </em>#1, it is revealed they also placed a bomb in Storm’s head, forcing Emma Frost and Jean Grey to operate. Both situations look bleak, and the impending threat from the Children is looming.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/marvel-comics-x-men-things-fans-need-know-brood/\">X-Men: 10 Things You Need To Know About The Brood</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:30:50 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-27.jpg","linkMd5":"27e2b6afc1a989217ab009b9c68108e6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn53@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-01-935_fdae102cacd96996.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":190152,"destBytes":190152,"author":"Jacob Nardone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-27.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn53@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-01-935_fdae102cacd96996.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/X-has-a-new-dream.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn21@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-11-650_dc4790260b9bbf83.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/house-of-x-moira.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn51@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-09-461_5ef08e0c02c7c4c3.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/doug-ramsey-krakoa.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn59@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-10-224_7b4ba330c8ce098e.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Age-Of-X-Man-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-06-003_737c10c4fa5f1592.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Kitty-Pryde-Krakoa-Portal.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn74@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-07-147_ed6b7c7d70c20359.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn89@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-09-582_681ddce2347abea9.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Powers-of-X-Nimrod-Omega-Sentinel.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn87@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-11-246_e803208b15c2686f.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/apocalypse-header-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-221_75cc479ce3953d5a.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Make-More-Mutants.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn22@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-13-263_47efa852479ab2c4.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Children-of-the-Vault.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn36@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-15-946_4c76b108adfe3d40.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700509},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"EXCLUSIVE Retro Doctor Doom Marvel Legends Figure Now Available HERE!","link":"https://www.cbr.com/exclusive-retro-doctor-doom-marvel-legends-figure/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EXCLUSIVE-Retro-ToyBiz-Inspired-Doctor-Doom-Marvel-Legends-Figure-Now-Available-HERE.jpg\"/></figure><p>It's Marvel Monday over at <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/entertainment-earth\">Entertainment Earth</a>, which means an amazing new figure from <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/marvel-legends/\">Marvel Legends</a> has been announced and is ready for pre-order! This week features the release of a new <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/doctor-doom\">Doctor Doom</a> figure in the Marvel Legends line, though this version is quite a bit different than the figure that was recently released.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/exclusive-wooden-iron-man-funko-pop/\">EXCLUSIVE Iron Man Funko POP! Shows Off All New, All-Wooden Armor</a></span></p><p>The new Marvel Legends figure features a retro take on the classic Marvel villain, which includes the ToyBiz-inspired packaging that was clearly brought from the '90s on Doom's Time Platform for fans to once again enjoy in their collection!</p><p>Victor Von Doom was a college associate of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/reed-richards\">Reed Richards</a> who was tragically disfigured during one of his ritualistic experiments, which led him to hide his identity in a high-tech suit of armor as Doctor Doom, monarch of Latveria and frequent enemy of Richards and his <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/fantastic-four\">Fantastic Four</a>. While Doctor Doom's regal uniform hasn't changed much over the years, this figure showcases some of the classic features of Doom's retro outfit with a number of accessories that further explore the unique mixture of mysticism and science employed by Doctor Doom.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MARVEL-LEGENDS-Retro-Doctor-Doom-2.jpg\"/></figure><ul><li>$20.99</li><li><strong>Entertainment Earth Exclusive! </strong>At last, Doom is ready to defeat Richards with Toy Biz-inspired retro packaging! This collectible 6-inch-scale Fantastic Four Marvel Legends Series 6-Inch Doctor Doom Action Figure - Exclusive, inspired by the Fantastic 4 comics, part of the Marvel Comic Universe, makes a great gift for Marvel collectors and fans.</li><li>Includes figure and 10 accessories like alternate hands and energy blasts.</li><li><strong>Purchase <a href=\"https://www.entertainmentearth.com/product/HSE9627?id=SC-909272771\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fantastic Four Marvel Legends 6-Inch Doctor Doom Action Figure HERE!</a></strong></li></ul><p>The retro Doctor Doom figure comes with 10 accessories that include interchangeable hands and a jet pack to use with an assortment of weapons, which include a pistol and the incredibly powerful Ultimate Nullifier. Along with the magic effects that can be added to his gauntlets, this figure also features two different magical books that highlight his mystical fortitude as well, with one of the books featuring the Seal of the Vishanti, which is a sigil that is more closely associated with Doom's magical rival, Doctor Strange.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MARVEL-LEGENDS-Retro-Doctor-Doom.jpg\"/></figure><p>A modern version of Doctor Doom was released from Marvel Legends recently, and while the armoring of the figure is similar, it has a lighter grey than the newer figure, and the green of his tunic has also been lightened as well, with additional embellishments to the costume added for the retro version to really bring it in line with the classic look of the character.</p><p>The recent wave of Marvel Legends figures that included the aforementioned Doctor Doom Allan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/EXCLUSIVE-Retro-ToyBiz-Inspired-Doctor-Doom-Marvel-Legends-Figure-Now-Available-HERE.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn13@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-326_d0aa38dbc5227796.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MARVEL-LEGENDS-Retro-Doctor-Doom-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn92@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-11-447_64338abd53bb6845.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/MARVEL-LEGENDS-Retro-Doctor-Doom.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn49@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-07-013_88ac20917536f8e1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"The Boys Lets You Channel Billy Butcher With Baby Laser Tag AR Game","link":"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-billy-butcher-baby-laser-tag-ar-game/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Screen-Shot-2019-09-16-at-2.03.00-PM-Cropped.png\"/></figure><p>One of the more memorable moments in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-boys-tv/\"><em>The Boys</em></a> Season 1 involved Billy Butcher using a super baby's heat vision to gruesomely cut through a trio of gunman while investigating the nefarious corporation Vought International. And now, in a new mobile AR game, players can get their hands on their own lethal infant and put them to destructive use.</p><p>Amazon has announced the release of <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GZi47SxBemM\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Baby Laser Tag</em></a>, a mobile game tie-in to the hit Dynamite Entertainment television adaptation. With a promo in the style of an infomercial, two home shopping channel hosts are seen holding a baby doll only for it to unleash its heat vision and causing some unforeseen technical difficulties.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-jeffrey-dean-morgan-season-3-covid-19/\">The Boys: Jeffrey Dean Morgan's Season 3 Role May Not Happen Due to COVID-19</a></span></p><iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/GZi47SxBemM?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allow=\"accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture\" allowfullscreen></iframe><p>Available now for iOS and Android devices, the game turns your immediate surroundings into a Vought facility that is being attacked by the corporation's shady operatives and the sociopathic superhero team The Seven. While there, players must use the laser-eyed baby to cut through their attackers and survive as long as possible. The game includes character models from the Amazon series and items that are expected to appear in Season 2.</p><p>The first season revealed that Vought had genetically engineering super babies to serve as their own super-soldiers, created under the guise of the medical vaccines, since 1971. As Butcher threatens to expose Vought's activities, The Seven are tasked with hunting him and his scrappy ensemble down.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-boys-season-3-storyline-covid-19/\">The Boys Boss Says Season 3 Storyline Will Be Informed by USA's Response to COVID-19</a></span></p><p><em>The Boys</em> stars Karl Urban as Billy Butcher, Jack Quaid as Hughie, Laz Alonso as Mother's Milk, Tomer Kapon as Frenchie, Karen Fukuhara as the Female, Erin Moriarty as Annie January, Chace Crawford as the Deep, Antony Starr as Homelander, Aya Cash as Stormfront and Simon Pegg as Hughie’s dad. The Boys has been renewed for Season 3, with Season 2 set to premiere on Amazon Prime Video Sept. 4.</p><p>(Via <a href=\"https://collider.com/the-boys-mobile-game-baby-laser-tag-amazon/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><em>Collider</em></a>)</p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 21:31:44 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Screen-Shot-2019-09-16-at-2.03.00-PM-Cropped.png","linkMd5":"5005a5134c0ae45573c41d23a2d4269b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn46@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-01-956_46d77145b030432a.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":491174,"destBytes":491174,"author":"Sam Stone","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Screen-Shot-2019-09-16-at-2.03.00-PM-Cropped.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn46@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-01-956_46d77145b030432a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700505},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"5 Times The Joker Was Ruthless (& 5 Harley Quinn Was Worse) | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/joker-harley-quinn-evil-villain-acts-comparison/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage171.jpg\"/></figure><p>Though they don't have any superpowers, Harley Quinn and the Joker have been proven to be two of the most cruel and dangerous criminals in the entire <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/dc-comics/\">DC Universe</a>. Whether it's in the comics, the animated shows, the video games or even in live-action, they leave a trail of death and destruction in their wake.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-punchline-harley-quinn-comparison-dangerous/\">DC Comics: 5 Ways Punchline Is More Dangerous Than Harley Quinn (&#38; 5 Ways Harley Is)</a></span></p><p>While <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-ways-harley-quinn-changed-over-years/\">in recent years Harley has gone through a bit of a transformation</a> into an anti-hero and reformed criminal, she can still be considered to have one of the most villainous paths ever seen in comics. The Joker is considered to be especially ruthless, but there's potential for Harley to have actually surpassed him on a number of occasions when it comes down to the evil deeds that she has committed.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>JOKER: Everything He Did In The Killing Joke</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Killing-Joke.jpg' /></figure><p>One of the stories that has defined the Joker ever since its initial release is <em>The Killing Joke.</em> It has been retold in a number of capacities but it ultimately reflects just how cruel the clown prince of crime can actually be.</p><p>The story sees the Joker paralyze Barbara Gordon after shooting her, ending Batgirl's career and in the process torturing her father Commissioner Jim Gordon. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-batfamily-red-hood-vs-killing-joke-tragedy/\">It's a narrative that has continued to haunt the lives</a> of the Gordon family ever since its inception. Though the one-shot didn't exactly age perfectly, Joker's seemingly endless capacity for evil was memorably made most evident here.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>HARLEY QUINN: Enabling The Joker</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Enabling-The-Joker.jpg' /></figure><p>Harley Quinn started out in a career as a psychologist working in Arkham Asylum with some of the most troubled inmates. One particular criminal that she comes across manages to seduce her with his way of life, forming the Quinn audiences know today.</p><p>That initial <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-batman-harley-quinn-mister-freeze-tragic-villain/\">meeting between the doctor and the clown has become pretty iconic</a>, but it showcases that there is a villain deep within Harley. She enabled Joker so many times over, allowing him to escape from prison and taking great joy in being a witness and helper in his many crimes.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>JOKER: Murdering Lois Lane</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-Kills-Lois-Lane.jpg' /></figure><p>In the <em>Injustice</em> universe, the Joker took things a step further in his attempts to push the man of steel over the edge. In a moment of madness he killed Lois Lane, and this turned Superman into the fascist leader the video games pitch him as.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-black-label-three-jokers-batman-excited-worried/\">5 Reasons We're Excited For Batman: Three Jokers (&#38; 5 We're Worried)</a></span></p><p>With Lois Lane dead Superman did the unthinkable, killing the Joker with his bare hands. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-best-villain-joker-vs-bane/\">Even in death, the psychotic clown</a> won due to the fact that his heinous actions actually broke Superman and changed reality into something far more chaotic.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>HARLEY QUINN: Killing The Joker</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Kills-Joker.jpg' /></figure><p>Quinn has actually killed the Joker a number of times, demonstrating that she isn't afraid to say goodbye to her Puddin' forever, if it benefits her in some way. There's a couple of key examples of this. The first is actually during their wedding.</p><p>Joker smeared some cake on Harley's face, which she didn't find funny at all. As retribution, she slit his throat, murdering him on their special day. Another occasion is during the first <em>DCeased</em> storyline where she once again killed him in cold blood. However, he was a zombie by that point so she was more than justified.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>JOKER: Creating The Red Hood</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jason-Todd.jpg' /></figure><p>The Joker has done some terrible things over his time, but one of his actions had long term consequences. The torture and supposed murder of Jason Todd in <em>A Death in the Family</em> sent Batman into a spiral that fans hadn't seen before.</p><p>What's more, when Todd eventually returned thanks to resurrection and forces beyond anyone's control, he donned the identity of the Red Hood and became a serial killing vigilante, throwing the bat code out of the window and becoming a key rival to the dark knight. It was a story that showed that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/joker-war-best-worst-joker-inspirations-dc-batman/\">Joker's chaos had a genuine impact on the characters</a> around him.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>HARLEY QUINN: Getting Kicked Out Of Hell</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Quinn-Hell.jpg' /></figure><p>There was once a time that Quinn actually found herself in the depths of Hell. Any villain would likely feel pretty much at home among the fires of the underworld and its evil denizens, as it's what they deserve for their horrible acts of violence and their various sins.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/harley-quinn-solo-team-character-better-worse/\">Harley Quinn: 5 Reasons Why She's Better Solo (&#38; 5 Why She's Better In A Team)</a></span></p><p>But, Harley was so annoying, evil and downright awful that she was actually kicked out of Hell altogether. Even the Joker probably couldn't achieve that even if he was trying to!</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>JOKER: The Joker Tower Plan</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-Tower.jpg' /></figure><p>The Joker has come up with <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-joker-most-hilarious-deadliest-masterplans-all-time-ranked/\">some terrible master plans over the years</a>, but during his rivalry with the animated iteration of Harley Quinn, he developed a Joker Tower and put his grand scheme of ruling Gotham City and wiping out the Legion of Doom into action.</p><p>The strange thing was that it actually worked, with Joker torturing the inhabitants of Gotham, eventually aiding to destroy the city altogether. It's shocking that one of his most comically terrible plans actually worked and caused the sheer amount of misery and destruction that it did.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>HARLEY QUINN: Making Children Explode To Vent Out</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Children.jpg' /></figure><p>Harley has done some pretty despicable things alongside the Joker before, but her campaign to kill a bunch of kids is something she did solo and it was a horrific way to vent her frustrations about her relationship with Mr J.</p><p>She rigged a load of video games to explode when they were played, meaning lots of families were decimated in the ensuing explosions. She showed some remorse, but a plan like that had only one thing in mind, and that was to cause misery.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>JOKER: He's A Serial Killer</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Killing-Joker.jpg' /></figure><p>The Joker has always been portrayed as a serial killer, even more so than Harley Quinn. He was murdered hundreds of people just for fun and has a penchant for creating the most grizzly of murders just to catch Batman's attention.</p><p>He really has no limits as well, having at one point murdered Sarah Essen (Commissioner Gordon's wife) while she was holding a baby in the final moments of <em>No Man's Land</em>. Again and again, Joker has proven that human life means nothing to him and he would kill just for the hell of it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>HARLEY QUINN: Actively Torturing Tim Drake</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tim-Drake-joker.jpg' /></figure><p>Tim Drake is one of the most iconic iterations of Robin, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-robin-tim-drake-best-worst-moments/\">but tragedy struck</a> him in one of the animated versions of the dark knight's world.</p><p>In <em>Batman Beyond: Return of the Joker, </em>the Joker had young Tim Drake (the series' second Robin) turned into a copy of him as a sick way of \"starting a family.\" Through Harley's consistent torture of the boy and her drive to impress her Puddin', she turned Drake into Joker Jr., creating a harrowing image and shocking Batman at how cruel the pair could be.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/joker-war-best-worst-joker-inspirations-dc-batman/\">Joker War: The 5 Best Characters Inspired By The Clown Prince Of Crime (&#38; The 5 Worst)</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:30:56 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage171.jpg","linkMd5":"f4043b170c08fc1838c809e6d9095cbb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-019_728d169d802a2bc8.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":121686,"destBytes":121686,"author":"George Chrysostomou","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage171.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn74@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-02-019_728d169d802a2bc8.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Killing-Joke.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Enabling-The-Joker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn24@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-17-473_dbce16e7d4bd5fea.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-Kills-Lois-Lane.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn87@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-10-460_a1c4c6a641f73555.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Kills-Joker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn10@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-118_498d9539733bbae5.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Jason-Todd.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn28@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-16-826_4ab3e2389debc7fd.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Quinn-Hell.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn21@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-10-690_8115f0f5b9f9b0b5.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Joker-Tower.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn45@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-07-549_6935360a0d7322bb.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Harley-Children.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn1@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-07-172_f09f6598b812ead0.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Killing-Joker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn66@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-08-642_917c5aa5bc8a6824.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tim-Drake-joker.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn58@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-05-904_f8d2c1605595280a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700510},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Rent-A-Girlfriend: Why Chizuru Works as a Rental Girlfriend | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/rent-a-girlfriend-why-chizuru-works-as-a-rental-girlfriend/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Chizuru-and-Umi-Feature-Image.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/rent-a-girlfriend/\">Rent-A-Girlfriend</a> Season 1, Episode 8, \"Christmas and Girlfriend,\" streaming now on Crunchyroll. </strong></em></p><p>It's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tim-burtons-nightmare-before-christmas-ghoulish-advent-calendar/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Christmastime</a> on <em>Rent-A-Girlfriend</em>, and love is... not exactly blooming, but feelings are stirring in the winter air. The holiday themes here are stalking, Chizuru's mysterious new male acquaintance, a largely ignored provisional girlfriend, misunderstandings, and the long-awaited reveal of why Chizuru works as a rental girlfriend.</p><p><em>Rent-A-Girlfriend</em> typically conveys its messages through extroverted actions, words and shenanigans. This episode however, says just as much, if not more, through the characters' unspoken thoughts and facial expressions. Despite the fact that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/rent-a-girlfriend-episode-7-kazuya-blackmailed-into-relationship/\">Kazuya is dating Ruka</a>, his only true feelings are for Chizuru. Ruka's still happy as a clam though, with one of her blackmail conditions being that he has to contact her regularly. Though Chizuru spots them together on campus -- notably with a somber look on her face -- Ruka is basically cast aside in favor of more significant developments between the co-protagonists.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lapis-relights-episode-8-finally-forms-tiaras-orchestra-too-late/\">Lapis Re:LIGHTs Finally Forms Tiara's Orchestra - But Is It Already Too Late?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Ruka-Going-Out-With-Kazuya.jpg\"/></figure><p>As he's finishing up some errands on Christmas Eve, Kazuya exits the bank to find Chizuru crossing the street to meet up with an exceptionally attractive male acquaintance. He's surprised that she would be working on Christmas Eve before suspecting his worst nightmare has come true: Chizuru has a real boyfriend she's in love with and they're spending the holidays together. So does Kazuya go the adult route and leave them in peace? Of course not. Instead he <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/perfect-blue-perfect-ending-explored/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">stalks them</a> -- all afternoon and evening.</p><p>The two attend a movie together (titled <em>The Redemption of a Twenty-Year-Old</em>) and go shopping, and Chizuru's clearly having a great time with the mystery guy. Kazuya grows increasingly despondent seeing their chemistry. The final nail in the coffin comes when he overhears Chizuru talking about making breakfast for him in the morning. Nearly all evidence suggests the two are in a serious relationship.</p><p>Kazuya has finally resolved to go home and leave them be when the mystery man, named Umi, goes into the restroom while Kazuya is there. Kazuya overhears him on the phone discussing topics like Chizuru's measurements, qualifications and how she'd be a great fit for an unspecified job. He concludes that Umi is a scam artist trying to lure Chizuru into a less than savory line of work, then later interrupts them as they are seemingly about to kiss in front of a giant <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lobo-christmas-special-homage/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Christmas</a> tree.</p><p>With the ensuing confusion and embarrassment building to a breaking point, Chizuru finally reveals the reason she works as a rental girlfriend: she's an <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/soap-opera-actress-supergirl-mary-jane-karen-page/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">aspiring actress</a> who also attends an acting classes, and Umi is a fellow attendee. The lovey-dovey talk was the two of them rehearsing a script they'd been assigned, while Umi's suspicious phone call was actually him recommending Chizuru to a director he knew. As for the shopping, Chizuru was searching for the perfect gift to give Kazuya: a new phone case to protect the phone he'd broken while saving her from drowning.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/diary-of-our-days-at-the-breakwater-episode-8-who-needs-ocean/\">Diary of Our Days at the Breakwater: Who Needs the Ocean Anyway?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Kazuya-and-Chizuru-Christmas-Eve-Feature-Image.jpg\"/></figure><p>Interestingly, despite Kazuya admitting to stalking them, embarrassing her and forcing her to reveal her secret, Chizuru isn't that upset with him. Though she gives him a quick lecture, deep down she seems happy because his heart was in the right place and he was trying to look out for her. Other points earlier on -- her stoic look at seeing him locked in arms with Ruka, the happiness in her eyes when she selected his gift -- that show her feelings toward Kazuya are developing further.</p><p><em>Rent-A-Girlfriend</em> has been light on the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/best-romance-anime-2020-so-far/\">heartfelt moments</a>, and when they do arrive, they're often swiftly followed by something comedic or a bumbling screwup. Here though, Kazuya receiving the phone case from Chizuru is a genuinely touching scene. It clearly means a lot to her to give it to him (even if she claims it's not a gift, but a thank you for saving her life), while Kazuya tears up in admitting it's the first time a girl has given him something meaningful at Christmas.</p><p>It's unclear where all this leaves Ruka, or why she was introduced in the first place if Kazuya can't even feign any serious interest in her. She doesn't seem to have a firm desire to out Kazuya or Chizuru, but she must know Kazuya's heart isn't fully invested in their blackmail-driven relationship. The long-kept secrets will surely come out at some point, but as Kazuya and Chizuru grow closer, the potential effects to their dynamic are changing thanks to some shared holiday joy.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/anime-distributors-can-follow-in-steams-footsteps-to-fight-piracy/\">Anime Distributors Can Follow in Steam's Footsteps to Fight Piracy</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:00:55 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Chizuru-and-Umi-Feature-Image.jpg","linkMd5":"d7999398bf433d2d385d5598c2dc3128","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-02-188_40e11df6bcf2dcb1.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":59240,"destBytes":59240,"author":"Joe Ballard","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Chizuru-and-Umi-Feature-Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn3@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-02-188_40e11df6bcf2dcb1.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Ruka-Going-Out-With-Kazuya.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn30@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-11-681_95c4a5e11540c3f8.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rent-A-Girlfriend-Kazuya-and-Chizuru-Christmas-Eve-Feature-Image.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn10@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-12-312_89bec498cbe9b57d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700507},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Batman Beyond: A DEVASTATING New Villain Does What Mr. Freeze Never Could","link":"https://www.cbr.com/batman-beyond-zeh-ro-mr-freeze/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Beyond-Zeh-Ro-feature.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/batman-beyond\"><strong>Batman Beyond</strong></a><em><strong> #46, by Dan Jurgens, Sean Chen, Chris Sotomayor, Dave Wielgosz, Ben Abernathy and Travis Lanham, available now.</strong></em></p><p>In the world of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman\">Batman</a>, Mr. Freeze has been one of the Dark Knight's most formidable opponents, even if he's not as evil as Joker or Bane. He doesn't usually upset the status quo in terms of damaging the Bat-Family, but his tragic history gives him an emotional tug-of-war that often reminds Batman about humanity in them both.</p><p>Freeze's main ambition has always been to get funds to cure his wife, Nora, making him a sympathetic villain in most comics, cartoons and even the big screen. However, in <em>Batman Beyond</em> #46, a similar kind of criminal enacts a devastating Ice Age and achieves what Freeze never could.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-beyond-bruce-wayne-next-ras-al-ghul/\">Batman Beyond: Bruce Wayne Is Becoming the Next Ra's al Ghul</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-beyond.jpg\"/></figure><p>This comes in the form of the ice-cold Zeh-Ro, Ra's al Ghul's disciple who took over the League of Assassins in a coup. Zeh-Ro was initially content being second-fiddle to Damian, just working as Ra's' top scientist in order to freeze the planet over, but soon lost faith.</p><p>Ra's knew he'd die before the plan came to fruition, so it was expected Damian would follow through. However, the Son of the Bat opted not to as he felt there was still good in the world. It clearly resonated from the brief time spent with Bruce and Zeh-Ro felt this made Ra's' legacy look weak. It's why he convinced the soldiers to attack Damian and Goliath, which led to them aligning with the new Bat-Family.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-beyond-just-used-guns/\">Batman Beyond: Bruce Wayne Just Broke One of His Biggest Rules</a></span></p><p>Zeh-Ro doesn't waste any time putting his plan into motion because within hours, as he launches his space fleet from al-Ghul's Arctic base, Earth begins to experience frigid conditions. As it freezes over, Bruce sends his charges to space via a Star Cruiser, and they discover how Zeh-Ro's getting the job done. He's using a space station and mini-satellites to block out the sun's rays, making the planet an icebox that'll kill all humans in a day or so. It's a smart plan because the station is well fortified, and the entire plot far outclasses the kind of similar thing that Mister Freeze used to do.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-batman-beyond.jpg\"/></figure><p>What's intimidating about Zeh-Ro is he has the genius of Freeze but also the guile of Ra's. He even lures Damian, Batwoman, Dick and Terry to a fake control room to jettison them into space, concluding a plot that was set up years before when he showed Ra's' grandson fake schematics.</p><p>Given his name and his affection for cold-based tech, there's even a chance that Zeh-Ro might be the son of Freeze and Nora in this universe. Freeze died at the hands of Blight in the animated episode, \"Meltdown,\" and Ra's may have raised Freeze'schild in secret. While Zeh-Ro's history remains shrouded in mystery, what's clear is that Zeh-Ro is a deadlier villain than Freeze ever was.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-beyond-future-bat-family/\">Batman Beyond Introduces the Future's New Bat-Family</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:20:53 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Beyond-Zeh-Ro-feature.jpg","linkMd5":"fc1004558fa95059e7d3ed636dfe2720","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn13@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-03-200_a6c78a93d0e35df6.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":162430,"destBytes":162430,"author":"Renaldo Matadeen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Beyond-Zeh-Ro-feature.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn13@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-03-200_a6c78a93d0e35df6.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/batman-beyond.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn42@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-10-057_395f4d0952ab41fc.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-batman-beyond.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn47@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-10-193_ba7b5cbd3a3303a6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Dragon Ball Super: Every Match In The Universe 6 Tournament (In Chronological Order)","link":"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-universe-6-tournament-every-match/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/u6t-fi.jpg\"/></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It admittedly took some time for </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-super\">Dragon Ball Super</a> </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">to get going. </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Battle of Gods</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> May have gotten modern </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball\">Dragon Ball</a> </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">off to a great start, but </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Resurrection F </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">immediately dropped the ball and </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s first two arcs almost killed the sequel before it even began. While many fans consider the Goku Black arc to be when </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">started to get good, the Universe 6 Tournament has a certain charm missing from every other arc in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"http://cbr.com/tag/dragon-ball-z\">Dragon Ball Super</a></span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-manga-anime-similarities-differences/\">Dragon Ball: 5 Things They Changed From Dragon Ball Super To The Manga (&#38; 5 That Stayed The Same)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Universe 6 Tournament was our first real look at </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s mythos, deliberately calling back to OG </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">in the process. Like Uranai Baba’s 5 on 5 exhibition, the Universe 6 Tournament saw the best fighters of Universes 7 and 6 going at it for the Super Dragon Balls. Although Universe 7 ultimately came out victorious, Goku and company came face to face with some of the oddest fights in the franchise. </span></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Son Goku Vs Botamo</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Botamo.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Universe 6 Tournament arc straddles a line between early </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s tone and the action of the Z-era. It’s debatable how well this balance works narratively and thematically, but it does lead to a comfortable atmosphere. Goku’s first fight against Botamo isn’t too exciting, but it plays out like a proper OG </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">match. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The manga does an especially good job at capturing the tone of the early tournaments. Botamo is a gag villain through and through, but Goku strategizing around this fact is charming. Goku earning his victory by ring-out is a reminder that he knows how to handle a tournament setting. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Son Goku Vs Frost</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Super-Saiyan-Goku-vs-Frost.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The fact that Goku is fighting first should be a sign that not all is as it seems in the Universe 6 Tournament. Realistically, there’s just no way </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’s first proper arc</span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">will let Goku either hog every match or bow out early. The fight against Frost tries to suggest the latter with Goku suddenly falling unconscious, but it’s clear something is amiss. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it’s revealed that Frost is fighting with poison, Goku is allowed to jump back into the fight. Instead of taking his former slot, however, Goku chooses to come after Vegeta– giving him an opportunity to study Hit when the time comes. As for Goku and Frost’s fight, it’s a big step up from Botamo, but the ending is anticlimactic. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Piccolo Vs Frost</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Frost-Frost-vs-Piccolo-Dragon-Ball-Super.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With Goku defeated by Frost, Piccolo steps into the arena to fight on behalf of Universe 7. Unfortunately, </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">makes it a point to mention how utterly outclassed Piccolo is. At best, he can do some damage on Frost, but he won’t be winning. It’s a detail that frankly holds the fight back. Piccolo can lose, but there’s no reason to spell it out. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-z-vs-super-which-series-better/\">Dragon Ball Z VS Dragon Ball Super: Which Series Is Better?</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Worse is that Piccolo loses, but gets the chance to stay in the tournament. Instead of taking his rightful place in the arena, Piccolo forfeits so Vegeta can knock his way through four of Universe 6’s five fighters. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Vegeta Vs Frost</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Frost-Vegeta-vs-Frost-Dragon-Ball-Super.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Vegeta’s fight against Frost is really nothing special and just highlights how poor of an introduction to the Universe 6 Tournament arc Frost is. Botamo was unexciting, but his match at least brought some early </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">atmosphere. The fight against Frost just feels like a way of rearranging Universe 7’s playing field. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Vegeta knocks out Frost with a single punch, moving onto the next match. There’s no reason Piccolo couldn’t have beaten Frost and then lost to Magetta. That would have at least prevented the tournament from dedicating nearly half of its fights to Vegeta. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Vegeta Vs Magetta</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Magetta-vs-Vegeta-Dragon-Ball-Super.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With Frost out of the way, however, the Universe 6 Tournament starts to really pick up. The fight against Magetta is one of the better matches in the arc, essentially an early </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">gag</span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">battle with the ridiculously powerful Vegeta as the leading man. It’s a genuinely exciting fight that forces Vegeta to strategize around his opponent. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When push comes to shove, though, Vegeta ends up winning the match by insulting the ultra sensitive Magetta. It’s a turn that feels appropriately </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball </span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">and ends up leading into what is arguably Vegeta’s best bit of character development in </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Dragon Ball Super</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Vegeta Vs Cabba</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Cabba-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cabba is the best thing to happen to Vegeta since Future Trunks’ death. The amount of fresh characterization Vegeta shows when confronting Cabba is outstanding. When face to face with what the Saiyan race became without a Frieza enslaving them, Vegeta sees fit to bring out the full potential he knows is lurking inside of Cabba. </span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-manga-best-chapters/\">Dragon Ball Super: 10 Best Chapters Of The Manga (So Far)</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Vegeta does this the only way he knows how– by being a callous monster– but it’s enough to trigger Super Saiyan in Cabba, along with a chain reaction that has Cabba teaching other U6 Saiyans the technique. Vegeta shows Cabba a flash of Super Saiyan Blue before taking him out, urging Cabba to keep training &#38; showing an important new side to the prince of all Saiyans. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Vegeta Vs Hit</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Vegeta-vs-Hit-Dragon-Ball-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Vegeta’s defeat at the hands of Hit is a bit different between the anime and manga. In the anime, Vegeta’s overwhelmed by Hit’s time skip, unable to fight back even in Super Saiyan Blue. In the manga, Vegeta triggering Super Saiyan Blue while fighting Cabba drains so much of his energy that even God Ki can’t defend him from Hit. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Hit clobbers Vegeta into submission in both adaptations, ruining the prince’s winning streak right at the finale. While Vegeta leaves the arena confused over how he lost, Goku’s seen enough to start devising a plan around Hit’s mysterious abilities. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Son Goku Vs Hit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Goku-vs-Hit.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Goku’s fight against Hit is also different between mediums, but far more significantly than Vegeta’s. In the anime, Hit gradually becomes more powerful as Goku tries to outmaneuver his time skip. Goku is forced to combine Kaioken with Super Saiyan Blue to fight back. He’s able to fight evenly with Hit, but he’s forced to turn off Kaioken, prematurely end the fight, and forfeit on his own terms.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the manga, Goku goes through every stage of Super Saiyan while fighting off Hit’s time skip. Hit never becomes more powerful and Goku is able to gain the upper hand by overwhelming the assassin with Super Saiyan Blue. Although he would have won, Goku forfeits the match regardless as he realizes Hit wasn’t fighting at full power with the intent to kill. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Monaka Vs Hit</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Monaka-Punched-Dragon-Ball-Super.png' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With every member of Universe 7 down for the count (Buu is disqualified as the fifth fighter in both adaptations,) Monaka is left to fight Hit. Monaka was always supposed to be a tool Beerus hyped up to motivate Goku and Vegeta. The intent was never for him to fight. In truth, Monaka is pitifully weak. Hit immediately recognizes this but chooses to play along.</span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Out of respect for Goku, Hit allows Monaka’s pitiful punch to land. Instead of tanking it, Hit launches himself backwards and out of the arena, handing victory over to Universe 7. It’s a satisfying, smart end to the tournament that highlights the profound effect Goku has on others.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dragon-ball-super-saiyan-vs-mystic-strongest-power-up/\">Dragon Ball: Super Saiyan vs Mystic: Which One Is Stronger?</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 18:30:09 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/u6t-fi.jpg","linkMd5":"ae5daf79ae2aa20a86021e3e239aa25e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn38@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-980_e16298e8980040d2.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":140032,"destBytes":140032,"author":"Renan Fontes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/u6t-fi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn38@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-980_e16298e8980040d2.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Botamo.jpg":null,"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Super-Saiyan-Goku-vs-Frost.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn42@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-14-177_e7a76d150cf354e7.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Frost-Frost-vs-Piccolo-Dragon-Ball-Super.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn1@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-06-656_ad7432bcb4f162d3.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Frost-Vegeta-vs-Frost-Dragon-Ball-Super.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-15-209_2f1dcd02b498a2bd.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Magetta-vs-Vegeta-Dragon-Ball-Super.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn65@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-12-055_5d42eff5e0f31c08.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Cabba-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn47@2020_1/2020/09/01/02-35-09-407_7ee24bc5134bc347.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Vegeta-vs-Hit-Dragon-Ball-Cropped.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn81@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-12-836_936b915896be4faa.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Goku-vs-Hit.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn45@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-10-943_b7bdf295d28c06de.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Monaka-Punched-Dragon-Ball-Super.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn94@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-08-076_52999a14ddee3939.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700508},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Demon Slayer: Kimetsu No Yaiba: 10 Pieces Of Rui Fan Art You Have To See","link":"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-anime-rui-fan-art/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rui-Header-Cropped.jpg\"/></figure><p>Many of the Lower Moons under <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-muzan-kibutsuji-facts/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Muzan</a> were dispatched rather brutally without ever getting to show off. Rui was one of the two exceptions, getting an entire arc to show off both his power and how disturbed a character that he was. The things he did to create the family he yearned for were twisted.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/kimetsu-no-yaiba-everything-we-know-kyojuro-rengoku-spin-off-manga/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Kimetsu No Yaiba: Everything We Know About The Kyojuro Rengoku Spin-Off Manga</a></span></p><p>This lets him be a good introductory <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/jojo-worst-thing-every-major-villain-did-ranked/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">villain</a> to the power of the moons before the <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/demon-slayer/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Demon Slayer</a></em> team has to deal with some of the heavier hitters later on in the series. Rui's desire for a family and his inability to understand how toxic the one he created was, made him an interesting <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-what-to-know-before-watching-mugen-train/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">demon</a>. He had a cool look, one evident in the following fan art.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Tied Around His Finger</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rui-Demon-Slayer.jpg' /></figure><p>Rui's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-katara-family-trivia/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">family</a> was always tied around his fingers, doing whatever he wished for them to do, ruling them as if they were subjects. Any demon that was pulled into his web would be trapped for as long as he desired. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/nyanea\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Nyanea</a> does a good job with the webbing, not only in having that silken glimmer but in how it easily curls around Rui's fingers with ease. He's able to manipulate it as if it were nothing more than a piece of string.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Family</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rui-Demon-Slaye-2.jpg' /></figure><p>His need for family stemmed from his time as a human. His human body was weak and frail, but his family loved him regardless, cherishing every moment with him. Unfortunately, that changed once <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/demon-slayer-muzan-kibutsuji-memes-hilarious/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Muzan</a> gave him the ability to walk, leading to the scene depicted here by <a class=\"_e75a791d-denali-editor-page-rtfLink\" href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/zthesoi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Zthesoi</a>. His family tried to kill him, seeing what he'd become, however, they weren't strong enough to finish the deed.
