The sight of this Bane alone would surely send his weaker enemies running.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>“Bane And Vader” By OSRO (Seoro Oh)</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bane-vader-fan-art.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/zgul-osr1113/art/Bane-and-Vader-318499575\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/zgul-osr1113/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Oh's DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p><a href=\"https://oseoro.tumblr.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Oseoro</a>, who makes animated films, has a little fun with the otherwise menacing Bane and Darth Vader’s shared aesthetic, having them sip food through straws while comparing notes about their masks.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-batman-bane-marvel-avengers-defeat-lose/\">Batman: 5 Avengers Bane Can Defeat (&#38; 5 He'd Lose To)</a></span></p><p>Unlike Vader, Bane did not <em>need</em> his mask to survive in <em>The Dark Knight Rises</em>, but <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dark-knight-trilogy-changes-comics/\">the gas it emitted</a> lessened his constant pain from failed attempts to heal his face after it was brutally beaten. Their food trays may ring a bell to astute fans of cinema, as they are in fact the same ones from <em>2001: A Space Odyssey</em>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>“Bane Vs. Batgirl” By AviKishundat</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-vs.-Batgirl-by-Avi-Kishundat.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/avikishundat/art/Bane-Vs-Batgirl-406621949\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/avikishundat/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">AviKishundat’s DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>While Bane has taken on and even teamed up with Batman no small amount of times, he has never taken on <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batgirl\">Batgirl</a>, at least in a <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/dc-comics-most-powerful-batgirl-villains-ranked/\">one-on-one fight</a>. His raised fists certainly have Barbara Gordon on high alert, but surprised or not, the Batarang in her hand could be her key to getting the upper hand on the hulking powerhouse.</p><p>If she aimed just right, Batgirl just might be able to severe Bane’s Venom tube. Provided, of course, the villain doesn’t dodge or block the weapon from reaching its destination.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>“Bane Fanart Batman Rises” By Brian Fajardo</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-fan-art-by-Brian-Fajardo.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/brianfajardo/art/Bane-fanart-Batman-Rises-311679743\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/brianfajardo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Fajardo's DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>Batman has often been called a “creature of the night,” but Bane just might take that title from him with this piece. The fan art depicts Bane with his arms out, fingers bent, and one bent leg forward, as if about to charge or pounce at a foe like a wild cat.</p><p>Bane's mask, which already resembles two rows of sharp teeth, amplifies that imagery even further. Meanwhile, the lightning bolt and the rain bouncing wildly off him make him seem even more menacing. This is a Bane who’s ready to break something.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>“Bane’s Secret” By Philip Rau</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-Mountain-Dew-fan-art-by-Philip-Rau.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/macaddict17/art/Bane-s-secret-149479040\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/macaddict17\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Rau’s DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>What if Bane’s source of super-strength was something a little more… refreshing? Rau replaces Venom with something even more extreme — at least that’s what Mountain Dew's commercials certainly suggest!</p><p>Bane may not necessarily get a big <em>strength</em> boost from his new “power source,” but the sugar and caffeine are bound to give him plenty of energy to go a few rounds with the Caped Crusader and his crew. Of course, since Mountain Dew is a PepsiCo product, he could end up attracting the attention of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/most-powerful-japanese-comic-characters-ranked/\">Japanese superhero</a> and Pepsi mascot Pepsiman, who’d no doubt disapprove of Bane Doing the Dew for evil.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>“Villainy Mix: BANECROCODILE” By Gingashi</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Villainy-Mix-Banecrocodile-fan-art-by-Gingashi.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/gingashi/art/Villainy-Mix-BANECROCODILE-100694513\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/gingashi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Gingashi's DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>Bane and Killer Croc are <em>not</em> friends. The first time they met, Bane broke both of Croc’s arms. Waylon fared somewhat better <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-best-fight-knightfall-ranked/\">in their rematch</a> but still got one arm broken yet again, and ultimately lost.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-dc-bane-drug-venom-facts/\">Batman: 10 Things DC Fans Don’t Know About Bane’s Drug, Venom</a></span></p><p>As much as the two characters hate each other, however, they would be a brutal foe if combined together. Gingashi gives Banecrocodile a slightly modified version of Bane’s traditional costume while borrowing from various incarnations of Killer Croc for the character’s physique. With Waylon Jones’ enhanced reptilian strength, speed and regeneration at his disposal — not to mention his sharp claws and teeth — Bane would become an absolutely vicious opponent. Doubly so when the Venom starts flowing.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>“Bane” By Craig Spence</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bane-by-cspencey-db3i2hx.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/cspencey/art/Bane-671009829\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/cspencey/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Spence's DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>In the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/new-52\">New 52</a>, Bane sometimes wore a hybrid of his classic and Christopher Nolan movie looks. Spence follows suit, with minor alterations like making Bane’s long coat sleeveless and giving the character a tattoo. One highly notable change is the Venom delivery system, whose wrist device no longer connects to the back of his head.</p><p>Whether this means Bane is off the drug or has changed Venom’s transfer method is unknown, as he has often worn his Venom equipment even when no longer taking it. Spence <em>has</em> modified Bane’s backstory for this piece, however, which updates an <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/cspencey/art/Bane-599497908\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">older drawing</a> tying the character more closely to Talia and Ra’s Al Ghul.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>“Batman – Knightfall – Commission” by Jeremy Hale Bronaugh</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Knightfall-fan-art-commission-by-Jeremy-Hale-Bronaugh.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/jeremyhalebronaugh/art/Batman-Knightfall-Commission-800943361\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/jeremyhalebronaugh/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Bronaugh’s DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p>Bronaugh homages the storyline that <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/reasons-batman-knightfall-should-join-dcs-animated-movie-universe/\">put Bane on the map</a>, drawing him looming over not just Batman. The art piece also includes the man who would replace Bruce Wayne, Jean-Paul Valley, and two villains Bane used to weaken the Dark Knight’s resolve, the Joker and the Scarecrow.</p><p>As part of his master plan to defeat Batman, Bane had attacked Arkham Asylum, setting many of the Dark Knight’s foes free so they could slowly wear him down. Bane would then confront Batman within the Batcave and snap his back, but later on was ultimately defeated by Bruce’s successor, Jean-Paul.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>“Batman- Bane” By Piktips</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Beware-the-Batman-Bane-fan-art-by-piktips.jpg' /></figure><p><a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/piktips/art/Batman-Bane-609298098\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Original image</a> from <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/piktips/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Piktips’ DeviantArt page</a>.</p><p><em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-batman/\">The Batman</a></em> was a cartoon series unafraid to experiment with the designs of Batman’s friends and foes. One of the more radical examples was Bane, who wore a full-body black and grey armored suit that even covered his eyes and mouth, as seen on the left. The picture on the right, however, shows Bane when on Venom, which on the show was depicted as an outright transformation, changing his size and even turning his skin red.</p><p>This Bane was stronger than most other versions, as well as impervious to gunfire. On one occasion, Batman resorted to a robot suit to take him down and <em>still</em> had trouble.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/10-awesome-bane-cosplay-every-batman-dc-fan-needs-to-see/\">10 Awesome Bane Cosplay Every Batman &#38; DC Fan Needs To See</a></span></p>\n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 02:00:28 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-fan-art-banner.jpg","linkMd5":"b5cd9bdcaf66d7f622123d0f854539e2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn90@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-03-170_18ac889e0a271c96.webp","destWidth":1710,"destHeight":900,"sourceBytes":217598,"destBytes":217598,"author":"Tomas Balino","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-fan-art-banner.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn90@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-03-170_18ac889e0a271c96.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-vs-Venom-fan-art-by-Andy-W.-Timm.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn81@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-124_db328e2e40128511.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-fan-art-by-Jose-Real.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn53@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-14-461_b2a7509ddb2b56a3.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bane-vader-fan-art.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn86@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-12-124_9ca07dbd948aff76.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-vs.-Batgirl-by-Avi-Kishundat.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-fan-art-by-Brian-Fajardo.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn54@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-11-006_d099c8ea67a74a38.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Bane-Mountain-Dew-fan-art-by-Philip-Rau.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn83@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-17-191_5c74773e386764f3.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Villainy-Mix-Banecrocodile-fan-art-by-Gingashi.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-17-276_04a55c8f2badeae3.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bane-by-cspencey-db3i2hx.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn13@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-08-993_4ea0a39513f52b30.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Knightfall-fan-art-commission-by-Jeremy-Hale-Bronaugh.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn77@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-09-609_98374ad04bab2801.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Beware-the-Batman-Bane-fan-art-by-piktips.jpg":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Black Panther’s Michael B. Jordan Makes Powerful Dedication to Chadwick Boseman","link":"https://www.cbr.com/black-panther-michael-b-jordan-dedication-chadwick-boseman/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/killmonger.jpg\"/></figure><p><em>Black Panther </em>co-star Michael B. Jordon wrote a powerful tribute to the film's titular star, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/chadwick-boseman/\">Chadwick Boseman</a>.</p><p>Boseman, who also portrays King T'Challa / Black Panther in<i> Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War </i>and <em>Avengers: Endgame, </em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/chadwick-boseman-obituary/\">died at the age of 43</a> after battling colon cancer since 2016. Despite progressing from stage III at diagnosis to stage IV, Boseman continued to act, appearing in 2017's <em>Marshall, </em>2019's <em>21 Bridges</em> and 2020's <i>Da 5 Bloods.</i></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/petition-replace-confederate-statue-chadwick-boseman-hometown/\">Fans Petition to Replace Confederate Statue With One of Chadwick Boseman in the Actor's Hometown</a></span></p><p>Jordan, who stars as <em>Black Panther</em>'s villain Erik Killmonger, shared his full statement on <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEkpoYcgi43/?utm_source=ig_embed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Instagram</a>, and it can be found in full below:</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CEkpoYcgi43/?utm_source=ig_embed\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p>\"I've been trying to find the words, but nothing comes close to how I feel. I've been reflecting on every moment, every conversation, every laugh, every disagreement, every hug…everything.</p><p>I wish we had more time.</p><p>One of the last times we spoke, you said we were forever linked , and now the truth of that means more to me than ever. Since nearly the beginning of my career, starting with <em>All My Children</em> when I was 16 years old you paved the way for me. You showed me how to be better, honor purpose, and create legacy. And whether you’ve known it or not…I’ve been watching, learning and constantly motivated by your greatness.</p><p>I wish we had more time.</p><p>Everything you've given the world … the legends and heroes that you’ve shown us we are … will live on forever. But the thing that hurts the most is that I now understand how much of a legend and hero YOU are. Through it all, you never lost sight of what you loved most. You cared about your family , your friends, your craft, your spirit. You cared about the kids, the community, our culture and humanity. You cared about me. You are my big brother, but I never fully got a chance to tell you, or to truly give you your flowers while you were here.</p><p>I wish we had more time.</p><p>I'm more aware now than ever that time is short with people we love and admire. I'm gonna miss your honesty, your generosity, your sense of humor, and incredible gifts. I'll miss the gift of sharing space with you in scenes. I'm dedicating the rest of my days to live the way you did. With grace, courage, and no regrets. 'Is this your king!?' Yes . he . is! Rest In Power Brother.\"</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/artist-honors-chadwick-boseman-mind-blowing-painting/\">Artist Bou bou Honors Chadwick Boseman With a Mind-Blowing Painting</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 01:12:10 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/killmonger.jpg","linkMd5":"d2200dff489df118967597eff442386e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn59@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-04-399_4c7863e10edbbc9d.webp","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":640,"sourceBytes":96502,"destBytes":79172,"author":"Samuel Gelman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/killmonger.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn59@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-04-399_4c7863e10edbbc9d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"My Hero Academia: 10 Pieces Of Melissa Fan Art We Love | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-melissa-fan-art/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-2020-08-26T024656.956.jpg\"/></figure><p>Throughout <em><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/my-hero-academia/\">My Hero Academia</a>, </em>fans follow Izuku as he transforms from a quirkless nobody into the next user of the legendarily powerful One For All, but that isn't to say that every character <em>has </em>to develop a quirk to feel and act like a hero.</p><p>A great example of this is Melissa Shield, a quirkless young girl who was introduced to viewers in the first official movie for the series, \"Two Heroes.\" In the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-love-annoyed-by-mei-hatsume/\">same vein as Mei Hatsume</a>, Melissa looks instead to what she can invent and create to be a hero in her own way, rather than lamenting her lack of a quirk.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-things-got-right-vs-left-out/\">My Hero Academia: 5 Things The Anime Got Right (&#38; 5 It Never Did)</a></span></p><p>She's an incredibly bright, intelligent, and positive spirit who quickly makes friends with most of the main cast quite easily, but especially with Izuku. She's even risked her life against villains despite not having powers like many of the other characters, and, combined with her radiant appearance, it's no wonder fan artists took a liking to her.</p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Glasses Off</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/my-hero-academia-two-heroes-melissa-shield-by-bluewolfartista-dck2x91.jpg' /></figure><p>Due to<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-10-best-deku-quotes/\"> how similar Izuku and Melissa are in personality</a> and their shared worldview of wanting to be able to become someone's hero in their own way, it didn't take long for fans to begin thinking they might be compatible romantically. This gorgeous piece by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/bluewolfartista\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">BlueWolfArtista</a> captures this tension-filled moment between them quite well. With how Melissa's blushing and awkwardly fidgeting with her hair, one can only wonder how embarrassed Izuku must look on the other side of the piece.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Formal Heroes</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/party-by-yuukiartda-dcoaxpn.png' /></figure><p>Especially once tensions in the series start to rise, casual moments of peace become somewhat less common, so, when they do happen, it's all the more enjoyable. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/yuukiartda\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Yuukiartda</a> managed to create an incredibly fun piece displaying a formal Melissa interacting with the members of U.A High, and it's just great to see. Everyone's personalities are colorfully displayed through their actions here, even down to <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-ochaco-uraraka-cosplay/\">Uraraka looking slightly pouty</a> as Izuku instead blushes at a smiling Melissa.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Father Figures</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-dads-by-takashidaimao-dcpjt26-fullview.jpg' /></figure><p>Although he isn't actually related to Melissa, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-things-fans-want-forget-all-might/\">All Might</a> and her father have such a close bond that from an incredibly young age, Melissa addressed him as Uncle Might. Not only is this endearing and downright adorable, but <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/takashidaimao\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Takashidaimo</a> made it even cuter by drawing this piece of Melissa resting on All Might's arm while he and her father converse.</p><p>It's no wonder that Melissa sticks so firmly to her ideals of wanting to be someone's hero despite being quirkless since she would have had All Might as a pretty close role model from such a young age.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Wide-Eyed Fascination</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/My-Hero-Academia-Melissa-Shield-Fascinated.jpg' /></figure><p>Melissa's expressive, curious personality makes her quite the joy to witness on-screen, and <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/mikazukiblue\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">MikazukiBlue</a> captures her rosy cheeks and sparkling eyes perfectly. The lineart on this piece is incredibly colorful and interesting, playing around with RGB to add more little lines of blue and red tones throughout.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-couples-best-worst/\">My Hero Academia: 8 Couples That Are Perfect Together (&#38; 7 That Make No Sense)</a></span></p><p>It's colored beautifully, and Melissa's personality is on full display even for those unfamiliar with the series or perhaps just her character. Finally, the simple background works in this case, as all of the viewer's attention is drawn to her expression.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Beaming Heroes</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melissa-and-deku-boku-no-hero-two-heroes-by-darlo98-dcz9a8w.jpg' /></figure><p>While this one isn't a fully original piece of fan art, it's still quite impressive whenever fans take official drawings from the series creator and color them in, breathing new life and appreciation into them. <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/darlo98\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Darlo98</a> captures how sweet and <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-izuku-midoriya-death/\">radiant both Melissa and Izuku are</a>, with both of their expressions being incredibly cute. While the coloring itself is quite simple, it helps keep the focus on the quality of the original lineart rather than overpowering it.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Empowered Engineers</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melissa-shield-and-mei-hatsume-by-luizhtx-dcro501.jpg' /></figure><p>It makes sense that the two engineering powerhouses would make for great friends, which makes it such a shame that Melissa doesn't actually <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-mei-hatsume-facts/\">get to meet Mei</a> throughout the movie. That was fixed wonderfully by <a href=\"https://www.deviantart.com/luizhtx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">luizhtx</a>, who drew them standing together, with Mei waving excitedly towards the viewer while Melissa chooses to flash a peace sign. The artist notes that they didn't fully clean-up the lineart, but that honestly sort of lends itself to their style, without anything looking too messy or unfinished.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Confident Gaze</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Melissa's one of the most optimistic characters in the series by far, and that's saying something when many of the cast have the ultimate beacon of hope, All Might, to look up to. Her drive and brimming brilliance is on full display in this piece by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/nunchifox/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">nunchifox</a>, and it shows their dedication to her character when she's what came to mind when the prompt was simply \"glasses.\" The small splash of color that her golden locks add to the piece make it much more dynamic, and the floating roses around her are a great touch.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Serene Smile</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Melissa is an incredibly earnest and endearing character, and her beaming smile is on full display here in this piece by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/artzy_haypi/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">artzy_haypi</a>. They include three slight variations, too, one where the outline isn't colored at all, and then both half-and-full shaded versions, as well. Her smile comes off as genuine and makes her seem reliable and warm-hearted, both of which suit her character quite well.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-best-rivalries-ranked/\">My Hero Academia: The 10 Best Rivalries, Ranked</a></span></p><p>The slight shading is quite nice and resembles the actual show's style nicely. It's left a mystery who she's smiling at, but, with how well the fan community received them when the movie launched, there's <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-izuku-midoriya-more-powerful-characters/\">a good chance its Izuku</a>.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Earnest Expression</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>It's always endearing whenever fan artists love a shot of a character so much that they want to recreate it, simply with their own unique touch. <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/ririka_artt/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ririka_artt</a> accomplishes that perfectly with their recreation of Melissa in her formal outfit near the end of the movie. The choice to include the markers that they used in the picture is a great touch, and they even include a version that only showcases the art itself in case viewers want it in more detail. The marker coloring looks great, and Melissa's shining golden hair is especially well-captured.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Deer In The Headlights</h2><figure><img src='' /></figure><p>Melissa is a bright, beaming ball of sunshine throughout her appearances in the first movie, which makes the duality of seeing her terrified of the unknown quite interesting. This is especially true in the case of <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/redsymoe/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Redsymoe's</a> rendition of her, with their super-expressive cartoonish style.</p><p>The lines are thick and super-exaggerated, and the pale contrast of the coloring helps them, as well as her wide, bright eyes, really stand out. One can only wonder what sort of horror would have gotten her so shaken up, but let's hope it doesn't pose a real threat to such a sweet character.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/my-hero-academia-10-all-might-quotes-that-inspire-all-of-us/\">My Hero Academia: 10 All Might Quotes That Inspire All Of Us</a></span></p>\n                        \n Grimes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/pjimage-2020-08-26T024656.956.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn96@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-02-361_efe90507697d7d31.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/my-hero-academia-two-heroes-melissa-shield-by-bluewolfartista-dck2x91.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn61@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-07-847_d7e753df1fbae697.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/party-by-yuukiartda-dcoaxpn.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn94@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-14-770_1541bbee1939249d.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/2-dads-by-takashidaimao-dcpjt26-fullview.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-16-027_88d867cab25cfc9a.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/My-Hero-Academia-Melissa-Shield-Fascinated.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn13@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-13-113_8e47efca7556deaf.webp","https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melissa-and-deku-boku-no-hero-two-heroes-by-darlo98-dcz9a8w.jpg":null,"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/melissa-shield-and-mei-hatsume-by-luizhtx-dcro501.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn5@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-13-153_3b5b5e8bbd8a2d65.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700502},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Bill & Ted Face the Music Has a Righteous George Carlin Tribute","link":"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-george-carlin/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-and-ted-3.jpg\"/></figure><p><b><i>WARNING: The following contains major spoilers for </i></b><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/bill-and-ted-3/\"><span class=\"s1\"><b><i>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</i></b></span></a><b><i>, now in theaters and on premium video on demand.</i></b></p><p>In <em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music</em>, the Wyld Stallyns are sputtering in their seemingly endless, supposedly inevitable, quest to write the perfect song through which they'll unite humanity and save reality. This leads them to once again start bouncing through time. However, as a result of the comedian's death in 2008, Rufus isn't there to guide the heroes. Still, <em>Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music </em>pays homage to Carlin in a great way.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-music-interview-ed-solomon-chris-matheson/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music's Ed Solomon &#38; Chris Matheson Break Down the Long-Awaited Sequel</a></span></p><p>Kelly -- Rufus' daughter -- instead serves as the Wyld Stallyns' guide, which is a nice touch to keep a connection to Carlin's character in the film. While it's fitting she is the one who first escorts the heroes forward through time, the Stallyns eventually come face to face with Rufus' past and his wife, along with the iconic phone booth.</p><p>Bill and Ted first encounter their old time travelling phone booth when they're brought to the future. Inside is a hologram of Rufus, who comes to greet them. The short scene is uses old footage from the first movie, and producers even had a similar sounding actor record a few extra lines to include in the scene. Instead of relying on a larger CGI sequences, these moments are restrained in the best, most respectful way.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-ted-face-the-music-post-credits-scene/\">Does Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Have a Post-Credits Scene?</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rufus-Bill-and-Ted.jpg\"/></figure><p>There is also a duality of sorts with the legacy of Carlin’s character in the film. The Rufus' widow, played by Holland Taylor, is now the future’s Ultimate Leader. She is the prime antagonist for Bill and Ted, whom she has lost faith in to record the song that will save them all. Having Taylor’s character is a nice and easy way to keep the feeling of having Carlin around in these scenes.</p><p>Carlin’s presence in the films always gave the impression that he was like the band's road manager of sorts. He was the one guiding the boys towards their destiny to save everyone. When not bestowing them with encouragement, gifts and matchmaking advice, Carlin always seemed to be going along with Bill and Ted in spirit. 12 years after his death, in a very heartwarming way, he is still there in spirit, tagging along for their final journey.</p><p><em>Directed by Dean Parisot and written by Chris Matheson and Ed Solomon, Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music stars Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, Anthony Carrigan, Kid Cudi, Brigette Lundy-Paine and Samara Weaving. The film is now in theaters and on premium video on demand.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/bill-and-ted-face-the-music-review/\">Bill &#38; Ted Face the Music Is a Most Uplifting Threequel</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 31 Aug 2020 20:45:06 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-and-ted-3.jpg","linkMd5":"9968923473f0d5c43e90b4b404f78e9b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn58@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-683_562f052750f1c6a7.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":95908,"destBytes":95908,"author":"Sean Ellard","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/bill-and-ted-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn58@2020_5/2020/09/01/02-35-00-683_562f052750f1c6a7.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Rufus-Bill-and-Ted.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn80@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-15-492_601d3cf1342f5c3c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700506},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Batman: The Dark Knight Proves He Can STILL Fight Like a Bat","link":"https://www.cbr.com/joker-war-batman-bats-inspired/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Joker-War-hallucination.jpg\"/></figure><p><em><strong>WARNING: The following contains spoilers for </strong></em><strong><a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/batman/\">Batman</a> <em>#97, by James Tynion IV, Jorge Jimenez, and Tomeau Morey, on sale now.</em></strong></p><p>As \"<a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/joker-war/\">Joker War</a>\" rages on in the streets of Gotham, and a powerful new fear toxin is raging through the bloodstream of the Dark Knight. To make matters worse, the Clown Prince of Crime has unleashed a \"zombie\" army, and Batman is forced to take a page out of a real bat's playbook.</p><p>So far the Joker War has been an increasing set of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-joker-war-dark-knight-clown-prince-dynamic/\">terrible scenarios for Bruce Wayne</a>. First, the locations of his micro-caves were tortured out of Lucius Fox by the <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/joker/\">Joker</a>. Next, he was dosed with a three-part chemical cocktail of Joker toxin, venom and the Scarecrow's fear toxin before discovering that the Joker had successfully stolen (as well as repainted) all of his vehicles and gadgets. Finally, the Joker unveiled an army of dead Jokerized victims that have been reanimated using nanobots and uses them to attack Batman.</p><p>In <em>Batman</em> #97, the third issue of \"Joker War,\" picks up with Batman attempting to fend off these pseudo zombies in the Monarch theatre - which is, of course, the site of his childhood trauma - while the Joker taunts him from the big screen.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/joker-war-batman-arkham-games-cues/\">Joker War Takes Terrifying Cue From Arkham Games</a></span></p><figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-blindfolded.png\"/></figure><p>If all of this wasn't bad enough it is made incredibly apparent that Punchline's special blend is still working it's twisted magic on Batman's nervous system, causing extreme visual hallucinations which make it nearly impossible for him to put up a fight against the grinning reanimated horde. Being the Dark Knight, however, he has one more trick up his sleeve, or on his cloak to be precise. Realizing that he cannot fight with his eyes playing tricks on him, Bruce tears a strip from his cloak and ties it over his eyes. He then relies on his other senses in order to come out on top of the brawl. While this blindfolded fighting move has been seen in a variety of different stories the idea of the blind fighter is probably best represented by Marvel's Daredevil.</p><p>Matt Murdock, aka Daredevil, unlike Batman, is actually blind and relies on his other senses (which are supernaturally heightened) in order to perceive the world around him. This is relatively well-represented in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/hawkeye-vs-bullseye-invokes-netflix-daredevil-series/\">Netflix's now-defunct <em>Daredevil</em> series</a> as well as more recent issues of his comic. The black blindfold is a semi iconic look for Daredevil and is featured in both the Netflix series and more recent Daredevil comics.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-joker-war-clownhunter-gotham-vigilante/\">Joker War Turns Clown Hunter Into Gotham's Deadliest Vigilante</a></span></p><p>While there may be a nod to a Marvel hero here, the idea of fighting based primarily on sound is fitting for Batman as well, since he's not unlike an actual bat using echolocation. He references this himself saying that a bat should be able to fight blind while managing to still look menacing with a piece of cloth over his eyes. Of course, he doesn't finish the fight simply via his own martial arts skills but instead with the use of a hand-held EMP which shuts down the nanobots and returns the Jokerized corpses to being just that once again.</p><p>Even with the obvious differences in consideration, it speaks to Batman's skill and training that he is able to quickly adopt a new set of fighting abilities inspired by the creatures that famously inspired him to take up his war on crime.</p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/batman-long-halloween-guide/\">Batman: The Long Halloween - A Complete Guide to DC's Most Puzzling Mystery</a></span></p><p><!-- Used for easily cloning the properly namespaced rect --></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:20:35 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Joker-War-hallucination.jpg","linkMd5":"f6d590ace090d0934270d3836e81380e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn93@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-784_ee32fba3817b0857.webp","destWidth":1400,"destHeight":700,"sourceBytes":137174,"destBytes":137174,"author":"Carter Burrowes","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-Joker-War-hallucination.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn93@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-01-784_ee32fba3817b0857.webp","https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Batman-blindfolded.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn27@2020_6/2020/09/01/02-35-15-899_6356ce70f57402d5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Charlie Kaufman's I'm Thinking of Ending Things Is Mind-Bending Nonsense","link":"https://www.cbr.com/charlie-kaufman-im-thinking-of-ending-things-review/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-header.jpg\"/></figure><p>What things, exactly, are the protagonist of Charlie Kaufman’s <em><a href=\"https://screenrant.com/tag/im-thinking-of-ending-things/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">I’m Thinking of Ending Things</a></em> thinking of ending? When the character, played by Jessie Buckley, first speaks those words in voiceover in the opening moments of the movie, it sounds like she’s contemplating suicide. But Kaufman soon introduces the young woman’s boyfriend Jake (Jesse Plemons), and her inner monologue about their relationship shifts the meaning of those initial words, making it seem like she’s thinking of ending her romance with this man she doesn’t feel connected to. As the movie goes on, though, growing increasingly surreal and disjointed, it’s easy to wonder if this woman is actually thinking of ending all space and time.</p><p>Kaufman, of course, provides no easy answers, and anyone familiar with the filmmaker’s work wouldn’t expect him to. Especially since he started directing his own screenplays, Kaufman has specialized in the inscrutable, in movies that filter emotions through bizarre metaphysical scenarios and challenge the audience to establish connections with the characters. Adapted from the 2016 novel by Iain Reid, <em>I’m Thinking of Ending Things</em> is just as confounding as Kaufman’s previous directorial efforts, 2008’s <em>Synecdoche, New York</em> and 2015’s <em>Anomalisa</em>, with a central couple whose relationship is constantly in flux, an unreliable narrator and a plot that is constantly shifting direction.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/raised-by-wolves-review-ridley-scott/\">Ridley Scott Comes to TV With Eerie Sci-Fi Drama Raised by Wolves</a></span></p><p>It’s impressively ambitious and strange, but it’s often tedious to watch, especially during the long car-trip sequences in which Jake and his girlfriend (whose name may be Lucy or Lucia or Louisa or Amy) talk in circles, quoting literature and philosophy and film at each other without ever communicating anything. Their inability to understand each other is part of the point, but their conversations are tedious rather than illuminating, and there’s no insight into intimacy or their individual mental states.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-david-thewlis-toni-collette.jpg\"/></figure><p>Lucy (or whatever her name is) narrates the movie incessantly, sometimes the dialogue even interrupts her voiceover, but she doesn’t seem to have an actual personality since the details of her life constantly change. She may be a poet, a painter or a physicist, but the poem she recites is actually a piece by Canadian poet Eva H.D. and the paintings she shows off come from museum prints. When she tries to make a point about a John Cassavetes movie, she just recites a Pauline Kael review verbatim.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-david-thewlis-reveals-sequels-hes-in/\">Avatar: David Thewlis Reveals Which of the Sequels He's In</a></span></p><p>Jake and Lucy spend so much time in the car because they’re on a trip to meet his parents, who are also never named and are played by Toni Collette and David Thewlis. Once they arrive at the remote family farmhouse, everything there keeps changing, too. Jake’s parents are middle-aged and chatty, and then they’re elderly, suffering from dementia and barely able to get out of bed or feed themselves. Later, his mom is young, picking up toys that she says are Jake’s. Lucy doesn’t understand any of this, although Jake seems to just go with it, or perhaps he's used to the slippery nature of time in his home.</p><figure><img src=\"https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-jessie-buckley.jpg\"/></figure><p>All of this uncertainty makes it impossible to get a handle on any of the characters, and while Buckley and Plemons give committed performances, Jake and Lucy never come across as actual people. Collette and Thewlis are suitably creepy as Jake’s parents, and the segment of the movie that takes place at the farmhouse features plenty of horror-movie elements, including an ominous locked basement with scratches on the door and evasive anecdotes about dead pigs. But <em>I'm Thinking of Ending Things</em> isn’t a horror movie, or even a meta deconstruction of horror movies, and Jake and Lucy spend less than half the movie with Jake’s parents.</p><p>Then they’re back on the road, stopping at a desolate ice cream stand in the middle of a snow storm, and eventually at Jake’s old high school, where the movie turns from surreal into complete nonsense, albeit nonsense that is artfully crafted and often mesmerizing. There have been flashes throughout the movie of an older janitor (Guy Boyd) at this same school, and that janitor may be Jake himself, or a manifestation of some aspect of his personality. Kaufman stages an entire dream ballet, the abstract style of dance sequence popular in classic movie musicals like <em>An American in Paris</em> and <em>Oklahoma!</em>, in the halls of the school, and while it’s beautiful to watch, it seems only tenuously connected to the story.</p><p>Like the works of David Foster Wallace and William Wordsworth, <em>Oklahoma!</em> is another piece of culture that Jake obsesses over, and Kaufman seizes on it for the movie’s bizarre, non sequitur finale. Unlike Reid’s novel, which concludes with a more conventional thriller-style twist, Kaufman’s film ends in complete opaqueness, dashing any hopes of resolution or narrative progression. It’s audacious and odd and unique, but it doesn’t really add up to anything.</p><p><em>Starring Jessie Buckley, Jesse Plemons, Toni Collette, David Thewlis and Guy Boyd, I’m Thinking of Ending Things premieres Friday, Sept. 4 on Netflix.</em></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">KEEP READING: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/lake-michigan-monster-review/\">Lake Michigan Monster Is a Delightfully Funny Fever-Dream</a></span></p>\n                        \n                        \n                    ","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 01 Sep 2020 00:45:24 +0000","feedId":3746,"bgimg":"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-header.jpg","linkMd5":"bf08c60a837679cbb12e59ab20434bf7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn54@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-969_dfad386537686da1.webp","destWidth":3600,"destHeight":1800,"sourceBytes":793032,"destBytes":406080,"author":"Josh Bell","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-header.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn54@2020_3/2020/09/01/02-35-00-969_dfad386537686da1.webp","https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-david-thewlis-toni-collette.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn26@2020_2/2020/09/01/02-35-09-246_97019f5ed0abc6ef.webp","https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/im-thinking-of-ending-things-jessie-buckley.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn41@2020_4/2020/09/01/02-35-05-985_b02f22ce704e72ca.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598927700503},{"createdTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","updatedTime":"2020-09-01 10:35:00","title":"Avatar: The 15 Most Powerful Benders | CBR","link":"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-most-powerful-benders-all-time/","description":"\n                        \n                        <figure><img src=\"https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Avatar-Strongest-Benders-Feature.jpg\"/></figure><p>The world of <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/avatar-the-last-airbender/\"><em>Avatar</em></a> is positively littered with some truly incredible benders. While there are some truly powerful benders throughout the series, it takes someone truly special to create something new with their bending.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-10-facts-you-didnt-know-about-ba-sing-se/\">Avatar: 10 Facts You Didn't Know About Ba Sing Se</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Powers like lava-bending, metal-bending, blood-bending, and flight are all-natural evolutions of the basic bending forms, but none of them would have been possible without the powerful benders that pushed their elements to the limits. The Avatars may have been the ultimates when it comes to mastering the various elements, however, there are certain skills that take a certain specialization to truly grasp.</span></p><p><em><strong>Updated By Amanda Bruce On August 31st, 2020:</strong> Between Aang and Korra's stories, there are so many incredible benders that we just can't leave it at the top ten benders. Now, even more of the most powerful benders in the Avatar universe have been added to demonstrate some truly awesome feats.</em></p>\n                        <h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">15 </span>Ming-Hua</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Alsoidliketotalkaboutminghuabeingthat-3a3a21b3058eef140ce4d434b2e987d9.jpg' /></figure><p>Ming-Hua might be a villain, but she's a truly impressive water-bender. Water bending is often seen to be dependent on the movement of someone's appendages. Katara initially has trouble when she can't get her hand motions exactly right. Ming-Hua perfects water bending without the need for those hand motions.</p><p>That's because she doesn't actually have arms to utilize. She manages to truly make her element an extension of herself, using water in place of her arms for a more fluid method of attack altogether. It's no wonder people have such a hard time besting her.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">14 </span>Zuko</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/KidsTV4.jpg' /></figure><p>Zuko doesn't get a lot of screen time as a bender in <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/tag/the-legend-of-korra/\"><em>The Legend Of Korra</em></a>, but the audience gets to steadily <a href=\"https://screenrant.com/avatar-zuko-character-arc-masterpiece/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">watch him improve</a> (in more ways than one) in the original series. He's able to eventually master every technique his uncle teaches him.</p><p>Zuko spends the bulk of his young life training and perfecting his technique. He even accepts, eventually, that he won't be able to master every technique because some fire-benders just might have more raw power than him.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">13 </span>Azula</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Avatar-The-Last-Airbender-Azula.jpg' /></figure><p>One of those fire-benders with more raw power is his own sister. Azula might be unhinged, but she's an incredible fire-bender. She's one of very few benders in the entire franchise to be able <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-lightningbending-things-fans-know/\">to use lightning</a>.</p><p>Bending lightning takes even more concentration and power than bending fire. Even Avatar Kyoshi isn't able to bend lightning during her 230 year lifetime. It also takes the combined force of Zuko and Katara to finally defeat her.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">12 </span>Jinora</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/jinora.jpg' /></figure><p>Jinora is a surprisingly strong bender. She's not someone the audience would expect to be so powerful when she debuts in <em>Legend Of Korra</em>, but she grows to have some serious skills.</p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/the-legend-of-korra-better-avatar-the-last-airbender/\">10 Things The Legend Of Korra Does Better Than The Last Avatar</a></span></p><p>Jinora has the honor of being one of the youngest air bending masters - ever. That's quite a feat considering her grandfather became the Avatar. It's not just her air bending that lands her here. She has strong power outside of her command of air; she's incredibly young to be able to communicate with spirits and enter the Spirit World, but she's able to lead Korra through the experience.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">11 </span>Kyoshi</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/kyoshi.jpg' /></figure><p>Kyoshi is the Avatar two generations before Aang. Though she's not the Avatar Aang communicates with most often, she is definitely one of the most powerful.</p><p>Born an earth-bender, Kyoshi commands all elements, but it's truly earth where she excels. She does, after all, use her ability to break off a piece of a continent, further separating the two pieces of land with lava bending, to create Kyoshi Island. She's the only Avatar we know of who created her own island.</p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">10 </span>Kuvira</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/DnD-LoK-kuvira-7.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Earth-benders are already an incredibly tough bunch. With the fortitude of the earth beneath them, they are able to unleash devastating attacks while standing their ground and rooted in the earth beneath them. Kuvira takes these principles to the extreme. <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-legend-korra-kuvira-characters-defeat-lose/\">She is incredibly tough</a> as one of the strongest metal-benders alive during the time that Korra is Avatar. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With this great strength, she takes control of a faltering Earth kingdom and pushes the Avatar herself to her very limits. Kuvira is cold, impenetrable and only made malleable through great force and external pressure, just like the element she uses with devastating efficiency. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">9 </span>Bumi</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Avatar-The-Last-Airbender-Bumi.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Bumi is another truly impressive earth-bender that uses his element like few others throughout the course of the two series. While he has a personality much like that of an air-bender, Bumi is one of the most powerful earth-benders around during Aang’s time as the Avatar. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Audiences may only get a peek at his elemental prowess as they are only introduced to him when he is over a century old, but that only makes the spritely Bumi more impressive. He may not have the body of his younger self, but even with his aging body, he’s still able to show the fire nation (and Aang) what earth-bending is really about. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">8 </span>Zaheer</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Zaheer-flying-in-Legend-of-Korra.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Zaheer may not have <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-fans-know-about-airbending/\">been an air-bender</a> for very long, but during his brief tenure he was able to not only take down the Avatar, but he was able to accomplish what few air-benders before him could, flight. The air-nation may have been devastated by the fire nation long before his time, but even so Zaheer perfect embodied the spirit of the air nation. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While he may have been much more serious than many of the air-bender that audiences were introduced to, he took their teachings to heart and used the free-flowing air nomad teaching to enact his plan to destroy that Avatar. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">7 </span>Katara</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Avatar-The-Last-Airbender-Katara-1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Katara may have just been a young water-bender when audiences were first introduced to her, but throughout the course of her time with Aang, she evolved nearly as much as the Avatar himself. From blood-bending to healing through the power of her bending, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-katara-fun-facts/\">Katara embodied</a> perfectly what it meant to be a water-bender.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-best-episodes-imdb/\">The 10 Best Episodes Of Avatar: The Last Airbender, Ranked</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Much like the greatest water-benders throughout the series, Katara was able to perfectly balance the offensive and defensive capabilities of her element. She may not have always <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-katara-best-fight-scenes-ranked-atla/\">been up for a fight</a>, but she was always there to help out or clean up the pieces afterward. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">6 </span>Toph</h2><figure><img src='https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Avatar-Toph.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While there have already been some incredibly impressive earth-benders mentioned in this article, <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-best-character-toph-vs-varrick-atla/\">Toph is perhaps</a> the greatest earth-bender to have ever lived. Not only was Toph a natural when it came to moving the sturdiest of the elements, and not only was she taught by the badger-moles (the original earth-benders), but she was also able to take earth-bending to its natural evolution, metal-bending. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As the creator of the metal-bending technique, Toph takes the top spot when it comes to earth-benders across the entirety of the series. There may have been many after her who would follow the steps that she had laid out, but Toph is the girl who opened the door to an all-new type of bending. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">5 </span>Iroh</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Entry-1-Iroh-in-the-Order-of-the-White-Lotus.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Iroh may have been the older brother in line for the throne before Ozai forced his way in, but he was never really one to hold that kind of power with much regard. The Dragon of The West as he was called during his heyday, Iroh was an incredibly powerful fire-bender. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While he earned the title of Dragon by his well-known ability to breathe fire and (supposedly) killing a dragon, Iroh was much more in harmony with the true roots of fire-bending than his brother and most of his peers. Ozai and others like him may have been beholden to the rage that the used to fuel their fire, but Iroh was able to see through that charade and find a path toward the life that fire-bending was truly attached to. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">4 </span>Wan</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Avatar-Wan-Cropped.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The first avatar both in this article and in history, Avatar Wan was capable of some truly incredible feats. After releasing the dark spirit Vaatu from his eternal fight with Rava, Wan traveled great distances to visit the lion-turtles of all four elements in order to free the world of Vaatu’s chaos. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While he had become the most powerful bender of his time and ushered in a new age where humans would live free of the lion-turtles, Wan was not able to broker a peace between the spirits of his world and the humans who were now capable of fighting back. He may have made many mistakes, but Wan fought for peace with all his might until the very end. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">3 </span>Korra</h2><figure><img src='https://static1.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Asami-vs-Korra-Best-Girl-korra-tough-10.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">From a very early age, Korra makes it abundantly clear that she is going to become an extremely powerful bender. Although Korra may be naturally very gifted when it comes to manipulating the elements, she has a tough time coming to terms with responsibilities as both one of the few remaining air-benders and as the Avatar.</span></p><p><span class=\"related-single\">RELATED: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-zuko-facts/\">Avatar: 10 Things You Never Knew About Zuko</a></span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As the link between the spirit realm and the physical realm, Korra is pushed to her limits time and time again by benders that have taken their element to the very furthest reaches of its power. While Korra is able to control all the elements with great power and precision, her adversaries routinely push her past her breaking points. Yet, somehow, she manages to keep going. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">2 </span>Firelord Ozai</h2><figure><img src='https://static2.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/Avatar-The-Last-Airbender-Ozai-1.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While Ozai’s fire-bending prowess and utter ruthlessness make him a truly terrifying adversary (and father) to oppose, they aren’t the only factors that make Ozai such a formidable opponent. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ozai’s fighting prowess in a one-on-one battle is certainly something to beware of, but what makes Ozai one of the most powerful benders to have ever lived, even more so than his own strength, is the fact that has the complete faith and trust of an entire nation of powerful fire-benders watching his back. And why wouldn’t they? His family has led the fire nation through prosperous times for generations now. That kind of loyalty and trust isn’t something that just anyone can command. </span></p><h2 class=\"item-title\"><span class=\"item-num\">1 </span>Aang</h2><figure><img src='https://static0.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/Child-Prodigies-avatar-aang-9.jpg' /></figure><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> And last but not least, Aang, quite possibly the greatest Avatar (and greatest bender) to have ever lived. Not only was <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-the-last-airbender-strongest-non-benders-jet-suki-piandao/\">Aang able to master</a> the four elements with relative ease and take down the fire nation, but he was also able to do so without compromising who he was as a person. </span></p><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Time and time again, Aang was told that the only way to end Ozai’s rule would be to end the Firelord’s life. But even as a child, Aang was able to see that there had to be some other way of doing it, some way that would keep his hands clean of the blood everyone expected him to shed. Finally, having exhausted all other options, Aang unleashed the power of soul-bending (taught to him by the wise lion-turtle, of course) and was able to safely end the tyranny of Firelord Ozai without taking his life.</span></p><p><span class=\"next-single\">NEXT: <a href=\"https://www.cbr.com/avatar-last-airbender-anime/\">10 Reasons Avatar: The Last Airbender Is An Anime</a></span></p>\n src=\"https://static3.cbrimages.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/x-men-1992-animated-series-wolverine-cyclops-rogue-jubilee-professor-x.jpg\"/></figure><p>Norm Spencer, who voiced Scott Summers/Cyclops on <em>X-Men: The Animated Series</em>, has passed away.</p><p>\"Lost my dear friend and cohort Norm Spencer,\" Wolverine voice actor Cal Dodd tweeted. \"WHat a sad day. Norm was the voice of Cyclops on <em>X-Men the animated series</em>.He was a genuine Character and sweetheart. I will miss her you Cyc. sorry about the 'convertible' Bub. see ya later my friend.\"</p><iframe width=\"320\" height=\"320\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://twitter.com/realcaldodd/status/1300451040412696576\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe><p><em>X-Men: The Animated Series</em> debuted in 1992 and ran for five seasons and 76 episodes, concluding in 1997. During its run, the show garnered impressive ratings, and it -- along with <em>Batman: The Animated Series</em> -- were credited with spawning what would be a major wave of comic book-inspired animated series. It also helped pave the way for 2000's live-action <em>X-Men</em> film.</p><p>In addition to voicing Cyclops in <em>X-Men: The Animated Series</em>, Spencer voiced the character in two episodes of <em>Spider-Man: The Animated Series</em>, as well as the X-Men video games <em>X-Men: Children of the Atom</em>, <em>X-Men vs. Street Fighter</em>, <em>Marvel Super Heroes vs. Street Fighter</em> and <em>Marvel vs. Capcom 2: New Age of Heroes</em>.</p><p>Other credits to Spencer's name include <em>The Busy World of Richard Scary</em>, <em>Ultraforce</em>, <em>Silver Surfer</em>, <em>Rescue Heroes</em>, <em>Dumb Bunnies</em>, <em>Mythic Warriors: Guardians of the Legend</em>, <em>Top Cops</em>, <em>Majority Rules!</em> and more.</p>\n                        \n                        \n Dominion</a> </em>has been on many fans' radar since its announcement. We were acting in a life and death situation.\" He said, \"We think it might be the last moments of our lives and we're all bonding with each other in an emotional and somewhat hilarious way.\"</p><p><em>Jurassic World: Dominion</em> is directed and co-written by Colin Trevorrow.
